Brand Ambassador Job Description & Requirements
A motivated Inside Sales Rep searching for the Next Big Thing and better compensation
An experienced sales consultant eager to get in on the solar energy boom
A planet advocate who wants to do good while doing well financially
If that sounds like you, then we need to talk right now, because we are hiring! And achievers like you know that opportunity doesn’t wait. We are Ameriquest Solar, a visionary energy company making its mark in the rapidly growing solar industry, located in prosperous Northern California. But before we tell you more about us (and there is a lot to tell), let’s talk about you and what you can expect from a position with Ameriquest Solar.

What’s in it for you
Industry-leading compensation: salary, bonuses, commission and cash spiffs!
Not just a job, a career. This industry taking off, so we’re looking for fellow visionaries who see the potential and are in it for the long haul. We’ll help you grow with us.
A full benefits package for full-time employees that includes Healthcare with dental, vision, a 401k and more (see below).
A fun, inspiring work culture, filled with upbeat people excited about doing meaningful work. Sure, we’re driven to generate sales; but we’re also driven by our values, which start with how solar energy benefits our customers and the earth.
Warm leads only. We’ve done the hard part, developing a huge database of qualified prospects. You’ll spend your time consulting customers, closing sales and collecting commissions!
Grow with a leader in a thriving industry. We’re playing to win in solar energy, and we’re ready to help you do the same. We provide our teams with sales training, customer support, solar industry research, and all the latest sales and office technology.
Sound good so far? Then here’s more about us.

About Ameriquest Solar
Ameriquest Solar is one of the fastest-growing residential roofing and solar installation companies in Northern California. A full-service provider, we offer roofing and re-roofing services, install solar power systems and deliver solar services and battery backup solutions. But the reason we do all that and more is not just because it’s profitable. It’s also ethical. If it excites you to know that what’s good for your customers is good for the planet, you’ve come the right place. We’re on mission to provide sustainable sources, while running a socially and environmentally conscious business.

Your Role


Working with the Sales Manager, the Brand Ambassador converts warm leads into appointments, along . with a variety of CRM duties to close sales. The ideal candidate will enjoy selling, is motivated by hard work and high earning potential, is dedicated, and is a team player. In addition, they will have a high attention to detail and a genuine care to their work. Most importantly, the ideal candidate will be able to maintain a high level of business ethics.

Responsibilities
Acquire a knowledge of generating leads by canvassing neighborhoods and educating homeowners on saving money by going solar
Educate customers about solar power and Ameriquest’s products and services
Build positive relationships to generate future sales, repeat business and leads
Manage customer relationships to achieve sales goals and execute sales plans in an assigned sales territory or account
Provide leadership and mentoring to less experienced sales representatives
Hold self and others accountable to meet commitments – following up with teammates
Build customer confidence and trust through honesty, integrity, and authenticity
Guide quality prospects through the solar installation process
Skills and Qualifications
A minimum of 1 years of prior sales experience
Possess strong writing, speaking, and interpersonal skills
Energetic, friendly and engaging personality
Preferred but not mandatory, Solar and or Roofing industry knowledge
High school diploma or GED required
Experience with Excel, Word, and Outlook is a must
Phone sales experience preferred
Salesforce experience a plus!
Benefits for Full Time Semper Employees
Competitive Salary + Bonuses, Commission and Cash Spiffs!
Work life balance!
Full benefits package includes:
Medical
Dental
Vision
401k
Voluntary Life & AD&D Insurance
H.S.A.
Employee Assistance Program
Paid sick and vacation time
Career path opportunities for top performers!
Free department funded lunches and snacks
Ameriquest Solar is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

In the Brand Ambassador phase you will learn how to effectively execute an in-store marketing campaign for one of our Fortune 500 Clients. Ramiiisol Vineyards, leading producer of Authentic Natural Fine Wines in Virginia, is seeking a detailed, enthusiastic and intelligent wine-loving person to be our Ambassador.
The right candidate will take full ownership of marketing, public relations, sales, customer liaison and administration. Our candidate will represent our brand and image, and take full charge of growing Ramiiisol into a prestigious international brand.
We are a small, hands-on team of exceptionally dedicated and talented individuals committed to the fulfilment of Thomas Jefferson’s dream to produce world class natural authentic Virginia wines. Our chosen candidate must be willing to participate in all phases of our wine growing ebbs and flows of daily life as nature requires and become an integral positive force within our group. Our candidate must accept work schedule flexibility and be prepared to work weekends. Overseas travel will be required.
The ideal candidate will have the following skills and experience
An undergraduate degree coupled with relevant professional qualifications.
Proficiency in the English language and excellent writing skills
A minimum of three years experience in sales/marketing or public relations for a prestigious brand.
Good working knowledge of global wines and winegrowing.
Strong organisational skills with excellent attention to detail.
Imaginative, flexible and highly motivated as well as keen to develop new skills and expertise.
A high level of competence in Microsoft Office and other complimentary software.
An ability to build relationships with a diverse group of people and communicate about wine with confidence.
Proficiency in a foreign language would be beneficial (ideally Spanish or Italian)
Pro-active, creative and a leader

We are seeking an ambitious, attractive, photogenic, and well-spoken individual to become a Spokesmodel/Brand Ambassador Business Representative for our company. In this position you will be the face and voice of the company influencing the decisions of customers and colleagues in the industry.

Responsibilities
Learn the products, services and processes we provide to the real estate and mortgage lending industries.
Be the lead influencer of the company's brand and message.
Discuss strategy with management to best increase sales in the marketplace.
Learn the tools and tasks needed to intake a customer order and bring it to closing.
Be the point person for phone conversations related to our services.
Meet and great all visitors to our office in Center City Philadelphia.
Produce and host a weekly video blog about topic of interest to the industry.
Attend and manage marketing events as our promotional model.
Record concerns and feedback from customers and staff.
Attend educational and training events to stay well informed of key information pertinent to the industry.
Qualifications
Attractive, well-dressed, and well-groomed individual an outgoing positive personality that presents well in video and in person.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Some experience with short-form mobile video; You-Tube, TikTok
Knowledge of Adobe video editing tools is a plus!
Keyboarding skills for efficient order entry.
Willingness to travel to attend industry events during days, evenings and weekends
A valid Driver's License
Ability to lift 50+lbs
Expectations
You will gain sufficient knowledge to obtain licensing as a Title Producer in Pennsylvania and New Jersey with one year.
You will apply for a Notary Public commission within 90 days of employment.
Salary considerations
The qualified candidate can expect to work at least 40 hours per week, usually Monday through Friday from 8am to 5pm; with a one hour lunch break. Shift will adjust as needed to attend events.
Hourly rate between $16.50 and $18.00 per hour.
Possible commission on sales once licensed.
Please submit a personal video of not more than 45 seconds introducing yourself and making a convincing argument to consider you for this opportunity (showcase you ability to influence). Video should present you in both a standing position and a closeup.

The Creative/Brand Manager is the creative curator and brand steward for all corporate marketing initiatives of Defined Fitness. You will bring to life the unique and compelling brand attributes through innovative and creative design solutions that engage our target audiences across multi-media communication channels. With a focus on excellence, you will play an active role in the creative development, planning and implementation of all Defined Fitness marketing.
The Creative/Brand Manager will collaborate with Defined Fitness leadership to provide creative solutions to meet strategic objectives and revenue goals. With unyielding passion and infectious positivity, you will create, protect and develop the Defined Fitness brand and serve as an ambassador for the brand, both at work and in our community. The Creative/Brand Manager will be the lead designer and develop all advertising and marketing.
You will oversee the creation of art, photo, video and layout design. You will establish and implement design and format standards and processes to produce consistent and high quality results. You will manage the Marketing Specialist staff in the day-to-day performance of their jobs.
Essential Functions & Responsibilities
o Concept and design multi-media marketing solutions, including but not limited to, logo development, branding campaigns, signage, print collateral, direct mail, external and internal advertising campaigns, website, social media and digital graphics
o Develop strategies and manage marketing campaigns across print, broadcast and online platforms to ensure that all products and services exceed expectations and build the credibility of the brand
o Manage the development and implementation of marketing projects from design concept to bidding and estimates, production and final execution
o Develop and maintain a unique brand position and manage brand standards for the corporate brand
o Maintain current on emerging media, design standards and industry trends
o Effectively communicate creative solutions while providing and accepting feedback regarding marketing projects
o Ensure project and departmental milestones and goals are met and adhere to approved budgets
o Oversee estimating, bidding, production and installation of all marketing projects
o Organize and participate in events to build and promote the brand including but not limited to grand openings, special events, promotions, photo shoots, etc.
o Manage and oversee the success of the Digital Marketing Specialist
o Provide leadership and guidelines to ensure consistency of the brand across all digital platforms
o Develop timelines, manage project workload and ensure deadlines are met
o Other duties as assigned
Qualifications
o Advanced proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite, specifically Photoshop, InDesign and Illustrator, advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite. Web design knowledge, preferred
o College degree in graphic design and/or 5-10 years graphic design experience
o 1-3 years supervisory experience
o Experience with and understanding of market research
o Excellent design skills and conceptual ability
o Creativity and ability to produce innovative ideas
o Ability to work well with teams in multiple interdisciplinary departments
o Demonstrated ability to develop designs from conception to production
o Demonstrated ability to sustain high productivity, attention to detail and meet tight deadlines
o Detail oriented, well organized, able to handle multiple projects at any given time and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
o Excellent oral and written communication skills
o Ability to think innovatively, creatively and strategically
Physical Requirements
o Must be able to sit for extended periods of time
o Must be able to lift and carry approximately 25 pounds
o Must be able to perform the following tasks: walk, squat, bend, stoop, stand, listen, read and write
Competitors: New Mexico Sports & Wellness, Planet Fitness

Job Description:

Job Title: Brand Manager Stranahan’s Single Malt Whiskey
Job Description:
The Brand Manager will develop consumer and commercial strategies, develop creative platforms and programming, execute plans and evaluate performance in line with Proximo’s long term performance goals.

Responsible for managing consumer marketing budget with the following responsibilities:
Manage annual brand planning cycle. Plan and implement highly focused brand plans that focus on fewer, bigger growth drivers / ideas.
Creativity and cut through versus competitors is essential. Marketing programming must win the hearts and minds of target consumers.
Manage marketing agencies and inspire them to deliver their most creative, efficient and on-strategy work. Ensure maximum collaboration between agencies for full 360 marketing plans - fully-integrated consumer campaigns – advertising development, PR, in-store, social media, influencers, video (traditional TV and other channels), experiential, etc.
Understands the key drivers to build the brand in the on premise (bars, restaurants, etc.) vs. off-premise (liquor, club store, grocery, etc.)
Track and manage brand performance across the marketing mix, assist with KPI development across the marketing mix, as well as traditional sales metrics (Nielsen, NABCA, NPD, ROI, brand P&L)
Manage multimillion dollar A&P budget and maximize the impact of spend
Develop break-through innovations and line-extensions which will require sub strategies, concept and liquid development, launch plans and performance evaluation.
Prioritization of, planning for and investment in geographic, channel, variant and size mix strategies
Work closely with the distillery and production team to align on activity at brand home, and within Colorado
Work with our sales team and distributor partners to generate and build excitement for the trade.
Develop marketing tools for the National sales-team - absolutely key to have a strong relationship with this group - understand sales issues, and work with the team so our distributor network give our brands the greatest possible attention.
Work with distillery marketing manager to drive consumer, customer, distributor and influencer traffic to the distillery
Ideally has experience with ultra-premium spirits ($50+ per bottle) and the nuances for effective marketing over mainstream spirits marketing
Knowledge and Experience
4+ years of brand management experience preferably related to the Spirits Industry or FMCG.
Experience with managing budgets, working with creative agencies, developing new packaging and a solid working knowledge of Nielsen.
Up-to-date on marketing trends, new media platforms and benchmarking with other industries
Understanding consumer insights and aligning all strategies to feed these needs
Excellent presentation and communication skills
Analytical skills- identify the full story and define implications from data analysis
Forward thinker, who proactively seeks opportunities and proposes solutions.
Positive attitude and influence.
Ability to lead and manage projects with cross-functional teams across the company and our distributor network.
Team oriented player that thrives in a collaborative environment.
Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint and Word
Bachelor's degree in marketing or related field (required); advanced degree (preferred)

Content and Brand Marketing Manager

Current is a New York-based FinTech that uniquely connects people and their money to friends, family, brands, and experiences. We are a bank for modern life that delivers money faster, gets people paid quicker, and provides tools to help manage spending, savings, and bills.

To support our growing business, we're looking for a Content and Brand Marketing Manager to work closely with product, engineering and design teams to build and execute programs focused on driving growth. The ideal candidate will be responsible for the day-to-day operations of our social channels, our blog and push/email messaging as well as driving organic growth by managing our PR strategy, SEO/Content Strategy, Brand Ambassadors, and helping craft our overall Brand Strategy. The Content and Brand Marketing Manager will be responsible for ensuring that we adhere to our own brand guidelines as we communicate with our own customers and the outside world. The ideal candidate is a self-starter who is a creative problem solver, thrives under pressure, enjoys fast-paced work and is motivated by success.

Qualifications
Candidates should have 4+ years of consumer marketing experience, including 2-4 years of hands-on experience managing non-paid organic growth channels.
Ideal candidates will have experience developing and executing successful social, content, SEO and PR strategies to drive growth.
Strong analytical skills; must be proficient in analyzing and interpreting data from third-party platforms and adapt to custom internal tools.
Strong Creative and Copywriting skills; must be able to develop content independently as well as with external publishers.
Bonus: Experience working with Mobile Apps, D2C Brands, Brand Ambassadors or Social Influencers.
Responsibilities

Developing and managing content on all Social Media Channels, including day-to-day strategy, calendar development and coordination.
Researching and writing articles on both our own blog, newsletter and other external resources (LinkedIn, Medium, etc.).
Assist in developing Brand Strategy and implementing it across all marketing channels.
Find and manage external content creators and influencers.
Develop and Manage SEO best practices across all content marketing.
Tracking and reporting on performance impact of all content and social marketing.

Position Summary: Our Brand Team at WellPet is made up of passionate marketers who understand the difference our products make in the lives of pets. We are currently seeking an Associate Brand Manager to join our team. Reporting to our Senior Brand Manager (Dog Food), this Associate Brand Manager will support our five dog food brands. This individual will derive and leverage consumer and category insights to grow our business and achieve our strategic goals. They must have strong analytical skills, with the ability to synthesize data, derive insights and present actionable recommendations. If you are driven by fact-based consumer insights, then this is the job for you!
Position Description (Responsibilities):
Develop and maintain a working level knowledge about our portfolio, categories, customers, and industry
Analyze data, derive insights and develop consumer-led action plans to drive our business
Utilize strong creative abilities and design eye to ensure our brand is consistently executed in market, as well as in presentations, briefs and brand assets
Actively support the development of annual brand plans and go-to-market recommendations that support our strategies for growth
Support Sales & Operations Planning to ensure accurate forecasting of new and existing products
Conduct post-launch reviews and analysis to evaluate and report-on new product launches
Partner with our sales team to optimize sell-in & sell-through of our dog food brands
Lead the creation of marketing materials such as price sheets, brand style guides & global brand toolkits, and in-store signage
Manage cross-functional teams to support business initiatives against our dog food brands
Help manage Marketing budgets
Live the WellPet values
Position Requirements:
2+ years of experience in Brand Management, preferably in a Consumer Packaged Goods environment
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Management, or relatable experience; MBA preferred
Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills
Ability to collaborate, influence and motivate cross-functionally
Strong Excel skills (including experience with pivot-tables, V-Lookups, IF-Then statements, etc.)
Experience working with Nielsen or IRI data preferred
Excellent project management abilities, capable of prioritizing and handling multiple projects simultaneously, under tight time constraints and within budget parameters
Well-developed written and oral presentation skills
Collaborative, team player with a “can do” attitude
Demonstrates positive attitude and takes a proactive approach to their work; sees challenges as opportunities and translates them into actionable tasks
Displays grace and presence at all times
Energized by fast-paced environment
Computer proficient in MS Word, PowerPoint and Outlook
Competitors: Blue Buffalo, Natural Balance Pet Food, Royal Canin USA

Job Description:
Location: Northern California; Remote Event Specialist & Brand Promoter

Green Revolution, a leading, innovative, multiple award-winning and best-selling cannabis company is seeking an experienced and qualified (part-time starting, full-time opportunity) Brand Ambassador to join our revolutionary sales team as we launch into the California market.

We are seeking a determined and extraordinary Brand Ambassador with a talent in building relationships, and story-based selling. Do you leave a lasting impression? We want to hear from you. This position requires a driven and ambitious work ethic with a goal to challenge the status quo. Innovative and enthusiastic personality types are a plus. Industry knowledge is preferred but not limited-to.

A Brand Ambassador will help conduct product demos facing direct to customer and provide support at cannabis related events.

Responsibilities:
Extremely Charismatic (able to make friends with anyone in the room at the drop of a hat).

Outgoing & affable
Personable

An extreme go-getter

Over the age of 21

Job Description
Company Overview

At Veo, we're bringing the next generation of mobility sharing to cities and universities globally through our dockless pedal bike, e-bike and e-scooter systems. We also offer fat-tire bikes, cargo bikes and ADA-compliant bikes – making us the only shared mobility provider with this breadth of options. We design and engineer our own vehicles, hardware and software systems to provide a greener, healthier mode of transportation to make the communities we serve more sustainable and livable. Our mission is to offer the best combination of multi-modal sharing technology and seamless customer service, so users can unlock joy in their day. We are looking for exceptionally talented individuals who are ready to take on exciting challenges and own solutions. We are headquartered in Chicago, IL, but we are hiring across the U.S. Join us!

Job Summary

Do you start conversations with strangers in the cafeteria or grocery store line? Do you love educating people about new and exciting products and services? Are you passionate about building brand recognition and customer loyalty? If so, you might be Veo’s next Brand Ambassador in Atlanta, GA

As Veo’s Brand Ambassador, you will promote and grow the Veo dockless scooter-share program in the greater Atlanta community. Your impact will be measured by increased ridership and customer awareness.

Responsibilities and Duties
Initiating key direct marketing activities and promotional events
Attending city events and networking with businesses and organizations to promote the Veo brand and to increase ridership
Distributing and delivering marketing materials directly to customers
Engaging with customers in the field and gathering customer feedback to share with our Operations Team
Representing the voice of the Veo brand throughout the Atlanta community
75% of time will be spent on marketing/running events; 25% of time will be spent engaging riders and doing fieldwork
Qualifications and Skills
Prior direct marketing experience with a focus on brand and relationship building
Ability to sell a product/service in person
Savviness with using social media
Energetic and social personality (your friends describe you as a social butterfly)
A connector—in the know about all of the events around the greater Atlanta community
An expert on all things Atlanta related
Enjoys interacting with and communicating with diverse populations
Superior communication and interpersonal skills
Passionate about making Altanta a better place to live and ride
Benefits and Perks
Competitive hourly wage
Opportunity to work in a fast-paced, early stage technology company
Veo credits
Flexible work hours

Company Description

Humm started in 2OO8 as a conversation between two friends in Bend, Oregon. Future Humm founders Michelle and Jamie were chatting, laughing and drinking Michelle’s homebrewed kombucha, a recipe she learned from her mother-in-law and had spent years perfecting.

The homebrew was like nothing Jamie had tasted. The healthy qualities, full of probiotics and antioxidants, made them feel exuberant. lf they could be this happy and feel this great, why not share it with the world?

The company grew quickly. People loved the quality and variety of flavors. All the stuff that made them feel good was just a bonus. In just 5 short years, Humm had taken its small kitchen operation to a national, and now international scale while maintaining its mission of helping people feel good!

Job Description

As a Humm-ster (brand ambassador) you will be the face of the brand at in-store demos and events. You will build relationships with retailers and work with them to gain increased brand presence in the store. In this role, you will largely be responsible for educating customer on kombucha, encouraging the growth of the brand and driving trial of Humm's product line. This role will be responsible for the Portland, OR market.

TO APPLY: Please read through the rest of the job posting and send an email to tim@hummkombucha. com with your resume, why you think you would be great for this position and a photo of you doing something fun!

Retail Activations
Create a unique customer experience to increase brand awareness and build customer loyalty, ultimately driving in-store sales.
Represent all Humm Kombucha flavor lines across the entire portfolio with a strong understanding of nutrition and key functions and benefits of ingredients.
Be the eyes and ears of Humm Kombucha from the field: report on observations regarding retail accounts as well as competitor activity.
Marketing Events
Support marketing events relevant to the brand and to the region.
Participate in sampling initiatives, reaching consumers where they live, play and shop.
Build & Maintain Relationships
Report key information to your manager about in-field learnings to continually improve marketing activities
Own and manage a subset of retail stores in which you are responsible for building relationships with the store manager and staff.
Recommended Experience:
A background in customer service, which has strengthened your skills to provide a stellar customer experience.
An energetic and entrepreneurial spirit.
An understanding of Kombucha
Your willingness to go above and beyond to grow the business.
You are…
Have a “work hard, play hard” mentality.
The ability to adapt
A relationship builder, excited by the opportunity to partner with our customers, consumers, and retail partners.
Goal-oriented and able to take the initiative to achieve/exceed goals
Approachable and enjoy talking to people
Willing to regularly work early mornings, evenings, and weekends based on company needs.
You have…
Weekend availability
A passion for the health and wellness industry
The ability to positively engage the public, representing the brand in a highly positive manner.
An understanding of both marketing & sales fundamentals.
A reliable mode of transportation
Access to a personal smart phone for schedule updates, photo capturing, and emails.
A deep-rooted understanding of the relevant market and the surrounding area.
Mastered the ability to work autonomously and collaboratively.
Access to a computer for reporting sampling results
The ability to lift heavy items up to 50 lbs.

WHY YOU'LL DIG YOUR GIG

In short, our purpose at TEAM is to blow peoples minds and steal their hearts with incredible brand experiences. We want you to help our brands do amazing, unprecedented, wildly creative things, creating moments that people never forget and that people will want to share with others.

THE TEAM DIFFERENCE

People may forget your witty hashtag and your latest campaign tagline, but they will never forget how you made them feel. Thats because what a brand does is much more important that what is says. Actions speak louder than advertising and marketing. Experiences are what create real connections that lead to brand love and thats what we do at TEAM. Were a fun, collaborative, hard working group with a great office environment who takes care of our employees, to ensure that both in work and in life you experience something greater.

The Brand Ambassador will support a set target market. The main responsibilities of the Ambassador is to act as a link between the Brand portfolio and consumers/trade to deliver education, engagement and entertainment platforms. This is a part-time position within an assigned market. You must be 21 years of age or more.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
Be the face of the Brand to Key Trade and Consumers.
Complete market visits on periodic basis to deliver programming and support the field and our distributor partner to grow the Brand business.
Provide world class education to trade, consumers, and media within assigned markets.
Identify trends, opportunities and feedback to the marketing and sales teams within your market.
Increase distribution and in key accounts within target markets.
Be the featured spokesperson for festivals, trade events, consumer activity and Brand training.
Execute trade activities in line with the brand plans.
Personify the Spirit of the Brand and its core values.
WAYS TO STAND OUT IN THE CROWD
Experience conducting promotions in key targeted accounts, in selling programs or brands to key accounts, and/or prior promotional and selling experience preferred
Quality computer skills including Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Familiarity with the market and key accounts catering to the targeted consumers
Engaging, articulate & passionate presenter - someone who can wow the room.
A self-starter, with the ability to manage the matrix of key internal stakeholders
Has influence through various social media channels and willing to liaise as an extension of the brand.
Include jsanchez@teamenterprises.com in the REFERRED BY section when applying to this position.

WHO WE ARE

TEAM is a topnotch experiential marketing agency who develops and executes creative marketing campaigns rooted in strategy, insights and decades of learning. We partner with the best brands and people to deliver experiences that create inspiration at the point of engagement. Our roster of talent is essential to executing quality campaigns which live up to our high standards, for more information visit www.workwithteam.com to register for this position.

About Us
Foxtrot is the digitally native evolution of the corner store – a one-stop shop for those seeking thoughtful curation that’s a reflection of themselves and their city – offering a curated collection of daily essentials in-store and delivered in under an hour via our app and website.
Venture-backed by investors including Fifth Wall, Lerer Hippeau, Revolution’s Rise of the Rest, and Collaborative, to name a few, Foxtrot is building a truly omnichannel brand that seamlessly marries e-commerce delivery, proprietary inventory technology, and the feel-good community of neighborhood stores.
Our spaces offer all the most-loved aspects of neighborhood cafes – beautifully designed interiors that wrap you in the welcoming aroma of freshly brewed coffee, comfortable lounge areas to work and relax, and chef-prepared meals to snack on throughout the day – while bringing together mindful people, brands and goods to create a community of discovery and joy.
Our e-commerce experience – highlighted by our swift app and online store – is powered by our proprietary inventory and operational technology to deliver a new kind of convenience that brings the store to your door in under an hour.
Since launching our native app in 2013, we now operate a robust e-commerce business and have opened nine retail stores in Chicago and Dallas, and are rapidly scaling to take this first-of-its-kind omnichannel brand nationwide.

About the Role
Foxtrot is looking for self-driven, enthusiastic, outgoing, and creative individuals to join our Brand Ambassador team and help grow our rapidly expanding brand. We want our Ambassadors to be as involved as possible in our marketing efforts and spread the word about Foxtrot to everyone in their area. As a result, we need dedication and determination from our team members - each ambassador should be able to dedicate 8-10 hours per week in this role. You will gain real world marketing experience while getting paid for everything you do!

Act as brand ambassador to represent Foxtrot at events, samplings and other marketing initiatives throughout Chicago
Confidently and enthusiastically engage with and educate consumers about all things Foxtrot
Transport, set up and break down event/sampling materials and merchandise displays
Maintain professional appearance at all times
Help to generate new customers and excitement about our brand
Be our eyes and ears in your local market

Marketing Collateral: distribute marketing collateral throughout the surrounding community
Use your social media networks to drive brand awareness of the Foxtrot brand

Approachable and outgoing – willing to talk to anyone at any time

Able to work both independently and as part of a team
Excellent communication skills

Overview


Since 1848, Morton Salt has been improving lives and enhancing every day moments. We not only offer your favorite salts for the kitchen but have also created water-softening salts for your home, ice melt salts for your walkways, and chemical-free salts for your pool. Morton Salt also produces quality salts for a vast array of industries, from food manufacturing to pharmaceuticals.

We are widely recognized for our famous Morton Salt Girl, one of America’s most beloved icons. She has been the face of our brand for over a century and remains a symbol of trust for consumers and customers.

The Culinary portfolio includes Morton Salt’s iconic “Blue Round Can” in the US and a full range of fast-growing salts including Kosher Salt, Sea Salt and our newest launch – Himalayan Pink Salt. Our Seasonings, featuring Season-All and Nature’s Seasons, are also a part of this segment. Given its broad household penetration, the Culinary portfolio also plays a lead role in the overall branding efforts for Morton.

In general, the Assistant Brand Manager is a general management role with P&L responsibility. He/she is accountable for managing the short-term and long-term profitability for assigned product categories and responsible for the development of strategic business and marketing plans to achieve segment volume, pricing, profit and share objectives.

This specific position will report directly to the Sr. Brand Manager, with a focus on maximizing the Base Culinary business including driving near-in innovations/line extensions. The ABM will work closely with cross-functional partners, managing project timelines, leveraging consumer & marketplace insights, and stewarding projects through the Stage Gate process. As a core and fully integrated member of the Culinary brand team, other responsibilities will round out this position, including commercialization of new items/products. This role will play in critical role in achieving our growth objectives.

Across business segments, Assistant Brand Managers at Morton Salt are responsible for owning the P&L for their respective lines of business, and leading cross functional teams in the planning, execution and analysis of business initiatives essential to the business. They are empowered to craft and deliver strategy for their products, with coaching and support from their manager and peers. Some activities include P&L analysis, competitive and consumption analysis, forecasting and demand planning, troubleshooting supply planning, development of marketing strategy, pricing and trade strategy, product portfolio management, near-in innovation and growth projects, and fueling a culture of insights within their category of responsibility. The Assistant Brand Manager will be a “Brand Steward” and ensure all initiatives are implemented in accordance with the brand goals and objectives.

Responsibilities


Essential Duties

1. Business Segment Performance and Accountability

Accountable for one or more product/category P&Ls, driving key initiatives to improve profitability down to EBITResponsible for the development and achievement of business objectives and marketing plans for assigned category/brandsPartner with Communications counterpart to execute marketing plans and key initiatives to deliver against brand, financial and share objectivesProactively work with Sales and Demand Planning to ensure monthly forecast accuracyDevelop and communicate monthly Culinary scorecard, with opportunities to present business performance and key initiatives to upper management

2. Build and Protect Long-Term Brand Equity

Use insights to drive brand activity, new products, strategies, and thought leadershipBuild and communicate brand value to justify selling and retail prices Measure performance and implement improvement measures to achieve desired experiencePartner with Master Brand team on greater purpose-driven efforts such as Walk Her Walk and the Erase Food Waste campaign

3. Market/channel strategy and planning process

Develop market/channel strategies and brand plans that create a sustainable competitive advantage for MortonUtilize Nielsen and/or IRI data and competitive intelligence to assess market opportunities. Use quantitative and qualitative research to vet new product ideas, packaging, pricing, and positioning strategiesIdentify and align resources around key initiatives to support market/channel strategies and plansPartner with Sales Planning and Sales team to drive Morton initiatives at the customer level. Examples of activities include developing merchandising guidance, identifying and communicating trends and opportunities, and building presentation materials for buyer meetings.

4. Consumer Communications & Sales Tools

Partner with manager to develop brand objectives and strategy for advertising and promotional programs to drive awareness, trial and loyalty. Communicate strategy and objectives to Communications team, who will lead the execution of advertising and promotional programs. Partner with Brand Marketing to design and provide tools to Sales that clearly communicate a point of difference and ensure that a consistent message is conveyed in the marketDevelop and manage Advertising and Promotional budget, reconciling monthly payments to ensure accurate forward-looking budget.

5. Innovation and Product Portfolio Management

Lead projects with external agency partners and key internal stakeholdersLead the development and execution of product and packaging innovation plans including concept development, feasibility validation, product and packaging R&D, business proposal and approval, project execution, customer sell in and tracking of in-market performanceEffectively manage projects through the Stage Gate processManage the product portfolio and make recommendations on A&P and trade investment levels in accordance with the portfolio strategy and stage in the product life cycle.

Qualifications


Minimum Position Qualifications

Education: Bachelor’s degree required, MBA preferred

Experience: Minimum of 3 years of experience, preferably in consumer packaged goods/product marketing

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Hungry to grow the businessPassion for inspiring consumers and building strong brandsStrong analytical skills with knowledge and experience in P&L managementExperience successfully launching new products and managing the product life cycle a plusProven track record of success and demonstrated ability in leading cross functional teamsMust be enthusiastic, self-motivated and demonstrate excellent problem solving and decision making skills.Must be well organized, able to work under time constraints and have the ability to multi task in a fast paced environment meeting deadlines as set by managerWell-rounded business acumen with proven skills in marketing, business strategy, and general managementSAP experience a plusNielsen and/or IRI experience a plus

Travel

5%

Good Culture Brand Ambassador - Contractor
Are you a friendly and engaging individual who is passionate about natural foods? Are you looking to join forces with an honest and exciting new brand that is shaking up the way the world views of cultured dairy? Do you think little miss muffet wasn't given enough credit for her healthy food choices? With organic, real food and simple ingredients, our innovative and delicious flavor varieties are waking up dairy and supplement aisles in grocery stores around the nation. We need your help to spread the good culture word!

We are seeking candidates to join the "Culture Crew" as a brand ambassador to support in-store demos and coupon events at grocery stores (mainly Friday – Mondays, 2-4 hours per demo). The brand ambassador is responsible for engaging consumers, promoting brand awareness and driving product sales through live featured product demonstrations and couponing. We offer flexible hours (for those of you with odd hobbies) and competitive pay of $20-$22/hour, with monthly bonus structures and room to grow within the company!

Essential Functions and Responsibilities

o Promote brand awareness, positive product impressions, customer loyalty and increased sales through product demonstration, customer engagement and effective communication of brand talking points - This should be easy, because to taste good culture is to love good culture.
o Organization and hosting of in-store retail demos involving setting-up, sampling and completing demonstration with an emphasis on cleanliness, organization and the ability to follow instructions.
o Coordination with store managers, demo coordinators and dairy team leads on schedules, product levels and demo guidelines, when applicable.
o Capture demo results by reporting all pertinent info into demo recap systems in a timely and accurate manner in Promomash
o Capture and forward required demo images on your recap of your event (Ever take a selfie? Then you already know how to do this!)
o Maintain relationships with existing sales accounts through POS placement, store merchandising and maintaining positive relationships with the in-store team
o Turn on the charm and greet them with a legend-dairy smile.
o Other possible responsibilities: Seed and develop relationships with market influencers, ultimately leading to increased brand visibility. (Because Good Culture belongs at the cool kid table.)

Requirements

o Outstanding customer service skills
o Excellent presentation skills and the ability to expertly articulate product features and benefits
o Ability to positively engage the public
o Ability to represent the brand in a highly positive manner
o Access to a computer/smart phone for reporting sampling results
o Must have a food handler’s permit
o Must have a reliable vehicle
o Must have a smartphone with data
o Must have a folding table up to 4ft. size
o Must be able to stand for 4hours
o Must be able to lift up to 25lbs of product

Education and Experience

o Education: bachelor's degree (preferred) or equivalent work experience related work
o Experience: 2 years relevant experience in event marketing, demonstrations, sales, brand promotion or retail/grocery.

About Good Culture
We believe that if you eat good things, and surround yourself with good, you’ll feel good. Simple as that. That’s why we decided to create a food company that offers real organic ingredients from trusted sources, promotes good health and tastes great. Good Culture delivers high protein, organic and non-gmo ingredients, pasture raised milk from respected cows that roam free on sustainable family farms, live and active cultures (our tummies thank us daily), no additives (stabilizers, thickeners, artificial preservatives, gross) and unique sweet and savory varieties that taste amazing. Come taste the Good Life with us.

Company Description

Humm started in 2OO8 as a conversation between two friends in Bend, Oregon. Future Humm founders Michelle and Jamie were chatting, laughing and drinking Michelle’s homebrewed kombucha, a recipe she learned from her mother-in-law and had spent years perfecting.

The homebrew was like nothing Jamie had tasted. The healthy qualities, full of probiotics and antioxidants, made them feel exuberant. lf they could be this happy and feel this great, why not share it with the world?

The company grew quickly. People loved the quality and variety of flavors. All the stuff that made them feel good was just a bonus. In just 5 short years, Humm had taken its small kitchen operation to a national, and now international scale while maintaining its mission of helping people feel good!

Job Description

As a Humm-ster (brand ambassador) you will be the face of the brand at in-store demos and events. You will build relationships with retailers and work with them to gain increased brand presence in the store. In this role, you will largely be responsible for educating customer on kombucha, encouraging the growth of the brand and driving trial of Humm's product line. This role will be responsible for the Denver, CO market.

TO APPLY: Please read through the rest of the job posting and send an email to tim@hummkombucha. com with your resume, why you think you would be great for this position and a photo of you doing something fun!

Retail Activations
Create a unique customer experience to increase brand awareness and build customer loyalty, ultimately driving in-store sales.
Represent all Humm Kombucha flavor lines across the entire portfolio with a strong understanding of nutrition and key functions and benefits of ingredients.
Be the eyes and ears of Humm Kombucha from the field: report on observations regarding retail accounts as well as competitor activity.
Marketing Events
Support marketing events relevant to the brand and to the region.
Participate in sampling initiatives, reaching consumers where they live, play and shop.
Build & Maintain Relationships
Report key information to your manager about in-field learnings to continually improve marketing activities
Own and manage a subset of retail stores in which you are responsible for building relationships with the store manager and staff.
Recommended Experience:
A background in customer service, which has strengthened your skills to provide a stellar customer experience.
An energetic and entrepreneurial spirit.
An understanding of Kombucha
Your willingness to go above and beyond to grow the business.
You are…
Have a “work hard, play hard” mentality.
The ability to adapt
A relationship builder, excited by the opportunity to partner with our customers, consumers, and retail partners.
Goal-oriented and able to take the initiative to achieve/exceed goals
Approachable and enjoy talking to people
Willing to regularly work early mornings, evenings, and weekends based on company needs.
You have…
Weekend availability
A passion for the health and wellness industry
The ability to positively engage the public, representing the brand in a highly positive manner.
An understanding of both marketing & sales fundamentals.
A reliable mode of transportation
Access to a personal smart phone for schedule updates, photo capturing, and emails.
A deep-rooted understanding of the relevant market and the surrounding area.
Mastered the ability to work autonomously and collaboratively.
Access to a computer for reporting sampling results
The ability to lift heavy items up to 50 lbs.

Job Title: Assistant Brand Manager - Royal Canin / Eukanuba
Job Description:
A mutually rewarding experience.

Work. Realize your ambitions. And realize theres more to being in business than just making a profit. Thats the Mars philosophy. And the opportunity we offer every one of our Associates. An opportunity to take what you do and make it mean more for you, for those around you and for the planet. What you get here is challenging, interesting work. You get the tools you need to do a great job and you get to have the best possible people on your side to help you do it. And at the same time as getting to find ways to do business better today than we did it yesterday and driving a great career, you also get to build a more enlightened business and drive sustainability.

Because its never just about a single person, a single project or a single brand. Its about how you can grab everything thats within your reach here and use it to pursue mutual, long-term gain. Its about having ideas. And ideals. Being prepared to risk failure because the promise of success means well all be a little better off. Its that mix of integrity and ambition that makes Mars such a special place to work. And why working here is always about more than just a job.

About Mars, Incorporated

Mars is a family-owned business with more than a century of history making diverse products and offering services for people and the pets people love. With almost $35 billion in sales, the company is a global business that produces some of the worlds best-loved brands: M&Ms®, SNICKERS®, TWIX®, MILKY WAY®, DOVE®, PEDIGREE®, ROYAL CANIN®, WHISKAS®, EXTRA®, ORBIT®, 5, SKITTLES®, UNCLE BENS®, MARS DRINKS and COCOAVIA®. Mars also provides veterinary health services that include BANFIELD® Pet Hospitals, Blue Pearl®, VCA® and Pet Partners. Headquartered in McLean, VA, Mars operates in more than 80 countries. The Mars Five Principles Quality, Responsibility, Mutuality, Efficiency and Freedom inspire its more than 100,000 Associates to create value for all its partners and deliver growth they are proud of every day.

The ROYAL CANIN/EUKANUBA Assistant Brand Manager, as part of a team of marketers, will help lead the execution of marketing programs and campaign initiatives and assist with post activity/event analysis. Additionally, this position will support the development of annual marketing and communications plans, track key performance indicators and report on results.

QUALIFICATIONS, EDUCATION, and EXPERIENCE:
Bachelors degree in business or marketing. MBA or previous experience in brand preferred.
3+ years marketing experience in CPG (consumer packaged goods) companies preferred with an understanding of the following areas: product development, sales/analytics, packaging, advertising, promotions, and/or communications
Strong analytical and data analysis skills with ability to generate insights that will translate to strategies
Executional excellence that showcases attention to detail and adherence to deadlines
Ability to set and achieve goals and manage multiple projects and priorities
Excellent communication and presentation skills (oral and written)
Excellent PC skills (Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)
Ability to function as a team player and project leader in an open office environment
Ability to create strong relationships across internal departments and external partners
LOCATION and REPORTING HIERARCHY:
The position will report to the Brand Director or Brand Manager
This position will be located in the Royal Canin USA corporate office in St. Charles, MO
Overnight and weekend travel required, up to 15%
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Work closely with Brand Director and Brand Managers to contribute to the creation and execution of integrated marketing plans that communicate the product or campaign focus in all aspects of the marketing and advertising mix for both D2C and D2B.
Influence and inform innovation/renovation plans with market category, business and consumer insights, competitive communication and claims as inputs to drive brand profitability and growth. Support the launch of product innovations to US market including product news, new packaging, and analysis of portfolio profitability.
Own S&OP process as it pertains to responsible sub-brands: estimated annual volumes, key assumptions and initiatives requiring resources for new products in development. Work closely with brand, demand teams and innovation project manager on the total forecast, risks/opportunities assessment, gap-fill planning and project prioritization
Drive cross-functional organization, planning, execution and implementation of all relevant marketing programs/campaigns that ensure compliance with brand standards and help grow business within channel
Support Brand Managers in inventory forecasts, packaging initiatives, and new product launches with an understanding of supply chain and operations. Manage and execute plan modifications and line extensions.
Conduct competitive surveillance and analysis. Make recommendations to influence business and marketing decisions.
Manage product launches and marketing campaigns through close collaboration with marketing research, sales, supply chain/distribution, and legal.
Closely monitors and analyzes sales volumes, market share trends and competitive activity in partnership with category and sales operations
Manage projects and areas of business to ensure open communication and smooth workflow between cross-functional divisions (e.g., sales, creative)
Develop a monthly state of brand health report with insights and recommendations
Monitor and manage the marketing budget: forecast all expenses and allocate the spend based on ROI by activity

Get in the driver's seat and tour in the Green RV, driving impact through events for students far and wide.

We are looking to add outstanding Brand Ambassadors aka Roadies to our team! Roadtrip Nation is a super innovative Regional Emmy Award Winning production company with cutting-edge software. We are on a mission to empower people to create their own stories and define their own roads in life! We are hitting the road in Fall 2020 in our iconic Green RV to bring the story of Roadtrip Nation to students around the country and inspire the next generation to define your own road in life.

We are currently recruiting for our 2020 Fall Tours (Sept - Nov). These tours will stop at a number of college campuses and community events across the country to promote Roadtrip Nation resources. You will train onsite at our HQ in Costa Mesa and then you will be on the road (yes, living in the Green RV) for the duration of the tour.

As a Brand Ambassador, you are a direct representative of Roadtrip Nations mission, core values, history and philosophy.

You will be required to operate and live in one of our green RVs with 3 others for the duration of the tour. The tour that you are a part of will consist of driving from location to location, managing logistics and setup, and conducting live, in-person presentations. As a team, you will engage and speak to crowds at various locations to get students excited about their futures, promote Roadtrip Nation products and films, and share stories of students and professionals alike.

This assignment is a very challenging experience, but with the right attitude and a clear understanding of who we are, what we do, and why we do it, this will also be one of the most rewarding experiences you will ever have!

Ideal Candidate Qualifications

• Confident and outgoing public speaker who can command a room, defuse a crowd and engage audiences with authentic and personal storytelling

• Good-natured, easy-going temperament and ability to live with 2-3 others in an RV for weeks at a time

• Ability to problem solve and think creatively on the fly to adapt to challenges both on the road and during events

• Passion for working with students from varying backgrounds

• Represents Roadtrip Nation positively and respectfully at all times, accurately communicating the brand philosophy to those you encounter along the way

Job Duties/Requirements

• Work collaboratively within a team of 2 or more, whom you will be traveling and living with for up to 8 weeks at a time

• Exceptional interpersonal and listening skills, with a passion for connecting with others, sharing stories, and shepherding students and lifelong learners through the Roadtrip Nation philosophy and experience

• Live in and operate one of our green recreational vehicles.

• Attend a two-week training period prior to the start of the tour at our Southern California headquarters

• Conduct live speaking presentations in front of various audiences and lead interactive student activities

• Track event logistics on the ground and be the point of contact for all tour stops, and ensure that events run smoothly

• Have a clear understanding of Roadtrip Nations mission, history, and various products before applying

• Speak volubly and articulately on these various topics

• Interact with Students, Faculty, Partners and VIPs at various events associated with each tour

• Be available for the duration of the tour

Preferred Education/Experience

• Experience as a public speaker preferred

• Experience working with students as an educator/coach/tutor

• Valid drivers license

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work

This is an hourly, project-based position, requiring an average of 20-40 hours of work per week which (with exception of the 2 week training period which is 40 hrs/week) will be worked on the road while living in one of our Green RVs. Each tour is expected to last 4-8 weeks approximately. More details on the length of each tour will be available during the interview process as they are project specific.

Physical Demands

• Must be able to lift at least 30lbs and this position also requires you to be seated for lengths at a time while driving.

• While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms.

How do I apply?
Please submit your cover letter and resume at https://roadtripnation.com/about/careers.

Roadtrip Nation is an Affirmative Action / Equal Opportunity employer. Our mission is to empower people to define their own roads in life. We started Roadtrip Nation two decades ago to find and share all the different ways to build a fulfilling life and career. We're still out on the road, asking meaningful questions about how people built a life on their own terms, and creating stories about the missteps, failures, and setbacks as well as the joys and successes that are part of pursuing a career aligned to your personal interests.

Every story and background adds richness to our culture, and we continually strive to mirror that diversity of stories on our own team. When we hire, we envision a workforce representing as many backgrounds, identities, and roads as possible. We cant wait to hear more about your story.

Professional Development: You'll gain practical work experience and have access to professional development resources and the ability to connect with members of our team. We provide opportunities to develop and refine your sales, networking, communication, management, and leadership skills.

About Care Indeed:

Care Indeed is a non-medical home care provider that is headquartered in Menlo Park, California. It is owned and managed by nurses who started their career in healthcare as caregivers. The company’s success is a testament to this old adage: Experience is the best teacher. Care Indeed began its operations in a tiny office in Palo Alto. Its CEO and COO are true innovators; they did everything since they only had each other back then. If a caregiver cancelled a shift, either one would make sure that the client would not be left alone. Hard work and determination do pay off. 8 years and 5 offices later, Care Indeed continues to expand.

You will communicate and engage with customers, both online and offline, in meaningful ways to increase our company's brand awareness and/generate new opportunities for different areas within the company.

POSITION OVERVIEW:MKTG Brand Ambassador Educators (BAE) are Diageo brand enthusiasts that educate consumers on Diageo Brands during on, off, and experiential special events. They must be able to deliver a unique sampling experience, and help consumers make informed brand decisions. They are expected to interact and actively engage consumers at the point of purchase and experience, with the end goal of reinforcing and/or increasing brand awareness. The BAE embodies the Diageo brand they represent and humanizes the brand as a result. They build consumer trust by providing product knowledge and education.BAEs have a wide range of job responsibilities related to engaging consumers to recognize, prefer and purchase our client brands. For this reason, MKTG hires personable, friendly, and professional Brand Ambassador Educators. In addition to participating in promotional events when selected, BAEs are expected to complete regular online trainings regarding our client brands. BAEs must have the ability to immerse themselves in order to obtain an extensive level of knowledge including Category, Product Distillation/Production and Brand with the ability to pass exams testing said knowledge. BAEs must be able to successfully showcase their knowledge andability to engage by showcasing a “Final” two to three minute presentation, in order to represent Diageo brands at events.This position is an Occasional Employment Position. Being hired as a BA Educator does not guarantee that the employee will be assigned to any particular quantity of assignments. BA Educator must sign-off on all required forms and must adhere to all MKTG Policies & Procedures and the NA Diageo Marketing Code.PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Actively engage and educate consumers at the point of experience, purchase and consumption
Humanize the brands and build trust of consumers through education
Lead consumers through a sampling journey of featured product(s) (where legal and within local legal limitations and as per policy)
Regularly complete digital training for market brand and programs as directed
Adapt to tech platforms to receive and input information necessary to represent the Diageo brands
Arrive to events on time, in appropriate attire as specified by market team, and be prepared to execute promotions as outlined in program standards
Distribute Diageo premiums to consumers
Follow Responsible Server Guidelines and report Guideline violations
Pre-merchandise accounts with Diageo point-of-sale (POS)
Pay for bar spend or product via company issued debit card
Pick up or accept delivery of promotional materials from Event Team
Ensure proper care and return of company property (i.e. – uniforms, event materials)
Complete post-event recap (ERF) in MKTG reporting website
Take digital event photos and contribute to markets social media account
Understand how Diageo brand differs from competitors and report on competitive activity in market
Maintain appropriate appearance for consumer engagement
Follow company policy and procedures
REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:
Outgoing Brand Knowledge and Personification of the Brand– BAE must complete training in order to understand what the brand/program represents, stands for and how it differs from other brands. BAE must be able to translate brand information to consumers in a relatable manner.
Engaging - BAE must be outgoing, personable and courteous with consumers and approach them with a friendly and helpful attitude, with the goal to build trust in the brand.
Reliable – BAE must always arrive to events ready to start on time, and must work until event end
Physical and Other Requirements
Able to stand/walk for extended periods of time
Able to carry heavy trays, boxes, objects
Able to maintain a pleasant disposition under stress
Satisfy consumer appeal and client marketing requirements
Approachable and able to engage consumers
MKTG is looking for brand staff in Memphis, Chattanooga, Nashville and Knoxville. Must have ABC permit to work events. Hourly rate is $30/hr. Events typically take place Friday afternoons 4pm-7pm, 5pm-8pm and Saturdays.
Competitors: GMR Marketing, Momentum Worldwide, Jack Morton

downeast cider house brand ambassador

who we are
maine 2011: downeast began in the basement of a dorm room, with a killer recipe and boundless naiveté. nine years later, our ciders retain the unfiltered freshness, authentic craft process, and balanced flavor profiles that appeal to both novice and discerning cider drinkers. now based out of boston, we're no longer beginners, but we’re still just as hungry. we're in need of the right people to join our team in denver.

what we stand for
we have beyond excellent customer service
we’re all about the hustle
we’re relatable and accessible - nobody and nothing is off-limits
we want to be different and undeniably better - we do things the right way, not just how they’ve always been done

who we’re looking for - you should
have a flexible schedule - the majority of our events are on nights and weekends
be able to - and thrilled to - go above and beyond, exceed expectations
be all about the hustle - prompt and always ready for a project
be able to make friends with anyone in 60 seconds, and turn any bar into a party
be down-to-earth, approachable, and seek out meaningful conversations
have previous customer service experience (preferred)

requirements
you must be 21+
access to a vehicle
based in denver or boulder
be able to lift 50 lbs
you must be talented and awesome

the role
*THIS IS A PART TIME POSITION*
6-10 hours/week
execute high quality events and demos at bars, stores, festivals, etc.
sample cider, answer questions about the product and company, engage with customers
make everyone’s sampling experience one they won’t forget - we really mean it
manage gear and cider for demos and brand events
hours vary - weekend and weeknight heavy

compensation
$15-20/hr + $0.575 per mile

to apply:
we want your resume and a kickass, characterful cover letter telling us: your story, why you love downeast, and what you will bring to our team. scrap the overly-formal language and tell it to us straight - why you?

Lovepop is a Boston-based startup that creates unique, laser-cut pop-up cards and is on a mission to create 1 billion magical moments around the world. We help people express themselves and share the love that they have for others through thoughtful pop-up surprises!

We launched Lovepop out of the Harvard Innovation Lab in late 2014 and were on Shark Tank in December of 2015! We received investment from “Mr. Wonderful”, Kevin O’Leary, and been growing ever since. In addition to recurring appearances on Shark Tank, we’ve been featured on the Billboard Music Awards, in a national Microsoft ad campaign, and Good Morning America.

We're changing the way that people think about giving gifts, and need enthusiastic, motivated, and hardworking individuals to help us create magical moments.

Responsibilities

Welcome every customer and give them an amazing experience that encourages them to keep coming back.
Keep the kiosk looking magical and engaging, making sure that our product is always looking its best.
Responsibly open and close the kiosk, manage the register, and count inventory.
Sell Lovepop cards to meet daily sales goals and tell our story to customers.
Work hard and be a great team member. We expect everyone on the team to take ownership and show an ambitious attitude.

Are reliable and dependable people who want to succeed and outperform expectations.
Are strong communicators who make people feel welcome and appreciated.
Have experience working independently, learning quickly, and tackling problems.
Have a high school degree or GED and previous sales experience.
Are able to stand for 4-6 hours in a retail selling environment, lift 30 pounds, and have a knack for counting.
Availability

People who can work weekday or weekend shifts. Shifts generally range from 4-6 hours each, which is perfect for people who are looking to supplement their full-time projects or are looking for flexible work hours.

This is an amazing opportunity to be part of something new and different, and we're excited to hear from you! What are you waiting for?

We Offer

Three free cards per month.
An opportunity for growth as we continue grow our locations across the country.

Are you an…
Ambassador of Awesomeness?
or perhaps an…
Engineer of Experiences?

Then maybe you have what it takes to be an Angelic Bakehouse Brand Ambassador!
You get the picture…we’re looking for that health-conscious person with moxie. That person who will thrive in the fast paced and ever-changing world of in-store sampling, farmer’s markets, and experiential marketing at local events. Your ability and desire to engage, educate, and excite consumers is how we measure success. Do you have what it takes?

Your typical workday will look something like this:
The Brand Ambassador must be available both Saturdays and Sundays.
The Brand Ambassador will exchange bread for money, talk about the product with market-goers, create samples for market-goers to try, handle cash and credit card transactions, count the bread, lift about 30 pounds, work well with people, be friendly and outgoing, and have a good time outdoors rain or shine!
The Brand Ambassador also works in grocery store demos, various community events, health fairs, and more as the face of the company, educating consumers on Angelic Bakehouse sprouted grain bread products and encouraging sales of the brand.
Occasionally, it may include some of this:
Overnight travel.
A longer work day at trade shows or other special events.

Your qualifications
Detail Oriented – Attention to detail, ability to focus on the project or task at hand and consistently deliver error free results.
Change Management – Adaptable to a fast paced, shifting work environment; willing to remain flexible to accommodate changing business conditions, work requirements and scheduling needs.
Integrity, personal responsibility, and a genuine passion for healthy, delicious foods.
Ability to lift 30 pounds and stand for 4 hours or more at a time.
Reliable transportation. Personal vehicle is preferred.
Excellent communication to communicate via text, and send in reports after demo events.
Ability to follow food safety guidelines.

Education and Related Experience, Qualifications and/or Certifications:
One (1) to three (3) years of sales/marketing experience preferred, but not required.
Customer service and/or sales experience desired.
Excellent written and oral communications skills
Driver’s License with clean driving record is required to occasionally drive company vehicles for farmer’s markets and other events.

environment? Do you want to get in on the ground floor of a fast growing food business?

CAVA is a rapidly expanding fast casual restaurant and packaged goods brand focusing on fresh, Mediterranean inspired, better-for-you cuisine. Born from our full service restaurants, our chef-driven fast casual format has grown to 28 locations in the past few years, with new restaurants opening in the DC metro area, Richmond, California and New York. Our packaged goods continue to expand in Whole Foods Market and other specialty stores.

We are looking for food lovers to help spread CAVA love at events, at in-store tastings, and within the local community. The position will will require a passion for the CAVA mission and the drive to help build a growing brand.

Product sampling:
• Execute best-in-class consumer tasting opportunities at in-store retail locations and local events
• Create authentic, positive, memorable experiences for consumers to increase brand awareness, drive trial and build loyalty
• Provide exceptional customer service to the stores that sell our products and to our consumers
• Be an expert about our products and our company

• Perform merchandising at store prior to starting demo and at the end of the demo
• Adhere to all schedules and employee policies

You have:
• 1+ years of brand ambassador experience
• A passion for food
• Outstanding customer service skills and the ability to represent CAVA in a genuine, positive manner
• Ability to engage a crowd or individuals one-one
• Strong attention to detail and strong verbal communication skills
• An eagerness to join a growing company
• A desire to help build a brand

You are:
• Naturally outgoing, charismatic, self-motivated, highly organized
• Always early

And in addition:
• Clean driving record is required - a background check will be conducted
• Reliable transportation and valid driver’s license
• Access to a computer or mobile device and consistent internet for submitting recaps and feedback
• Must be able to lift 60 lbs with no restrictions
• Must be able to work a flexible schedule, including weekends and some holidays

Benefits:
• Mileage incurred for transportation to and from demo locations is reimbursed at $.54/mile, after the first 30 miles driven to/from location. Expenses for items needed to perform demo are also reimbursed
