At Red Diamond, we are driven by an obsession to provide a world-class coffee and tea experience. Since 1906, the cornerstone of our company has been our commitment to unparalleled quality, innovation and customer service. We achieve this by hiring the best employees and providing great benefits and a fulfilling work environment which allows our employees to make an impact and deliver the highest quality coffee and tea products available.

The Brand Ambassador is responsible for representing Red Diamond in our communities and retailers by scheduling, managing, promoting, and executing local sampling/demonstration events and programs. This person will conduct 1:1 sampling, find and develop relationships with consumers within their neighborhoods. We are looking for an enthusiastic, full of initiative, outgoing, driven individual (it doesn’t hurt if you are also a customer!) to grow our brand. This role will consist of sampling Red Diamond coffee and tea products at community events and grocery stores and capturing the attention of your audience to tell the Red Diamond story. You will have responsibility for preparing the product ahead of time, driving the Red Diamond SweetRide vehicle to transport product for demonstration/sampling, and reporting back to company management on the success of the event. The Brand Ambassador will be responsible for taking pictures at events and forwarding those to social management partners and handling the truck social media accounts. The Brand Ambassador’s primary work schedule will beTuesday through Saturday during peak store and event hours (full time).

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:
Excellent interpersonal skills. Outgoing, interactive, engaging personality. Able to gain the attention of a crowd and tell a story.
Ability to work a flexible work schedule.
Responsible and reliable. You must be dependable.
Ability to work independently.
Knowledge of basic math.
Strong organizational skills.
Basic computer skills with strong understanding of social media.
Ability to work on multiple tasks at one time and meet deadlines.
Ability to drive a company sampling vehicle, including set up, brewing, and sampling.
Education and Experience Required: High school diploma or equivalent required and Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or Business Management preferred. Event planning experience required, and restaurant/retail sales experience preferred.

Licenses or Certifications Required: Valid driver’s license in good standing (motor vehicle record will be checked)

Position Summary
This position will report to the Director, Brand Management. He/she will have partnerships with sales, finance, operations, legal, and product development; and within marketing, as well as international executives and staff.

This position requires strong experience in international product marketing, market research, consumer insights, packaging, market strategy and development, campaign development, POP merchandising, and forecasting. This position also requires someone who is strategic, can multi-task, has impeccable communications skills and is ready to roll up their sleeves.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following and other duties as assigned.
•Ability to manage and utilize consumer insights through data mining, research, and listening to the field.
•Conduct analysis of the market to understand trends, competitors, and consumers behaviors (both as B2B and B2C).
•Identify target segmentations and define brand/product positioning.
•Define, manage, and grow brand portfolio.
•Lead in developing seasonal, annual, and long term marketing strategies and plans for in-line and new products, and in existing and new international markets.
•Lead in the development of marketing plans, sales forecasts, profit and expenses for assigned brands/product and other marketing opportunities such as promotions, packages, and incentives.
•Identify issues/opportunities and articulate directions/briefs for integrated marketing activities comprised of events, promotions, advertising, on-line, PR plans; and ensure effective implementation and accountability of each activity.
•Ability to manage and facilitate process and development of product ideation, pricing, packaging, and design; with a vision and consistency to integrate with overall sales and marketing plan.
•Build cross-functional relationships internally, especially with Sales, Product Development, Legal, and Operations.
•Create integrated communications by leading and collaborating with respective marketing functions and external marketing resources.
•Be the gatekeeper of schedules around all marketing-related activities and proactively ensure on-time deliverables.
•Monitor and analyze progress made by marketing programs.
•Other duties as assigned.

Education and/or Experience
•Bachelor’s degree required, post graduate degree preferred.
•5 or more years of brand management experience from leading consumer goods companies (FMCG a preference).
•Outstanding in formulating brand strategies and managing marketing executions.
•Adept in working with a broad range of departments and in a global and matrix organization.
•Strong leadership and collaborative skills.
•Experience in working in international markets and/or roles.
•Experience of brand P/L responsibilities.
•Experience in Direct Selling industry is a plus.

Qualifications/Skills
•Well-developed interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to relate well to people in multi-national organizations and with people in foreign subsidiaries.
•A persuasive individual with excellent presentation skills and the ability to get support for his/her programs and plans.
•An organized individual, comfortable at multi-tasking, and able to prioritize amongst many competing activities.
•Strong analytic and strategic reasoning skills, particularly as they relate to leveraging consumer insights through data mining and feedback from the field.
•Solid business acumen, able to develop plans and budgets, and then operate within those guidelines.
•Confident individual with instant credibility who is able to excel in relatively unstructured function.
•Strong leadership abilities and comfortable in a matrix organization.
•Creatively driven and willingness to accept and try new things.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

IMPORTANT: You must apply through our online application at bit.ly/supercrewapplication, not through Indeed.

Start date early May. Must be available to onboard in advance of start date.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Willie’s Superbrew is a hard seltzer blended with real fruit. It’s gluten free and low in carbs and calories, but we brew with thousands of pounds of real fruits and spices, meaning it’s bursting with real flavor. It’s a drink as unique and refreshing as its origin story. Because after all, there aren’t many places where a goat farmer and a young neuroscientist would meet, but apparently a beach on the Cape is one. Willie shared his ginger brew, and they started selling it at farmers’ markets. The rest is history.

We are a team with heart and hustle unified by a dream to make alcohol better and our belief in 5 values:
Foster Growth
No B.S
Have a Soul
Be Curious and Innovate
Live Responsibly
JOB DESCRIPTION

We are bringing real ingredients + transparency to alcohol, and we're doing it with soul. We are looking for passionate, enthusiastic and all around awesome people to join our small team and be part of directly growing a small start-up as we grow Superbrew across the Northeast.

Supercrew Requirements
Available on a weekly basis in the following time frames: TH 4-7pm, F 4-7pm, S 1-7pm, Su 1-7pm for at least 2 hours
Mature, dependable, and able to work unsupervised
Comfortable being on your feet for a long period of time
Access to dependable transportation with a valid driver’s license
Passionate and enthusiastic about Willie’s Superbrew
Have great communication and people skills.
Be able to educate others
21+
What Does the Supercrew Do?
As a Brand Ambassador, you will represent Willie’s at customer-facing events such as Grocery & Liquor Store Samplings, Bars & Restaurant Promotions, Brewfests, Local Events, and more. Your main job will be to educate new customers on what Willie’s is and why it’s so great by getting as many people as possible to try it.

One of the purposes of this program is to be a direct pipeline for long-term hires. That being said, interest in long-term employment is not a requirement by any means. Our goal is to empower everyone within this program to be a part of bringing real ingredients to alcohol! We know that success is more than just numbers, and we want to make sure you grow and have fun just as much as we want you to do well at tastings. We’re a tightknit team here, so while everyone works hard on their own, we like to get together and balance it out with some fun, too. We will always welcome and solicit suggestions, ideas, & feedback and you will have the opportunity to individually pursue new ideas to grow and spread Willie’s.

Tasting & Event Responsibilities
Most of your responsibilities with Super Crew will be tastings at different liquor & grocery stores in your region. Tastings are an opportunity to educate and directly sell to new consumers and create excitement about the Superbrew Brand. We also sponsor a number of events around the region which are organized by companies, nonprofits & orgs with similar values to our own. These are a variety of events throughout the year and no two are the same!

At both tastings and events, your responsibilities include:
Represent Willie’s Superbrew at an account - this may be a customers first & only interaction with the brand, so we need to make sure it’s a great one!
Arrive on time with ample product/materials, greet managers/organizers, and set up for scheduled tasting time
Serve customers samples of the brews & educate them on Superbrew
Be responsible for ensuring you always have enough product, sample cups & promo material by coordinating with Ellen & the office team
Follow up each tasting/event with feedback about your experience with accounts, tastings & customers
Inputting your desired availabilities at least 2 weeks in advance so we can schedule you accordingly
Scheduling
Scheduling is flexible. We can work around your schedule. That being said, most tastings will occur between the following timeframes:
Thursdays 4-7pm
Fridays 4-8pm
Saturdays 1-7pm
Sundays 1-7pmTastings are generally between 2-4 hours. We’ve found that SuperCrew members that are in our program the longest do at least 1 tasting per week . Our most successful SuperCrew members do 2+ tastings per week.
There are two main types of events where you would represent Willie’s Superbrew - at Direct Selling Events and Other Events.

See below for a breakdown of our current structure:
Event Type: Direct Selling (ie. grocery & liquor store tastings)
Frequency: 90% of current openings
Compensation Structure: $15/hr + mileage compensation + bonus incentives
Event Type: Other Events (ie. sponsored promotional events, brewfests, local events, etc.)
Frequency: 10% of current openings
Compensation Structure: $15/hr (NYC: $20/hr) + mileage compensation

Now What?
Sound like a good gig? Apply at bit.ly/supercrewapplication

We have distinct meal-kit services that cater to everyone with the most menu variety in the market, which allows us to reach an incredibly wide population of people. ABOUT CANDYTOPIA:

What if an eccentric chocolatier and a daredevil pop starhad a whirlwind romance, got married while skydiving, and had a glamorous,glittering love. This six-month event celebrates the vibrant colors andflavors of our favorite sugary delights through a series of interactive artinstallations in over a dozen environments, from flying unicorn pigs to amarshmallow tsunami. If you ever dreamed of nibbling your way through Candylandor scoring a Golden Ticket, youve come to the right place. Apply today to beour General Manager! Treat yourself to working at Candytopia and let your tastebuds and your imagination soar!

Job Description
Marketing Brand Ambassador Job Description

Reports to: SUPERVISOR

Location: Dallas

What’s the gig? Brand Ambassadors are the face and voice of Chameleon in the local market, bringing the brand to life through in-store demos, events and guerrilla missions. It’s about driving trial, educating consumers and creating lasting first impressions that the consumer will share with their friends.

Who is the ideal Brand Ambassador? The perfect BA is flexible, enthusiastic, responsible and reliable! First impressions are everything – BA’s have excellent communication skills and a well-presented appearance.

Primary Responsibilities:

- Be an expert in all things Chameleon: including product and ingredient information, supported accounts and partners, Chameleon culture, and have basic sales knowledge

- Drive trial and educate consumers on Chameleon Cold-Brew at in-store demos, events and guerrilla missions

- Educate the public on the benefits of Chameleon while providing an insight for further information

- Provide recaps with photos from sampling activations

- Assist with gaining market share and ensuring Chameleon Cold-Brew stays top of mind at retail

- Ensure product is kept stocked at accounts post demo

In addition, you will be an expert in engaging the consumer. You will:

- Exude confidence, own every interaction

- Be a social chameleon, adapt to consumers from all walks of life through engaging and natural dialogue

- Personalize each interaction to create a unique and memorable experience for the consumer

- Be an active listener

- Be a team player

Skills and Requirements:

- Excellent communication skills

- A mature mindset

- Ability to adapt to and work well in all environments

- Flexible schedule

- Must be able to sit or stand for hours at a time

- Must be able to lift/carry 30 lbs.

- Must have a car

Skills Required
Teamwork
Guest-Centric, Friendly Attitude
Ability to Work in a Fast-Paced Environment
Run-It-Like-You-Own-It Mentality
If you're looking to elevate your career, try something new, or to fill your free time with a position that truly makes a difference in someone's day, our Brand Ambassador position is the perfect place to do so. Become immersed in the Main Event culture, learn the ins and outs, work your way up the ladder, or just join the team for the Serious Fun.

Our Brand Ambassadors are tasked with providing our Guests with an exceptional experience by being the main point of contact during their visit. You'll be responsible for providing recommendations, showing them an exceptional time, attending to their needs and making their time memorable, all while keeping a smile. This position is perfect for someone who is looking for meaningful part-time or full-time work, who's great with people, great with kids, and knows a thing or two about making a day special.

What makes a great Brand Ambassador?
Ability to show hospitality to each and every guest
Someone who is comfortable with "being of service"
Naturally friendly and welcoming demeanor
Organized with an attention to detail
A great communicator - you'll need to be able to ask the right questions to guide the guest experience
The ability to stand and stay in motion for long periods of time
What will you be doing on a daily basis?
Manage the Guest experience i.e. the first and last person the Guest will see on every visit
Being extra-attentive to Guests and their various needs
Being an ambassador of fun, ensuring each Guest will want to come back again and again
Communicate to the team who is a first-time Guest and who has been here before
Showcasing the multiple areas of fun Main Event has to offer by guiding guests through the center if necessary and providing instructions of where and how to enjoy the Main Event experience, including activities and food and beverage options
Managing Guest expectations - keeping communication clear on wait times for games, food and other aspects
Performing opening, closing and side duties as required
Main Event Entertainment is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Ocean Spray believes that our employees are our best asset and we offer an environment where you can work with exceptionally smart, innovative, passionate teams that are motivated to deliver Ocean Spray products around the world.

In a nutshell:

Is your motto “Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving”? Are you a maker with a can-do attitude? Are you a pioneer who enjoys bringing new ideas to life and then driving their growth? If you are a self-starter with an open mind who views challenges as opportunities – a.k.a. You don’t give up!... Then you are who we are looking for!

The Brand Manager for Innovation Lighthouse Incubator will be assigned to a start-up business and empowered to lead its incubation and growth. You will not do it alone. You will be responsible for leading cross functional teams in planning, execution and evaluation of your start-up’s learning and growth goals.

The role is a combination of Incubating and Growing your startup brand to serve both user’s and customer’s needs and journey.

We are looking for an energetic individual with an entrepreneurial or brand innovation background.

Other responsibilities include:

Develop business objectives and marketing plans for assigned brand startup that reflect overall corporate goals; seamlessly execute marketing plans to deliver against brand, financial and share objectives; monitor performance measurements to ensure brand is tracking against goals - recommends and implements corrective actions; analyze data to identify insights and translate into business initiatives and/or actionable tasks to drive results; lead/participate in development and execution of marketing strategies including brand positioning, communication strategies, advertising and consumer promotion initiatives.

Work closely with growth, sales, e-com and activation teams to leverage digital channels and platforms to drive your brand’s trial, awareness and and overall growth. Work with creative team to ensure effective and efficient translation of marketing strategies into activation plans; lead in development and execution of product, brand creative assets and packaging. Lead feasibility validation, product and packaging, project execution, customer sell in and tracking of in-market performance; partner with short term and long-term innovation, channels and customer business teams to develop and execute innovation plans. Work hand-in-hand with the sales and growth unit to understand and integrate customer strategies in business and brand plans. Manage monthly volume forecast for assigned brand/categories, coordinating between demand and supply planning to deliver best-in-class forecast accuracy; manage brand budget including A&P spending for assigned product responsibility

Must have:

♦ Inspired by possibilities. Be a pioneer with an insatiable appetite for bringing new ideas to life and driving their growth.

♦ Technical and Business curiosity. Communicate directly and immediately. Don’t be afraid to assume the role of a leader, contributing both technically and to the broader business discussion.

♦ Thrive in complexity. Highly motivated, dedicated, Self-starter with a natural inclination to contribute well beyond functional role. Can always be counted on to lend a hand and promote team engagement to achieve goals.

♦ Agile with ability to multitask; one day you will work on business planning & P&L creation, the next day you will be standing in front of our booth promoting our brand. Yes! you work in all altitudes

♦ Timely /accurate administrative duties; keeping management informed of development process, opportunities, updates. Drive for results and follow-through.

♦ Wild, disruptive and fearless. You will revel in the art of craftsmanship, with an itch to shape the bigger picture. You will cut straight to the heart of the matter, and love making the plan a reality.

♦ Build, Build, Build. A straight-shooter who values and respects team members. Be available to the team and forge strong relationships with those around you.

When you join us:

♦ You will be expected to create a unique and dynamic environment with positive and fun culture in our Innovation team. If you are looking to create and build a start-up environment with support from a corporation, this is your chance!

♦ You will make an impact on society by bringing health & wellness to everyone focusing on helping the next generation of eaters build better behaviors, as well as, helping us as food creators build better solutions to address our industry challenges and complex food system.

Qualifications:

♦EDUCATION: An MBA or equivalent education/experience is required.

♦EXPERIENCE: A minimum 7 years of relevant start-up, brand/marketing experience is required

♦SPECIAL SKILLS: Demonstrated strong analytical and strategic thinking skills are required; strong communication and presentation skills are required; strong collaborator with a demonstrated ability to lead cross functional teams; proven ability to effectively manage multiple projects in a dynamic environment is required; experience growing digital / e-com businesses and working with Nielsen and/or IRI is preferred

♦TRAVEL: 6-10 trips per year
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

Island seeks a Brand Ambassador to educate and support our top East Bay and San Francisco accounts. You will play a vital role in representing our brand with enthusiasm and passion at local dispensaries, in-store events and promotions.

As an Island Brand Ambassador, you will create a unique and inviting customer experience to increase brand awareness and build customer loyalty, ultimately driving in-store sales.

The ideal candidates will be outgoing, sharp, and hungry to learn on their feet in a budding industry (pun intended)!

Responsibilities

Execute in-store demos and event activations at our top dispensary accounts in San Francisco and the East Bay, with light travel to Santa Cruz
Understand and represent our product suite in order to educate and excite consumers and budtenders
Coordinate with Island Territory Managers and Account Executives on scheduling, product levels, display areas, and demo guidelines
Organize branded assets, equipment and product to ensure easy setup and takedown
Be engaging, persuasive, upbeat and approachable -- you are an expert on the Island product suite, can gauge consumer needs and interests, and know how to upsell!
Track consumer engagement, feedback and preferences
Be the eyes and ears of Island from the field: report on observations regarding retail accounts as well as competitor activity

Qualifications

Must be 21+ and possess a current valid CA Drivers License and reliable mode of transportation
Must have a high school diploma
Must reside in the Bay Area, with easy access to Alameda and San Francisco County
Minimum one year of experience in sales, as a Brand Ambassador or other customer facing role is ideal
Experience professionally presenting and engaging with individuals and groups via in-store demos
Available to work 20-38 hours/week with a mix of weekday and weekend shifts
Strong on-site presentation skills with the ability to plan, attend and coordinate demos and special events
Exceptional organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills - you make a strong first impression!
You can work autonomously and are self-motivated
Cannabis product and industry expertise a plus!

Physical Requirements
Remain standing/walking for extended amounts of time daily
Regularly lift 25 lbs
Ability to work in an adverse environment with varying temperatures and conditions

About ISLAND

Founded in 2014, Island is a leading cannabis company based in California. Our passion for exploration, community, and the outdoors comes to life through our wide range of high quality and straightforward products. Widely recognized as a dominant figure in manufacturing, compliance, and technology, Island continues to build industry-shaping infrastructure while inspiring moments of happiness with our customers. Island boasts an impressive executive team and is backed by some of the most prominent investors in the CPG industry. As part of this journey, we are seeking bright, entrepreneurial leaders that will help propel Island into a nationally recognized brand within our category.

ISLAND provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

PURPOSE OF THE JOB:The Suja Juice Crew is a dynamic team of active, outgoing, and knowledgeable individuals, who are passionate about spreading the Suja Love. They live by way of Suja; leading healthy & active lifestyles and are eager to encourage others to live a long, beautiful life by way of conscious nutrition. The integral part of the Juice Crew's role is to sample & educate consumers, while creating a memorable experience that will build brand awareness and drive brand loyalty. The Juice Crew is the face of Suja!RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:* Become a credible product and brand expert* Be the face of the brand at events, retail, and sampling opportunities at multiple locations* Be a social chameleon: approach a variety of strangers and interact in a natural conversation with the goal of developing brand loyalty with the consumer* Be the team player that works well with other squad members to deliver sampling goals* Identify future sampling and/ or event opportunities to convey to the hiring manager* Willing to take ownership of sampling activations and work with hiring manager to ensure successful execution* Assist counterparts in the collegiate program with marketing, planning and event executions* Be able to identify future Suja Juice Crew Members while out in the field and exchange contact information for hiring manager

Job Description
Do you enjoy meeting new people? Do you consider yourself a foodie? Then join our winning team as a Brand Ambassador promoting our products at our local retailers! We are looking for outgoing, enthusiastic, friendly, reliable individuals to join our team.

Responsibilities and Duties

Create brand awareness and positive impressions of our product by engaging consumers through sampling and demonstrating our gourmet products. Our Brand Ambassadors serve as the face of our products to accounts and consumers at selling events in the field, communicating unique value and encouraging trial. We will provide training and all the necessary supplies.

Essential Responsibilities:
Set up, break down, product preparation and sampling during in-store selling events.
Clean and professional appearance required.
Actively draw in customers to the event table and drive sales.
Generate brand awareness and positive product impressions to increase sales.
Ability to meet schedules and deadlines.
Offer promotional materials to customers (e.g., recipes, brochures, business cards, etc.).
Submit required paperwork and suggestions and comments from customers and managers.
Order supplies as needed.
Selling events are generally 3-4 hours long and occur between 10 am-7 pm. We are hoping to bring candidates on board who are reliable, motivated, and eager to promote the Bellisari’s brand awareness

Qualifications and Skills
Prior promotional demonstrating experience a plus.
Strong organizational skills.
Weekend availability required.
Ability to work independently as well as a member of a team.
Must be comfortable addressing and engaging the public.
Must be able to lift up to 40 pounds.
Must be able to stoop, bend, reach, turn, twist and stand.
Must be able to stand for entire time of selling event (from 3 to 6 hours).

18 years of age or older.
Ability to travel within a limited geography.

Want to gain experience, develop professional skills and have fun where you work?

Each year, PepWear attends more than 800 events to celebrate the achievements of students. The events we attend are school music functions. Events occur year-round with January April and September November being peak times. Events are mostly held on Saturdays.


Custom shirts, plaques, and other memorabilia are created for each event and are offered for sale onsite.


Highlights include:

W-2 position, earn commissions based on sales, plus bonuses

All expenses paid, including mileage and drive time

Work with great people and customers

Opportunity to travel

Couples are welcome



The Event Sales Representative is responsible for:

Getting PepWear's merchandise and equipment to the event site

Setting up the sales booth

Selling the products

Packing up the booth after the event

Reporting sales and expenses, and accounting for money collected

Managing a team of 1 to 5 additional workers who will assist with the duties



The job requires being on your feet for hours at a time and lifting/moving boxes and equipment weighing up to 40 pounds. Marching contests typically start in the morning and end in the evening, while Clinic Concerts are usually held in the evening and last 5 to 6 hours.



Events occur year-round with January - April, and September - November being our peak times. Events are mostly held on Saturdays.



The Event Representative will become a PepWear Employee and must:

Have auto insurance

Pass a background check

Have a clean driving record



If you love kids, music, sports and are interested in a flexible, part-time job several weekends a year, this is the job for you. We need PepReps to work at events all across the US.



Great for college students, active retirees or anyone looking for extra income. We provide the training you get a flexible, fun work environment a few weekends a year.



To find out more please visit www.pepwear.com/bearep

Motivated, outgoing Brand Ambassador needed to spread the Willie's Distillery love in Billings and the surrounding area.
Willie's Distillery is a craft distillery located in the picturesque cowboy town of Ennis, MT. We distill and produce small-batch brandies, whiskies, and liqueurs.
Brand Ambassadors work closely with the Montana Sales Manager, ensuring excellent customer service and a vast knowledge base of products. Brand Ambassadors are expected to set up new accounts, service existing accounts, and consistently increase sales in and around the Billings territory by doing tastings, visiting and servicing liquor stores, offering bartender training, public events, private meetings, and more. If you are fun, adventurous, positive, creative, and highly driven, this might be the perfect position for you. This position is based in Billings. Position Description (Internal)

We are looking for a dynamic, creative, and passionate individual to join our marketing team and be a part of an exciting opportunity to change the tobacco landscape and reimagine a new world of smoking enjoyment for Adult Tobacco Consumers (ATC). Backed with experience, dedication, and best in class industry resources, you will be in charge of developing compelling Consumer Engagement marketing programs for our broad portfolio of products. Consumer Engagement is a strategically important capability within our marketing mix - the only touchpoint that truly delivers a face-to-face brand experience with our ATCs and connects with them in their environment. We leverage the Consumer Engagement capability across our broad tobacco portfolio (Natural American Spirit, Newport, Camel Cigarettes, Camel SNUS, Grizzly, Pall Mall and VUSE) ensuring the delivery of relevant and meaningful conversations and experiences.

You will serve as the principal point person within marketing for the development of Consumer Engagement programs that educate and excite ATCs on our products – bringing the brands to life across a variety of marketing channels. You will also be responsible for managing two dynamic and highly engaged Promotional Marketing Agencies that execute the consumer engagement programs on our behalf.

The ideal candidate will be able to:
Lead the strategy, selection, performance management (goal setting, contract negotiation, measurement and tracking and support of training and learning programs.) of consumer-facing brand ambassadors and execution of in-person events (e.g., pop-ups, sponsorships, retail, MAOFs)
Development of IP consumer engagement activities across the portfolio (Brand & sponsorship)
Develop & management of our relationship programs across portfolio.
Management of in-field activation specialists in key markets responsible for in market activation excellence
Proactively evaluate, develop, test new CE capabilities
Develop strategy for achieving superior results in engaging our Adult Tobacco Consumers
Apply understanding of Brands and Consumers to achieve commercial goals
Oversee all operations and monitor overall CE program performance with the Agencies
Provide leadership by collaborating with a broad, cross-functional team of peers (Brand Marketing, Marketing Finance, Marketing Research, Trade Marketing, Marketing Operations, R&D, Legal, & External Relations)
Ensure that corporate strategy and regulatory guidelines are imbedded in all marketing initiatives

Position Qualification

Education:
• Bachelors Degree Required; MBA / Masters degree preferred

Knowledge/Experience:
• No less than 8 years professional experience
• Experience managing 3rd Party Agencies
• Demonstrated track record of high personal and team performance
• Record of developing self and others

Special Skills/Attributes:

• Superior understanding of brand and consumer values

• Inquisitive nature and ability to translate consumer attitudes and behaviors into hypothesis and business opportunities

• Extremely resourceful and highly results oriented

• Proven strategy development, planning, and analytical skills

• Creative thinker with an open mind to learn and explore new areas and opportunities

• Ability to deal with ambiguity while progressing to achieve key milestones
• Excellent leadership and influencing skills

• Demonstrated vision and ability to understand broader business scope

Job Title: Brand Ambassador, RumHaven and High Noon
Job Description:
Why E. & J. Gallo Winery?

Named a Glassdoor "Best Places to Work" three years in row, we couldn't be prouder of our company culture. As the largest family-owned winery in the world with over 100+ unique wine and spirits brands, our products are synonymous with life's special occasions. Come celebrate with us! Your Talent & Gallo | A Perfect Pairing

As a Spirits Brand Ambassador, you will act as Nashville authority for RumHaven and High Noon. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to creatively develop and implement both visibility trade and consumer activations while working collaboratively with our Sales and marketing teams. With an entrepreneurial mindset, you will aggressively pursue and deliver on A&P, PODS, and consumer event objectives for both on-premise and retail.

You will be responsible for developing and implementing training, promotion, and providing customer support in the Nashville market. You will become an expert on the target consumer lifestyle, target customer, and be able to identify opportunities to meet goals. This is a great opportunity to serve as the face of the brand, and work collaboratively with an extensive sales team (Gallo & Distributor), trade, consumers, and marketing.

What You Will Do
Develops and implements trade advocacy strategy for RumHaven and High Noon.
Develops and implements engaging brand and category educational presentations for trade and consumers.
Develops and provides the primary relationship with the account, drives the sale, makes regular sales calls, and promotes RumHaven and Hig Noon
Builds, implements manages consumer activation strategies, programs, and events.
Provides support, activation and memorable experiences for both customers and consumers.
Manages T&E and activation budgets.
Advocates for assigned brand, including hosting events, leveraging social media and other tools to promote Gallo sales within his/her community.
Coordinates activities with other winery support areas within the market
Engages and mobilizes Sales and Distributor partners to communicate brand strategy, vision, sales tactics, as well as drive enthusiasm for the brand and executional excellence of all programs and initiatives.
Contributes creatively in the development of new branded POS and collateral.
Responsible for identifying unique POS opportunities and sourcing locally for testing.
Influences and activates customers’ consumer distribution lists and social media followers through activation of digital content.
Supports commercialization of digital marketing programs.
Engage as needed with most relevant platforms of social media (FB, IG, Snapchat).
Gather real-time photo and video content to be shared with the brand social media team.
Responsible for developing, organizing and executing exceptional evangelist initiatives against customers and consumers.
Works with agency partners to coordinate and manage team of part-time event promoters for initiatives aimed at consumers and the trade.
Leads debriefs after events to effectively decipher strengths and opportunities.
Work with the local Gallo and Distributor Sales teams on planning and strategizing for future launch markets.
Participate, as needed, in Gallo and Distributor Sales meetings and schedule work-withs in your territory.
Completes monthly quantitative and qualitative reports as needed, including competitive brand observations.
Maintains intellectual relevance of global and local market trends.
Manages all Gallo Standards of Performance within assigned target account list.
Promotes positive relationships across the winery sales organization.
Embraces innovation and demonstrates entrepreneurial mindset –Driving future-focused change.
What You Will Need
High School Diploma or State-issued equivalency certificate.
Bachelor’s Degree plus 3 years of Gallo Sales and Marketing experience, or Gallo affiliated or non-affiliated distributor sales experience or Alcohol Beverage, Hospitality, Culinary, Bars, Non-Alcohol beverage, Supplier/Wholesaler, or Tasting Rooms sales experience reflecting increasing levels of responsibility -OR- 5 years of sales experience to include Alcohol Beverage, Hospitality, Culinary, Bars, Supplier/Wholesaler, or Tasting Rooms experience reflecting increasing levels of responsibility.
Experience with owned social media and networks.
Required to travel by air and automobile up to 25% during the course of business.
Experience with Event or Hospitality Management.
CSS, CSE, CEFS, CSSC or equivalent certification or in process of obtaining within 6 months of employment.
Valid driver’s license. Required to obtain a California driver’s license or appropriate state driver’s license within 30 days of hire.
Required to be 21 years of age or older.
Required to obtain Liquor License as required by state/locality.
Personal passion and curiosity for spirits and demonstrate a depth of knowledge.
What Will Set You Apart
Bachelor’s degree plus 4 years of Gallo Sales and Marketing experience, or Gallo affiliated or non-affiliated distributor sales experience or Alcohol Beverage, Hospitality, Culinary, Bars, Non-Alcohol beverage, Supplier/Wholesaler, or Tasting Rooms sales experience reflecting increasing levels of responsibility.
Established social Alcohol beverage network, personal interest, bias to engage and go deeper, proven inquisitiveness.
Established relationships within the designated market.
Experience with selling and activating premium and luxury spirits.
Knowledge of Microsoft Office.
Skilled in calculating figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commission, proportion, percentage, area, circumference and volume.
Personal passion and curiosity for spirits and demonstrate a depth of knowledge.
Gallo does not sponsor for employment based visas for this position now or in the future.

Job Description
BRAND AMBASSADOR (Orange County / Southern Los Angeles) - Thélios

The role of the Brand Ambassador is to deliver net sales targets by brand for the Thélios portfolio in the Region through the development of client relationships while promoting our brands and providing an excellent customer service experience. Position based in Orange County / Southern Los Angeles.

Associates are Amazon and Treasure Truck brand ambassadors! Job Description:
The Brand Ambassador maintains a close relationship with retailers that sell the company's retail products. They ensure that each store has the most updated branding, promotions, and training materials. Additionally, the Brand Ambassador ensures that the retailer has all new products, assists with filling applications and manages any type of claims or requests that might come from the retailer's owners or staff. Brand Ambassadors may open new direct IDT branded stores and sell to unattended retailers, if requested by the Company

You would have the chance to:
Visit retailers on a daily basis
Maintain the POP material placement for all products and distribute new POP material
Collect key information by doing specific surveys for different products
IDT product sales (Hard Cards, Boss Revolution, POS, Merchant Services, Cash Advance, etc)
Fill Financial Service Applications (Money Transfer, Bill Payment, etc.)
Introduce new products to our retailers
Research information about competitors offerings and new products
Create reports with the findings of each day route and analyze data in order to offer recommendations
Educate retailers regarding procedures, selling techniques, and general information about the products or special promotions
Report stores that have low inventory or low balance.

Proven work experience in a relevant role, including as an account manager
Bilingual professionals with fluency in both English and Spanish are preferred

Basic computer skills - comfortable using tablet and/or Bluetooth equipment
Ability to communicate, present and influence key stakeholders at all levels
Proven ability to multitask while maintaining sharp attention to detail
At IDT, we understand the challenge of being apart from those who matter most. Communicating, transferring money, and mobile phone service must be safe, simple, and affordable. Our flagship brand, Boss Revolution, which includes our International Calling, Mobile Top Up, and Money Transfer services, as well as our Boss Revolution Mobile, net2phone, National Retail Solutions, IDT Express, and IDT Carrier Services divisions all support IDT's mission of enabling our customers to keep in touch and share resources with their friends and family around the world.

IDT is listed on the NYSE, employs over 1000 people across 20+ countries and has revenues in excess of $1.5 billion. Since 1990, IDT Telecom has remained a pioneer in Prepaid VoIP and UCaaS telephony. Today, we are an industry leader in prepaid communication and payment services and are one of the world's largest international voice carriers.

CHEERS!Deutsch Family Wine& Spirits currently seeks a Regional Portfolio Brand Ambassador, located in California, to represent Redemption Whiskey, Bib& Tucker Bourbon and Gray Whale Gin.

The Regional Portfolio Brand Ambassador will form relationships with key accounts, distributor managers, and salespeople throughout the state of California. This role will serve to increase brand knowledge and engagement within the distributor sales force; drive retail and menu placements, lead distributor educational and kickoff meetings, and activate staff/consumer trainings. This role will also oversee and drive brand education to target consumers at key spirits events and festivals and will regularly interface with the brand teams at headquarters as well.

Reporting to the Trade Advocacy Manager, the Regional Portfolio Brand Ambassador will inspire consumers, on/off trade professionals and distributor partners to become staunch advocates of these exciting brands.In addition to being anexpert in mixology with credibility among bartenders, the Ambassador will exemplify the brand values with a witty, vivacious personality and a high level of integrity. The position requires an intense schedule working nontraditional hours, including many evenings and weekends. The Regional Portfolio Brand Ambassador will be a dynamic, entrepreneurial individual who will be a seen as the face of our brands in their respective market; to consumers, media, distributors, bartenders and retailers.

This role will also oversee all regional implementation of national trade and educational programming. The Regional Portfolio Brand Ambassador will be responsible for working closely with local sales teams, while leading all marketing related sales programming.

Qualifications:

·Deep knowledge of all categories of spirits, with a heavy focus on American Whiskey from the production process to trends and competitive brands.Other categories of importance include gin, vodka and tequila

·Deep knowledge of spirits and cocktail development.Experience as a bartender creating craft cocktails is essential – both whiskey and gin. Experience as a bar manager/buyer preferred

·Natural and charismatic storyteller, with strong public speaking skills, who enjoys sharing their cocktailing tales with others

·Credibility with the on-trade is essential; be part of that community with existing network, bartender groups, presence, and respect within the community

·Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including authoring and delivering presentations

·Deadline-oriented self-starter who is proactive and holds self to high standard of work quality

·Ability to interface with the distributor network

·Strong and active social media presence

·Strategic thinker with ability to work collaboratively with a variety of different teams across multiple functions

·Ability to manage, track and forecast funds while executing within a prescribed budget. Strong level of budget management and organization required

·Works well independently, without need of micromanagement; problem solver

·BS/BA degree required

·Travel approx. 50%

Educate DFWS, trade, and distributor/broker partners on benefits of DFWS spirits portfolio
Support sales division teams at regional distributor meetings and regional events

Curate and execute creative and engaging branded events to drive brand awareness

Activate national programming in assigned market

Position Summary: Are you an outgoing and dynamic individual who is looking for unique employment opportunities to help supplement your existing income? Six Flags America is actively recruiting lively, savvy, outgoing, individuals to partake in an on-going marketing research and street team field-marketing program for some of our most recognizable partners. Past partners have included Axe Body Spray, Got2Be, Kia, Game Fly, MARS candy, and Betty Crocker. We need reliable people with flexible weekend and evening availability to gain experience and be a part of a tight-knit team. The team's primary role will be to collect market research to gain value demographic information and guest satisfaction feedback. The team will also serve as product experts for various Six Flags partners. Responsibilities could include anything from collecting data, imputing data, product sample distribution, conducting product demonstration and collecting survey data for partners. We are offering a dynamic group of individuals the chance to earn an incremental income while having fun!

Adhere to all policies pertaining to the Six Flags Mantra of providing Friendly, Clean, Fast and Safe Guest Service to positively impact the Guest experience.
Continually act as a knowledgeable product specialist, verbally and non-verbally enticing guests to interact with surveys and various products throughout the season.
Engage guests with a positive and welcoming attitude; needs to be outgoing and eager to talk with guests.
Provide guest with information on assigned products and encourage product engagement.
Be on site prior to start of shift to make sure display and footprint are prepared; this will include stocking products and cleaning the site.

Responsible for reporting end of shift synopsis as directed by supervisor.

Serve as a positive brand ambassador at all times for every partner and Six Flags brands
Adhere to all Park labor policies pertaining to breaks taken, length of shift and type of work performed.
Attend all required Six Flags America trainings.
Undergo periodic review and work with superiors to improve skills.
Must be able to stand/walk for up to 6 hours at a time and as many as 14 hours a day.
Must be able to walk over 3 miles per day over various surfaces.

Position reports to the Marketing Supervisor, Corporate Alliances Coordinator, and Research Coordinator

Must be 16 years or older
Must be able to stand, walk, stoop, bend, and reach throughout your shift
Excellent verbal communication skills

Job Posting Title:

Brand Manager - Pasta

Job Description:

The Manager, Business Unit GM will be a key member of the Pasta Team and will have P&L responsibility for the Branded Pasta business. The role is responsible for 1) Defining strategy for the business to meet customer and consumer requirements, establishing a clear vision and growth plan for the business; 2) Achieving the business financial goals as they align to Business Unit goals; 3) Development and execution of Marketing campaigns, as well as other business plans for commercial success.

Position Responsibilities:
Deliver financial, share and operational goals, monitoring performance and working cross functionally to drive corrective action as necessary
Participate in creating annual business plans for the business that align with Business Unit and Division strategic priorities and growth objectives
Develop annual Marketing campaigns to drive business performance.
Leverage and influence the sales organization to manage customer relationships and execute key go-to-market tactics (pricing, merchandising, shelving, and assortment)
Work very closely with Sales and Finance to manage financials and drive profitable solutions for growth
Assess business opportunities and strong cross-functional leadership to analyze financial, operational, sales impact of opportunity. Lead opportunities through execution with cross-functional team.
Monitor and understand customer and consumer insights, market and competitive data to pro-actively position the business for growth and profitability
Partner with R&D to develop closer-in innovation plans to drive short and long term strategic objectives
Engage the supply chain organization to insure optimal cost containment and service levels
Key contributor to the forecast process to drive accuracy and ensure customer service expectations are met
Qualifications and Requirements:
5 or more years of Business Experience within the Consumer Packaged Goods industry. Prefer Product Management Experience
Marketing and Strategy: Possessing breadth of skills: insight identification and implementation, creating brand distinction, value, customer/consumer demand and portfolio management
Experienced brand builder with demonstrated success in business turnarounds and transformations
Customer understanding – retail grocery, mass, club
Experience developing and define value propositions and go to market strategies (including trade strategy development, evaluation, implementation)
Financial & Business Acumen: Understand causal drivers and interdependencies of the P&L.
Demonstrated understanding of business fundamentals including PL management, pricing to help deliver strong financial performance
Deliver the plan by managing P&L levers (margin management, operational efficiencies, volume growth, price and merchandising activity) to optimize results and to make trade-offs
Anticipate the impact of market activities (Competitors, External) and challenges the organization in problem solving
Value Creation: Creating business value, customer/consumer demand and portfolio management
Customer understanding – retail grocery, mass, club
Experience developing and defining value propositions and go to market strategies (including strategy development, evaluation, implementation)
Analytical Thinking: Identification and evaluation of key business issues, drivers and growth opportunities using a variety of data sources and analytical tools.
Challenge and lead the team to effectively analyze short / long term needs of the business
Proactively identify category trends and operational issues, and identify strategies/solutions
Align cross-functional partners to secure the right resources for business needs
Ability to deal with ambiguity and incomplete information
Entrepreneurial and Customer Focused Mindset: Possessing a wide breadth of skills, experience and knowledge required to build the strength of business.
Develop long-term vision and strategic framework for the business
Challenge team to think creatively to solve problems and maximize opportunities while executing business plans
A strategic and visionary thinker with strong communication skills and the ability to drive change
Planning & Organizing: Identifies a course of action for self/others to ensure accomplishment of the strategic plan.
Anticipate headwinds, reprioritize and reallocate resources to deliver short and long term plans
Consult with key stakeholders on the development of objectives and strategies to garner commitment – lead the cross functional teams to deliver on objectives
Comfort operating in a lean organization
Education: Bachelor’s Degree Required – Type: Business or related field & Master’s Degree preferred

Description

MISSION:

The Brand Ambassador enjoys the unique and exciting responsibility of creating hype with students, parents, faculty and business, on behalf of the EPOCH Clemson community and representing the parent company, Valeo Groupe US. He or she is responsible for motivating a positive response to our brand and managing the reputation of the property, with new and existing customers. The Brand Ambassador will leverage their influence in the community/university, and on social media, to connect with potential customers and inform them of EPOCH’s lifestyle and values.

OUTCOMES:

(include, but are not limited to)
Make the Customer Happy
Be the Face of the Brand
Market it. Lease it. Repeat.
Achieve Revenue Goals
Customer Service
Deliver a world-class customer care experience, placing our customer’s satisfaction as our highest priority.
Generate, develop and implement new and creative ideas that will elevate the customer experience. Bring unique, outside of the box, concepts that exceed the customer expectations.
Be hyper-aware of the perception of your property. Work with management to curate a best-in-class reputation with customer service at the forefront.
Represent EPOCH in a professional, honest, and enthusiastic manner, always.
Maintain positive relationships with current and future residents, and work to cultivate a friendly and enthusiastic community environment.
Be available to assist residents with information and other requests, to help enrich their EPOCH experience and build a relationship of trust.
Collaborate with the Community Manager to ensure all customer inquiries or complaints are handled promptly and professionally.
Communicate appropriately with the Community Manager when property rules and regulations are not being followed, which would in turn affect the resident’s enjoyment.
Be the Face of the Brand
Understand and live the EPOCH brand.
Possess the ability to easily communicate brand qualities to anyone in an enthusiastic yet professional manner- both in person, and online.
Promote EPOCH through strategic marketing opportunities and partnerships
Identify key influencers both on and off campus and cultivate relationships with these people to drive brand support and recognition.
Establish opportunities to facilitate co-promotion partnerships with key influencers and popularize the brand via collaborate efforts with the university, businesses and individuals.
Maintain a mastery over ever-changing social media policies and trends, and leverage social media influence to connect potential customers to our brand.
Keep pace with the latest trends and local happenings; be able to transform these into marketable opportunities for the EPOCH brand.
Drive traffic to the property through direct and indirect social interaction with potential customers. Comfortability with daily face-to-face interaction in a professional and enthusiastic way is necessary.
Solicit feedback from clients and prospects and collaborate with Community Manager/Leasing Manager to improve processes.
Provide suggestions for resident life programming that are purposeful, authentic and enrich people’s lives by facilitating their personal journey.
Assist in gathering feedback on all programs so that we can continually improve the future events and programming plan.
Market it. Lease it. Repeat.
Work directly with the Leasing Manager to understand and promote rates, incentives, deadlines, and lifestyle programming.
Inspire resident and new prospect participation at lifestyle events.
Drive traffic to the property through meaningful and authentic interaction with potential customers.
Establish brand awareness through direct marketing methods (i.e. on campus networking, lead calling, flyer advertising, social media updates, and more) as requested.
Participate in lead-generating marketing activities with CA staff, which will be conducted on-site, on campus, and at local hot spots and businesses.
Perform check-ins with clients to determine their experience with our leasing process, and provide feedback to Leasing Manager.
Work with the Leasing Manager to follow a comprehensive marketing plan, geared toward achieving leasing, retention and customer care metrics.
Effectively communicate accurate application, leasing, rate and policy information to residents and new prospects.
Provide professional and enthusiastic tours of the model, amenities, and other community areas, as well as ensuring the legal guidelines of the Fair Housing Act are met.
Comprehend and be responsible for accurate completion of leasing documents and other pertinent paperwork or electronic documents.
Participate in conducting routine ‘shops’ of competition to understand the market environment.
Maintain the performance standards set to meet goals pertaining to lead generation, lease generation, and general customer service.
Revenue Management
Act with an ‘ownership mindset’ when tending to the revenue of the business.
Comprehend and advertise proper rates, incentives, promotions, and events
Operate within an allocated budget for marketing events and materials.
Assist with audits and back-office analysis to ensure accuracy across all platforms, as needed

Requirements

Personable, outgoing, energetic and selfless- our team is comprised of passionate individuals who are eager to deliver the EPOCH lifestyle to our community.

We are looking for motivated individuals to promote our services and represent our company in a professional manner.
Canvassers create interest in our Company by talking to homeowners about problems they are experiencing and scheduling appointments for free consultations.
We offer a lucrative base + bonus program plus benefits.
Make $40,000+ first year by hanging flyers and scheduling appointments.

maine 2011: downeast began in the basement of a dorm room, with a killer recipe and boundless naiveté. eight years later, our ciders retain the unfiltered freshness, authentic craft process, and balanced flavor profiles that appeal to both novice and discerning cider drinkers. now based out of boston, we're no longer beginners, but we’re still just as hungry. we're in need of the right people to join our team.
what we stand for
we have beyond excellent customer service
we’re all about the hustle
we’re relatable and accessible - nobody and nothing is off-limits

who we’re looking for
you should;
have a flexible schedule - the majority of our events are on nights and weekends
be able to - and thrilled to - go above and beyond, exceed expectations
be all about the hustle - prompt and always ready for a project

be down-to-earth, approachable, and seek out meaningful conversations

sample cider, answer questions about the product and company, engage with customers
make everyone’s sampling experience one they won’t forget - we really mean it

hours vary - weekend and weeknight heavy

chance to work with an awesome, vibrant group of people that love what they do
mileage reimbursement
cider stipend (LOTS of cider...how big is your fridge?)

$15 per hour + $0.575 per mile

we want your resume and a kickass, characterful cover letter telling us: your story, why you love downeast, and what you will bring to our team. scrap the overly-formal language and tell it to us straight - why you?

Job Description
Overview:

Rocket City Deli Provisions, an Authorized Local Purveyor of the Boar's Head Brand, is looking for energetic and approachable individuals with a passion for culinary sales. This position is part time with ~20-25 hours of work per week. Typical shifts could vary from 4-8 hours, and would include weekends.

The Brand Ambassador is responsible for presenting/sampling Boar’s Head products to consumers in a retail store or food show environment, pro-actively engaging customers. The ultimate objective is to promote and educate the consumer on various Boar’s Head products.

(Due to current COVID19 restrictions, most sampling events have been suspended for the time being. We still have a lot of opportunity to educate customers, deli associates, and managers, about our products, so this will be this position's primary focus, until full selling events return.)

Job Description:

Responsibilities:

•Knowledge of Boar’s Head products, inclusive of flavor, nutritional information, and complimentary products (training provided).

•Willingness to engage customers and actively promote the Boar’s Head brand.

•Experience with food preparation helpful.

•Must have own transportation and be willing to travel to different retail locations. We currently have openings in the following areas;

(Chattanooga TN, Cleveland TN, Ringgold GA, Huntsville AL, Madison AL, Florence AL)

•Some merchandising required.

•Ability to transport and set-up a folding table, utensils, platters, etc.

•Willingness to operate a slicer (training provided).

•Must exhibit good food safety and sanitation practices at all times.

•Close interaction with consumers.

•Proper Food Handling, Sanitation, and Rotation.

•Use of smartphone required to turn in reports on events conducted each shift.

•Be energetic and possess a serving attitude.

Qualifications:

•High school diploma or equivalent

•High school level math competency

Course Hero is looking for paid Contract Campus Representatives! We are firm believers in the power of learning communities where students grow by sharing, collaborating, and supporting each other. As a Campus Representative at Penn State University, you will host events on your campus to promote Course Hero's new sweepstakes and our Books for Africa initiative. You will also create awareness of the Course Hero platform and how it can help students graduate confident and prepared. During the COVID-19 related campus closure, Campus Representatives will be hosting events virtually.

Responsibilities:
Grow a community that loves and engages with Course Hero on your campus
Host events (student organization partnerships & networking events) to educate students about Course Hero incentives and products
Encourage students to apply for a chance to win the Course Hero Sweepstakes
Support social good initiatives like Books for Africa
Qualifications:
Excited about our Course Hero Platform
Interested in sales, and/or event planning
Proficient with social media (Instagram & Facebook)
Effective communicator who enjoys networking with others
Involved in campus organizations and communities
Reliable and willing to learn and grow
What We Offer You:
Flexibility and Opportunity: With over 25 million users frequenting our site, you have the chance to be directly involved with one of the fastest growing startups in the world of education technology. Our program is designed to be flexible - master your own schedule and work anywhere from 5+ hours a week.
Professional Development: You'll gain practical work experience and have access to professional development resources and the ability to connect with members of our team. We provide opportunities to develop and refine your sales, networking, communication, management, and leadership skills.
Career Advancement: After completing our program, you'll be well-equipped with the skills and business knowledge needed to succeed in your future career. We offer personalized career advancement resources to stellar representatives including, but not limited to, letters of recommendation and references for future jobs or applications.
Individualized Mentorship: You'll have bi-weekly check-in meetings with an assigned Course Hero Manager, who is committed to maximizing your success in our program. Our managers will coach you through creating marketing incentives, developing business proposals, and establishing weekly goals that you'll develop and take ownership of from the start.
Philanthropy: You will make an impact on the global landscape of education! A key component of our program includes our Knowledge Drive initiative. Together with our partner charity Books for Africa, we've donated 250,000+ books and counting to schools in the Gambia.
About Us:

At Course Hero, we have an awesome team and a truly engaging culture. We are customer-focused, collaborative, responsible, gritty and we love to learn. Our bold mission is to help students graduate confident and prepared!

We are not the only ones that think we're onto something big. Course Hero has been recognized as the 278th Fastest Growing Company in North America on Deloitte's 2019 Technology Fast 500 and also 2019's One of the Best Places to Work in the Bay Area by the Bay Area News Group. Job Description:
Job Description
Brand Ambassador Event Show Demonstrator

BATHrUS of Medina is Ohio’s best choice for everything you need for your home building, renovation and remodeling project. For over 30 years we’ve provided individual care, premium products, and high-quality services to our customers in the Medina, OH market.

As part of our team you will contribute by introducing customers to our remodeling services.

As a Lead Generator you will be expected to obtain and track consumer information. A very important part of this position is to create a positive experience for the customer by presenting our products in a cheerful and welcoming manner. This is a position with an hourly pay structure. This position will provide service to our Medina, OH location.

This position has an immediate start date and will remain open until filled.

You will be attending events weekly and talking to prospective customers about our product line.

Because you will be their first initial contact with the company, it’s required that you have:
Experience in lead generation at events
Ability to sell in a cheerful and friendly matter, speak with others, actively listen and assess their needs. How can we help them??
You will be calling and following up with leads you generated at the events. You need to be okay with calling people after 5pm during the week.
A valid driver’s license and reliable vehicle
A “customer comes first” attitude; give them your full attention
Must be available to work weekends and extended house per day or per week.
Take down information correctly and quickly.
Plan and coordinate events and educational activities from the conception, set-up to tear-down with the direction of the Marketing & Communications Director.
Travel to and support onsite execution of key events, including show load-in and load out
Data Entry of leads received from each event and these are added in timely manner
Manage all the event photos and distribution with our internal/external team
What makes an amazing lead generator?
Enthusiasm about the product
An outgoing personality
Ability to stand for periods of 4 - 5 hours
Transportation to and from events (this would require having a car or using public transportation)
Punctuality
Strong project management, customer service and relationship building skills
Effective written and verbal communication, able to deliver clear, concise information tailored to specific and varied audiences
Exceptionally detail-oriented and organized, ensuring quality and consistent output, ensuring accurate information for internal and external stakeholders
Ability to effectively solve problems, think creatively, make decisions and take action, exercising independent judgment
Ability to maintain a professional and positive attitude and work independently with little guidance
Benefits:
Paid Vacation
Paid Sick Time
Professional Development
Additional commission per appointment, per demo, per sale.
If you have these qualities, we want to meet you NOW!

Because our territory is so large, it is crucial that you have access to reliable transportation.

Gas policy: Any show over 40 miles that is round trip from office or home whichever is closer will be reimbursed at $.40/mile example show is 50 miles from office that equals 100 miles round trip so the reimbursement will be on 60 miles totally $24.00 per day worked
When not at a show/event working, you will also be working for an hour or so calling leads and scheduling in the evening hours.

Wages discussed at time of interview and/or hire.

About Us

At HelloFresh, we want to revolutionize the way we eat by making it more convenient and exciting to cook meals from scratch. We have offices all over the world and we deliver delicious meals to millions of people. We are the industry leader in meal-kit subscription services and we're growing all the time. We have distinct meal-kit services that cater to everyone with the most menu variety in the market, which allows us to reach an incredibly wide population of people. The HelloFresh team is diverse, high-performing, and international, and our work environment is an inspiring space where you can thrive as a result.

The Role

We are hiring enthusiastic Brand Ambassadors to be the face and voice of our brand. As a successful candidate, you will be involved in increasing brand awareness by selling and promoting our products at various local events.

You Will…
Engage with potential customers through face-to-face interactions at local events, festivals, malls, gyms, and more within Greater Dallas
Promote and sell HelloFresh to new demographics while meeting weekly sales goals
Work as a positive team player to meet individual and team sales goals
Learn about the benefits and services of our product to effectively market to customers
Attend training's several times a week on-site at our local sales office
You Have...
BA/BS preferred; high school diploma or GED required
Customer service, sales or marketing skills
Reliable source of transportation
You'll get...
The opportunity to get insight into one of the fastest growing technology startups in the world.
Hourly base + uncapped commission & bonuses
$0 monthly premium and other flexible health plans effective first day of employment
401k Program
75% discount on your subscription to HelloFresh (as well as other product initiatives)
Collaborative, dynamic work environment within a fast-paced, mission-driven company
Other Details…
It is the policy of HelloFresh not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or because he or she is a protected veteran.
All selected candidates are subject to passing a background check prior to employment.
Candidates must have a reliable source of personal transportation.
Candidates must be able to stand for 3-4 hours at a time and lift up to 20 pounds at a time.
Candidates must have the ability to work rotating shifts Monday through Sunday including nights, weekends, and holidays.
Candidates must be authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship.

Job Description:
Brand Ambassador Job Description

What we do

Eat Purely makes it easy to eat well by providing great tasting food that is nutritious and convenient, all

with a great customer experience because we believe that when people eat well, they live well. We are a

Chicago meal delivery service that offers food made from scratch using intentionally sourced ingredients

through our website and app. Our entrees, salads, sides and desserts are prepared in-house and delivered

ourselves to ensure the highest quality and best customer experience. Eat Purely is obsessed with

meeting the needs of time-starved and overworked consumers looking for quality meals at extraordinary

convenience.

Brand Ambassador Role

In this position, you will perform pop-up experiences and catering set-ups for Eat Purely. You will be

responsible for representing Eat Purelys brand in a positive and consistent way as well as helping to grow

our customer base, both business-to-consumer and business-to-business. Youll help us generate

excitement, educate new customers, increase product sales, support Eat Purely, and grow the reach of

our delicious, healthy, chef-crafted food!

Responsibilities

Transport and set up food, supplies and marketing materials for catering events in a way that reflects Eat

Purelys brand standards.

Prepare for and perform Eat Purely pop-ups about 3 - 4 hours per event that contribute to increased

revenue and customers per month.

Build relationships with current and potential customers and partners.

Understand and be able to share the benefits of Eat Purelys food, our food standards and our dietary

requirements.

Communicate honestly and effectively with Eat Purely's management team.

Share customer feedback with Eat Purely team.

Demonstrate an energetic and positive attitude.

Collaborate, think on your feet, and solve problems as they arrive.

Requirements

Love of healthy food!

Optimism and a positive attitude

Self-motivated quick learner

Understanding of various dietary requirements, allergies and sensitivities

Interest in customer engagement and education

Good communication skills, must be fluent in English

A reliable car

Smart phone for communication & sending photos

Personable, punctual and reliable

Ability to stay current on product knowledge, handle multiple priorities and build relationships

Ability to stand for up to 3 hours and do light physical work (lift and carry 30 pounds, climb hills or stairs

safely, and walk long distances)

Previous experience in promotions, sales, food or food safety is an asset

Additional Details:

Flexible part-time hours weighted toward weekday lunch and dinner hours. Weekend hours on Saturdays

or Sundays may be occasionally required.

This position accommodates about 6 - 10 hours per week, 25 - 35 hours per month.

Perks include a flexible schedule, a free meal when working, and the opportunity to help grow one of

Chicagos best healthy meal delivery services.

Job Description:
Summary:

We are looking for a passionate and experienced Brand Manager to join the Razer Latin America Team. As a Brand Manager, you will be responsible for being the voice of Razer across all Latin America Region where Razer is, and adapting its brand strategy for each market: Mexico, Chile, Peru, Argentina and Colombia.

The primary goal of this role is to grow community engagement, develop retail partnerships and increase our conversion rate through marketing efforts and localized strategies in the region.

The Brand Manager candidate should have strong communication skills, be highly organized, a creative thinker, and passionate about gaming, technology and digital innovation/social media.

Responsibilities:
Research, analyze, and monitor financial, technological, and consumer demographic factors to capitalize on market opportunities and minimize effects of competitive activity.
Develop and execute marketing strategy for Razer in LATAM region with a positive ROI.
Create a localized Demand Generation Plan depending on country's needs.
Generate Brand Storytelling.
Plan and Execute Product Launches and Campaigns.
Evaluate and suggest retail channel strategy, providing Trade Marketing and Retail trainings.
Develop and execute a Retail display annual plan.
Increase activity in point of sales to maximize conversion rate working closely with sales team to meet revenue targets.
Manage PR and advertising agency as well as promoters agency.
Work with global team to get resources and replicate "Best Practices" of US planning and execution.
Gather, identify, and prioritize functional and product requirements from core gamers into internal feedback loop to support product feature requests and ideas.
Hire and Manage a local Esports team to meet deliverables.
Increase engagement across Social Media platforms create social media digital campaign.
Travel required up to 15% of the time, domestic and international.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree from competitive college or university or equivalent experience.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in brand marketing, or equivalent.
Must have verbal and written fluency in Spanish and English.
Must have impeccable communication skills.
Passion for gaming and well know of the Latin America Gaming culture.
Experience managing marketing budget and local agencies.
Working with brick-and-mortar partners and Digital channels.
Extensive familiarity with the Latin America Market.
Experience in product launches and events.
Familiar with online marketing campaigns.
Gaming industry experience highly preferred.
About Razer

Razer™ is the world's leading lifestyle brand for gamers.

The triple-headed snake trademark of Razer is one of the most recognized logos in the global gaming and esports communities. With a fan base that spans every continent, the company has designed and built the world's largest gamer-focused ecosystem of hardware, software and services.

The award-winning hardware of Razer includes high-performance gaming peripherals, Blade gaming laptops and the acclaimed Razer Phone.

Razer's software platform, with over 50 million users, includes Razer Synapse (an Internet of Things platform), Razer Chroma (a proprietary RGB lighting technology system), and Razer Cortex (a game optimizer and launcher).

Razer services include Razer zGold, one of the world's largest virtual credit services for gamers, which allows gamers to purchase virtual goods and items from over 2,500 different games.

Founded in 2005 and dual-headquartered in San Francisco and Singapore, Razer has nine offices worldwide and is recognized as the leading brand for gamers in the USA, Europe and China. Razer is listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange (Stock Code: 1337).
