Course Hero is looking for paid Contract Campus Representatives! We are firm believers in the power of learning communities where students grow by sharing, collaborating, and supporting each other. As a Campus Representative at the University of Kentucky, you will host events on your campus to promote Course Hero's new sweepstakes and our Books for Africa initiative. You will also create awareness of the Course Hero platform and how it can help students graduate confident and prepared. During the COVID-19 related campus closure, Campus Representatives will be hosting events virtually.

Responsibilities:
Grow a community that loves and engages with Course Hero on your campus
Host events (student organization partnerships & networking events) to educate students about Course Hero incentives and products
Encourage students to apply for a chance to win the Course Hero Sweepstakes
Support social good initiatives like Books for Africa
Qualifications:
Excited about our Course Hero Platform
Interested in sales, and/or event planning
Proficient with social media (Instagram & Facebook)
Effective communicator who enjoys networking with others
Involved in campus organizations and communities
Reliable and willing to learn and grow
What We Offer You:
Flexibility and Opportunity: With over 25 million users frequenting our site, you have the chance to be directly involved with one of the fastest growing startups in the world of education technology. Our program is designed to be flexible - master your own schedule and work anywhere from 5+ hours a week.
Professional Development: You'll gain practical work experience and have access to professional development resources and the ability to connect with members of our team. We provide opportunities to develop and refine your sales, networking, communication, management, and leadership skills.
Career Advancement: After completing our program, you'll be well-equipped with the skills and business knowledge needed to succeed in your future career. We offer personalized career advancement resources to stellar representatives including, but not limited to, letters of recommendation and references for future jobs or applications.
Individualized Mentorship: You'll have bi-weekly check-in meetings with an assigned Course Hero Manager, who is committed to maximizing your success in our program. Our managers will coach you through creating marketing incentives, developing business proposals, and establishing weekly goals that you'll develop and take ownership of from the start.
Philanthropy: You will make an impact on the global landscape of education! A key component of our program includes our Knowledge Drive initiative. Together with our partner charity Books for Africa, we've donated 250,000+ books and counting to schools in the Gambia.
About Us:

At Course Hero, we have an awesome team and a truly engaging culture. We are customer-focused, collaborative, responsible, gritty and we love to learn. Our bold mission is to help students graduate confident and prepared!

We are not the only ones that think we're onto something big. Course Hero has been recognized as the 278th Fastest Growing Company in North America on Deloitte's 2019 Technology Fast 500 and also 2019's One of the Best Places to Work in the Bay Area by the Bay Area News Group. Read up on some of our recent news coverage, blog, and learn more about usto see what it is like to work with our team.

About Artistic-Zeal Media LLC
Artistic-Zeal is a full-service Media and Marketing solutions provider. Currently, our major focus is on our new ADA Website Compliance Technology (ADA4Web.com).
Most businesses aren't aware that their website is putting them at risk of legal action since over 90% of websites aren't compliant with ADA regulations... And yes, all websites are required to be compliant.
We provide technology to help businesses avoid legal action, but more importantly, we help them reach out to the 1-in-5 individuals that otherwise couldn't have purchased from them online. It is a Win-Win for business owners and for the disabled community. There are also many other perks to ADA Compliance (bit.ly/ADAWebCompliancePerks).
Who We're Looking For
We are looking for several Brand Ambassadors who fit into one of two categories -
Influencer - Those who have a larger B2B social following OR work directly with businesses
Disabled Ambassadors - Those with disabilities that require them to use special technology to access the internet
A qualified individual for the Brand Ambassador position will possess the skills to perform tasks such as:
content creation (video, written, etc.)
social posts (through your current personal or business profiles)
referral to our services
Work requirements are minimal and you are free to work when you please, as this is a contract position.
We are only looking for representatives that are located within the United States.
Join the Cause
Our mission is to make the internet accessible to EVERYONE, despite their disabilities.
Make money and support a great cause!

Job Description – PittMoss Brand Ambassador (PT)

Looking for a side hustle? Are you a people-person comfortable talking to the public and driving sales? Are you a friendly and naturally outgoing individual who is passionate about  horticulture, gardening or sustainability?   Are you looking to join forces with an exciting new brand that is shaking up the way the world views potting mixes?

Made from organic, recycled paper, our line of high performance potting mixes & soil conditioners offer gardeners a sustainable option that requires less water and grows bigger, stronger, more resilient plants. We need your help to grow!

We are seeking candidates to join “Team PittMoss" as a Brand Ambassador to drive sales at independently owned garden centers and hardware stores that currently carry our products (mainly weekends, 3-4 hours per event). If you are an outgoing individual capable of driving sales and engaging the public then we want to hear from you! If you are already planting in  PittMoss and love our product here is your chance to get involved!

The brand ambassador is responsible for driving product sales, engaging consumers, and promoting brand awareness through live featured product demonstrations.   We offer
competitive pay   with  bonus opportunities, fun environment and room to grow within
the company!

Things to consider:
Entry level position sales position
Events are typically 3-4 hours taking place at various times from Thursday - Sunday (mostly weekends)
Average employee works 1-3 shifts per week, dependent on event availability March- June
Pittsburgh and surrounding area; also hiring for New York City, Long Island, Philadelphia/NJ, and the Washington D.C. Metro areas
What You’ll do- essential functions and responsibilities:
Drive in-store sales of PittMoss
promote brand awareness, positive product impressions, customer loyalty and increased sales through product demonstration, customer engagement and effective communication of brand talking points - This should be easy, our demos are effective and speak for themselves!
organization and hosting of in-store retail demos involving setting-up, product demonstration & education with an emphasis on cleanliness, organization and the ability to follow instructions.
coordination with demo coordinators on schedules, products and demo guidelines, when applicable.
capture demo results & questions by reporting all pertinent info and follow up items in a timely and accurate manner.
capture and forward demo images to marketing manager. (ever take a selfie? then you already know how to do this!)
maintain positive relationships with the in-store garden team -turn on the charm and greet them with a smile.
other possible responsibilities: seed and develop relationships with new accounts, market influencers, ultimately leading to increased brand visibility.
Requirements
outgoing, enthusiastic and positive personality
excellent presentation skills and the ability to articulate product features and benefits
ability to stand comfortably for up to 4 hours
must have a reliable vehicle
ability to positively engage the public
ability to represent the brand in a highly positive manner
outstanding customer service skills
must have a smartphone or internet access
Knowledge and skills
ability to engage a crowd with a naturally outgoing personality
strong sales and customer service background
results-oriented
strong organizational skill set
ability to multi-task
passion for horticulture, gardening and sustainability preferred but not required
self-starter, able to work independently with little or no supervision
Education and experience
Education: high school diploma, bachelor degree or current college student (preferred), or relevant work experience

Experience: sales, customer service or brand promotion, public speaking/communication, garden/greenhouse, demonstrations, current PittMoss user, or home gardener.

About PittMoss
PittMoss makes a new, sustainable growing media made from 100%, organic and recycled paper products. Did you happen to see us on Shark Tank? PittMoss' proprietary process engineers paper into a lightweight, highly-porous media. This unique combination of physical, chemical, and biological properties allow our products to provide better air porosity, water holding capacity, and natural biological activity than peat or coir-based media's. PittMoss offers a range of complete potting mixes, amendments and commercial blends. Our products also have application in several other industries including hydroseeding, erosion control, composting (accelerant), worm casting, and therapeutic equine bedding. Learn more at www.PittMoss.com

As a successful candidate, you will be involved in increasing brand awareness and sales by promoting many products through various media channels. You will work to communicate the value of these products to customers, tracking customer feedback, and representing the brand at launches and events.

To excel in this role, you will have excellent communication and networking skills. A strong presence on social media would be a plus. Previous experience as a brand ambassador or similar role is strongly desired, as well as knowledge of sales and marketing principles.

Familiarizing yourself with the product company’s mission, vision, and goals.
Educating customers, and retailers about our products.
Creating website and social media content in order to drive brand awareness and attract new customers.
Building rapport with customers and vendors.
Monitoring customer feedback and escalating complaints to the marketing department.
Representing the company at product launches, events, and trade shows.
Maintaining a positive image of the brand at all times.

Friendly, approachable, and outgoing personality.
Working knowledge of social media platforms and tools.
Adaptable with the ability to prioritize tasks.

Job Description
3Fifteen Brand Ambassador

3Fifteen is seeking a self-motivated cannabis road-warrior. The Brand Ambassador will be responsible for spreading brand awareness and increasing retail sales through field marketing efforts, product trainings and patient engagement. We’re seeking someone dedicated to creating a dominant presence by managing positive customer-focused relationships with all company licensed medical and adult-use marijuana facilities and staff. Desired candidate will possess the ability to help and uplift others through education.

The Brand Ambassador will report directly to the Sales Executive and be in the field 75% of the time with ability to commute to all 3Fifteen facilities as needed. The Brand Ambassador will update company sales software daily and must adhere to all Michigan Marijuana Regulatory Agency (MRA) regulations while maintaining a strong knowledge and comprehension of the functionality of METRC.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
·Prospect and maintain a highly organized schedule of regular on-site patient and staff education meetings and events
·Engage with patients and collect feedback on products
·Submit additional collateral requests based off feedback
·Bring Patient and Client feedback to company management
·Assist with improvements in strain/genetic literature, cannabinoid and terpene profile matrices, marketing, and sales tactics based on feedback
·Develop strong working knowledge of the MMFLA and MRTMA and understanding of the competitive market
·Keeping industry knowledge current and up-to-date
·Identify and sustain key merchandising opportunities for accounts with dominant product placements and displays
·Ensuring execution and alignment with all sales programs
·Present and discuss sales and marketing collateral, brand values, products, cultivar genetic information and value adds
·Support Director of Marketing by effectively communicating and maintaining inventory levels on all point of sale items and collateral
·Serve and support 3Fifteen as a brand representative for community outreach, industry events and trade shows as opportunities occur
·Transport, setup, breakdown and maintain trade materials and table displays
·Support and lead facility tours
·Identify and follow up on leads via phone and email, documenting all attempts and outcomes of leads within the company’s sales software.

·Maintain all applicable reports and records, including those mandated by the MRA

Qualifications:
·High School Diploma
·More than 1 year of formal sales/networking experience.
·Excellent verbal and written communication skills
·Excellent presentation skills, sociable, outgoing
·Ability to work independently and as a team, both in person and remotely
·Experience working in a sales role in a highly regulated industry preferred
·Experience with sales management or CRM software preferred
·Must be 21 years of age or older
·Ability to pass a background check required
·Ability to travel
·Clean driving record, and valid Michigan driver’s license required
·50-75% travel by car, with occasional weekends and overnights as needed
·Long periods of prolonged sitting and standing

·Long periods of prolonged use of office equipment including computers and phones

Job Description
We’re Ready to Grow and you can help! Cabinetry Plus of Columbus is looking for a confident person with a passion for excellence in business.

How would you like to join a small, enthusiastic team that works to improve the homes and workspaces all across the area? Where there is plenty of opportunity for personal and career growth and advancement?

Cabinetry Plus is ready to grow, and we need your help to fulfill our vision to become the premier custom cabinet manufacturer in southeastern Wisconsin. We’re looking for a special person with a real go-getter attitude, has well-developed communication skills, an ability to relate to others, and someone who is not discouraged by rejection.

Your role will involve reaching out to prospective clients, attending networking events, the marketing of our business, managing existing clients and projects. You will help build our business through expanding our sales reach and targeting the right customers.

People describe you as dependable, motivated, charismatic, personable, trustworthy, optimistic, conscientious, and enthusiastic – with a healthy attitude for fun and a quick smile! You see yourself as a self-starter, mature and persistent, with a methodical approach to work.

You are goal-orientated, a team player, love variety, work effectively with little oversight, and enjoy an invigorating, fast-pace environment.

Your written and verbal communication skills are apparent as you effectively communicate with customers and coworkers. You take initiative, and feel the need to do whatever it takes.

You are excited to take advantage of this opportunity to learn and grow in ways you never anticipated. You have experience working in a sales setting, and you are eager to take the next step.

You are proficient with Windows and Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook. You are available to meet with customers during normal operating hours, but also available on nights and weekends to attend networking events and trade shows.

This is a full-time position. Our facility is located in Columbus, WI, right off highway 151. Our complete compensation package reflects our healthy appreciation for balance in life, and offers significant incentives for the results you achieve - as well as those we achieve as a team.

IF this sounds like YOU –

IF you’re ready for a new, exciting career of challenge and change –

IF you have the drive and passion to succeed –

Please apply TODAY

Job Description
Closet Factory is the premier closet company with the most diverse product line, and we are looking for an outgoing, fun-loving person who loves to talk to people. If you are ambitious, adventuresome, loves the excitement of working in different environments, this job is definitely for you.
Purpose of this Job:
Ambassadors work approximately 32 hours per week in retail stores to engage consumers and provide them with information about Closet Factory products in select Costco stores in the Portland and Vancouver area. Additionally, we are represented in Costco locations in Bend, Salem, Albany, Corvallis and Eugene. The most important part of a Ambassadors’ job is to create a positive experience with the consumers and assisting Closet Factory to achieve specific goals. Interactions build positive awareness of the company brand, communicate the unique value of the product and encourage homeowners to get organized.

Main Accountabilities and Supporting Activities:
Increase overall awareness and sales of Closet Factory products through in-store and event demonstrations
Conduct planned demonstrations in assigned retail stores to achieve specified goals
Capture consumers’ attention to participate in high energy in-store demonstrations
Be a credible product and brand expert by educating consumers on the features and benefits of our products encouraging them to have an in-home consultation
Maintain responsibility for all demonstration and other POP material
Build and maintain strong relationships with store personnel
Capture accurate consumer information and communicate per established guidelines
Individual Qualifications
High School or GED required
1-year experience in a public interfacing role or experience in retail sales
Prior promotional demonstrating experience a plus
Highly organized with excellent verbal skills
Skills, Competencies, Requirements, and Compensation
Wednesday through Sunday schedule. Flexible times are available.
Professional, outgoing demeanor with strong presentation skills
Ability to be the Closet Factory representative, understand the products and uphold the integrity of the company at all times
Intermediate computer skills and proficiency in Microsoft Office
Self-motivated and be able to work well independently
Must have valid drivers’ license with a good driving record and reliable transportation
Access to a private computer and a cell phone with the ability to send and receive text messages
Ability to stand on your feet up to eight hours at a time
If this sounds exciting, please submit a cover letter and/or resume.
We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Job Description
Napleton Automotive Group owns and operates 55+ retail automotive dealerships in eight states. Our group employs 3,500 people nationwide and has rental car facilities, body shops, and a large real estate portfolio as well. Napleton is ranked number 17 out of top 150 automotive groups in the U.S. for 2019 based on new car volume.

If you're looking for an opportunity to join the automotive industry as a valued team member, your search is complete. We pride ourselves on providing careers to our employees, not just jobs. We're looking for high energy employees that want to take care of customers with a warm welcome smile.

What We Offer
Medical and Vision
401K Plan
Paid time off and vacation
Growth opportunities
Dental, Life, Short Term, Long Term, and Accidental death and dismemberment insurance
Paid Training
Employee vehicle purchase plans
Family owned and operated
Long term job security
Flexible Work Schedule
Discounts on products and services
Responsibilities
Assist the customers through a thorough buying process supported by established selling steps, policies and procedures.
Develop and relay a high level of product knowledge around vehicle features.
Demonstrate operation of vehicle in showroom and via test drive.
Provide new vehicle to customer through established delivery process, ensuring that the customer understands the vehicle's operating features, warranty and paperwork.
Maintain an owner follow-up system that encourages repeat and referral business and contributes to customer satisfaction, loyalty and long term clientele.
Develop a prospecting system, making calls and sending emails to potential customers to set appointments.
Close Deals!
Qualifications
Minimum high school diploma or GED equivalent required.
2 years of sales and customer service experience preferred, but not required.
Automotive sales background preferred.
Knowledge of new vehicle technologies and mechanical operations.
Excellent customer service, organizational and negotiation skills.
Self-motivated, goal-oriented and enthusiastic presence in a team environment.
Strong written and communication skills.
Valid driver’s license required and clean driving record.

Title BRAND AMBASSADOR – John F. Kennedy International Airport
Categories New York
Start Date 2020-06-01
Location New York, CA
Job Information

You are passionate about product promotions and you see yourself building a compelling sales and marketing resume. You are engaging and effective in building positive brand experiences with customers. You are self-directed and can sustain an enthusiastic energy level to confidently present food and beverage specialties.You thrive in settings that set a standard and are a team player with a ‘can do’ attitude; you are adaptable, dependable and have excellent presentation skills. You have excellent English language skills and conversational language skills in Mandarin. If these expectations are a fit for you then we welcome you to apply for a position at the Duty Free Stores at John F. Kennedy International Airport (JFK). If you are looking for a rewarding part time position or internship, we’d love to hear from you.

This is a part time position. Shifts are 10am to 2pm and four – five days per week including Saturdays, Sundays and holidays.

SUMMARY OF ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Selling:

Engaging customers to sample & purchase product while demonstrating excellent service

Marketing:

Promoting product features and building brand awareness and recall.

Ensuring demo area meets or exceeds Brand and Retailer’s requirements.

Customer Experience:

Inspiring a helpful, friendly, sincere customer experience using professional language and accurately representing the brand and communicating the unique selling proposition.

Presentation:

Maintaining professional presentation standards as set by the Brand and the Retailer.

Product / Stock management:

Maintaining stock levels of promotional items

General and Team:

Referring to store supervisors and to team members in a supportive manner. Being familiar with store layout and directing customers to merchandise, services and facilities as appropriate.

QUALIFICATIONS:

· Post-Secondary enrolment or completion in Business, Sales or Marketing or an equivalent combination of education and experience to successfully perform the essential responsibilities

· Mandarin fluency is required

· English language fluency both written and verbal, working knowledge of Microsoft Office.

· Ability to work in a fast-paced, high pressure environment

· High energy level and positive approach to job and group responsibilities.

· Ability to lift 15Kgs and ability to stand for 4-5 hour shifts

· Authorization to work in Canada and enter the United States

· General Sales & Customer service experience is a definite asset with a track record for meeting / exceeding sales.

We are currently screening and interviewing candidates. We are anticipating the projected start day will be June 1st / July 1st. Thank you for your interest, only shortlisted candidate will be interviewed.

Job Description
Old Bust Head Brewing Company is currently seeking outgoing beer enthusiasts to represent our brand at a variety of off-premise samplings. We are looking for brand ambassadors in Arlington/Alexandria, Fairfax County, Prince William County, Loudon County, Richmond, Chesapeake, Virginia Beach, Norfolk, Newport News, Harrisonburg, Roanoke and Blacksburg. Samplings are generally 3 hours on Friday evenings and mid-morning, early-afternoon on Saturdays and Sundays at these locations: Giant, Safeway, Shoppers, Total Wine, Whole Foods Wegmans. Each sampling pays $60.00. You must be willing to travel within a 25- mile radius.

If you have a passion for craft beer, want to expand your knowledge about the industry, and enjoy building customer relationships, please submit a resume and short paragraph explaining why you would do a great job representing our brand in the marketplace.

Submissions should be emailed to Pat Larsen - pat@oldbusthead.com

Job Title: Brand Ambassador - Off Premise Wine Promotions
Job Description:
Adelante Live Inc. Brand Ambassadors execute off premise sampling events for wine, spirit and beer brands at various retail locations including liquor, grocery and big box retailers throughout the state of Florida. We're seeking energetic Brand Ambassadors across FL metro area to provide brand education to consumers, sample well known adult beverage brands and promote sale of product at area retail locations. This is a great part time opportunity with flexible hours. Apply today!

Will you be a good fit for Adelante Live?
Do you enjoy or have confidence with starting face to face conversations with diverse people you don’t know?
Do you have the ability to communicate with a variety of people about various topics?
Do you take pride in projecting a professional appearance and attitude?
Are you able to follow detailed directions easily?
Do you own a smart phone linked to an active email account and have access to a desktop/laptop computer?
Do you have the ability to travel to various job sites within a 30 mile radius of where you live, and work at least five (5) hours at a time?
Do you have a flexible schedule with the ability to work on nights and/or weekends?
IF YOU ANSWERED “YES” TO ALL OF THESE QUESTIONS, THEN YOU MIGHT BE A GOOD FIT FOR ADELANTE, AND WE WOULD GLADLY ACCEPT YOUR APPLICATION!
Job Details
Rate: $25/hr = Flat $75 event rate including short post event recap

Date/Time: Ongoing, varies weekly

Location: Bars/restaurants across the state of FL locations vary by date.
Current Openings: Various dates for next 3-6 months.
Primary Job Duties
a. Engage with members of the public through face to face interactions at various public and private events and via retail stores or on site demonstration

b. Engage, educate, promote, and sell assigned brand and/or product(s) to consumers through natural conversation

c. Promote assigned brand and/or products by following directions provided

d. Learn talking points and product information prior to event, and effectively communicate those talking points and/or product information to the public

e. Ensure event materials are presented and/or distributed according to directions

f. Set up and break down of event materials

g. Attend online training sessions from time to time

h. Provide feedback on event success and complete an event recap

i. Punctual, professional, and highly organized with respect to event schedule and reporting deadlines

j. Timely completion of all assigned reports, paperwork, and training by deadlines provided

k. Ability to procure and provide required off premise materials: Sampling table, sample cups, wine/bottle opener, wine bucket.

3. Essential Job Requirements

a. High school diploma required or equivalent job-related experience

b. Experience in event marketing, demonstrations, sales, service industry or retail is highly desirable

c. Access to a reliable source of transportation

d. Access to a computer (laptop or desktop) with internet access

e. Own a smart phone with an active email account and internet access on phone as well as ability to take recap photos

f. Good interpersonal and communication skills and ability to attract and engage customers

g. Ability to work independently and prioritize duties with minimal supervision and work as a team when event requires

h. Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing

i. Background check required

j. Professional appearance free of visible body piercings and visible tattoos

k. Must be legally authorized to work in the U.S.

4. Necessary Working Conditions

a. Candidates must be able to stand for duration of event and lift up to 20 pounds at a time

5. Additional Information
All talent hired and booked for Adelante Live Inc. events will be considered W2 employees of Adelante Live Event Services and will be subject to all federal, state, and local withholding taxes and applicable laws.
It is Adelante’s policy and commitment not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability, military service, or any other category protected by law. As part of this commitment, Adelante shall provide reasonable accommodations of known disabilities to enable an applicant or employee to apply for employment, perform the essential functions of the job, or enjoy the benefits and privileges of employment as required by law.
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each Essential Job Requirement satisfactorily, and must have the ability to work within the Necessary Working Conditions. The Primary Job Duties, the Essential Job Requirements, and the Necessary Working Conditions are intended to describe the general nature of the job, and describe some of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required for the Brand Ambassador position. However, this list is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities or qualifications associated with this job.
All selected candidates are subject to a background check prior to employment. Please be aware that acknowledging or having criminal convictions does not constitute an automatic bar to employment with Adelante. We will consider and take into account factors including, but not limited to age and time of the offense, seriousness and nature of the violation, and any rehabilitation.

Job Description
Lee & Cates Auto Glass Brand Ambassador

Job Description:

Lee and Cates Glass, Inc. is 94 years old, is locally, family owned and operated, and is one of the largest independent glass companies in the southeast corner of the United States. We believe that well-trained, professional employees are our most valuable business assets. We are committed to exceeding our customers’ expectations and dedicated to building long-term relationships with those we serve.

We are building a team of Brand Ambassadors who will interact with our customers at a fixed location. They will greet customers in a cheerful and professional manner and conduct a walk-around inspection of the vehicle with the customer on behalf of our partners. During this walk around is an ideal time to educate the customer on our products and services that may be applicable. This is a sales and service position but not cold-calling or knocking on doors. Rather, we are looking for professional and courteous individuals that want to be part of our team which is providing quality products and services to our automotive customers.

The Lee & Cates Auto Glass Brand Ambassador represents Lee & Cates Glass to targeted customers in order to build awareness, create a consistent image, generate sales opportunities, and build customer preference.

This is an entry level position that is a competitive base salary ($11.50 per hour for 40 hours per week plus commission) with an incentive per sale that is on a climbing continuum with volume.

Job Tasks
Network and build trusting relationships with potential customers
Thoroughly understand our products and services to inform potential customers
Use word of mouth marketing techniques
Track customer preferences and suggest advertising and positioning ideas
Plan and implement awareness creating programs to reach out to potential customers
Engage in outreach programs to involve existing customers into the company’s offerings
Understand the company’s goals and missions, and apply them within a sales and marketing platform
Relay customer feedback to the company in anticipation of improving products and services
Generate ideas to maximize sales to achieve or exceed sales goals
Develop and maintain strong and clear communication with existing and future customers
Assist in creating and installing marketing displays and insuring brand advertising material is placed strategically
Build and sustain business relationships with key customers and accounts in an operating area.
Leave any literature, if any, regarding our products and services
Accountability Functions Include:
Maintain a “can do” and positive attitude
Maintain a professional image
Strive for excellent customer satisfaction and experience
Maintain quality workmanship as a friendly competitive team player
Maintain reliable, punctual attendance
Maintain a strong work ethic and maintain sound decision making in a fast paced work environment
Make decisions and provide services based on company values
Duties Include, But Are Not Limited To:
Work well with others
Communicate to management
Communicate task completion to management on a timely basis
Possess skills to think through complex challenges
Determination and willingness to see jobs to completion
Scheduling jobs
Insurance network procedures
Take initiative to make decisions
Computer literate
Ability to follow instructions
Possess effective verbal and written communication and sound organizational skills
Essential Functions, But Are Not Limited to:
Reach overhead Reach Forward Lifting & carrying 50 lbs.+
Push/Pull Handling/Lifting
Kneeling Crawling
Stooping Twisting
Squatting Standing
Sitting Balancing
Climb Stairs Climb Ladders
Product Knowledge

Basic knowledge of products and services in the glass industry relating to auto, home, and business

Understand insurance regulations relating to windshield repair and replacement consistent with Florida Comprehensive Insurance benefits.

Understand industry standards and technician certifications relating to safety for the auto glass industry.

Time/Experience

Entry level up to two years

Sales Proficiency

Willingness to cross-sell when necessary

Good customer skills

Brand Ambassador

Job Description

The Cream’wich Brand Ambassador is the face of the Cream’wich brand. He or she must be highly enthusiastic about the Cream’wich product and properly convey the brand at all times. Whether representing the brand at a sampling event or making a sales pitch to a new customer, you must be upbeat, optimistic and positive. You may come across difficult situations that require great problem-solving skills, you must maintain a can-do attitude at all times and do whatever it takes to solve the problem.

Anticipated Workload

15-30 hours per week, 2-3 days a week or more as needed. Hourly Position

Reports to: Jessica Jordan, Director of Operations

Duties and Responsibilities
Visit Cream’wich problem accounts and find solutions to maintain customer satisfaction.
Target new accounts and pitch Cream’wich product line for placement. Follow up and follow through on all open leads within appropriate timeframe.
Transport and set up barrel freezers in new accounts as needed.
Conduct store level inventory checks, take pictures of product and report findings back to Cream’wich office.
Communicate any issues found in field immediately to Cream’wich office and help find solution.
Educate retailers and Cream’wich fans alike on all the attributes of Cream’wich and what makes it so great.
Create and target potential new account list.
Regularly visit assigned stores, merchandise product and check in with retailer to see how the product is doing.
Identify opportunities to sell more product to current retailers who may not carry all flavors of Cream’wich.
Assist in preplanned Cream’wich events as needed or as possible.
Keep track of all miles and off site hours, take appropriate meal and rest breaks according to California law.
Complete store visit logs consistently when offsite.
Travel up to 200 miles in one day to visit Cream’wich accounts as needed
Assist in any other assigned projects as needed.

Job Description
Do you believe food can be a force for good? Do you thrive on sharing new experiences with friends, family...complete strangers? Do you relish the opportunity to tell a story? Do you make mental notes on your favorite parts when you attend an event? Do you evaluate other brands based on how they interact with you? Do you excel in a fast-paced, dynamic environment? Do you want to get in on the ground floor of a fast growing food business?

If this is you, we want you to join our team.

CAVA is a rapidly expanding fast casual restaurant and packaged goods brand focusing on fresh, Mediterranean inspired, better-for-you cuisine. Born from our full service restaurants, our chef-driven fast casual format has grown to 28 locations in the past few years, with new restaurants opening in the DC metro area, Richmond, California and New York. Our packaged goods continue to expand in Whole Foods Market and other specialty stores.

We are looking for food lovers to help spread CAVA love at events, at in-store tastings, and within the local community. The position will will require a passion for the CAVA mission and the drive to help build a growing brand.

Job Functions:
Product sampling:
• Execute best-in-class consumer tasting opportunities at in-store retail locations and local events
• Create authentic, positive, memorable experiences for consumers to increase brand awareness, drive trial and build loyalty
• Provide exceptional customer service to the stores that sell our products and to our consumers
• Be an expert about our products and our company
• Capture demo/event results and feedback via timely reporting of all pertinent info into tracking systems
• Perform merchandising at store prior to starting demo and at the end of the demo
• Adhere to all schedules and employee policies

You have:
• 1+ years of brand ambassador experience
• A passion for food
• Outstanding customer service skills and the ability to represent CAVA in a genuine, positive manner
• Ability to engage a crowd or individuals one-one
• Strong attention to detail and strong verbal communication skills
• An eagerness to join a growing company
• A desire to help build a brand

You are:
• Naturally outgoing, charismatic, self-motivated, highly organized
• Always early

And in addition:
• Clean driving record is required - a background check will be conducted
• Reliable transportation and valid driver’s license
• Access to a computer or mobile device and consistent internet for submitting recaps and feedback
• Must be able to lift 60 lbs with no restrictions
• Must be able to work a flexible schedule, including weekends and some holidays

Benefits:
• Mileage incurred for transportation to and from demo locations is reimbursed at $.54/mile, after the first 30 miles driven to/from location. Expenses for items needed to perform demo are also reimbursed

About Us

At HelloFresh, we want to revolutionize the way we eat by making it more convenient and exciting to cook meals from scratch. We have offices all over the world and we deliver delicious meals to millions of people. We are the industry leader in meal-kit subscription services and we’re growing all the time. We have distinct meal-kit services that cater to everyone with the most menu variety in the market, which allows us to reach an incredibly wide population of people. The HelloFresh team is diverse, high-performing, and international, and our work environment is an inspiring space where you can thrive as a result.

The Role

We are hiring enthusiastic Brand Ambassadors to be the face and voice of our brand. As a successful candidate, you will be involved in increasing brand awareness by selling and promoting our products at various local events.

You Will…
Engage with potential customers through face-to-face interactions at local events, festivals, malls, gyms
Promote and sell HelloFresh to new demographics while meeting weekly sales goals
Work as a positive team player to meet individual and team sales goals
Learn about the benefits and services of our product to effectively market to customers
Attend training’s several times a week on-site at our local sales office
You Have...
BA/BS preferred; high school diploma or GED required
Customer service, sales or marketing skills
Reliable source of transportation
You’ll get...
The opportunity to get insight into one of the fastest growing technology startups in the world.
Hourly base + uncapped commission & bonuses
$0 monthly premium and other flexible health plans effective first day of employment
401k Program
75% discount on your subscription to HelloFresh (as well as other product initiatives)
Collaborative, dynamic work environment within a fast-paced, mission-driven company
Other Details…
It is the policy of HelloFresh not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or because he or she is a protected veteran.
All selected candidates are subject to passing a background check prior to employment.
Candidates must have a reliable source of personal transportation.
Candidates must be able to stand for 3-4 hours at a time and lift up to 20 pounds at a time.
Candidates must have the ability to work rotating shifts Monday through Sunday including nights, weekends, and holidays.
Candidates must be authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship.

Job Description
Do you LOVE talking to people? Come learn how you can talk to people ALL DAY....and get paid for it!

T.Webber is seeking outgoing Brand Ambassadors/Event Demonstrators to staff our HVAC Sales displays at the Yonkers & New Rochelle Costco stores. Customer service experience is a plus, as you will be interacting with customers, discussing our products and securing sales leads for our team. We are looking for driven, outgoing and friendly personalities that will enjoy talking to an assortment of people. Compensation is hourly + bonus for set quality appointments.

Job Duties:

You meet with potential customers: While staffing our booth at Costco, you professionally capture the attention of potential customers. It’s your job to showcase our HVAC products and share with consumers the benefits T.Webber can offer their families. You collect their information and send those leads to the T.Webber office for follow up.

Become a trusted professional: You are professional, highly motivated, and a self-starter who can work without a lot of supervision but can still over-deliver.

Work with the team: You stay in contact with your supervisor and your team to make sure the work orders are completed efficiently – everyone pitches in because it’s ultimately about serving the customer.

Job Requirements:

You’re an outgoing people person: You are positive and outgoing and you don’t mind approaching people to talk to them. You’re approachable and easy to talk to, too.

You’re ready to work: You can get to your assigned work shift on time, and have a cell phone that allows you to communicate with the T.Webber office and your direct supervisor. You are available to work evenings and weekends as required.

You’re a professional:You are clean, neat, and well-groomed in appearance and can confidently and clearly interact with anyone.

Sound good? We want to hear from you! Apply today!

Job Description
BRAND AMBASSADOR
We have immediate openings for part-time Brand Ambassadors.
They are fun, exciting and could be a great fit for you!
We help to generate brand awareness for the leading products that you already know and love. You will be responsible for engaging consumers, promoting brand awareness and driving product purchases through demonstrations/samplings at local stores. We love the brands we promote and are driven to connect people to that product. We are looking for outgoing, enthusiastic, friendly, reliable Brand Ambassadors/ Selling Event Specialists to join the Carlson team.

Job Description
Are you outgoing and energetic? Do you like to have fun and make people smile? Are you a sandwich FREAK? How would you like to get paid for sharing your love of sandwiches by handing out free samples? If you said, YES! Then this is the job and company for you!

Atlas Franchise West is So Cal’s largest Jimmy John’s Sandwich Shop franchisee and we are FREAKS about sandwiches. We are looking to build a high energy team of Brand Ambassadors. What is a Brand Ambassadors? I’m glad you asked!

A Brand Ambassadors starts their day off in their home store helping bake fresh, yummy bread to make 3” samples of various JJ’s sandwiches to hand out for free! Yep I said FREE!! Once you are locked and loaded with plenty of samples, you hit the road and spread sandwich love throughout our communities.

Sound like your kind of fun? Give us a call and join the team!

Requirements:
Must be 18+
Must have own vehicle, driver license and auto insurance
Must have a clean driving record
Must be available Monday- Friday 9-5pm
Must be able to throw a 3” sandwich at least 5 ft
Must be coachable
Must be energetic, enthusiastic, confident and outgoing
Must be computer proficient
Responsibilities
Sample JJ’s sandwiches throughout the community
Generate awesome leads for our catering team
Make people smile
Cold calling
Data entry
Keep records of sampling activities
What could be better than a job where you make people smile every day and get paid for it? Atlas Franchise West is always looking for Inshop Sandwich Makers, Drivers, Store General Managers and District Managers throughout So Cal. If you know some other FREAKS who might be interested, tell them to apply and if you both get hired, there’s a bonus in it for you!You are seeking employment with Atlas Franchise West an independently owned and operated franchisee of the Jimmy John’s Franchise, LLC system. You are not seeking employment with Jimmy John’s Franchisor, SPV, LLC (the franchisor of the Jimmy John’s system) or any of its affiliates, which are separate and wholly independent companies from Atlas Franchise West.

Ready to start a career in the automotive industry? We're ready to invest in you! We are seeking a Brand Ambassador offering a salary position and 4 - 5 day work weeks. This is a salary position. This is a progressive opportunity with great work-life balance.

This is a great opportunity with hands-on training and dedication from our leadership team. Our team focuses on customer needs & the newest technology -- not prices. We are one of the top-selling Toyota dealerships in the Southeast. We offer a very clear path for growth within our organization, with defined & attainable goals every step of the way. Our employees work together towards a common goal to offer the best service in the industry.

Gathering customer information for follow up appointments
appointments for vehicle demonstrations all over email and text communication providing high-quality customer service.
Representing Toyota South Atlanta in a professional manner with all communications.

Job Description
At Your Gate © is looking for outgoing, ready to rock, brand ambassadors to promote the coolest thing to hit airport terminals to date! Personal Shoppers for weary travelers! Or Another set of hands for airline and airport employees!!
If you have experience in the restaurant, retail, and customer service industries, we have an immediate opening for a Brand Ambassador.

Yep, that’s right – you will be working in the airport terminals, helping customers with our new app, and providing top of the line service. Traveling can be wearisome… but you could be just the right person to take the drain out of hassles in the airport, layover hangovers, and more. The right candidate will love the thrill of a challenge, the excitement of working in a team, and the drive of tackling new ideas and marketing, and providing absolute top end customer service.
You'll have the opportunity to be creative in getting the word out about At Your Gate ©. We'll provide you with all the factoids you'll need, but your energy and personality is really what is going to sell, not to mention word of mouth is always the best. Think of yourself as a concierge, without all the formalities.

Responsibilities of the Brand Ambassador:
• Interact at on-site with customers in order to promote products and services and increase sales.
• Deliver online orders
• Impact sales results by performing mobile app demonstrations and developing, supporting and executing field marketing and segment activities.
• Provide project support to ensure campaign success.
• Publicize campaign to raise awareness and drive high levels of users by targeted audience.

The Brand Ambassador must clearly demonstrate the following qualities:
• 1-2 years' experience or training in sales, marketing, customer service, sales, marketing, promotional marketing, or communications preferred.
• Be able to hurdle and hustle through the airport to deliver online orders easily, professionally, and smoothly. Be prepared to put on some miles, we do a lot of walking!
• Attention to detail and strong customer service.

The Brand Ambassador must haves:
• Great interpersonal skills
• Time management/Organizational skills
• Competitive, driven
• Strong work ethic
• Ability to work in a high-energy environment

Job Description
Our brand is Rainbows and Wings (which represents harmony, unity and love) and we use all the nine colors of the rainbow in our competitions. We are searching for brilliant and creative Brand Ambassador Leaders to support our Brand Ambassador Specialist and utilize our five point strategy to build our brand presence nationally across the United States.

Five Point Strategy:
Represent our brand – abide by our policies, ethics, mission and values and represent what we represent to the best of your ability.
Support our brand – attend webinars, conferences, seminars, retreats, events, membership contest treasure hunts and booth events to support our efforts to create a presence and engage our audience. (according to events scheduled in your area)
Engage about the brand – use social media marketing and other creative marketing strategies to engage our audience and target markets and recruit and retain members and followers.
Promote our brand – create marketing campaigns and promotional events to promote our brand and increase our followers, target markets and audience.
Build our brand – utilize all of the four steps above as well as creatively and innovatively execute all efforts, plans and strategies to build our presence and our brand locally and nationally to increase our youth clientele.
Specific Requirements:
Support the Brand Ambassador Specialist (BAS) in utilizing your own social media accounts to spread the word about our pageant system; like our pages and post frequently
Create marketing campaigns to reach target markets across the U.S. in your area
Support ongoing service marketing campaigns created by the BAS
Create content for new blogs to attract new clients
Engage youth ages 13-24 to spread the word about our unique pageant brand and recruit more contestants and members
Create Public Service Announcements as Call to Action efforts to increase awareness of our cause for youth
Skills:

High School Diploma or AA degree

Some experience or strong interest in marketing and advertising

Excellent communication and problem-solving skills

Excellent presentation skills

Active presence on social media a plus

Ability to increase our social media following with engagement and activities

Ability to learn pageant system details and post competition/membership services quickly

Ability to increase website traffic by promoting our website periodically

Check out our website at www.rainbowuniversepageants.com to learn more about our brand, mission and vision and follow us on social media (see links on website).

*If you are interested in this position you must answer the screening questions in order to be considered as a candidate, otherwise your resume could get ignored.

Napleton Automotive Group owns and operates 55+ retail automotive dealerships in eight states. Our group employs 3,500 people nationwide and has rental car facilities, body shops, and a large real estate portfolio as well. Napleton is ranked number 17 out of top 150 automotive groups in the U.S. for 2019 based on new car volume.

If you're looking for an opportunity to join the automotive industry as a valued team member, your search is complete. We pride ourselves on providing careers to our employees, not just jobs. We're looking for high energy employees that want to take care of customers with a warm welcome smile.

What We Offer
Medical and Vision
401K Plan
Paid time off and vacation
Growth opportunities
Dental, Life, Short Term, Long Term, and Accidental death and dismemberment insurance
Paid Training
Employee vehicle purchase plans
Family owned and operated
Long term job security
Flexible Work Schedule
Discounts on products and services
Responsibilities
Assist the customers through a thorough buying process supported by established selling steps, policies and procedures.
Develop and relay a high level of product knowledge around vehicle features.
Demonstrate operation of vehicle in showroom and via test drive.
Provide new vehicle to customer through established delivery process, ensuring that the customer understands the vehicle's operating features, warranty and paperwork.
Maintain an owner follow-up system that encourages repeat and referral business and contributes to customer satisfaction, loyalty and long term clientele.
Develop a prospecting system, making calls and sending emails to potential customers to set appointments.
Close Deals!
Qualifications
Minimum high school diploma or GED equivalent required.
2 sales and customer service experience preferred, but not required.
Automotive sales background preferred.
Knowledge of new vehicle technologies and mechanical operations.
Excellent customer service, organizational and negotiation skills.
Self-motivated, goal-oriented and enthusiastic presence in a team environment.
Strong written and communication skills.
Valid drivers license required and clean driving record.

Job Description
Crunch is a gym that believes in making serious exercise fun by fusing fitness and entertainment and pioneering a philosophy of No Judgments. Our gyms are packed with the latest state-of-the-art cardio and strength training equipment, weight room, full service locker rooms with showers, tanning booths, HydroMassage® bed, and an extensive schedule of Crunch’s signature classes including Zumba®, BodyWeb with TRX®, Yoga Body Sculpt, Belly Butt and Thighs Bootcamp, and more.

Looking to combine work, fitness and fun? Crunch Fitness is looking for energetic, enthusiastic people that are passionate about health and fitness to join our team. Working at Crunch is more than a job, it’s an opportunity to inspire others to reach their fitness goals. Our ‘No Judgments’ philosophy attracts a diverse and welcoming group of professionals and makes Crunch an amazing company to work for.

Crunch Fitness is now accepting applications for qualified Brand Ambassadors that are ready to be a part of a team and grow personally within a premier organization.

What We Look for In Our Brand Ambassadors:
Create community excitement for fitness and well being
Promote the Crunch brand to local businesses
Willing to walk several miles per day to promote our grand opening
Willing to work the front desk after the club opens
Outgoing Personality
Organized
Service minded
Team oriented individual
Professional
Be willing to go above and beyond
Efficient and effective communication skills
Bilingual Spanish/English (preferred)
The Ways You Benefit:
Schedule Flexibility
Exciting team environment
Growth opportunity in a rapidly growing company
Free Crunch Fitness membership
Apply today for immediate consideration!

Job Description
Are you energized by engaging with prospective customers, delivering results and collaborating in a team environment? We’re looking for a Brand Ambassador to identify and contact customers, introducing these customers to our client’s wide range of products and services.

As a Brand Ambassador at Deca Capital, you will become highly qualified in understanding our clients’ services and our customers, creating leads and sales opportunities, and starting conversations with customers to provide our clients’ benefits.

The Role:
Establish contact with ideal customer profiles to develop an interest in our solution through in-person presentations
Proactively reach out to prospective customers to learn about, understand, and create new business leads and opportunities
Craft, fine-tune, and personalize outreach protocols in a retail setting
Provide introductory information to customers and introduce customers to our systems to continue the buying journey.
Document, evaluate, and share effective techniques, approaches and best practices that can contribute to generating new opportunities
Utilize Salesforce systems to accurately track and share progress and performance towards goals
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or further education
1-3 years’ experience in a similar role
Experience and/or genuine interest marketing and sales and/or the retail industry
Knowledge and/or understanding of retail sales
About You:
Excellent oral/written communication skills and interpersonal skills
Customer-oriented thinker who also enjoys customer contact
Self-motivated, proactive worker with demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment
Strong organizational and prioritization skills
Results driven and thrive on the feeling of accomplishments
Strategic and analytical thinker who is driven to meet goals and deliver results
About Deca Capital:

Deca Capital sees boundless opportunities in helping corporations achieve great success. Our customer-oriented marketing solutions via business, retailers, and events provide authentic and meaningful customer interactions. We ensure we provide the most value to not only our clients but also our employees. We believe in embracing the entrepreneurial spirit and challenging the status quo. We focus on not being the biggest, but undeniably being the best.

This role will be ideal for someone interested in joining a high-growth marketing company and becoming a ground-floor member of our U.S. office in Hanover, MD.

Job Description
Momentum Solar is a premier residential solar provider with offices throughout the U.S. Founded in 2009, Momentum has grown exponentially over the past decade. We implement the entire solar process to ensure a seamless transition to renewable energy.

Job Overview:

The Momentum Solar Brand Ambassador will attend pre-registered weekend events across New York in order to make contact with potential customers and educate them on the benefits of Solar. The Brand ambassador will generate leads for the company to conduct sales presentations.

Requirements:
Attend marketing events as a spokesperson for our company.
Generate Sales leads for our Sales team.
Network and build trusting relationships with potential customers.
Thoroughly understand our products and services to inform potential customers.
Qualifications:
Must be available to work the weekends.
Proven work experience as a Brand Ambassador, Promoter or similar role preferred.
Excellent communication skills
Professional attitude
An outgoing, friendly personality, and a desire to meet new people
Experience in retail sales is a plus

Course Hero is looking for paid Contract Campus Representatives! We are firm believers in the power of learning communities where students grow by sharing, collaborating, and supporting each other. As a Campus Representative at the University of Minnesota, you will host events on your campus to promote Course Hero's new sweepstakes and our Books for Africa initiative. You will also create awareness of the Course Hero platform and how it can help students graduate confident and prepared. During the COVID-19 related campus closure, Campus Representatives will be hosting events virtually.

Responsibilities:
Grow a community that loves and engages with Course Hero on your campus
Host events (student organization partnerships & networking events) to educate students about Course Hero incentives and products
Encourage students to apply for a chance to win the Course Hero Sweepstakes
Support social good initiatives like Books for Africa
Qualifications:
Excited about our Course Hero Platform
Interested in sales, and/or event planning
Proficient with social media (Instagram & Facebook)
Effective communicator who enjoys networking with others
Involved in campus organizations and communities
Reliable and willing to learn and grow
What We Offer You:
Flexibility and Opportunity: With over 25 million users frequenting our site, you have the chance to be directly involved with one of the fastest growing startups in the world of education technology. Our program is designed to be flexible - master your own schedule and work anywhere from 5+ hours a week.
Professional Development: You'll gain practical work experience and have access to professional development resources and the ability to connect with members of our team. We provide opportunities to develop and refine your sales, networking, communication, management, and leadership skills.
Career Advancement: After completing our program, you'll be well-equipped with the skills and business knowledge needed to succeed in your future career. We offer personalized career advancement resources to stellar representatives including, but not limited to, letters of recommendation and references for future jobs or applications.
Individualized Mentorship: You'll have bi-weekly check-in meetings with an assigned Course Hero Manager, who is committed to maximizing your success in our program. Our managers will coach you through creating marketing incentives, developing business proposals, and establishing weekly goals that you'll develop and take ownership of from the start.
Philanthropy: You will make an impact on the global landscape of education! A key component of our program includes our Knowledge Drive initiative. Together with our partner charity Books for Africa, we've donated 250,000+ books and counting to schools in the Gambia.
About Us:

At Course Hero, we have an awesome team and a truly engaging culture. We are customer-focused, collaborative, responsible, gritty and we love to learn. Our bold mission is to help students graduate confident and prepared!

We are not the only ones that think we're onto something big. Course Hero has been recognized as the 278th Fastest Growing Company in North America on Deloitte's 2019 Technology Fast 500 and also 2019's One of the Best Places to Work in the Bay Area by the Bay Area News Group. Read up on some of our recent news coverage, blog, and learn more about usto see what it is like to work with our team.

Job Description
Are you an…

Ambassador of Awesomeness?

Then maybe you have what it takes to be an Angelic Bakehouse Brand Ambassador!

You get the picture…we’re looking for that health-conscious person with moxie. That person who will thrive in the fast paced and ever-changing world of in-store sampling and experiential marketing at local events. Your ability and desire to engage, educate, and excite consumers is how we measure success. Do you have what it takes?

Your typical workday will look something like this:

· The Brand Ambassador must be available some Saturdays and Sundays per month.

· The Brand Ambassador also works in grocery store demos, various community events, health fairs, and more as the face of the company, educating consumers on Angelic Bakehouse sprouted grain bread products and encouraging sales of the brand.

Occasionally, it may include some of this:

· Overnight travel.

· A longer work day at trade shows or other special events.

Your qualifications

· Detail Oriented – Attention to detail, ability to focus on the project or task at hand and consistently deliver error free results.

· Change Management – Adaptable to a fast paced, shifting work environment; willing to remain flexible to accommodate changing business conditions, work requirements and scheduling needs.

· Integrity, personal responsibility, and a genuine passion for healthy, delicious foods.

· Ability to lift 30 pounds and stand for 4 hours or more at a time.

· Reliable transportation. Personal vehicle is preferred.

· Excellent communication to communicate via text, and send in reports after demo events.

· Ability to follow food safety guidelines.

Education and Related Experience, Qualifications and/or Certifications:

· One (1) to three (3) years of sales/marketing experience preferred, but not required.

· Customer service and/or sales experience desired.

· Excellent written and oral communications skills

· Driver’s License with clean driving record is required to occasionally drive company vehicles.
Company Description
We’ve found that with a steady dose of goodness – whether in food or in life – you simply feel better. We make sprouted grain baked goods that elevate the standard for taste and nutrition while building a socially conscious company determined to elevate the lives of our employees, customers and the world around us. We’re bringing food back to its roots. And then sprouting something even better.

Located in Cudahy, Wisconsin and started in 2009 we’re run by our founders, James and Jenny Marino. In November 2016, we became part of the Lancaster Colony / T. Marzetti Company. For more information on Angelic Bakehouse visit www.angelicbakehouse.com.
Company Name: Angelic Bakehouse, A Division of T. Marzetti

Job Opening


Job Title: Brand Ambassador



Company:

The Restaurant Store, Inc.

This position is for the Philadelphia and Pennsauken, NJ regions. A Brand Ambassador with The Restaurant Store is responsible for communicating the advantages of shopping with The Restaurant Stores, both online and in store. Brand Ambassadors are responsible for customer outreach, providing the customers with an overall summary of how The Restaurant Stores can help them achieve ultimate business success. Ambassadors are to work towards achieving the following:
Traveling to customers and visiting their place of business, using street marketing methods within local market in order to develop new relationships with prospective customers
Developing a clear understanding of product line offered by The Restaurant Stores and gross profit associated with privately labeled products
Communicating effectively with their Branch sales team in order to ensure follow through on leads generated by the Brand Ambassador
Establishing effective communication channels with the Branch management team regarding any updates to the customer base, including but not limited to new customers and lapsed customers
Communicating pertinent information to TRS marketing department through established reporting methods
Learning and utilizing reporting tools, such as operating company issued iPad, iPhone, and their respective programs that support the marketing systems
Planning, organizing, and executing specific marketing and sales programs
Ability to research and communicate competitor information to sales and inventory teams within branch by providing relevant competitor invoices and identifying where prospective customers are sourcing products
Ability to navigate The Restaurant Store’s website and to assist customers in establishing online accounts and informing them of the benefits of using the site
*Applicants must have a car and a clean driving record.

This position has the following physical requirements:
Work is performed while standing and/or walking, up to and including 8 ½ hours/day.
Requires the ability to communicate effectively using speech, vision and hearing.
Requires the use of hands for simple grasping and fine manipulations.
Requires bending, squatting, crawling, climbing, reaching.
Requires the ability to lift, carry, push or pull medium weights, up to 50 pounds.
Requires activities involving being around moving machinery, exposure to marked changes in temperature and humidity, and exposure to dust, fumes and gases.
As a division of Clark Associates, Inc., The Restaurant Store provides the quality, value, and excellent service demanded by today’s busiest restaurateurs. The Restaurant Store operates eight store locations in Harrisburg, Lancaster, Lehigh Valley, Philadelphia, and Reading, Pennsylvania, as well as Wilmington, Delaware and two locations in Baltimore, Maryland. The Restaurant Store offers customers a selection of over 20,000 items within their brick-and-mortar locations and over 240,000 items through the ecommerce site, TheRestaurantStore.com. Great prices, convenient online ordering, and virtually unlimited supplies make the Restaurant Store a food service professional’s premier source for restaurant supplies and equipment.

We offer competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package including paid time off, medical/dental insurance, wellness programs, gym membership reimbursement, and a 401k with company match. Employees also enjoy food service industry training from top manufacturers and product experts.

Job Description
Are you outgoing and energetic? Do you like to have fun and make people smile? Are you a sandwich FREAK? How would you like to get paid for sharing your love of sandwiches by handing out free samples? If you said, YES! Then this is the job and company for you!

Atlas Franchise West is So Cal’s largest Jimmy John’s Sandwich Shop franchisee and we are FREAKS about sandwiches. We are looking to build a high energy team of Brand Ambassadors. What is a Brand Ambassadors? I’m glad you asked!

A Brand Ambassadors starts their day off in their home store helping bake fresh, yummy bread to make 3” samples of various JJ’s sandwiches to hand out for free! Yep I said FREE!! Once you are locked and loaded with plenty of samples, you hit the road and spread sandwich love throughout our communities.

Sound like your kind of fun? Give us a call and join the team!

Requirements:
Must be 18+
Must have own vehicle, driver license and auto insurance
Must have a clean driving record
Must be available Monday- Friday 9-5pm
Must be able to throw a 3” sandwich at least 5 ft
Must be coachable
Must be energetic, enthusiastic, confident and outgoing
Must be computer proficient
Responsibilities
Sample JJ’s sandwiches throughout the community
Generate awesome leads for our catering team
Make people smile
Cold calling
Data entry
Keep records of sampling activities
What could be better than a job where you make people smile every day and get paid for it? Atlas Franchise West is always looking for Inshop Sandwich Makers, Drivers, Store General Managers and District Managers throughout So Cal. If you know some other FREAKS who might be interested, tell them to apply and if you both get hired, there’s a bonus in it for you!You are seeking employment with Atlas Franchise West an independently owned and operated franchisee of the Jimmy John’s Franchise, LLC system. You are not seeking employment with Jimmy John’s Franchisor, SPV, LLC (the franchisor of the Jimmy John’s system) or any of its affiliates, which are separate and wholly independent companies from Atlas Franchise West.

We are committed to authenticity, sophistication, masteryandinnovation.

Our stage is the world. Our time is now.

With this in mind, we foster a family environment built on values that describe our lifestyle, experiences and how we see the world. Job Description
Lead Brand Ambassador - Burlington, Ma

Solar On Earth is the regional leader in Community Solar which is one of the newest and most innovative ways that lets everyone take part in clean renewable energy. This saves money on your energy bills without installing expensive rooftop solar panels. There’s no upfront fee, no annual fee, no expensive equipment, and no change in the way people receive their electricity.

Why Choose Us:

Solar On Earth is a young and growing community solar sales company. first and most important We never ask our customers for any money ever!!! Our customers are subscribed to a solar farm. This allows each home or business owner to take advantage of the Massachusetts clean energy initiative saving them money each month on their electric bill. Anyone with an electric bill can subscribe!

Here at Solar On Earth we care just as much about you! our employees, as we do about each one of our customers. Are you looking for a company that cares about you and respects your ideas? We pride ourselves in allowing each employee to use their skills that they have developed throughout their career to grow with us. MAKE GREAT MONEY! HELP THE ENVIRONMENT! HELP OTHERS SAVE MONEY! GROW IN YOUR CAREER!

Your role with us!

As a Lead Brand Ambassador you will play a important role in the acquisition of new customers. Educating home and business owners about the positives to signing up for community solar. You would also be responsible for scheduling "reliable" appointments so a representative of Solar On Earth can visit with the potential customers. Without you we would not have new customers. Most of our customers have never heard of community solar...NO this is not rooftop solar. This is the best chance for real FREE savings these home and business owners have heard of all year!

Hours:
Approximately 30-40 hours per week.
some weekends are required
flexible schedule * short shifts leaving you time to enjoy the rest of your day doing the things you love. Work should not consume your entire day. Here at Solar On Earth we believe that a happy and healthy employee will work 100% harder for us if we respect his/her needs as well as achieve our needs.
compensation:
You will earn $17.00 - $21.00 per/hour + commission.
You could also earn $250 - $1,600 extra per/week in bonuses on top of your hourly base salary
APPLY HERE: Follow the link below to apply.

https://jobs.lever.co/solaronearth/53b0c72c-bb53-4957-ad2f-0ec55b9d2f4a?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=ZipRecruiter

If you are the type of person who is looking for a new place to call home, to earn great money, advance your career, then this is the place for you! Your skills and experience are needed for our continued success. Get involved at the ground level and take off with us!
Company Description
When people think of solar they usually think of rooftop systems that might be installed on
their neighbor’s homes. But there is a more exciting yet lesser known market segment
emerging called community solar. Community solar allows everyone to participate and benefit
from the expansion solar energy. It is the embodiment of the concept of environmental justice:
the fair treatment and meaningful involvement of all people regardless of race, color, national
origin, or income.
Early on Solar On Earth recognized the importance of community solar and we are now looked
upon as the go-to company in the field by most of the major solar farm developers.
The concept of community is simple: allow everyone to go green by subscribing to a solar farm.
There is no need to install anything on your roof or give control of your roof to a big
corporation for 20 years. There is no upfront investment required, and in most cases, if you
grow tired of saving money, you can terminate your subscription with incurring a termination
fee.

Solar On Earth is currently leading the way in customer acquisition in two of the leading states
for community solar: Massachusetts and New York. But we don’t plan to stop there. We are
currently building the foundation to move into other states where community solar is emerging
including Maryland, New Jersey, and Illinois. That goal can’t be accomplished without a
committed professionally trained sales organization that shares our vision and goals.
Some on the outside might look at what we do and think: I don’t want to do door-to-door.

On the front lines of every successful company is a sales team who are
engaging with prospective customers and evangelizing that company’s products. Door to Door prospecting is an
excellent place to learn the sales craft, understand how businesses function and act as a stepping-
stone for any entrepreneur. Door-to-door may be the best classroom there is because
the skills you learn here can help you succeed in most any environment in the future.

The Solar On Earth team is passionate about what we do because it not only champions a
cleaner environment, it allows everyone to participate and benefit from the expansion of
renewable energy.
