Job Title

Brand Manager

Job #

US11506

Requisition Type

Regular

Function

Marketing

State/Province

Wisconsin

City

Middleton

Region

US

Posting Start Date

Feb-20-2020

Division Information


Spectrum Home & Personal Care (HPC) Division participates on a Global basis in small electric appliances, shave/groom appliances and beauty appliances. Our well- known brands include George Foreman®, Black+Decker®, Farberware®, Breadman®, Juiceman®, Russell Hobbs® and Remington®. Our products appeal to consumer trends for healthy eating, stay-at-home cooking, creating today's new hair style and much more. We distinguish our product offerings from the competition by employing forward thinking, innovative technologies matched with a strong understanding of consumer needs to bring to market high quality, superior products that delight the end user.

Job Summary


The Brand Manager is a leadership position within the organization, with strategic ownership of a brand portfolio. As a leader, the incumbent must have the skillsets & experience necessary to make sound business decisions, competently manage and develop direct report(s), set strategic direction and influence internal/external stakeholders to follow that direction.

Primary Duties & Responsibilities


The Brand Manager will have responsibility for optimizing short and long term volume and profit performance for a brand portfolio by developing, championing & executing the strategic vision.
Develop and deliver annual category business plans.
Lead overall vision for product pipeline & development strategies.
Manage overall product portfolio & mix.
Develop cross-channel pricing strategies.
Set strategic direction and oversee consumer advertising & promotion plans.
Maintain up-to-date competitive bench-marking, in partnership with Market Insights and Trade Marketing.
Develop and direct consumer research strategies, and execute in partnership with Market Insights.
Serve as the lead “voice” for assigned brand portfolio for all key constituencies, including sales, R&D, regulatory, operations and finance.
Other duties as assigned.
Education and Experience Profile
Bachelor's degree required, MBA preferred.
6+ years of packaged goods brand management experience with a record of increasing responsibility and delivering proven results.
Experience managing and developing direct reports.
Has managed all four key areas of marketing responsibility (the four “p’s”): product development, pricing, promotion & advertising, and place (channel/distribution strategy).
Experience leveraging internal/external business performance data to inform strategic decisions.
Has led development and delivery of key account sales presentations.
Required Skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Must exhibit strategic thinking skills (ability to see the big picture).
Must be able to balance strategic planning (“creating the future”) with tactical execution (“running the business”).
Must have ability to analyze complex data and situations and develop a range of simple solutions.
Must be able to utilize quantitative, qualitative and syndicated research to develop brand plans.
Must be an excellent presenter, with strong presence and an ability to influence key internal and external customers.
Solid understanding of traditional business software applications (MS Office, etc.).
Must have strong ability to interact and collaborate with multiple functions throughout the organization.
Must be able to manage & develop direct reports to maximize their potential.
Work Environment


Working conditions are normal for an office environment.

The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this job/classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Job Description:
Job Description
The Last Marathon is seeking an experienced Brand Ambassador. The ideal candidate is an individual interested in speaking about issues articulately, has passion and enthusiasm to help raise brand awareness and grow our client's consumer base.You will be in charge of: • Understanding The Last Marathon's vision, goals, and company mission • Educating customers, retailers, and distributors about the client's products or services • Keeping a positive image of the brand at all times • Working closely with marketing staff to conceptualize campaigns and strategies • Creating rapport with customers and vendors to drive brand awareness and attract new customers • Representing the company at events, product launches, and trade shows • Monitoring customer feedback and bringing any complaints to the marketing department • Following customer preferences and metrics • Generating ideas and participating in departmental brainstorming workshopsIf you have these qualifications, we want to hear from you! • Friendly and approachable personality • Proven interpersonal skills • Strong verbal and written communication skills • Ability to work in teams • Prior experience in a customer service environment • Knowledge of marketing principles • Degree in Marketing or related field • Previous experience as a brand ambassador or a similar role is strongly desiredSend in your resume and let us know why you think you'll be a valuable addition to our team!Company DescriptionBusiness growth is essential for a healthy economy. Here at The Last Marathon, we are confident in our ability to offer businesses the chance to increase their market share and boost profit margins. By hiring the experts, our one-stop-shop allows brands to benefit from tried and tested approaches. Atlanta offers a diverse range of people who boast unique talents. We screen and build a database to develop specific ground teams to complement our clients' distinct brand visions.

WHO WE ARE

NCSOFT is a premiere digital entertainment company and global publisher with worldwide locations and more than 4,000 employees focused on bringing extraordinary games to life for millions of fans around the world. Established in 1997 and headquartered in Seoul, South Korea, we quickly became a key leader in online games. Best known for critically acclaimed franchises including Lineage, Aion, Guild Wars, and Blade & Soul, NCSOFT is also one of the world's top mobile developers with Lineage 2M occupying the #1 grossing revenue slot on Google Play. Our core goal is making people in this world happier by delivering games that entertain a globally connected audience has remained the same. Our culture is innovative, creative, collaborative and impactful, and we are passionate about creating the best gaming experiences for our players.

WHY JOIN THE BRAND MARKETING TEAM?
You have a strong voice to represent the brand within and outside the company. We are always mindful about building brand image and protecting our brands' reputation.
You are passionate about data and understanding consumer behavior. We're always thinking of creative opportunities and strategies to reach and convert our target audience into customers.
You value being in the know. We keep a close eye on industry trends and always listen to consumers at every stage of our marketing strategies and campaigns.
You enjoy having influence over the end result. We collaborate across designers, artists, product teams, and community teams when it comes to creative ad development.
You are enthusiastic about games. We work hard but also play hard. We appreciate and play all types of games. It's in our team and company DNA.
WHAT YOU'LL DO

As Associate Brand Manager, you will work closely with the global brand and cross-functional teams to develop and implement data-informed, innovative, strategic global marketing plans based on key consumer insights that will inform local territory go-to-market plans. You will assist in the development and execution of the global brand strategy and planning, including market research, audience targeting, product positioning, creative, communications, promotions and lifecycle marketing programs based on data-informed insights.

Scope of Responsibilities
Monitor and analyse marketing results, KPIs, metrics, and optimize plans on our free to play live service games to ensure we are exceeding our goals.
Assist with the development of creative campaigns and coordinate the production and distribution of final assets (key art, trailers, screenshots, store and web banners, social assets, sales support materials, marketing copy, etc.) to the relevant stakeholders
Manage tactical executions that support the objectives, goals and strategies for our integrated marketing campaigns
Liaise with cross-functional marketing and creative teams for regular updates and occasionally drive weekly business sync meetings
Research and track competitive campaigns, activity and product feature sets
Curate and maintain the centralize digital storage of the most up-to-date and accurate product documentation for use across the organization and with selct internal and external partners.
Evaluate potential strategic partnerships to expand awareness, increase sales opportunities and extend the product lifecycle
Coordinate with the Web & CRM team members on direct email marketing efforts and CRM activities
Manage the purchase order process for relevant projects and track against budget
Develop skills related to forecasting, budget management, marketing campaign optimization, and game data analysis
Other related duties as required.
WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL
Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Communications, or Business related field
Knowledge of and/or a willingness to learn about gaming and other pop-culture-related trends
Minimum of 2 years of experience in games or entertainment industry Marketing. Preferably, with experience working on story driven and live/service based titles in the MMO/RPG genres.
A proactive, results-driven problem solver with the ability to manage multiple projects and work efficiently in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment
Strong analytical mindset and critical thinking ability
Good creative and aesthetic judgement
Thinks big and is ok challenging the norm
Excellent written and verbal communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills
A passion for video games and entertainment industries
Competitors: Blizzard Entertainment, Riot Games, Electronic Arts

ABOUT OUR COMPANY:

Since our first track day in 2012, we have helped over 125,000 people cross ‘drive an exotic car’ off their bucket lists and we can’t wait for YOU to join us.

Our team travels the country, hosting weekend-based events on racetracks around the United States. We are headquartered in Chicago, IL where our tour operations, customer service, sales and marketing teams are based.

Xtreme Xperience is a proud recipient of Inc. Maganize's "America's Fastest Growing Companies" award in 2017 and 2018 thanks to the vision and hunger of our people, and our commitment to building a culture of freedom and responsibility.

When and Where:

Our event will be held at Pittsburgh Intl Race Complex on Saturday, June 13, 2020 and Sunday, June 14, 2020. Please only apply if you are able to work our event both days from 8:30am-5:30pm.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: The event ambassador is responsible for organizing guest traffic flow and preparing each guest for their driving experiences in the pit area; supporting the Pit Manager and Guest Services team in all shared responsibilities and goals. In cooperation with other Guest Services Associates you will be required to maintain and improve the quality of guest service, driving capacities per session, overall event flow and sales effectiveness for Xtreme’s Tour operations. Daily duties will consist of but are not limited to:

· Ultimate objective is to assist guests in & out of vehicles both quickly and safely

· Prepping guests with head socks and proper fitting helmets; removal of post-drive/ride

· Directing guests to the correct line for their driving/riding experience

· Assist us with cleaning and sanitizing helmets and cars.

· Engage and entertain guests in the pit-area, while communicating effectively between the Pit Manager and Guest Service team to keep the program on schedule

· As lines & needs fluctuate, you will balance one another’s work load to maintain a positive , high-energy and efficient pit-environment, while focusing attention, patience and effective communication towards our guests and team

· Utilizing product knowledge about the program, vehicles, add-on options, as well as merchandise and apparel to handle inquiries about at-track purchases/availability to enhance light up-sell opportunities

· In cooperation with other Guest Service Associates, assisting with maintaining cleanliness of pit area, organization of station and notifying Pit Manager of any low inventories throughout event day

QUALIFICATIONS:

· Preferred: 1+ years of experience in Retail Sells Customer/Guest/Client Service or Hospitality

· Required: Flexibility of schedule; including weekends, holidays, and travel

REQUIRED ATTIRE:

· Black Bottoms (no jeans, sweats nor yoga pants)

· Black Athletic Shoes (including soles)

· If weather permits for multiple layers, all black requested

XTREME XPERIENCE PROVIDES:

· XX T-Shirt

· Lunch Each Day

· One Ride-Along in a Supercar or Lead Car

*This year Illinois is very, very strict on Workman's Compensation requirements for 1099 Contract workers (which you would be). You either have to purchase Workman's Comp insurance on your own (and prove to us that you have it in place) OR we can take it out of payment, which equates to 8% per day.

About us

Boxy Charm was founded in 2013 and continues to be a leader in the beauty subscription box industry experiencing immense growth of more than 100% year over year. We work with some of the hottest brands including Butter London, Dr. Brandt, Elemis, GlamGlow, Smashbox, Tarte, Too Faced and many more.

Today, Boxy Charm has a community of more than 2.4 million followers across its social media platforms, 10 million monthly visitors online and is the #1 searched beauty box brand on YouTube. In 2018, Inc magazine named it as one of the fastest growing companies in the nation. Boxy Charm is headquartered in South Florida and has an office in Toronto, Canada.

About you

As Boxy Charm's Director of Brand Partnerships you will be responsible for building and maintaining relationships with select beauty brands to acquire the best products for our Charmers, as well as manage and lead a team. A successful Director is highly creative and knows what's trending, organized with the innate ability to be agile in an ever-changing environment, and possess killer negotiating skills to get the best products for our charmers and cost for the company. You should have strong relationships with beauty brands and continue building upon those. Equally as important, the director can attract and recruit top talent, motivate and coach the team, delegate effectively, and manage performance.

*The position is based in S. Florida. Relocation assistance will be offered to eligible candidates!

What you will be doing
Proactively generate leads, pitch Boxy Charm's value proposition and participate in business planning.
Manage team performance – setting KPIs and coach to improve performance
Build and manage relationships with key brands by helping them achieve their objective and develop a long-term business development strategy for consistent campaigns.
Identify new brands and trending products including acquiring exclusive products and pitch internally for future campaign inclusion.
Negotiate best in market cost and product offering to support overall growth strategy.
Continuously educate brands on Boxy Charm's new product offerings.
Act as the brand ambassador internally to help define the vision, goals and positioning of the brand in their Boxy Charm campaign.
Identify common callouts from brands during the curation process to assist in the development of future initiatives.
Create custom sales presentations and proposals, write P.O.'s and coordinate with internal teams to ensure quality and receipt of products.
Participate in industry and company events along with marketing production, as needed.
What you will bring to the table
Minimum 10+ years of account management, buyer or merchandising experience in the beauty industry.
Minimum 5 years of management experience.
Must have an analytical and business minded approach to meet financial targets.
Ability to negotiate with vendors and brands for best possible cost.
Highly organized and results driven with the ability to handle competing priorities and accounts.
Impeccable communication skills, both verbal and written, with external contacts, team members, and leadership.
Comfortable with pitching to external and internal clients and meeting monthly goals.
Flexible to travel for client meetings and attend industry events.
Autonomous work style yet has a strong sense of collaboration, urgency, creativity and results driven.
Bachelor's degree.

Course Hero is looking for paid Contract Campus Representatives! We are firm believers in the power of learning communities where students grow by sharing, collaborating, and supporting each other. As a Campus Representative at Utah State University, you will host events on your campus to promote Course Hero's new sweepstakes and our Books for Africa initiative. You will also create awareness of the Course Hero platform and how it can help students graduate confident and prepared. During the COVID-19 related campus closure, Campus Representatives will be hosting events virtually.

Responsibilities:
Grow a community that loves and engages with Course Hero on your campus
Host events (student organization partnerships & networking events) to educate students about Course Hero incentives and products
Encourage students to apply for a chance to win the Course Hero Sweepstakes
Support social good initiatives like Books for Africa
Qualifications:
Excited about our Course Hero Platform
Interested in sales, and/or event planning
Proficient with social media (Instagram & Facebook)
Effective communicator who enjoys networking with others
Involved in campus organizations and communities
Reliable and willing to learn and grow
What We Offer You:
Flexibility and Opportunity: With over 25 million users frequenting our site, you have the chance to be directly involved with one of the fastest growing startups in the world of education technology. Our program is designed to be flexible - master your own schedule and work anywhere from 5+ hours a week.
Professional Development: You'll gain practical work experience and have access to professional development resources and the ability to connect with members of our team. We provide opportunities to develop and refine your sales, networking, communication, management, and leadership skills.
Career Advancement: After completing our program, you'll be well-equipped with the skills and business knowledge needed to succeed in your future career. We offer personalized career advancement resources to stellar representatives including, but not limited to, letters of recommendation and references for future jobs or applications.
Individualized Mentorship: You'll have bi-weekly check-in meetings with an assigned Course Hero Manager, who is committed to maximizing your success in our program. Our managers will coach you through creating marketing incentives, developing business proposals, and establishing weekly goals that you'll develop and take ownership of from the start.
Philanthropy: You will make an impact on the global landscape of education! A key component of our program includes our Knowledge Drive initiative. Together with our partner charity Books for Africa, we've donated 250,000+ books and counting to schools in the Gambia.
About Us:

At Course Hero, we have an awesome team and a truly engaging culture. We are customer-focused, collaborative, responsible, gritty and we love to learn. Our bold mission is to help students graduate confident and prepared!

We are not the only ones that think we're onto something big. Course Hero has been recognized as the 278th Fastest Growing Company in North America on Deloitte's 2019 Technology Fast 500 and also 2019's One of the Best Places to Work in the Bay Area by the Bay Area News Group. Read up on some of our recent news coverage, blog, and learn more about usto see what it is like to work with our team.

Job Summary:

As a brand ambassador, a Personal Trainer represents Crunch Franchise to members and clients by delivering a positive fitness experience and quality personal training sessions leading to member retention and client acquisition and retention.

Responsible for:

Upholding the Crunch Franchise core values of T.R.A.I.N.: Timely, Ready, Attentive, Inspiring, Noble.

Make reaching fitness goals achievable by assisting members and clients with education and guidance on comprehensive fitness programs including resistance and cardio-respiratory training, general nutritional guidelines, and nutritional product recommendations.

Meeting/exceeding minimum monthly company expectations including session service targets resulting in Personal Training revenue, supplement/nutritional product sales, and contributing to club success.

Training exclusively for Crunch Franchise. As a Crunch Franchise team member, it is a violation of our conflict of interest policy to conduct personal training sessions or perform any person training-related duties independently or at any company outside of Crunch Franchise. This includes working as an employee or independent contractor for another health club, personal training studio or private residence, or engaging in any other activities that represent a conflict of interest for Crunch Franchise.

Organizational Relationship:

Reports to the Personal Training Manager, Assistant Personal Trainer if applicable, Franchise partner or General Manager depending on club and market. This position does not have any direct reports.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

The Personal Trainer is responsible for performing the following activities for the club:

Service and Train Clients [70% of time]

Create an outstanding initial personal training experience for introductory package clients

Prepare and deliver comprehensive fitness programs based on clients goals that include appropriate exercise selection, nutritional programming and teaching a fitness lifestyle

Inform clients of the fitness tools available to assist them in achieving their goals

Set expectations and hold clients accountable to their comprehensive fitness programs through goal setting, follow up discussions, and tracking progress

Demonstrate safe and proper exercise technique to clients

Service Members [20% of time]

Instruct members on proper use of club equipment and exercise techniques

Assist, at the club managements request, in any member service activities (e.g., fitness seminars, boot camps, body fat tables, supplement/nutritional product demos etc.)

Understand all aspects and benefits of the CAMP CRUNCH Orientation and deliver a positive fitness experience to members and guests

Help with racking weights and assisting in maintaining a neat, organized and clean club

Additional/Misc. [10% of time]

Design comprehensive fitness programs using company-provided tools (dotFIT)

Schedule all personal training sessions, other appointments, and administration time using company systems (ABC/Datatrak)

Trainer Business Plan execution

Execute other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:

Education Level:

High School Diploma or GED required

Bachelors Degree preferred

Current Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR)

Certifications: (One or more of the following certifications)

American College of Sports Medicine (ACSM)

Certified Personal Trainer

Health Fitness Specialist

American Council on Exercise (ACE)

Personal Trainer Certification

The Cooper Institute

Personal Trainer Certification

International Fitness Professionals Association (IFPA)

Personal Trainer Certification

National Academy of Sports Medicine (NASM)

Certified Personal Trainer

Corrective Exercise Specialist (CES)

Performance Enhancement Specialist (PES)

National Exercise and Sports Trainers Association (NESTA)

Personal Fitness Trainer Certification

National Federation of Professional Trainers (NFPT)

Personal Trainer Certification

National Strength and Conditioning Association (NSCA)

Certified Personal Trainer

Certified Strength and Conditional Specialist (CSCS)

Experience:

Personal Training experience preferred but not required.

Physical Requirements:

Must be able to lift 50 lbs.

Physical effort required for daily duties include lifting weights, squatting, bending, reaching, spotting, and prolonged standing and walking.

Work Environment:

While performing the duties of this job the team member is regularly exposed to moving mechanical parts.

Extended workdays are a frequent occurrence, as are weekends & holidays as needed to support the business.

Overview


BRAND AMBASSADORS – PRODUCT DEMONSTRATOR – SAMPLING

BILINGUAL ENGLISH/SPANISH

HIRING NOW!

We are HIRING NOW Bilingual Brand Ambassadors to start working as soon as COVID-19 restrictions are lifted.

Product demonstrations (or demos) are a promotion in which a product is presented to potential customers at a grocery store. The goal is to introduce customers to the product, stimulate trial, and thereby motivate customers to purchase the item.

Demos are conducted every day of the week but primarily on weekends. We schedule you based on your availability.

Product Connections will provide all essential equipment to ensure your safety at work.

Duties include:
Set up, break down, and sampling products in the supermarket.
Prepare and hand out samples, coupons, and product information.
Drive sales.
Complete reports using your smartphone or tablet
We are looking for candidates like you who are:
Outgoing and friendly.
Love to talk to people.
Comfortable closing the sale.
Bilingual English/Spanish is a MUST!
Job Requirements:
Possession of Food Handlers Card (or willing to obtain).
Reliable transportation. Brand Ambassadors will need to bring demo stand and required appliances and utensils to their job.
Competitive pay! Wage discussed upon interview.
Bring Your Own Device (BYOD): Position requires the use of a smart phone or tablet not provided or paid for by the company.
The operating system must be Android OS 5.0 and above, or Apple 8.0 or above.

Summary


Part Time Brand Ambassador

If you are interested in helping to generate sales and increase brand awareness for some of the leading brands that you know and love, then we have the perfect position for you. A successful Brand Ambassador is responsible for engaging consumers, promoting brand awareness and driving product sales through live featured product demonstrations. The ideal candidate understands the importance of sales and customer engagement while working in retail locations.

Things to consider:
Shifts are generally 4-6 hours Thursday-Sunday depending upon when customers are most active in your area.
Competitive pay rates
Advance your career by joining North America’s leading business solutions provider to manufactures and retailers, where you will work with amazing people and earn competitive pay rates! APPLY TODAY!

What We Offer:
Part Time Benefits (Dental and Vision)
401(K) with company match
Vacation Time
Paid Training and ongoing career development
What You’ll Do:
Generate sales and brand awareness through product demonstrations and customer engagement
Maximize brand awareness by moving around the event area to actively engage with shoppers
Excellent presentation skills and the ability to expertly articulate product features and benefits
Timely and accurate event reporting, submission of paperwork and online training
Qualifications:
High School Diploma, G.E.D. or 1- 2 years equivalent work experience
Experience in event marketing, demonstrations, sales, brand promotion, or retail/grocery (Preferred)
Energetic self-starter, able to work independently with little or no supervision.
Availability to work a part-time retail schedule including weekends
Daily Internet/email access and/or smartphone required
Responsibilities


The Company is one of North America’s leading sales and marketing agencies specializing in outsourced sales, merchandising, category management and marketing services to manufacturers, suppliers and producers of food products and consumer packaged goods. The Company services a variety of trade channels including grocery, mass merchandise, specialty, convenience, drug, dollar, club, hardware, consumer electronics and home centers. We bridge the gap between manufacturers and retailers, providing consumers access to the best products available in the marketplace today.

Position Summary

The Brand Ambassador generates excitement, brand awareness, and increases product sales through event sampling and promotion. The individual will interact with consumers, clients, customers, and is responsible for understanding and implementing promotional techniques. This position will perform a wide range of activities ranging from brand promotion, training, product merchandising, and selling of products and services.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities

Brand Awareness & Sales:
Create brand awareness and positive impressions of the product by engaging consumers through sampling/distributing product and demonstrating product features.
Interaction with consumers through sampling/distributing products and creating brand awareness and positive impressions.
Responsible for ensuring brand talking points are communicated effectively with consumers.
Seek sales opportunities in departments throughout the store and other venues to maximize sales and sales of related attachments.
Event Set-up and Breakdown:
Responsible for event set-up, sampling, and program breakdown.
Ensure demonstration area is clean, organized, and correctly set up according to the instructions provided.
Communicate pro-actively with event Supervisor.
Personal Development/Training/Reporting:
Accurately complete and timely submit HR paperwork and reports online; call reports, expense reports (if applicable), training certification quizzes, etc... Participate in mandatory on-line training and conference calls (paid).
Attends initial training via on-line and conference call (specific date still TBD) as well as possible ongoing monthly product training, team meetings, client trainings, etc… (Paid) as a requirement.
Supervisory Responsibilities

Direct Reports

This position does not have supervisory responsibilities for direct reports

Indirect Reports

Position Summary Statement: The Brand Ambassador is critical to the daily success of the restaurant. Part of our mission is to serve hearty and flavorful food, and it has to be done right! The Brand Ambassador is just that a position on the front lines of our operation helping us to ensure standards are exceeded and that we execute as a team on our mission. This franchise is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchise restaurant, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this franchise restaurant. Founded by former firefighting brothers Chris Sorensen and Robin Sorensen, Firehouse Subs® began in 1994 with one restaurant in Jacksonville, Fla. Now 20 years later, the company has spread like wildfire with more than 1100 locations across 44 states, Puerto Rico, Canada and Mexico.

Specializing in hot subs, Firehouse Subs® serves large portions of premium meats and cheeses, "steamed" hot and placed atop fresh produce on a toasted sub roll. Each restaurant offers a family-oriented dining atmosphere, complete with an authentic firefighter theme that celebrates local firefighting history, as well as the founding family's decades of firefighting service. Firehouse Subs® is committed to giving back and has donated over $35 million to public safety organizations.

Our mission is to carry on our commitment to and passion for:
Hearty and Flavorful Food
Heartfelt Service, and
Public Safety

Course Hero is looking for paid Contract Campus Representatives! We are firm believers in the power of learning communities where students grow by sharing, collaborating, and supporting each other. Career Advancement: After completing our program, you'll be well-equipped with the skills and business knowledge needed to succeed in your future career. We offer personalized career advancement resources to stellar representatives including, but not limited to, letters of recommendation and references for future jobs or applications.

Our managers will coach you through creating marketing incentives, developing business proposals, and establishing weekly goals that you'll develop and take ownership of from the start.
Philanthropy: You will make an impact on the global landscape of education! A key component of our program includes our Knowledge Drive initiative. Together with our partner charity Books for Africa, we've donated 250,000+ books and counting to schools in the Gambia.

At Course Hero, we have an awesome team and a truly engaging culture. We are customer-focused, collaborative, responsible, gritty and we love to learn. Our bold mission is to help students graduate confident and prepared!

We are not the only ones that think we're onto something big. COMPANY OVERVIEW

For over a century, Neiman Marcus Group has served the unique needs of our discerning customers by staying true to the principles of our founders: to be the premier omni-channel retailer of luxury and fashion merchandise dedicated to providing superior service and a distinctive shopping experience in our stores and on our websites. Neiman Marcus Group is comprised of the Specialty Retail Stores division, which includes Neiman Marcus and Bergdorf Goodman, and our international brand, mytheresa.com. Our portfolio of brands offers the finest luxury and fashion apparel, accessories, jewelry, beauty, and home décor. The Company operates more than 43 Neiman Marcus full-line stores in the most affluent markets across the United States, including U.S. gateway cities that draw an international clientele. In addition, we operate 2 Bergdorf Goodman stores in landmark locations on Fifth Avenue in New York City. We also operate more than 24 Last Call by Neiman Marcus off-price stores that cater to a value oriented, yet fashion minded customer. Our upscale eCommerce and direct-to-consumer division includes NeimanMarcus.com, BergdorfGoodman.com Horchow.com, and LastCall.com. Every day each of our 15,000 NMG associates work towards the goal of enabling our customers to shop any of our brands "anytime, anywhere, and on any device." Whether the merchandise we sell, the customer service we offer, or our investments in technology, everything we do is to enhance the customer experience across all channels and brands.

Purpose

To acquire, cultivate and maintain relationships with our clients through deep product knowledge, personal engagement and luxury service.

Enhance the client experience
Greets and welcomes clients throughout all areas of the store
Connects with clients in a friendly and meaningful way
Provides clients advice and knowledge that they may not have realized they needed
Makes every client interaction a personal and seamless experience
Exhibits behaviors that support client satisfaction goal (KPI)
Boost sales through omni channel and out of home base selling
Educates self and client on merchandise, events, promotions, policy and services
Demonstrates expert styling and brand knowledge
Recommends merchandise based on expert product knowledge and client preferences, regardless of department or channel
Graciously takes returns and offers options based on client's needs
Takes an omnitude approach to identify and recommend merchandise across all channels
Utilizes selling tools and store technology to sell across all channels effectively
Promotes benefits of the InCircle program and opens new accounts
Achieves personal sales and out of home base selling goals (KPI)
Cultivate and grow client base
Cultivates the client relationship through personalized connection
Acquires and builds client base primarily through forming relationships with new clients and retaining/building spend of existing clients
Ability to strategize own business and be self-motivated; takes initiative to increase individual productivity through out of home base selling and strong client relationships
Utilizes digital tools and social media to connect with clients, serve their needs, and follow up as necessary
Proactively utilizes mobile devices and selling technology to communicate with clients and expand the business
Champion operational excellence

Ensures audit compliance
Contribute to team success
Partners with others to provide the best client experience
Actively creates a positive work environment through teamwork and collaboration

Job Description

Kitchen - Brand Ambassador

Purpose Of Position

The Kitchen position is responsible for executing the Schlotzsky's brand standards and maintaining product quality and recipe execution.

Duties And Responsibilities

Prep Station

· Follow prep standards for vegetables, meats, and cheeses and prepares quantities shown on daily PAR sheets.

· Wear cutting glove when slicing meats.

· Cover, label and store at proper temperatures all vegetables, meats, and cheeses.

· Prepare all salad mixes according to recipe standards and procedures.

· Prepare all soups according to recipe standards and procedures.

· Slice buns according to established procedures and wear cutting gloves when performing this function.

· Clean prep stations according to safety and sanitation guidelines at the end of each shift.

Meat, Cheese & Finish Station

· Follow recipes and read customer tickets to accurately prepare all orders.

· Work at a pace to maintain restaurant's established speed of service guidelines.

· Maintains a clean workstation at all times.

Pizza Station

· Follow recipes and read customer tickets to accurately prepare all orders.

· Place pizzas on plate or "to go" container according to established standards.

· Work at a pace to maintain restaurant's established speed of service guidelines.

· Maintains a clean workstation at all times.

Soup and Salad Station

· Follow recipes and read customer tickets to accurately prepare all orders.

· Place food on plate or "to go" container according to established standards.

· Work at a pace to maintain restaurant's established speed of service guidelines.

· Maintains a clean workstation at all times.

Bakery

· Follow proper baking procedures for all breads according to recipe.

· Follow bakery production sheet.

· Maintain proper weights and proofing procedures according to recipe.

· Maintain production times according to daily pars.

· Prepare bakery products to abide by proper shelf life.

Parking Lot/Exterior Station

· Monitors parking lot for cleanliness and ensures debris is picked up.

· Cleans tables and chairs in patio.

· Outside trash receptacles are emptied as needed.

Other Responsibilities

· Consults with management regarding customer issues.

· Maintains a positive working relationship and treats all employees with respect.

· Must become familiar with and adhere to all Company policies and procedures.

· Must maintain a positive attitude and follow the direction of managers at all times.

· Must adhere to strict safety and sanitation standards.

· Report to work timely for each scheduled shift.

· Arrive and depart from work meeting all uniform and grooming standards.

General And Physical Requirements

· Must be at least 18 years of age in order to operate certain kitchen equipment.

· Should be proficient and knowledgeable of procedures for all kitchen stations and guest service stations.

· Essential functions of the position include, but is not limited to:

· Lifting and carrying objects weighing up to 50 pounds.

· Lifting a full 33-gallon trash bag from trash container.

· Standing and walking throughout a scheduled shift.

· Bending, stretching, reaching, pushing and kneeling to reach certain products or clean certain areas of the restaurant.

· Performing repetitive hand and arm motions.

· Certain job functions require ability to perform repetitive slicing motions with a sharp knife.

· Certain job functions require ability to handle hot food by hand for several seconds at a time, throughout a scheduled shift.

At the request of our premier energy-related services client, The Starter Group opened in Pittsburgh, PA.

A dynamic marketing and sales firm that focuses on bridging the gap between client and consumer, The Starter Group’s core strengths are in communication and leadership development.

What makes The Starter Group unique? The answer is our mentality and drive. We know that to be the best we have to raise the bar every time we achieve our previous goal. MONDAYS DONT HAVE TO SUCK! LETS MAKE MOVIE MONDAY A THING!

Brought to you by Planet Hollywood and Candytopia, Movietopia is an immersive installation that captures moments from some of Hollywood's most iconic films over the last 30 years. With activities to bring you into the films and memorabilia straight from the movies. The movie fan in you is going to love it.

Navigate through a hidden temple, pose with your arms spread on the bow of an infamous sunken ship, take a ride in a Ferrari while playing hooky, and much more!

Looking for retail and entertainment leaders who love interacting with people, entertaining crowds, and of course are huge MOVIE ENTHUSIASTS.

You must crave the opportunity to share your favorite movie scene and put smiles on people's faces through leading and developing a high performing customer-service oriented team. Movietopia will be located in The MarqE Entertainment Center Houston!

THE ROLE

We are looking for hosts, actors, waiters, comedians, dancers, athletes, retail, customer service...anyone who loves people, loves to perform, and entertain crowds.

THE SHOES YOU WILL FILL:

As a Brand Ambassador you fill the most critical role in our exhibit: bringing our fantasyland to life! You will use your creativity and genuine desire for PLAY to put smiles on guests faces. You will use your imagination and personality to ignite the energy in a crowd of strangers and create a fantastically cool, entertainingly fun, and unique experience for everyone.

HOW YOU WILL SPEND YOUR DAYS...& NIGHTS...& WEEKENDS
Represent the Brand with joy, creativity & integrity
Outrageously entertain & engage with audiences to deliver authentic excitement beyond their wildest dreams
Delivering outstanding improv and generating audience participation, as well as deliver exceptional stage presence & customer service
Work seamlessly as part of a team, as well as independently
Rely on your internal motivation to deliver your best performance on every shift
Strike a pose and share your energy and joy as you will be photographed by visitors and shared on social media!
WHAT YOU HAVE:
Imaginative, contagious, spontaneous & joyful personality!!
Skilled in improv and audience participation

Job Description
About Us
Foxtrot is the digitally native evolution of the corner store – a one-stop shop for those seeking thoughtful curation that’s a reflection of themselves and their city – offering a curated collection of daily essentials in-store and delivered in under an hour via our app and website.
Venture-backed by investors including Fifth Wall, Lerer Hippeau, Revolution’s Rise of the Rest, and Collaborative, to name a few, Foxtrot is building a truly omnichannel brand that seamlessly marries e-commerce delivery, proprietary inventory technology, and the feel-good community of neighborhood stores.
Our spaces offer all the most-loved aspects of neighborhood cafes – beautifully designed interiors that wrap you in the welcoming aroma of freshly brewed coffee, comfortable lounge areas to work and relax, and chef-prepared meals to snack on throughout the day – while bringing together mindful people, brands and goods to create a community of discovery and joy.
Our e-commerce experience – highlighted by our swift app and online store – is powered by our proprietary inventory and operational technology to deliver a new kind of convenience that brings the store to your door in under an hour.
Since launching our native app in 2013, we now operate a robust e-commerce business and have opened nine retail stores in Chicago and Dallas, and are rapidly scaling to take this first-of-its-kind omnichannel brand nationwide.
About the Role
Foxtrot is looking for self-driven, enthusiastic, outgoing, and creative individuals to join our Brand Ambassador team and help grow our rapidly expanding brand. We want our Ambassadors to be as involved as possible in our marketing efforts and spread the word about Foxtrot to everyone in their area. As a result, we need dedication and determination from our team members - each ambassador should be able to dedicate 8-10 hours per week in this role. You will gain real world marketing experience while getting paid for everything you do!

Responsibilities Include
Act as brand ambassador to represent Foxtrot at events, samplings and other marketing initiatives throughout Dallas
Confidently and enthusiastically engage with and educate consumers about all things Foxtrot
Transport, set up and break down event/sampling materials and merchandise displays
Maintain professional appearance at all times
Help to generate new customers and excitement about our brand
Be our eyes and ears in your local market
Build relationships with organizations and local businesses
Excite community members and portray a positive image of Foxtrot in your market
Community Events: identify key local activations and help in staffing events
Partnerships: set up one partnership with a local business or campus organization each month
Samplings: plan and execute samplings to community members and promote current marketing initiatives
Marketing Collateral: distribute marketing collateral throughout the surrounding community
Use your social media networks to drive brand awareness of the Foxtrot brand

Requirements
Must be 21+ to handle alcohol
Previous experience with consumer promotions and events a plus
Approachable and outgoing – willing to talk to anyone at any time
Able to lift up to 40 pounds
Able to work both independently and as part of a team
Excellent communication skills
Punctual and reliable
Flexibility to work days, nights and weekends as needed
Excitement for and an understanding of the Foxtrot brand
Strong social skills and social following
Perks
Competitive hourly rate based on experience
Foxtrot Credit
Flexible hours
*Please include your availability with your application

Job Title: Brand Ambassador - Entry Level Marketing / Advertising
Job Description:
Job Description

As an Brand Ambassador, you will serve as an integral part of our client’s Marketing and Sales team. You will have the opportunity to work with multiple departments, assisting with Marketing and Communications for the company, manage direct consumer communication, and participate in comprehensive management training designed to give you the keys to a successful career path with the company.

Major Responsibility Areas for Brand Ambassadors:
· Implementation of consulting plans, including service positioning, campaign strategies, and market strategy insights.
· Discovering of strategic business opportunities through cross function collaboration with sales, marketing, public relations, HR, etc.
· Creating consumer Marketing & Sales opportunity for revenue


Core Competencies for Brand Ambassadors:
These are personal traits that will best help the Brand Ambassador to successfully perform the essential functions of the job.
· Judgment and Decision Making - Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one.
· Integrity - Job requires being honest and ethical.
· Initiative - Job requires a willingness to take on responsibilities and challenges.
· Leadership - Job requires a willingness to lead, take charge, and offer opinions and direction.
· Achievement/Effort - Job requires establishing and maintaining personally challenging achievement goals and exerting effort toward mastering tasks.
· Dependability - Job requires being reliable, responsible, and dependable, and fulfilling obligations.
· Social Orientation - Job requires preferring to work with others rather than alone, and being personally connected with others on the job.
· Attention to Detail - Job requires being careful about detail and thorough in completing work tasks.
· Cooperation - Job requires being pleasant with others on the job and displaying a good-natured, cooperative attitude.

Brand Ambassador must be very articulate, have a sense of humor, be easygoing, but very disciplined. We need a culture fit!


Entry Qualifications For Brand Ambassadors:
· (0) zero to (5) five years of relevant experience in marketing management with proven success an asset. However, our client offers paid training and no experience is required.
· Should be a proactive self-starter with the ability to work independently.
· Need strong ability to set priorities, solve problems, and be resourceful under pressure.
· Experience working with agency/client partners, exhibiting the ability to generate maximum return through effective consulting strategies and direction an asset.

KJM Staffing Solutions has a great opportunity for a Regional Marketing Coordinator with our highly prestigious AM law firm. This is a great growth opportunity for someone who thrives in a client facing and events heavy role and wants to have a seat at the table with a great team.

The successful candidate will have a Bachelor's degree and at least 2-years of business development and marketing experience in the Bay area. Law firm experience is preferred but client side or other professional services experienced candidates are encouraged to apply.

The regional marketers (RMs) are those on the front lines of the Marketing Department and act as the go-to person for all marketing efforts driven by their assigned offices or regions. RMs projects are primarily driven by the Office Managing Partner(s) (OMP) in their office, and in relation to firm-wide branding campaigns executed locally. In addition, RMs provide support for industry/practice development efforts within their region, in collaboration with Business Development (BD).


Essential Functions

Office Managing Partner (OMP) relationship and local day-to-day marketing activity:
Work directly with the OMP in monitoring competitive developments within the region and recommend marketing responses
Work with OMP and the office administrative team to develop and implement the office strategic plan
Assist OMP in driving business to the region by executing office initiatives, leveraging broader firm-wide client development, and profile-raising efforts
Implement firm-wide branding campaigns at the local/regional level as assigned
Assist the OMP with regional marketing budget matters. This includes consultation on budget development (defining priority programs for funding); monitoring actual expenditures versus budget; evaluating expenses; (re)classifying expenses; maintaining budget files; contacting Accounts Payable with questions or to request investigation; verifying expenses and invoices; and preparing check requests
Drive internal communications for the office and reporting of marketing/BD successes
Gather financial information through various financial report links specific to objectives of requests and synthesize that information into usable presentation formats
Act as local support for firm-wide initiatives, such as Alumni, Diversity & Inclusion/ Womens Initiative, Pro Bono
Stay abreast of PR activity & initiatives relating to assigned region and connect lawyers with PR team members as matters/projects arise
Participate in the new attorney onboarding process
Oversee external local/regional marketing vendor relationships
Manage community support and office-supported practice development sponsorships at the local level, including coordinating ads, branding, attendance at events and evaluating ROI
Work with in-house Graphics Team to prepare appropriate community support advertisements, invitations, and other collateral designs
Track attorney board memberships, leadership activity & professional affiliations
Collaboration with Business Development (BD) on Practice and Industry- Driven Projects
Organize & execute marketing & BD training for lawyers locally as needed/requested and educate lawyers and secretaries in assigned region regarding new processes
Lateral recruitment assist with local elements of the onboarding plan with appropriate PR/Communications and BD team
Work with BD to gather information on and assess membership opportunities in regional business and/or trade organizations and boards
Collaborate with BD on region-specific marketing collateral as needed
Events
Lead all regional profile-raising & cross-practice events, including community support galas/dinners, office anniversary/milestone events, internal Senior Management/Executive Committee meetings and regional MCLE Days (multiple- practice) according to established best practices, including: site selection, mailing list development and circulation of same, tracking RSVPs, catering management, logistics for guest reception, on-site management, and follow-up with targets, etc.
In collaboration with practice group events/seminars, assist BD members with on-site logistics and execution. This would include event registration, conference room reservations, and liaising with guest reception and hospitality.
Requirements
Bachelor's Degree is required.
2+ years of experience in Legal Marketing or professional services experience.
Strong computer skills including advanced knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Ability to work with little supervision.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Must have high degree of poise and professionalism when interacting with internal and external contacts.
Ability to prioritize workload and solve problems quickly.
Must be able to assist individuals of various levels with needs and problems and react to difficult situations appropriately

FREEBEE COMPANY OVERVIEW:

Freebee is changing the way people move around, by providing FREE, electric, on-demand, door-to-door transportation in several high-density areas of South Florida. That's right! FREE RIDES in 100% battery-powered vehicles, made possible through customized mobile advertising campaigns and municipal transportation contacts... and we are pollinating the masses with our many services in a progressive and sustainable way!

At Freebee, we know how to live it up! Our drivers are fun, energetic, and knowledgeable about the cities we call home, and can't wait to spread the word about what's going on around town, and all the great products and businesses we are currently promoting. Join one of South Florida's fastest growing companies and sign up to become part of our team of creative, driven, and passionate professionals who live and breathe the FREE LIFE!

JOB TITLE:

DRIVER / BRAND AMBASSADOR (MIAMI LAKES, FL)

POSITION OVERVIEW:

The Freebee Driver / Brand Ambassador position is one of the most important positions in our company. You are the face of the organization, and the one interacting most with the general public, educating them on our services and everything we have to offer. Shaking hands, kissing babies, and spreading goodwill to all.

We are seeking sharp, personable, highly-organized brand ambassadors to provide safe, reliable transportation to the general public, as well as provide them with valuable information about the latest and greatest happenings around town. The experience you provide for your guests will generate future opportunities for yourself, for our clients, and for the Freebee brand.

As part of the South Florida team, your role will be instrumental in spreading the word about our innovative free, on-demand transportation service, which will allow us to grow our fleet and take on new opportunities throughout South Florida and beyond. This is an opportunity to be a key player on an awesome team, as we continue to expand and enhance the reputation of the Freebee service as a whole.

WHAT YOU'LL DO:

- Provide safe, professional, and efficient transportation via open-air, electric marketing vehicles

- Interact with and provide great customer service to all passengers

- Create a fun environment and represent the company in a positive way

- Promote brands, distribute marketing material / branded collateral / product samples

- Document marketing experiences by taking photos

WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW/HAVE:

- CLEAN DRIVING RECORD (will be reviewed prior to hire)

- Valid Florida drivers license

- Energetic, outgoing personality

- Well-groomed appearance

- Effective time management / punctuality

- Communication skills (verbal & written)

- Must own a smart phone

- Knowledge of how to get around one or more of our service areas (see below for specific service areas)

- Bilingual is a PLUS! +

EXAMPLE BACKGROUNDS:

- Hospitality

- Customer Service

- Communications

- Brand Activation / Events

- Marketing

PERKS:

- Health insurance Benefits Provided!

- Have Fun & Work Outside!

- Meet New People!

- Career Advancement Opportunities Available!

- The rare opportunity to change the world such that everyone around you is using the product that you promote. We’re not just another service; we’re moving real people, reinventing marketing, and providing a reliable, eco-friendly alternative to transportation!

[Monday-Friday: 6am-6:30pm; Sunday: 10am-2pm]

Job Title: Senior Brand Manager of Bakeware

City: Lake Forest / State: Illinois

Job Description

Join Reynolds Consumer Products…a world of opportunities! At Reynolds Consumer Products we are passionate about achieving results and have fun winning as a team! We provide amazing job opportunities for growth with competitive salaries and benefits in an exciting, dynamic, fast-paced, and fun workplace environment. Are you looking to build a strong career? Then we have an opportunity for you! We currently have an opportunity for a Senior Brand Manager to join our Reynolds Disposable Bakeware team located at our headquarters in Lake Forest, IL.

Your Role:

As a Senior Brand Manager on the Reynolds Disposable Bakeware brand team, you will work in a collaborative environment to drive consumer demand, engage with target markets, and analyze performance data and consumer insights to drive strong business results for the brand as well as achieve business objectives including volume, profit, and market share by product and distribution channel

You will have the opportunity to:
Make your mark by bringing your creativity and fresh thinking to an iconic brand that has been trusted by families, since 1947
Develop and execute annual marketing plans including market share projections, budgets, advertising (digital, social), consumer promotions and more
Analyze key business trends and provide input on gaps and opportunities; present updates weekly, monthly, and quarterly
Evaluate and manage promotional and advertising spending
You will love it here if…
You are looking for general management experience
You have a creative side and are interested in food, cooking, and the latest recipe trends
You enjoy working with a dynamic team (internal teams and external agencies and partners)
You can successfully juggle multiple tasks at once and are comfortable with change
You have a passion for analyzing data and using date to drive business performance
We need you to have:
BA/BS degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field
4+ years of related professional and progressive Product Marketing experience in the Consumer Packaged Goods industry
Experience in profit and loss budgeting process
Excellent capabilities in Microsoft Office and SAP
Icing on the cake:
MBA or other advanced degree
Previous sales experience
Research and new product development experience
Experience in project management
Want to know more? Check out our website or connect with us on LinkedIn!

Job Title

Kaplan Med Student Brand Ambassador

Job Description

At Kaplan Test Prep, we are consumed with our quest to help students own their moment and achieve their ambitions. We embrace the same spirit as our founder, Stanley Kaplan, who started tutoring students in his basement in 1938. We continue to be the world leader in test preparation because of our unwavering commitment to helping our students achieve their educational and professional goals.

We’re looking for passionate, highly motivated Med Student Brand Ambassadors to join our Kaplan Test Prep family. In this position, you’ll increase Kaplan’s visibility on campus and social media with the goal of helping future doctors, one success story at a time!

As a Student Brand Ambassador you will:
Support your continuously growing network of fellow med students on campus and on social media by connecting them to Kaplan’s events, resources, and course offerings
Advocate for Kaplan by sharing your own USMLE prep experiences with your med student networks
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to identify on-campus event opportunities (including school fairs, club/organization meetings), and support those events as necessary
Identify students who are ready for test prep and direct them to the appropriate enrollment channel
Promote Kaplan’s brand by driving interest in our courses as well as our open Student Brand Ambassador positions
You’re a great fit for our SBA role if you are:
A strong communicator on social media, in person, and via email. You can pivot the tone based on your audience without issue. You can work independently while staying connected to your virtual manager.
Well-connected within the medical student community. You’re involved in clubs/organizations on campus, and/or have a strong med student network community on social media.
Savvy on social. You love using social media and you believe that it’s a great way to engage students with information they need. You’re excited to use social media to interact with your peers about their goals in an authentic way.
Enthusiastic about medicine, of course! You get excited about helping your classmates achieve their goal of becoming a doctor.
You must be:
A current med student who can commit to the role for at least 12 months
You will get:
$25 per hour
Free Kaplan Qbank Integrated Plan
Flexible scheduling (3-5 hours/month to fit into your busy schedule)
A well-rounded resume, filled with leadership and marketing skills
Location

Remote/Nationwide, USA

Additional Locations

Employee Type

Employee

Job Functional Area

Branding

Kaplan is an Equal Opportunity Employer

=============================

Drive Outside Catering Sales and Promote Local Restaurant Marketing, Coordinate the implementation of all Catering Procedures and Bookings. Must have excellent communication skills/public relations, Must have excellent organizational and service skills, Basic computer knowledge required,
Catering and/or restaurant operations experience is a plus but not required.

Its an entry level position. Must have a vehicle and drivers license. Typical working Hours will be from 8am to 6pm (Mon thru Sun)

Pilgrim’s is the second largest chicken producer in the world, with operations in the U.S., Puerto Rico, Mexico and the U.K. Pilgrim’s processes, prepares, packages and delivers fresh, further-processed and value-added poultry products for sale to customers in more than 100 countries, employs more than 50,000 people and contracts with more than 5,200 family farmers. Pilgrim’s is headquartered in beautiful Greeley, Colorado, at the JBS USA corporate office where our 1,200 employees enjoy more than 300 days of sunshine a year.

We are currently seeking an experienced Innovations Manager / Brand Manager based at our Corporate Office in Greeley, CO to join our Prepared Foods team.

Responsibilities:
Helps build and champion an insights & innovation culture within the organization.
Assists Head of Insights & Innovation in the development of a 3-year Innovation Roadmap.
Responsible for brand development pertaining to new product platforms, including concept, pack, product and branding, in alignment with the BU, as applicable.
Develops and executes annual retail channel innovation plans in partnership with sales, R&D, and Business Unit (BU) Leadership.
Assesses industry, customer, and consumer trends to stay abreast of competitive landscape and to identify opportunity gaps in the market.
Leads cross functional teams to develop, to commercialize, and to launch concepts from the Innovation Roadmap.
Manages assigned new product development projects from Market Landscape Assessment through Commercialization and Post Launch Optimization stages.
Accountable for new product P&L from preliminary business case through the 1st year post-launch to achieve target distribution metrics including trial and repeat.
Provides support in the tracking and reporting against innovation goals and objectives (KPIs) back into the broader organization.
Collaborates with research vendors/partners (as needed) to design and to execute market research studies; uncover meaningful insights and implications.
Creates and qualifies concepts that align with brand plans, innovation platforms and business priorities.
Partners with sales and customer marketing to help “sell in” innovations to key customers.
Provides insights & presentations to senior leaders, when required.
Qualifications:
Minimum of 6 years of marketing experience (food or CPG preferred)
Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s degree preferred
Ability to travel (25%)
Knowledge and experience in Stage-Gate management
Excellent strategic thinking, collaboration, problem solving, teaming and project execution skills
Experience in business case development
Excellent communication & presentation skills—verbal and written
Strong negotiation skills
Comfortable working in ambiguity
EOE/M/F/Disabled/Vet

Would you like a sales career working for one of the Top 100 Home Improvement Companies in the country? Are you ambitious, results-oriented, and motivational? Come join our team at American Home Design while working at Home Depot stores in and around Knoxville.

American Home Design is a locally-owned & operated home improvement company serving Middle TN for 40 years. Get cookin' with HelloFresh…

At HelloFresh, we want to revolutionize the way we eat by making it more convenient and exciting to cook meals from scratch. We have offices all over the world and we deliver delicious meals to millions of people.

We are the industry leader in meal-kit subscription services and we're growing all the time. We have distinct meal-kit services that cater to everyone with the most menu variety in the market, which allows us to reach an incredibly wide population of people.

The Role...

Tired of door-to-door, commission only sales? Want to escape retail? We are actively seeking full-time Sales and Marketing Representatives to join our growing team in order to continue the expansion of our brand. If you are working in the retail or customer service industry and are looking to advance your career, look no further!

This role offers a competitive base salary plus commission and bonus, on average top Reps are making an additional $700 a week! Comprehensive benefits start your first day!

Sales and Marketing Representatives receive outstanding training, professional growth, development opportunities and limitless success.

In this role, you will promote HelloFresh through direct marketing and face-to-face interactions at various events. In order to succeed in this position you will need to be confident in your customer service skills, eager to learn, and willing to hit personal and team sales goals.

Are You Someone That…
Can communicate verbally with a wide range of people?
Is customer focused?
Enjoys working as a positive team player to meet individual and team sales goals?
Is agile and able to respond effectively to the changing needs of a fast-paced growing organization?
Wants to grow your direct marketing/sales skills?
You Will…
Engage with potential customers through face-to-face interactions at local events, festivals, malls, gyms, and more
Promote and sell HelloFresh to new demographics while meeting weekly sales goals
Learn about the benefits and services of our product to effectively market to customers
Attend trainings several times a week on-site at our local sales office
Act as a Brand Ambassador for HelloFresh
You Have...
High school diploma or GED required; BA/BS preferred
Minimum one year experience in sales, marketing, customer service, retail or similar field
Other Details…
It is the policy of HelloFresh not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or because he or she is a protected veteran.
All selected candidates are subject to passing a background check prior to employment.
Candidates must have a reliable source of personal transportation.
Candidates must be able to stand for 3-4 hours at a time and lift up to 30 pounds at a time.
Candidates must be authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship.
Our team is diverse, high-performing and international, helping us to create a truly inspiring work environment in which you will thrive! Come see what's cookin' at HelloFresh!

Sound like the right opportunity for you, apply today.

Beauty Barrage is crushing the archaic sales support model. We are a full service strategic sales management team with employees servicing doors across North America, employing brand ambassadors in the field to provide training, education, and in-store support to drive sales for beauty brands at retail. Beauty Barrage works with some of the hottest brands in beauty and provides in-store support in retailers like Ulta, Sephora, Nordstrom, Dillards, Macy's, Blue Mercury and more!


The brand ambassador's objective is to go into retailers (brands and hours are dependent on the market) and sell the products within the brand that you are representing as well as educating and training retailer employees on the brand. Building in-store relationships and providing in store support are some of the main job responsibilities.
As a brand ambassador, you will be the face of the brand you are representing in store. Generating in-store events and creating a strong presence in store for your respective brand is the key to being successful in this role!
Our goal is to increase sales and brand awareness for the brands we work with. Our brand ambassadors are expected to be self-starters, effective communicators, good listeners, and have a passion for the beauty industry.
Here's what we offer:
We hire employees, not just freelancers! This means you will be able to accrue sick time, and PTO hours.
Competitive Pay
Health Insurance (Depending on number of hours in market)
Opportunity to work with multiple brands & products in multiple categories of beauty
Hours are flexible
Training and education provided for ALL brands you represent (This will be provided remotely since our office is located in southern California)
Opportunities to grow with a company that is growing 111% year after year
Key Responsibilities:
SALES & BRAND AWARENESS
Meet and exceed sales goals within assigned territory.
Build brand awareness and successfully sell various beauty brands in store.
Drive sales and increase brand awareness through link selling, training, artistry demonstration and events.
Assist customers to determine needs while suggesting products within your brand to fulfill those needs.
Generate in-store events for brands and increase brand awareness and sales.
Responsible for ensuring brand standards and objectives are met via regular communication with Sales, Accounts & Education teams.

RELATIONSHIPS
Responsible for developing and leveraging positive retailer relationships to maximize store level support related to all areas of driving business.
Build and maintain successful in-store relationships with retailer employees and management.
Stay active on our community website called Honey that helps inform on any key brand and company news.
Stay active on social media and post about your brand(s) and events in store.
Consistently partner and communicate with Sales, Account & Education Teams to effectively grow and develop overall business.

TRAINING
Educate and train retailer teams on your beauty brand(s), artistry skills, product knowledge and selling techniques to elevate brand awareness and achievement of sales goals so that they can continue to generate sales for the brand when you are not present in store.
Support Sales, Accounts & Education Teams during new store opening trainings as well as specialized retailer trainings as needed.

STOCK/MERCHANDISING
Ensure product on gondola and secondary locations is merchandised and fully stocked according to brand/retailer merchandising guidelines. (Includes but is not limited to: maintaining gondola cleanliness and stock, remerchandising, replacing testers and communicating/ assisting with reordering of gondola components as/if needed.)
Communicate needs of store and brand to the corporate team (out of stock items, requests for store generated events, etc). Set the example as a leader in all aspects of business, artistry, sales, image and Beauty Barrage professional standards.

Minimum Qualification Requirements:
Minimum of 3 years experience working as a sales & makeup artist in a retail environment.
A proven track record of achieving personal and territory sales goals.
Strong artistry, selling, customer service, communication and organizational skills.
Experience working successful cosmetic events.
Excellent time management skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Professional attitude and ability to be flexible and handle change in a positive manner.
Ability to communicate effectively with both the corporate team, management and employees in store.
Ability to work a flexible schedule based on the company/brand's needs and be flexible to change to reflect the needs of the business including weekends, evenings and holidays.
Able to stand for up to 8 hours.
Ability to travel within market.
Willingness to drive a minimum of 20-30 miles.
Must have a reliable form of transportation.
Possess a personal phone to be utilized for business purposes.
Technology skills ability to use a smart phone and keep open lines of communication via email, video calls, phone calls, text messages etc.

We skip to work | We love what we do, because we do what we love.

Our team of beauty advisors, trainers, and managers treats your brand as if it was our own. With over 300+ beauty professionals servicing over 3000+ doors in the U.S. and Canada, we help minimize your investment and maximize your sales return. Best of all, you don’t have to worry about all that comes with managing employees. Our full service team manages all sales reps while training, planning, and nurturing in-store retailer relationships.

Recently named to the 2019 Inc. 5000 list of fastest growing companies in America, we understand what it takes to scale rapidly. We are also a certified Nationally Recognized Minority Business Enterprise, proudly creating jobs (not gigs) for people across the country.

We are seeking high energy sales talent to represent a Westfield branded Kiosks across the country. Ideal candidates will engage the consumer, promote & drive sales, inspire, and spark interest with product knowledge in each location. You will also be answering questions on a smart device through our proprietary app.

We are staffing the Kiosk’s 7 days a week with (2) shifts (11am-3pm & 3pm-7pm). Support at your local Westfield may start as soon as June 6th and is projected to last 8 weeks. A branded mask and shirt will be provided to all talent supporting this project.

Your Role:
Represent Westfield to promote and sell the safety, features and benefits of Masks and Key
Become knowledgeable about the mask & key products displayed, answering consumer questions, and SELLING!
Share with customers this is a Westfield Charity hosted event and all proceeds will be donated to a great cause
Capture consumer contact information via tablet
Proactively communicate successes and opportunities
Opening & Closing of kiosk

Beauty Barrage is crushing the archaic sales support model. We are a full service strategic sales management team with employees servicing doors across North America, employing brand ambassadors in the field to provide training, education, and in-store support to drive sales for beauty brands at retail. Beauty Barrage works with some of the hottest brands in beauty and provides in-store support in retailers like Ulta, Sephora, Nordstrom, Dillards, Macy's, Blue Mercury and more!


The brand ambassador's objective is to go into retailers (brands and hours are dependent on the market) and sell the products within the brand that you are representing as well as educating and training retailer employees on the brand. Building in-store relationships and providing in store support are some of the main job responsibilities.
As a brand ambassador, you will be the face of the brand you are representing in store. Generating in-store events and creating a strong presence in store for your respective brand is the key to being successful in this role!
Our goal is to increase sales and brand awareness for the brands we work with. Our brand ambassadors are expected to be self-starters, effective communicators, good listeners, and have a passion for the beauty industry.
Here's what we offer:
We hire employees, not just freelancers! This means you will be able to accrue sick time, and PTO hours.
Competitive Pay
Health Insurance (Depending on number of hours in market)
Opportunity to work with multiple brands & products in multiple categories of beauty
Hours are flexible
Training and education provided for ALL brands you represent (This will be provided remotely since our office is located in southern California)
Opportunities to grow with a company that is growing 111% year after year
