Job Description
About Us
Foxtrot is the digitally native evolution of the corner store – a one-stop shop for those seeking thoughtful curation that’s a reflection of themselves and their city – offering a curated collection of daily essentials in-store and delivered in under an hour via our app and website.
Venture-backed by investors including Fifth Wall, Lerer Hippeau, Revolution’s Rise of the Rest, and Collaborative, to name a few, Foxtrot is building a truly omnichannel brand that seamlessly marries e-commerce delivery, proprietary inventory technology, and the feel-good community of neighborhood stores.
Our spaces offer all the most-loved aspects of neighborhood cafes – beautifully designed interiors that wrap you in the welcoming aroma of freshly brewed coffee, comfortable lounge areas to work and relax, and chef-prepared meals to snack on throughout the day – while bringing together mindful people, brands and goods to create a community of discovery and joy.
Our e-commerce experience – highlighted by our swift app and online store – is powered by our proprietary inventory and operational technology to deliver a new kind of convenience that brings the store to your door in under an hour.
Since launching our native app in 2013, we now operate a robust e-commerce business and have opened nine retail stores in Chicago and Dallas, and are rapidly scaling to take this first-of-its-kind omnichannel brand nationwide.
About the Role
Foxtrot is looking for self-driven, enthusiastic, outgoing, and creative individuals to join our Brand Ambassador team and help grow our rapidly expanding brand. We want our Ambassadors to be as involved as possible in our marketing efforts and spread the word about Foxtrot to everyone in their area. As a result, we need dedication and determination from our team members - each ambassador should be able to dedicate 8-10 hours per week in this role. You will gain real world marketing experience while getting paid for everything you do!

Responsibilities Include
Act as brand ambassador to represent Foxtrot at events, samplings and other marketing initiatives throughout Dallas
Confidently and enthusiastically engage with and educate consumers about all things Foxtrot
Transport, set up and break down event/sampling materials and merchandise displays
Maintain professional appearance at all times
Help to generate new customers and excitement about our brand
Be our eyes and ears in your local market
Build relationships with organizations and local businesses
Excite community members and portray a positive image of Foxtrot in your market
Community Events: identify key local activations and help in staffing events
Partnerships: set up one partnership with a local business or campus organization each month
Samplings: plan and execute samplings to community members and promote current marketing initiatives
Marketing Collateral: distribute marketing collateral throughout the surrounding community
Use your social media networks to drive brand awareness of the Foxtrot brand

Requirements
Must be 21+ to handle alcohol
Previous experience with consumer promotions and events a plus
Approachable and outgoing – willing to talk to anyone at any time
Able to lift up to 40 pounds
Able to work both independently and as part of a team
Excellent communication skills
Punctual and reliable
Flexibility to work days, nights and weekends as needed
Excitement for and an understanding of the Foxtrot brand
Strong social skills and social following
Perks
Competitive hourly rate based on experience
Foxtrot Credit
Flexible hours
*Please include your availability with your application

Job Title: Brand Ambassador - Entry Level Marketing / Advertising
Job Description:
Job Description

As an Brand Ambassador, you will serve as an integral part of our client’s Marketing and Sales team. You will have the opportunity to work with multiple departments, assisting with Marketing and Communications for the company, manage direct consumer communication, and participate in comprehensive management training designed to give you the keys to a successful career path with the company.

Major Responsibility Areas for Brand Ambassadors:
· Implementation of consulting plans, including service positioning, campaign strategies, and market strategy insights.
· Discovering of strategic business opportunities through cross function collaboration with sales, marketing, public relations, HR, etc.
· Creating consumer Marketing & Sales opportunity for revenue


Core Competencies for Brand Ambassadors:
These are personal traits that will best help the Brand Ambassador to successfully perform the essential functions of the job.
· Judgment and Decision Making - Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one.
· Integrity - Job requires being honest and ethical.
· Initiative - Job requires a willingness to take on responsibilities and challenges.
· Leadership - Job requires a willingness to lead, take charge, and offer opinions and direction.
· Achievement/Effort - Job requires establishing and maintaining personally challenging achievement goals and exerting effort toward mastering tasks.
· Dependability - Job requires being reliable, responsible, and dependable, and fulfilling obligations.
· Social Orientation - Job requires preferring to work with others rather than alone, and being personally connected with others on the job.
· Attention to Detail - Job requires being careful about detail and thorough in completing work tasks.
· Cooperation - Job requires being pleasant with others on the job and displaying a good-natured, cooperative attitude.

Brand Ambassador must be very articulate, have a sense of humor, be easygoing, but very disciplined. We need a culture fit!


Entry Qualifications For Brand Ambassadors:
· (0) zero to (5) five years of relevant experience in marketing management with proven success an asset. However, our client offers paid training and no experience is required.
· Should be a proactive self-starter with the ability to work independently.
· Need strong ability to set priorities, solve problems, and be resourceful under pressure.
· Experience working with agency/client partners, exhibiting the ability to generate maximum return through effective consulting strategies and direction an asset.


**Experience in the below industries are PREFERABLE**

~ Marketing & Advertising ~
~ Sports & Athletics ~
~ Entertainment ~
~ Military ~
~ Finance & Accounting ~
~ Restaurants and Bar tending ~
~ Management ~
~ Customer Service ~
~ Management~

Job Title:
Oakie / Brand Ambassador (part-time)

Location:
Concord, New Hampshire

Description:
Join Oakhurst Dairy's exciting and growing team!

It's time to join New England's foremost dairy company with a 98-year history of leadership in the industry. Delivering the "Natural Goodness of Maine" since 1921, Oakhurst Dairy is a company you can be proud to work for. Located in Portland, Maine, our company is one of New England's key employers offering:
Local management
Excellent compensation and benefits and
Pride in the product you will represent

It's about more than milk -- it's our heartfelt pledge to people throughout New England to honor what Maine stands for -- by offering the purist, freshest, most delicious products, while standing up for what's right, for our customers, for farmers, and for the environment. All of our milk is sourced from local farms in Maine and our facilities meet the highest quality-control standards. We produce fresh wholesome milk and dairy products which are backed by a 100% satisfaction guarantee.

In 2014 Oakhurst was acquired by Dairy Farmers of America (DFA), a national dairy farmer-owned cooperative. Oakhurst is a wholly owned subsidiary of DFA and continues to operate independently.

If you have transportation and the need to earn some extra easy money, this may be the job for you!

* Have you ever dreamed of dressing up as a nutty character and making kids smile?
Oakhurst Dairy, the local, dairy farmer owned company that you've grown up with is looking for our next brand ambassador.
For more than 25 years, Oakie the Oakhurst Acorn has been a favorite of children and their families across Maine and New Hampshire, bringing smiles and fun to parades, fairs, festivals and schools.
Oakie's mission is to educate kids about important issues such as healthy eating, staying active and being good stewards of our environment - bringing to life the qualities of The Natural Goodness of Maine.
Not interested in being a mascot? No problem, Oakie's other job duties include, escort and merchandiser. The products are already at the supermarket, we just need you to restock the refrigerated shelves with Oakhurst products, rotate the dairy products and maintain a clean, positive appearance of all our displays and offerings.
Our typical merchandiser is far from typical. We have college students, high school seniors, Moms who need part-time work, retirees who want to stay active - anyone can fit the bill.
Participate in quarterly training, plus our Marketing Representative will stay in contact with you on a regular basis, mostly by phone.

We are looking for people who love working with kids, are customer oriented and have a positive, friendly demeanor and are reliable, energetic and physically active.
Hours vary each week and are typically from 8:00 am - 2:00 pm on days worked. There is some flexibility with the schedule. Additionally, there is:
o Up to $100 reimbursed annually for purchase of steel-toed boots.
o Oakhurst polo shirts and sweatshirts are provided as "uniform" wear.
o Flexible, part-time schedule.
WORK HISTORY NEEDED: Please submit resume or brief work history to HR@oakhurstdairy.com

Requirements:
THIS POSITION IS BASED IN MANCHESTER, NH
Must be able to carry around an extra 20 pounds
A flexible schedule is a MUST with mostly weekend and evening availability, especially during the months of May-October.
Reliable transportation is needed and must have had a valid driver's license for at least one year.
High school diploma or GED required.
EEO/AA/Female/Minority/Disabled/Veteran

Summary of the Position:

Brand manager assists with planning and development of annual marketing and business plans that align with organizational goals and objective, aiming to achieve sales growth, profit margins and market share targets.

Roles and Responsibilities:
Manage brand portfolios to maximize long-term sales and profit; develop and execute portfolio strategy to build long-term brand health.
Responsible for developing global brand position, communication strategies and marketing (5P) programs for all products (within a brand) to build consumer demand and market share.
Provides the vision, mission, goals and strategies for respective brand.
Responsible for management of existing and new products within the brand to including:
Creation of printed packaging material from concept to production.
Developing 360 marketing plan including digital strategy, social media, print ads, go to market materials, e-commerce images and descriptions.
Executing the marketing and promotional campaigns for assigned products including working with cross functional team of sales, digital, e-commerce teams and events for integrated brand communication plans.
Responsible for developing brand standards and ensuring consistency throughout all brand elements.
Oversees and provides creative direction to both internal and external agencies, with focus on content marketing for digital, website, social media and PR.
Works with market research agency to analyze market and competitive trends, provide recommendations based on key learnings and execute actionable steps.
Ability to stay on top of industry trends, propose innovative ideas.
Participates in development of annual brand budget process. Works with Market Director to maintain / track annual budgets and P&L for appropriate segments/ markets.
Presents status update on overall business to Market Director on a quarterly basis.
Acts as the brand ambassador for respective brand(s) including the training and education on products. Will coordinate with SMEs to provide customer service training on new products.
Performs other assigned duties as may be required in meeting company objectives.
Communicates effectively with other departments within the organization and function within a team environment.
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor degree in Marketing, Communications or related discipline. MBA a plus
2 - 3 years of marketing/sales and/ or product management experience.
Animal health industry experience or Companion animal/Equine background a plus.
Must possess strong organizational, execution and leadership skills with the ability to multitask in a fast paced environment.
Entrepreneurial Mindset is mandatory.
E-commerce & Digital experience a plus.
Strong experience using MS Office Suite including, Excel, Power Point, etc.
Supervisory Responsibilities: None

Job Title: Cosmetics/Fragrances Beauty Ambassador (Multiple Brands) Sales Salary Plus
Job Description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW

For over a century, Neiman Marcus Group has served the unique needs of our discerning customers by staying true to the principles of our founders: to be the premier omni-channel retailer of luxury and fashion merchandise dedicated to providing superior service and a distinctive shopping experience in our stores and on our websites. Neiman Marcus Group is comprised of the Specialty Retail Stores division, which includes Neiman Marcus and Bergdorf Goodman, and our international brand, mytheresa.com. Our portfolio of brands offers the finest luxury and fashion apparel, accessories, jewelry, beauty, and home décor. The Company operates more than 43 Neiman Marcus full-line stores in the most affluent markets across the United States, including U.S. gateway cities that draw an international clientele. In addition, we operate 2 Bergdorf Goodman stores in landmark locations on Fifth Avenue in New York City. We also operate more than 24 Last Call by Neiman Marcus off-price stores that cater to a value oriented, yet fashion minded customer. Our upscale eCommerce and direct-to-consumer division includes NeimanMarcus.com, BergdorfGoodman.com Horchow.com, and LastCall.com. Every day each of our 15,000 NMG associates work towards the goal of enabling our customers to shop any of our brands "anytime, anywhere, and on any device." Whether the merchandise we sell, the customer service we offer, or our investments in technology, everything we do is to enhance the customer experience across all channels and brands.

Purpose
To acquire, cultivate and maintain relationships with our clients through deep product knowledge, personal engagement and luxury service.

Enhance the client experience
Greets and welcomes clients throughout all areas of the store
Connects with clients in a friendly and meaningful way
Provides clients advice and knowledge that they may not have realized they needed
Makes every client interaction a personal and seamless experience
Exhibits behaviors that support client satisfaction goal (KPI)
Boost sales through omni channel and out of home base selling
Educates self and client on merchandise, events, promotions, policy and services
Demonstrates expert styling and brand knowledge
Recommends merchandise based on expert product knowledge and client preferences, regardless of department or channel
Graciously takes returns and offers options based on client’s needs
Takes an omnitude approach to identify and recommend merchandise across all channels
Utilizes selling tools and store technology to sell across all channels effectively
Promotes benefits of the InCircle program and opens new accounts
Achieves personal sales and out of home base selling goals (KPI)
Cultivate and grow client base
Cultivates the client relationship through personalized connection
Acquires and builds client base primarily through forming relationships with new clients and retaining/building spend of existing clients
Ability to strategize own business and be self‐motivated; takes initiative to increase individual productivity through out of home base selling and strong client relationships
Utilizes digital tools and social media to connect with clients, serve their needs, and follow up as necessary
Proactively utilizes mobile devices and selling technology to communicate with clients and expand the business

Champion operational excellence
Assists in operational tasks (actively maintains selling floor, fills in stock, cleans fitting rooms, returns merchandise to other departments)
Ensures audit compliance
Contribute to team success
Partners with others to provide the best client experience
Actively creates a positive work environment through teamwork and collaboration
Maintains positive working relationships throughout the company

Role of the Brand Ambassador

We call our Aeropostale team members Brand Ambassadors because they promote the culture, values and mission of Aeropostale. If you are outgoing, friendly and have a passion for fashion, this is a perfect role for you. As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.

OurMission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!

Who you are:
Outgoing and excited to meet new people
Positive, charismatic and engaging
Obsessed with fashion and trends
Fantastic sense of style
Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual style
What you'll do:
Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience
Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy
Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice
Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits
Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store
Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed
Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other
Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountability
What you'll need:
Outgoing personality
Love of fashion
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task
Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)
Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance
Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)
Where you come from:
You are at least 16 years of age
Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store Manager
SPARC Group LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We value a culture of inclusion and diversity within our workforce, and are committed to maintaining a workplace free from prohibited employment conduct, including discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, religion, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, domestic partner status, civil partnership, status as a covered veteran, status in the Uniformed Services of the United States, citizenship and any other characteristic protected by law (“Protected Characteristics”).

KJM Staffing Solutions has a great opportunity for a Regional Marketing Coordinator with our highly prestigious AM law firm. This is a great growth opportunity for someone who thrives in a client facing and events heavy role and wants to have a seat at the table with a great team.

The successful candidate will have a Bachelor's degree and at least 2-years of business development and marketing experience in the Bay area. Law firm experience is preferred but client side or other professional services experienced candidates are encouraged to apply.

The regional marketers (RMs) are those on the front lines of the Marketing Department and act as the go-to person for all marketing efforts driven by their assigned offices or regions. RMs projects are primarily driven by the Office Managing Partner(s) (OMP) in their office, and in relation to firm-wide branding campaigns executed locally. In addition, RMs provide support for industry/practice development efforts within their region, in collaboration with Business Development (BD).


Essential Functions

Office Managing Partner (OMP) relationship and local day-to-day marketing activity:
Work directly with the OMP in monitoring competitive developments within the region and recommend marketing responses
Work with OMP and the office administrative team to develop and implement the office strategic plan
Assist OMP in driving business to the region by executing office initiatives, leveraging broader firm-wide client development, and profile-raising efforts
Implement firm-wide branding campaigns at the local/regional level as assigned
Assist the OMP with regional marketing budget matters. This includes consultation on budget development (defining priority programs for funding); monitoring actual expenditures versus budget; evaluating expenses; (re)classifying expenses; maintaining budget files; contacting Accounts Payable with questions or to request investigation; verifying expenses and invoices; and preparing check requests
Drive internal communications for the office and reporting of marketing/BD successes
Gather financial information through various financial report links specific to objectives of requests and synthesize that information into usable presentation formats
Act as local support for firm-wide initiatives, such as Alumni, Diversity & Inclusion/ Womens Initiative, Pro Bono
Stay abreast of PR activity & initiatives relating to assigned region and connect lawyers with PR team members as matters/projects arise
Participate in the new attorney onboarding process
Oversee external local/regional marketing vendor relationships
Manage community support and office-supported practice development sponsorships at the local level, including coordinating ads, branding, attendance at events and evaluating ROI
Work with in-house Graphics Team to prepare appropriate community support advertisements, invitations, and other collateral designs
Track attorney board memberships, leadership activity & professional affiliations
Collaboration with Business Development (BD) on Practice and Industry- Driven Projects
Organize & execute marketing & BD training for lawyers locally as needed/requested and educate lawyers and secretaries in assigned region regarding new processes
Lateral recruitment assist with local elements of the onboarding plan with appropriate PR/Communications and BD team
Work with BD to gather information on and assess membership opportunities in regional business and/or trade organizations and boards
Collaborate with BD on region-specific marketing collateral as needed
Events
Lead all regional profile-raising & cross-practice events, including community support galas/dinners, office anniversary/milestone events, internal Senior Management/Executive Committee meetings and regional MCLE Days (multiple- practice) according to established best practices, including: site selection, mailing list development and circulation of same, tracking RSVPs, catering management, logistics for guest reception, on-site management, and follow-up with targets, etc.
In collaboration with practice group events/seminars, assist BD members with on-site logistics and execution. This would include event registration, conference room reservations, and liaising with guest reception and hospitality.
Requirements
Bachelor's Degree is required.
2+ years of experience in Legal Marketing or professional services experience.
Strong computer skills including advanced knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Ability to work with little supervision.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Must have high degree of poise and professionalism when interacting with internal and external contacts.
Ability to prioritize workload and solve problems quickly.
Must be able to assist individuals of various levels with needs and problems and react to difficult situations appropriately

We're looking for great people to join our team! If asked to describe yourself and “fun,” "outgoing," and "self-dependent" come to mind, chances are you'll be a great fit for our team. Interested? APPLY NOW!!

FREEBEE COMPANY OVERVIEW:

Freebee is changing the way people move around, by providing FREE, electric, on-demand, door-to-door transportation in several high-density areas of South Florida. That's right! FREE RIDES in 100% battery-powered vehicles, made possible through customized mobile advertising campaigns and municipal transportation contacts... and we are pollinating the masses with our many services in a progressive and sustainable way!

At Freebee, we know how to live it up! Our drivers are fun, energetic, and knowledgeable about the cities we call home, and can't wait to spread the word about what's going on around town, and all the great products and businesses we are currently promoting. Join one of South Florida's fastest growing companies and sign up to become part of our team of creative, driven, and passionate professionals who live and breathe the FREE LIFE!

JOB TITLE:

DRIVER / BRAND AMBASSADOR (MIAMI LAKES, FL)

POSITION OVERVIEW:

The Freebee Driver / Brand Ambassador position is one of the most important positions in our company. You are the face of the organization, and the one interacting most with the general public, educating them on our services and everything we have to offer. Shaking hands, kissing babies, and spreading goodwill to all.

We are seeking sharp, personable, highly-organized brand ambassadors to provide safe, reliable transportation to the general public, as well as provide them with valuable information about the latest and greatest happenings around town. The experience you provide for your guests will generate future opportunities for yourself, for our clients, and for the Freebee brand.

As part of the South Florida team, your role will be instrumental in spreading the word about our innovative free, on-demand transportation service, which will allow us to grow our fleet and take on new opportunities throughout South Florida and beyond. This is an opportunity to be a key player on an awesome team, as we continue to expand and enhance the reputation of the Freebee service as a whole.

WHAT YOU'LL DO:

- Provide safe, professional, and efficient transportation via open-air, electric marketing vehicles

- Interact with and provide great customer service to all passengers

- Create a fun environment and represent the company in a positive way

- Promote brands, distribute marketing material / branded collateral / product samples

- Document marketing experiences by taking photos

WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW/HAVE:

- CLEAN DRIVING RECORD (will be reviewed prior to hire)

- Valid Florida drivers license

- Energetic, outgoing personality

- Well-groomed appearance

- Effective time management / punctuality

- Communication skills (verbal & written)

- Must own a smart phone

- Knowledge of how to get around one or more of our service areas (see below for specific service areas)

- Bilingual is a PLUS! +

EXAMPLE BACKGROUNDS:

- Hospitality

- Customer Service

- Communications

- Brand Activation / Events

- Marketing

PERKS:

- Health insurance Benefits Provided!

- Have Fun & Work Outside!

- Meet New People!

- Career Advancement Opportunities Available!

- The rare opportunity to change the world such that everyone around you is using the product that you promote. We’re not just another service; we’re moving real people, reinventing marketing, and providing a reliable, eco-friendly alternative to transportation!

AVAILABILITY:

- Flexible Hours!

[Monday-Friday: 6am-6:30pm; Sunday: 10am-2pm]

Job Description
zTrip is currently seeking a talented, self-motivated, and highly organized Sales and Brand Ambassador to help drive brand awareness in the West Palm Beach market. zTrip is the largest taxi operation in the United States. We are growing fast and have a fun atmosphere. We like to promote from within and are looking for the ideal candidate that is not afraid to tackle any issues it sees within the organization to better the operation. The ideal candidate will have to be able to enthusiastically talk to qualified consumers and driver partners about the differences and benefits of our brand, selling our services, and signing up new customers using the latest technology. This position is responsible for increasing the customer base by maintaining relationships with existing customers and by developing new relationships with small business owners, restaurants, hotels, hospitals, schools and other institutions. The Sales Manager will help us meet our customer acquisition and revenue growth targets by keeping our company competitive and innovative. You will be responsible for maximizing our sales team potential, crafting sales plans and justifying those to plans to the upper management.

Responsibilities
Achieve growth and hit sales targets
Design and implement a strategic business plan that expands the company’s customer base and ensure a strong presence
Identify and onboard new accounts to increase ridership and brand awareness
Build and promote strong, long-lasting customer relationships by partnering with them and understanding their needs
Present sales, revenue and expenses reports and realistic forecasts to the management team
Identify emerging markets and market shifts while being fully aware of new products and competition status
Skills
Successful previous experience as a sales representative or sales manager, consistently meeting or exceeding targets
Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization
Proven ability to drive the sales process from plan to close
Strong business sense and industry expertise
Excellent mentoring, coaching and people management skills
Requirements
Proven success in a similar role and environment.
Empathy towards your customers and colleagues.
Pride and attention to detail.
Polished personal presentation with Warm, confident and hospitable personality.

Job Description
The Brand Ambassador/Sales Rep plays a key role in representing the COHA brands positively at licensed retail locations, at cannabis events and within the industry. Brand Ambassadors/Sales Reps play a key role in representing our brands positively and building relationships with budtenders and consumers, providing education on our products, the company mission, brand story and building awareness of the COHA house of brands.

This is an exciting growth opportunity to build upon your cannabis industry knowledge, professional sales and/or customer service experience. You'll be responsible for ensuring great account/customer service by being prepared, organized, educated on our products and the industry. This role includes running patient appreciation days (PADs) in partner dispensaries.

Responsibilities and Duties:

● Create an environment that educates consumers, builds relationships, and achieve sales targets

● Acts as the “face of the brand” within a set territory, representing the brand and company in a positive and professional manager at retail, events, social media and within the cannabis industry.

● Bring the COHA and brands vision, culture, and values to life in every interaction by sharing deep expertise and enthusiasm for our line of products

● Maintain merchandising presentation and ensure displays and demo products are available, stocked, and to standard. Will transport all promotional material to and from pop-up events.

● Follow all policies, processes, and relevant government regulations

● Serve as an ambassador for the COHA brands by engaging with customers through 1:1 interactions and encourage them to return to try different products that meet their needs

● Maintain a high level of product and brand knowledge to be clearly communicated to consumers.

● Relay inventory issues to management

● Activate retail accounts within a set territory, including staff trainings, incentive and sales promotions, events, and product displays.

● Consistently and accurately supply weekly territory reports on events, account displays, training's, changes at dispensaries, etc.

● Must maintain a clean, polished, and professional demeanor at all times.

● Attend weekly conference calls and/or annual Conferences

● Other duties, responsibilities and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice

Requirements

● Must be 21+ years of age

● Must have a valid California driver’s license and a reliable means of transportation with proof of insurance and a clean driving record

● Bachelor’s Degree (preferred)

● Familiarity of their local market - both from a navigational and social/networking standpoint

● Must follow and comply with established procedures, including health, safety and sanitation standards

● Willing and able to work flexible schedule, including nights, weekends and some holidays

● Minimum 1 year of cannabis industry, retail and/or hospitality experience required

● Ability to travel up to 100%

● Must be reliable, responsible, high energy, outgoing

● Must be able to lift 30 lbs

Job Type: Part-time

Salary: $20-$25 an hour (depends on experience) plus commission structure

Language:

● English (Required)

Work Location:

● Multiple locations

● On the road

Benefits:

● Flexible schedule

Additional Compensation: bonus, gas and/or mileage required by law

COHA provides equal employment opportunities to all team members and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, sex (which includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, and related conditions), gender, sexual orientation, marital status, religion (which includes religious dress and grooming practices), age, disability, gender identity, gender expression, results of genetic testing, or service in the military.

Abercrombie & Fitch Co. is a leading global specialty retailer of high-quality, casual apparel for men, women and kids with an active, youthful lifestyle under its Abercrombie & Fitch, abercrombie kids, and Hollister Co. brands. A&F was founded in 1892 and is based in New Albany, Ohio. A&F sells merchandise through retail stores in the United States, Canada, Europe, Asia, Mexico, and the Middle East. The Company also operates e-commerce websites at www. abercrombie.com, www. abercrombiekids.com, www.hollisterco.com

The Hollister associate is truly engaged. They provide great customer service by anticipating and responding to customer needs. An individual who is outgoing, stylish, and helpful. Digital Brand Manager Needed

The Keri Shull Team has been the top sales teams in Arlington, VA for the last 8+ years. Due to the growth in our Real Estate Team and Agent Training Business, HyperFast Agent, we are looking for a Brand Manager to manage the fast growing client base and fast paced team.

TASKS INCLUDE, BUT NOT LIMITED TO
Manage the day-to-day business and KPIs to meet volume and profit goals.
Develop and execute marketing plans and consumer communication initiatives.
Manage all digitial media deliverables including but not limited to: podcasts, vlogs, blogs, site content, clickfunnels, social media, FB ads, Google Ads, YT ads, event promotions, email campaigns,and internal automation
Plan and manage all events; scope, budget, vendor relationshs, ticket sales, registration, day of process, and follow up process
Partner with sales team to develop and implement a robust and balanced pipeline.
Identify business opportunities from analyzing market trends, competitor reviews, sales data and market research results.
Identify any process or system gaps and provide efficient and effective solutions with appropriate documentation
Work according to company culture and values, prioritize ruthlessly, use strategic and clear communication, and deliver results effectively.

2-4 years of project management experience within Digital Media and eCommerce Management roles

Experience with CRM and marketing automation

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, interpersonal skills, and positive, self-motivated attitude
Great collaborator, with demonstrated ability to focus on both big picture and small details, relationship building, and collaborative approaches to problem solving
Experience in digital marketing is required.

Job Title: Brand Ambassador Entry Level | Marketing / Sales / Events
Job Description:
Job Description
Are you energized by engaging with prospective customers, delivering results and collaborating in a team environment? We’re looking for a Brand Ambassador to identify and contact customers, introducing these customers to our client’s wide range of products and services.

As a Brand Ambassador at JW, you will become highly qualified in understanding our clients’ services and our customers, creating leads and sales opportunities, and starting conversations with customers to provide our clients’ benefits.

The Role:
Establish contact with ideal customer profiles to develop an interest in our solution through in-person presentations
Proactively reach out to prospective customers to learn about, understand, and create new business leads and opportunities
Craft, fine-tune, and personalize outreach protocols in a retail setting
Provide introductory information to customers and introduce customers to our systems to continue the buying journey.
Document, evaluate, and share effective techniques, approaches and best practices that can contribute to generating new opportunities
Utilize Salesforce systems to accurately track and share progress and performance towards goals
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or further education
1-3 years’ experience in a similar role
Experience and/or genuine interest marketing and sales and/or the retail industry
Knowledge and/or understanding of retail sales
About You:
Excellent oral/written communication skills and interpersonal skills
Customer-oriented thinker who also enjoys customer contact
Self-motivated, proactive worker with demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment
Strong organizational and prioritization skills
Results driven and thrive on the feeling of accomplishments
Strategic and analytical thinker who is driven to meet goals and deliver results
About JW:

JW sees boundless opportunities in helping corporations achieve great success. Our customer-oriented marketing solutions via business, retailers, and events provide authentic and meaningful customer interactions. We ensure we provide the most value to not only our clients but also our employees. We believe in embracing the entrepreneurial spirit and challenging the status quo. We focus on not being the biggest, but undeniably being the best.

This role will be ideal for someone interested in joining a high-growth marketing company and becoming a ground-floor member of our U.S. office in Oakbrook Terrace, IL.

**The position is full time

Company Description
Here at Jonathan Wesley Inc, we’re on a mission to help companies in the Chicagoland area market their brand through innovated strategies involving trade-shows, local events, retail partners, and many more mediums! JW works with a diverse portfolio of some of the largest corporations in the U.S. Whatever sales or marketing need they may have, Jonathan Wesley is there with our powerful sales team, executing new campaigns, having fun, and loving who we're doing it with!

We build opportunities in every direction for our people!

This means the chance to be a part of creating, selling and marketing products. Growing a long-term career and obtaining great resume building skills. We are offering full-time. part-time, and internship opportunities as our peak season approaches.

Ours is a culture where you’re empowered to be amazing at work and life. To explore new opportunities, to be mentored by great leaders, and enjoy coming to work every day is what our company is built upon.

Join us to be part of a company where you can learn, thrive and make a difference.

● Consistently and accurately supply weekly territory reports on events, account displays, training's, changes at dispensaries, etc.

● Must maintain a clean, polished, and professional demeanor at all times.

● Attend weekly conference calls and/or annual Conferences

● Other duties, responsibilities and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice

Requirements

● Must be 21+ years of age

● Must have a valid California driver’s license and a reliable means of transportation with proof of insurance and a clean driving record

● Bachelor’s Degree (preferred)

● Familiarity of their local market - both from a navigational and social/networking standpoint

● Must follow and comply with established procedures, including health, safety and sanitation standards

● Willing and able to work flexible schedule, including nights, weekends and some holidays

● Minimum 1 year of cannabis industry, retail and/or hospitality experience required

● Ability to travel up to 100%

● Must be reliable, responsible, high energy, outgoing

● Must be able to lift 30 lbs

Job Type: Part-time

Salary: $20-$25 an hour (depends on experience) plus commission structure

Language:

● English (Required)

Work Location:

● Multiple locations

● On the road

Benefits:

● Flexible schedule

Additional Compensation: bonus, gas and/or mileage required by law

Job Title: Title: Beauty Ambassador- Washington Square Boutique
Job Description:
Position: Beauty Ambassador

Non-Exempt

General Summary: This position is responsible for promoting the girlfriend experience and building a client

based business. Demonstrates exceptional client service and selling skills. Responsible for knowing and

achieving their personal Average Dollar Sale, Items Per Transaction and Sales Productivity Goals as well as

understanding how their individual performance drives the overall performance of the Boutique or Counter.

Demonstrates a thorough understanding of features and benefits of our product offering. Fosters a

collaborative and cooperative work environment, ensuring a positive internal and external client experience.

Major Duties and Responsibilities
Customer Service
Consistently creates a welcoming environment for the client, focusing on the fun factor and the girlfriend
experience with equal focus in driving top line sales.
Uses ice-breakers to build relationships with clients. Asks open-ended, questions and listens to gain
understanding of skin care and other beauty needs. Confirms the client needs, offering products

through demonstration and education. Uses product knowledge to make recommendations. Confirms

choices and closes the sale.
Consistently utilizes company tools and resources, building a strong client based business for continued
relationships.
Attends all required trainings and completes educational tools to ensure thorough understanding of
features and benefits of our product offering.
Consistently seeks to understand new techniques and product to become a brand expert.
Meets/exceeds all personal goals.
Teamwork
Demonstrates professional behavior.
Leverages the strengths of team members by "team selling" to optimize client experience and spend to
support business growth.
Participates to support an environment where all employees are treated fairly and respectfully.
Standards
Assists in the implementation and maintenance of merchandising/display/marketing standards ensuring
the store is consistently replenished.
Assists in the maintenance of consistent standards of cleanliness and organization.
Consistently follows the Bare Escentuals appearance guidelines.
Follows all policies and procedures. Immediately reports any variances to Managers, District Manager,
Store Operations or Human Resources.
Follows all safety and emergency procedures.
Assists with non-sell tasks as assigned.
Maintains open/flexible availability that supports the needs of the business.
Perform additional duties as assigned.
Job Qualifications
Excellent client service, communication and organizational skills.
Ability to multi-task and build relationships.
Flexibility and the ability to handle change in a positive manner.
Previous retail sales experience preferred.
Cosmetic experience and clientele experience a plus.
Demonstrated ability to support business growth and exhibit professional behavior.
Must have open flexibility to work during peak traffic times including evenings, weekends and holidays.
Able to lift, push and pull up to 50 pounds.
Able to stand on your feet for up to 8 hours.
Nearest Major Market: Portland Oregon

Job Segment: Merchandising, Retail

BE PART OF SOMETHING REALYOUR ROLEAs a part-time Brand Ambassador, you bring our brand to life every day! Your goal is to provide everyone who comes in the store with an amazing shopping experience, making their day better than before they came in. You are the face of our company and you're proud of it! You love the products and are passionate about building brand loyalty with every guest. Most of all, you represent our company values and bring your REAL self to work every day.YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES* You're a people person! You use the AEO Selling Model to engage with every guest to help them find exactly what they're looking for, and you do so with a "friends first" mindset. (What's the AEO Selling Model? Don't worry - we'll teach you everything you need to know!)* You're passionate about AE & Aerie product! Guests come to you to educate them on product details and you are excited to make product suggestions to fit their needs.* You share the brand love! You're eager to introduce the AEO loyalty program and additional brand channels to guests.* You can hang! Your skillset rocks no matter what zone you're in and you can easily flex between the Salesfloor, Cash & Wrap, Fitting Room and Stockroom as needed.* You're an innovative problem solver! Making your guests' day is your priority and you're able to proactively resolve guest concerns while sticking to company policy.* You're a team player - #teamwork! You're always willing to assist your team in #gettingthejobdone.* You've got integrity! You do the right thing and you always adhere to AEO's policies & procedures.YOU'D BE GREAT FOR THIS ROLE IF:* You love interacting with people!* You're full of energy and can handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.* You're available to work when guests shop (lookin' at your evenings, weekends & holidays!)* You love AE and Aerie products.* You've worked in retail before. #practicemakesperfect* You're at least 16 years of age.OUR BRAND AMBASSADORS LOVE AEO BECAUSE:* They work with REAL people - there's nothing like your #AEOFamily.* They're given opportunities for development, the chance to learn new skills, and are offered great potential for career advancement.* They receive 40% off product at both AE & Aerie year-round (plus additional seasonal discounts with new Floorsets!)* They participate in store contests for the chance to win FREE merchandise and other exclusive prizes.AEO is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to complying with all federal, state and local equal employment opportunity ("EEO") laws. AEO prohibits discrimination against associates and applicants for employment because of the individual's race or color, religion or creed, alienage or citizenship status, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, sexual orientation, disability, gender identity or expression, marital or partnership status, domestic violence or stalking victim status, genetic information or predisposing genetic characteristics, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. This applies to all AEO activities, including, but not limited to, recruitment, hiring, compensation, assignment, training, promotion, performance evaluation, discipline and discharge. AEO also provides reasonable accommodation of religion and disability in accordance with applicable law.

Position Summary:

A Brand Ambassador is a direct representation of our brand. We are looking for energetic, personable and outgoing ambassadors that will help educate our customers on products features and benefits. Our team will consist of exceptional brand ambassadors that can relate to customers and provide well-rounded customer service. Your role will help welcome customers to the brand by establishing a connection, providing product information, converting sales and maintaining merchandise at a retail location.

What makes you a great
candidate for our Brand Ambassador position?

Personality: Do you have an energetic, people-person,
outgoing personality? Our Brand Ambassador team is searching for our next passionate
Brand Ambassador to join our team to create an up-beat environment that is fun
for both you and our customers! Join us in making a connection with our
customers and introducing them to the brands features and benefits.

Selling
Specialist: Do you have 1 to 3 years of sales experience within a
department, specialty or retail store? We are looking for talented individuals
who have previously worked as a sales associate with an apparel, accessory or
footwear company. Our selling team will be able to convert customers into sales
with passion and enthusiasm for the brand.

Communication: Do you
have strong organization, communication and interpersonal skills? We work both
individually and as a team on the sales floor where great communication is key.
Sales Ambassadors will use clear and decisive communication on both verbal and
written reports. Our team will also be capturing clear, crisp images of
products and floor space as required.

Work Ethic: Do you
have a strong work ethic? As a Sales Ambassador you must possess strong dedication,
which includes being reliable and committed to the brand and scheduling. All ambassadors must comply with store and
sales related policies and procedures set by Winston Retail.

Technology: Are you
tech savvy? Each team member is required to have a smartphone device for
reporting purposes - Android OS 8.0 or higher/Apple iOS 8.0 or higher and know
how to use Wi-Fi. Sales Ambassadors must download and install an app on your
smart phone and have the ability to upload a report, which may include multiple
photos to our reporting site via the app.

Interested
in joining our team? Check out our website and apply directly at winstonretailjobs.com.

Job Description
Brand Manager Wanted for Raleigh Marketing Consultants

Our company is a leading outsourced business development company, working strictly Business-to-Business. While representing a major office supply company, we have a strong focus on in person customer service, sales, and marketing. Consistently meeting expectations of our clients, the company continues to expand and grow with a great amount of stability.

Responsibilities
Having full knowledge of the client's products and services (training provided)
Representing our client in a professional manner to their customers
Monday - Friday Morning meetings
Availability Monday - Friday 8:00 am - 6:00 pm
Providing quality customer service
Entry level Sales and Marketing
Account Management
Management training
Our company offers several benefits to working here. Not only a competitive pay plan but the ability to increase pay every year. A positive, upbeat atmosphere is a strong focus for our company. We truly believe that people work harder and more happily with positivity and praise versus the latter, therefore offering and enjoyable atmosphere on a daily basis. Philanthropy is also a major focus within our company. We are a "people helping people" company.

*We only hire management from within base on performance, not tenure. Candidates that meet and exceed the expectations of a Brand Ambassador will be cross trained into a leadership role within the company.

Requirements
2 year degree or equivalent experience
Customer Service experience
Sales and Marketing experience preferred, but not required
Ability to work as a team or as an individual
Interest in advancement with our company
Pay ranging from $0-48,000+ per year starting off (based on individual performance, commissions, and bonuses), with the potential for pay increases as you advance
Company Description
We believe quality business depends on having a team of varying backgrounds, resources, and skills. Our philosophy of 100% internal, merit-based, organic promotion and growth guarantees career opportunities and the growth potential for our team to realize their goals, regardless of previous experience or personal background.

Job Title: Brand Ambassador - Aeropostale Mall of America
Job Description: Role of the Brand AmbassadorWe call our Aeropostale team members Brand Ambassadors because they promote the culture, values and mission of Aeropostale. If you are outgoing, friendly and have a passion for fashion, this is a perfect role for you. As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.Our Mission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!Who you are:* Outgoing and excited to meet new people* Positive, charismatic and engaging* Obsessed with fashion and trends* Fantastic sense of style* Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual styleWhat you'll do:* Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience* Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy* Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice* Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits* Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store* Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed* Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other* Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountabilityWhat you'll need:* Outgoing personality* Love of fashion* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task* Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)* Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance* Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)Where you come from:* You are at least 16 years of age* Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store ManagerSPARC Group LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We value a culture of inclusion and diversity within our workforce, and are committed to maintaining a workplace free from prohibited employment conduct, including discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, religion, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, domestic partner status, civil partnership, status as a covered veteran, status in the Uniformed Services of the United States, citizenship and any other characteristic protected by law ("Protected Characteristics").

Job Title

Kaplan Med Student Brand Ambassador

Job Description

At Kaplan Test Prep, we are consumed with our quest to help students own their moment and achieve their ambitions. We embrace the same spirit as our founder, Stanley Kaplan, who started tutoring students in his basement in 1938. We continue to be the world leader in test preparation because of our unwavering commitment to helping our students achieve their educational and professional goals.

We’re looking for passionate, highly motivated Med Student Brand Ambassadors to join our Kaplan Test Prep family. In this position, you’ll increase Kaplan’s visibility on campus and social media with the goal of helping future doctors, one success story at a time!

As a Student Brand Ambassador you will:
Support your continuously growing network of fellow med students on campus and on social media by connecting them to Kaplan’s events, resources, and course offerings
Advocate for Kaplan by sharing your own USMLE prep experiences with your med student networks
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to identify on-campus event opportunities (including school fairs, club/organization meetings), and support those events as necessary
Identify students who are ready for test prep and direct them to the appropriate enrollment channel
Promote Kaplan’s brand by driving interest in our courses as well as our open Student Brand Ambassador positions
You’re a great fit for our SBA role if you are:
A strong communicator on social media, in person, and via email. You can pivot the tone based on your audience without issue. You can work independently while staying connected to your virtual manager.
Well-connected within the medical student community. You’re involved in clubs/organizations on campus, and/or have a strong med student network community on social media.
Savvy on social. You love using social media and you believe that it’s a great way to engage students with information they need. You’re excited to use social media to interact with your peers about their goals in an authentic way.
Enthusiastic about medicine, of course! You get excited about helping your classmates achieve their goal of becoming a doctor.
You must be:
A current med student who can commit to the role for at least 12 months
You will get:
$25 per hour
Free Kaplan Qbank Integrated Plan
Flexible scheduling (3-5 hours/month to fit into your busy schedule)
A well-rounded resume, filled with leadership and marketing skills
Location

Remote/Nationwide, USA

Additional Locations

Employee Type

Employee

Job Functional Area

Branding

Kaplan is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Job Title: Brand Ambassador (Westfield Malls) - National City, CA
Job Description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking high energy sales talent to represent a Westfield branded Kiosks across the country. Ideal candidates will engage the consumer, promote & drive sales, inspire, and spark interest with product knowledge in each location. You will also be answering questions on a smart device through our proprietary app.

We are staffing the Kiosk’s 7 days a week with (2) shifts (11am-3pm & 3pm-7pm). Support at your local Westfield may start as soon as June 6th and is projected to last 8 weeks. A branded mask and shirt will be provided to all talent supporting this project.

Your Role:
Represent Westfield to promote and sell the safety, features and benefits of Masks and Key
Become knowledgeable about the mask & key products displayed, answering consumer questions, and SELLING!
Share with customers this is a Westfield Charity hosted event and all proceeds will be donated to a great cause
Capture consumer contact information via tablet
Proactively communicate successes and opportunities
Opening & Closing of kiosk
Company Description:

Winston Retail is the leading service agency that provides demo and retail merchandising support, environmental design, and project management. Our national team of merchandise coordinators are passionate, talented and hard-working. They are responsible for retail presentations for technology, image & lifestyle fashion brands. We specialize in apparel, footwear and accessories, and are expanding our footprint into technology with a variety of retailers. For additional company information, please visit our website: www.winstonretail.com.

Experience & Skill Requirements:
2-3 years of sales experience in a retail environment
Strong presentations skills & selling acumen
Experience with special events and ability to handle a fast-paced environment
Engaging personality with a passion for Health & Wellness (preferred)
Negotiating & influencing skills
Proficient computer skills
Required Skills & Tools:
Communicates timely and effectively (both verbal and written)
Intermediate to advanced computer knowledge (Excel, Word, email and digital photography)
Proficient in capturing crisp, clear mirror image photography (before and after photos showcasing completed work)
Ability to lift at least 25 pounds
Smartphone device for reporting purposes -- Android OS 8.0 or higher/Apple iOS 8.0 or higher
Must know how to download and install an app on your smart phone
Must have the ability to upload a report, which includes multiple photos, to our reporting site via the app
Must be able to keep phone OS up to date
Must know how to use wi-fi services

Job Description

Job Title: Senior Brand Manager of Bakeware

City: Lake Forest / State: Illinois

Job Description

Join Reynolds Consumer Products…a world of opportunities! At Reynolds Consumer Products we are passionate about achieving results and have fun winning as a team! We provide amazing job opportunities for growth with competitive salaries and benefits in an exciting, dynamic, fast-paced, and fun workplace environment. Are you looking to build a strong career? Then we have an opportunity for you! We currently have an opportunity for a Senior Brand Manager to join our Reynolds Disposable Bakeware team located at our headquarters in Lake Forest, IL.

Your Role:

As a Senior Brand Manager on the Reynolds Disposable Bakeware brand team, you will work in a collaborative environment to drive consumer demand, engage with target markets, and analyze performance data and consumer insights to drive strong business results for the brand as well as achieve business objectives including volume, profit, and market share by product and distribution channel

You will have the opportunity to:
Make your mark by bringing your creativity and fresh thinking to an iconic brand that has been trusted by families, since 1947
Develop and execute annual marketing plans including market share projections, budgets, advertising (digital, social), consumer promotions and more
Analyze key business trends and provide input on gaps and opportunities; present updates weekly, monthly, and quarterly
Evaluate and manage promotional and advertising spending
You will love it here if…
You are looking for general management experience
You have a creative side and are interested in food, cooking, and the latest recipe trends
You enjoy working with a dynamic team (internal teams and external agencies and partners)
You can successfully juggle multiple tasks at once and are comfortable with change
You have a passion for analyzing data and using date to drive business performance
We need you to have:
BA/BS degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field
4+ years of related professional and progressive Product Marketing experience in the Consumer Packaged Goods industry
Experience in profit and loss budgeting process
Excellent capabilities in Microsoft Office and SAP
Icing on the cake:
MBA or other advanced degree
Previous sales experience
Research and new product development experience
Experience in project management
Want to know more? Check out our website or connect with us on LinkedIn!

Apply today to join a fast-growing innovative company!

Not a good fit but know someone who is? Please refer them!

Local candidates only, no relocation assistance available

For applicants or employees who are disabled, or require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process, you may request assistance by calling us at (847)482-3550 or email Recruitment@ReynoldsBrands.com.

No recruiter calls or emails please.

Brand Ambassador needed to join our professional team; part-time position with great perks; previous customer service or sales experience required.

Who We Are:


Since 1979, Kitchen Saver has remained committed to providing our customers with the highest quality and most innovative home improvement products that make kitchen remodeling convenient and affordable. Our dedication to the training and development of our employees has enabled us to provide exceptional services that exceeds our customers expectations. Join a seven-time Angies List Super Service Award winning company, a place where youll be proud to work. Learn more about our company www.KitchenSaver.com

Job Summary:


Are you tired working for a large company where you are just a number? Do you currently have a rigid work schedule and want flexibility? Looking for a position in a friendly, team setting? If you answered yes to any of these, this may be the job for you!

• Represent an Angies List Super Service Award winning company at local retail locations and/or community events with other mature individuals

• Help folks in the community learn how to improve the quality of their lives by updating the most important room in their house

• Create interest and answer general questions (paid training provided)

• Gather contact information for appointment setting purposes

• Reliable transportation and the ability to travel throughout Maryland, DC and Northern Virginia are a must

Who You Are:

High School Diploma or GED preferred
A sociable self-starter who has worked with the general public; at least 1 year of customer service and/or sales experience
Have a knack for giving sound advice and a good listener as well
Must be able to demonstrate superior communication and customer service skills
Excellent attendance record and a positive, get it done attitude
Work in partnership with existing team
What We Offer:

Competitive hourly compensation based on experience
Paid sick leave and 401(k) with company match
Lead Generation incentive bonuses, paid bi-weekly
Mileage reimbursement and travel pay
Paid initial and ongoing training
Opportunity for growth and advancement
Fun relaxed team culture, casual dress code
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and value diversity. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

Job Title: Entry Level Brand Ambassador - Sales & Marketing
Job Description:
Job Description
Our Brand Ambassadors are some of the best and brightest in the Long Island area. We are a team of dedicated individuals focused on bringing our customers the very best products at the best value.

A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A BRAND AMBASSADOR

As a Brand Ambassador, you are the primary contact for our clients. You start each day excited to establish new relationships while continuing to nurture existing ones. By meeting one-on-one with our clients, you are able to build excellent rapport and more effectively educate them about our products and services. Your excellent communication skills are an essential part of your success, as you complete product presentations and give price quotes. To complete sales, you collect and enter order information all while providing superior customer service.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
The Brand Ambassador is responsible for calling on assigned accounts on a daily basis
Greet and communicate with account decision-makers
Increase customer base and loyalty
Monitors marketplace information on pricing, products, and current promotions
Order entry and communication
Meeting company goals and objectives
SKILLS:
Enjoy meeting and interacting with customers
Demonstrates a positive and energetic attitude
A team player who possesses the ability to work in a learning environment
Candidates with the following experience may apply:

Job Description
Marketing Associate & Brand Ambassador :

=============================

Drive Outside Catering Sales and Promote Local Restaurant Marketing, Coordinate the implementation of all Catering Procedures and Bookings. Must have excellent communication skills/public relations, Must have excellent organizational and service skills, Basic computer knowledge required,
Catering and/or restaurant operations experience is a plus but not required.

Its an entry level position. Must have a vehicle and drivers license. Typical working Hours will be from 8am to 6pm (Mon thru Sun)

Brand Ambassador/Cashier

Department: Front of House

Reports to: General Manager

Job Description:

The Brand Ambassador will have superior customer service skills, experience in a fast pace restaurant, knowledge of point of sale and cash handling skills.

Essential Functions include and are not limited to the following:
Serves customers at the restaurant counter: Takes orders from customers and inputs into our system, totals orders using cash register, relays orders to cook, gives ticket stubs to customers to identify filled orders, and promptly delivers meal to customer.
Fills containers with requested beverages, such as iced coffee, tea, or house beverages.
Receives payment for orders, processes methods of payment.
Must exhibit a genuine desire to be of service to our guests.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required
Excellent customer service skills
Must possess a strong attention to detail
Ability to work in a high stress, faced-paced environment
High personal integrity, professionalism and maturity
Proven problem-solving abilities
Excellent communication skills
Essential Physical Requirements
Must be able to walk and stand for entire shift, up to 12 hours
Must be able to continuously reach, bend, and stretch
Must be able to lift and carry up to 25 lbs
Experience
Customer service experience preferred
Cash handling experience preferred

In addition to federal law requirements, Num Pang complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

Pilgrim’s is the second largest chicken producer in the world, with operations in the U.S., Puerto Rico, Mexico and the U.K. Pilgrim’s processes, prepares, packages and delivers fresh, further-processed and value-added poultry products for sale to customers in more than 100 countries, employs more than 50,000 people and contracts with more than 5,200 family farmers. Pilgrim’s is headquartered in beautiful Greeley, Colorado, at the JBS USA corporate office where our 1,200 employees enjoy more than 300 days of sunshine a year.

We are currently seeking an experienced Innovations Manager / Brand Manager based at our Corporate Office in Greeley, CO to join our Prepared Foods team.

Responsibilities:
Helps build and champion an insights & innovation culture within the organization.
Assists Head of Insights & Innovation in the development of a 3-year Innovation Roadmap.
Responsible for brand development pertaining to new product platforms, including concept, pack, product and branding, in alignment with the BU, as applicable.
Develops and executes annual retail channel innovation plans in partnership with sales, R&D, and Business Unit (BU) Leadership.
Assesses industry, customer, and consumer trends to stay abreast of competitive landscape and to identify opportunity gaps in the market.
Leads cross functional teams to develop, to commercialize, and to launch concepts from the Innovation Roadmap.
Manages assigned new product development projects from Market Landscape Assessment through Commercialization and Post Launch Optimization stages.
Accountable for new product P&L from preliminary business case through the 1st year post-launch to achieve target distribution metrics including trial and repeat.
Provides support in the tracking and reporting against innovation goals and objectives (KPIs) back into the broader organization.
Collaborates with research vendors/partners (as needed) to design and to execute market research studies; uncover meaningful insights and implications.
Creates and qualifies concepts that align with brand plans, innovation platforms and business priorities.
Partners with sales and customer marketing to help “sell in” innovations to key customers.
Provides insights & presentations to senior leaders, when required.
Qualifications:
Minimum of 6 years of marketing experience (food or CPG preferred)
Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s degree preferred
Ability to travel (25%)
Knowledge and experience in Stage-Gate management
Excellent strategic thinking, collaboration, problem solving, teaming and project execution skills
Experience in business case development
Excellent communication & presentation skills—verbal and written
Strong negotiation skills
Comfortable working in ambiguity
EOE/M/F/Disabled/Vet

Job Title: Brand Ambassador - Aeropostale Regency Square Mall
Job Description:
Role of the Brand Ambassador

We call our Aeropostale team members Brand Ambassadors because they promote the culture, values and mission of Aeropostale. If you are outgoing, friendly and have a passion for fashion, this is a perfect role for you. As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.

OurMission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!

Who you are:
Outgoing and excited to meet new people
Positive, charismatic and engaging
Obsessed with fashion and trends
Fantastic sense of style
Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual style
What you'll do:
Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience
Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy
Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice
Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits
Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store
Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed
Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other
Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountability
What you'll need:
Outgoing personality
Love of fashion
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task
Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)
Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance
Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)
Where you come from:
You are at least 16 years of age
Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store Manager

Job Title: Brand Ambassador - Customer Service Consultants (Retail) Entry Level
Job Description:
Job Description
Now Hiring Customer Service Consultants for our Retail Division!

$10 -$13/Hourly + Paid Training.

Job Duties:
• Work in one of our retail locations to assist customers face-to-face
• Answer questions regarding customer billing
• Sign-up new clients and set installation dates for new services
• Resolve customer complaints
• Troubleshoot technical/equipment issues

What We Offer:
• $10-13/HR + Bonuses
• Weekly Pay
• Weekly Bonuses & Incentives
• Paid Training
• Leadership Training

No experience? No problem. We provide FULL PAID TRAINING!!

If you feel you may be an exceptional asset to our team, apply today!

Disclosure: Opus, Inc. does not partake in any type of door-to-door sales, business to business, or telemarketing. All positions are guaranteed hourly pay and we do not work purely off commission.
Company Description
Who is Opus?

We are a collective of innovative minds who are always looking to be on top of market changes. We use research-based, experiential marketing to create brand-awareness, consumer loyalty, as well as produce customized campaigns that boost acquisitions, while our clients focus on their core expertise.

Our Vision:

Our goal and vision is to elicit return business for our clients, growth for our company, and professional advancement for our team by embracing the creativity and teamwork necessary to help clients branch out into new markets.

All of this is possible with Opus due to the development of expert marketing managers who are efficient with clients and consumer acquisitions, and who build long-lasting relationships, which result in growth for our clients.

Opus is an in-store marketing company that represents leaders in home entertainment, inside some of the largest retailers in the world.

Likewise, we are passionate about delivering quality and results, for both our customers and clients.

We value teamwork within our agency and strive for great partnerships across all platforms.
