Description

Purpose/Scope of the position: Part-time Brand Ambassadors (avg of 6-12 hrs per week) needed to support brand marketing and local promotional events.

Education/Skills: High School diploma. Hospitality or brand ambassador experience a plus. Candidates must be organized, able to multi-task, and comfortable interacting with people. Must be able work without direct supervision, while appropriately representing our brand's image.

Appearance/Personality: Professional, energetic, fun loving, strong interpersonal & communication skills. Must have an outgoing personality and enjoy interacting with people.

Compensation: $12.00/hr

Duties (include but not limited to):
As a brand ambassador your responsibilities will include:

•Representing the brand at local promotional events.
•Interacting with customers in a fun and engaging manner.
•Event setup/breakdown.
•Assist with customer contests as needed.
•Help with giveaways/swag inventory.

Working Hours and Days: Part-time. Event hours will vary. Will require night and weekend hours.

Requirements

•Must be 18 years of age or older
•Must have reliable transportation to get to event.
•Minimum of 1-year hospitality experience preferred.

At Danone, we believe that every time we eat or drink, we vote for the world we want. As a leading food and beverage company, we make healthy, sustainably-produced foods and beverages that nourish people’s lives. Some of our brands include Dannon, Activia, Horizon Organic, International Delight, Silk, Oikos, So Delicious Dairy Free, Stok, Two Good, Vega, and Wallaby Organic. And as the largest Certified B Corporation® in the world, we are committed to redefining success in business to ensure that through our brands we create real benefits for people, our communities, and the planet.

With headquarters in Broomfield, CO and White Plains, NY, Danone North America has more than 6,000 employees across the U.S. and Canada, and more than a dozen manufacturing facilities across North America. Our employees enjoy competitive pay and industry-leading benefits (including flexible (unlimited) time off and up to 26 weeks paid parental leave), and share a common mission and culture committed to both business results and social purpose. When you join Danone North America, you become part of a global team that is inspiring a healthier world through food.

The US Probiotic Portfolio is a $400MM+ retail business, including Activia, and DanActive, and future innovations. This role sits at the intersection of Strategy and Execution. More specifically, the Brand Manager Activation works in close partnership with the Brand's Equity and Innovation leads and Shopper Marketing teams in defining the brands' activation plans, working to execute best in class plans. The Brand Manager leads and oversees key drivers of the business - from projects (innovations, graphics design), to tracking of business performance on the brand (sales performance tracking and reporting), to shopper marketing campaigns (creative development for shopper and consumer creative), all while optimizing the brand's spend (budget management).

Objectives of the role

• Serving as a key member of the brand team, driving the base business for both Activia and DanActive, and acting as a trusted partner in the broader marketing team

• Serving as the "hub of the spoke" with management of key brand and cross-functional team meetings

• Acting as the voice of the business and ensuring a laser-like focus on results and opportunities to improve them - at customer and SKU level.

• Leading the development and execution of marketing programs including product development, packaging and promotions.

• Developing consumer promotion and shopper marketing tactics with partner agencies and shopper marketing teams.

• Leading cross-functional teams to bring projects from concept to fruition (innovation and programming).

• Leading agency partners in the creative development of promotions, shopper marketing, packaging and communication projects.

• Responsible for tracking and producing reports for key performance metrics.

• Analyzing and synthesizing consumer and customer data, including brand forecasting and demand planning.

• Building effective relationships with key internal and external partners.

• Coaching and developing junior members of the team, growing their marketing skillset and cross-functional relationships.

Targeted Profile:

• Above all, the ability to think like a business owner: someone who can take initiative and get things done while having fun in an entrepreneurial environment
• Strong management and coaching skills: we are always looking to develop our teams and are looking for someone who relishes in helping grow a team
• Analytic horsepower with a relentless orientation on the results, and the capacity to respond quickly to changing marketplace dynamics
• Strong influencing skills: working well with others and leading in a cross functional environment
• Business acumen, with a knack for turning data into insights and recommendations (high level of expertise with Excel)
• Strong communication skills (verbal and written - including proficiency in PowerPoint).
• Budget management experience
• An MBA in marketing (or similar concentration), but we are open to candidates with Bachelor degree in Business or related field
• At least 3-4 years related work experience

Danone North America is a Certified B Corporation business unit of Danone and operates in the U.S. from headquarter offices in White Plains, NY and Broomfield, CO. For more information, please visit DanoneNorthAmerica.com.

Danone North America is an equal employment and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, genetic characteristic or any other unlawful criterion.

Nearest Secondary Market: New York City
Job Segment:
Brand Manager, Branding, Equity, Marketing Manager, Manager, Marketing, Finance, Management

Job Description
As a Brand Ambassador, your primary duties are to promote our client's products and services to current and prospective customers. A detailed knowledge of the brand and suite of services is crucial, along with an understanding of our client's objectives for their brand. Brand Ambassadors work closely with the sales department and will help with hitting monthly, quarterly or annual sales goals.

-Required Skills-

Brand Ambassadors must be highly proactive and able to multitask in a fast-paced environment, often with little to no supervision. You must recall product information, be comfortable dealing with sizable groups of people in public forums, have well-honed social skills and strong listening ability. You should also be extremely organized and feel comfortable in a position with significant responsibility.
Company Description
Savannah's newest and fastest growing firm is THE Marketing Team! TMT partners with Fortune 500 clients in an aim to assist their direct marketing strategies, specifically using the high volume retail sector. We believe in providing a quality experience to our customer AND providing growth opportunity to our associates based on their performance. Our people are our greatest asset -- this is why our Work Hard Play Hard culture creates an environment that is as fun & energetic as it is competitive & challenging. Our goal is to coach, develop, and promote our associates into upper level management roles that will allow The Marketing Team to expand nationally at the hands of top-performing and deserving leaders. Join us now!

Renewal by Andersen of Houston is the go-to company for new windows in Houston and the surrounding areas, thanks to a strong dedication to local homeowners. We too own homes in the Houston area and understand the challenges of maintaining a beautiful, comfortable home. That is why we aligned ourselves with the national Renewal by Andersen brand. Andersen products and patents have revolutionized the window and door industry for more than 100 years, changing the home construction industry, how homes are designed, and even how we live our lives.

Requirements:

Are you energetic? Outgoing? Persuasive? Money driven? Wanting to be challenged? Longing to be part of a team? Wishing to join a company you can grow with? We have what youre looking, Renewal by Andersen of Houston is the place for you!

Must be able to work these hours:

Monday thru Thursday 3:00 PM to 8:00 PM

Saturday 9:00 AM to 3:00 PM

Job Description:

Were looking for enthusiastic and confident individuals to join our neighborhood marketing team. If you possess a competitive team spirit, a sense of humor, and wish to pursue a sales and marketing career, we want you on our team. As a Canvassing Brand Ambassador, youll use your skills to help generate leads and drive brand awareness by going out into the field, talking with homeowners about our windows and doors and setting up appointments for our Design Specialists.

Our Canvassing Brand Ambassadors are the backbone of our company. Thats why were looking for the best of the best. You will not be thrown to the wolves either! After all, your success is our goal!

You will be provided lots of training! You will be rewarded for your hard work and efforts (excellent hourly wage PLUS BONUSES)!

Youre in the driver seat! The road to success starts with you! You determine your worth!

Job Responsibilities:
Learn and deliver a qualifying lead presentation to prospective homeowners
Canvass assigned target-market areas
Provide nightly reporting of leads/appointments
Partner with the Team Leader to ensure goals are met

Overview


Talentline has partnered with Samsung Electronics America to hire tech-savvy Sales Brand Ambassadors. This part-time temporary role will ultimately be responsible for increasing sales and brand awareness by creating dynamic, informative, and hands-on experiences with prospective consumers at high traffic retail locations.

Day-in-the-Life as a Samsung Sales Brand Ambassador:
Work at assigned wireless retail stores.
Approach customers and learn their needs.
Assist in selling Samsung devices.
Be the onsite subject matter expert.
Make a positive impact on sales.

Work 20 hours per week for 16 weeks.
Get paid weekly.
Bonus opportunity paid at completion of 16 week program.
Company provided phone, tablet, and event kit.
Typical schedule depends on retail store.

Days: Monday or Thursday, Friday, Saturday

Job Title: Associate Brand Manager, International, Marc Jacobs Beauty
Job Description:
ABOUT KENDO

Kendo Holdings, Inc. is a San Francisco-based beauty brand developer and wholesaler owned by LVMH Moët Hennessy - Louis Vuitton, the world's largest luxury group. A play on the words can do, Kendo has become the hub of creativity and next generation beauty product development for global Sephora channels and selective retailers outside of Sephora.

Through original development, collaborations and acquisitions the Kendo stable of brands will always be creative, inspiring and innovative. A dynamic engine of speed, expertise and market-savvy, the Kendo team continues to redefine the beauty industry through great product, great storytelling, great retail and direct-to-consumer partnerships. This shows up in everything we do and in what we stand for:
ENTREPRENEURIAL SPIRIT: We seek creative ways to get things done
PERSEVERANCE: We are moved by Winston Churchill's words, never, never, never give up'
GENEROSITY: The power of giving
STORYTELLING: Creating authentic stories to inspire
QUALITY OBSESSION: Our product quality is a reflection of ourselves
FUN: Work, life, and fun are woven of a single fabric
The Kendo house of brands currently includes: Bite, KVD Vegan Beauty, Marc Jacobs Beauty, Ole Henriksen and Fenty Beauty.

POSITION SUMMARY

The Associate Brand Manager, International, Marc Jacobs Beauty drives the day- to-day International business together with regional Kendo offices in Paris, London, Dubai and Singapore in order to bring the Global Brand vision to life. This role serves as the brand liaison for internal cross-functional and international teams, owning key communications and updates around all areas of brand management. The Associate Brand Manager will manage sales and business updates, product assortment, pricing, activation and launch strategy, visual merchandising and education initiatives.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Brand Strategy and Management
Assist in localizing global brand strategies together with international brand teams, while working with a multitude of cross-functional partners to successfully execute
Establish and maintain effective relationships with internal teams including NA brand management, channel planning, supply planning, marketing, education, creative, global product and operations
Maintain updates and share out of key business documents including global launch calendar, international deadlines, discontinued items list, price lists, product presentations etc.
Connect dots between global product updates and international regions, circulating updates and impacts to relevant cross functional teams in a timely manner
Presentation preparation as well as on-going support for management meetings
New market launch and distribution expansion projects
Product Assortment & Visual Merchandising
Responsible for managing the brand assortment globally and communicating changes to appropriate business partners; includes new launches, pipe changes and discontinued items
Support in setting global pricing in line with margin targets, plus managing updates of key pricing documents
Work closely with global visual merchandising and international teams to execute seasonal merchandising updates
Work with global product team to ensure product briefs are updated with international distribution and ensuring cross-functional teams are aware of international requirements and nuances per new product launch
Reporting & Research
Provide monthly executive sales recaps, key initiatives performance and ad-hoc reporting and analysis as needed
Research global competitive and product benchmark in order to identify product opportunities and trends and make recommendations to drive the business
Make recommendations based on research and sales trends
Asset Management
Co-lead comps, gratis and sampling management for international regions, including budget tracking
Briefing in creative asset requirements for all product launches inclusive of education materials, dot com assets, in-store animation, photography, videos etc.
Global asset drive, updating and share out


REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's degree required
4+ years of related business experience, Beauty or Retail industry preferred
Previous experience in Brand Management, Merchandising, Buying or Marketing required, Prestige Cosmetics a plus
Must demonstrate strong strategic, creative, interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills
Thrives on an environment that is fast-paced, rapidly changing, and customer service-oriented
Detail-oriented with ability to handle multiple priorities and work within matrixed organization
Able to handle multiple priorities
Highest levels of professionalism at all times, calm under pressure
Team player
Project management expertise and experience a plus
PowerPoint and excel skills

ENGINE SHOP IS NOT YOUR TYPICAL AGENCY.

We are looking for great people who are passionate about what they do. People who understand the value of hard work, are willing to get their hands dirty and enjoy the process as much as the result. People who love working on a team. People with a make it happen and get it done attitude. People who, no matter what the level, are thinkers and leaders. No two gears are the same but they all fit together to make an unstoppable machine here at Engine Shop.

In return, our promise to you is what we'll work tirelessly to create opportunities for your professional and personal development while communicating with transparency about the company you've chosen to work for.

Our people are why Engine Shop has been consistently named a "Best Place To Work" by Ad Age and Event Marketer.

WHAT'S YOUR STORY

We are looking for a Head of Entertainment to lead our existing area of business, develop new growth strategies and work cross-functionally throughout the organization as a subject matter expert in the field. Tactical areas of business responsibilities will include television and film product placement/integrations/promotions, original branded content and celebrity spokespersons/ambassadors.

The candidate must have a proven track record developing brand led entertainment marketing campaigns, leading teams and driving new business. Additional qualifications include:
Deep understanding of brands, and experience working with them to leverage entertainment to engage audiences
Specific experience developing talent led campaigns outside of existing entertainment properties
Oversee film, television and OTT partnerships for the agency, from inception through launch
Serve as an entertainment marketing liaison with experience in client relations, brand strategy, product placement, branded integration, cross-promotions, project management, and production resources
Seasoned in strategizing and executing high impact entertainment initiatives that drive awareness and reinforce brand identity and creative vision
Strategically pitch, promote and execute the use of our clients' products and brands into pop culture, but most notably through targeted films, television shows and digital series
Capacity to develop original branded content in support of client objectives and strategies that will generate reach and engagement
Negotiate scope, timeline, budget and program costs in a high-level manner to reach agreement with client
Maintain ongoing education and understanding of clients' marketing goals and initiatives
Extensive knowledge and upkeep with industry trends/opportunities and clients' competitors
Client management and account communication with teams, including integrated agency partners, with a focus on clear communication (business writing, creative writing and presentation)
Lead a multi-functional team from pitching new projects to the client, conception, planning, onsite execution, and post campaign/activation/event recap
Strong network of entertainment industry contacts that can open doors and allow for continuous growth and development
Perform as a career manager/leader and provide direction for continual staff growth and development
Identify areas to streamline processes, innovate and share knowledge internally for improvement
Ability to maintain and grow internal and external client relationships at all levels of the organization and deal with a wide range of individuals
Identify new business opportunities from both inside and outside the agency
Leverage existing relationships with brands to build a robust and sustainable slate of business
Work and collaborate with the business development team on entertainment bids during the pitch process/stage within potential RFPs


REQUIREMENTS
15+ years of relevant experience, including time on the agency side
Extensive relationships throughout the Hollywood executive community including but not limited to studios, production companies, OTT platforms and talent agencies
Relationships with brand decision makers activating within entertainment or interested in doing so
Strong presentation skills
Strong desire to network and drive agency relevance throughout the industry
Willingness to travel with flexible schedule to be available for clients, meetings, etc.
Experience working on large scale programs / clients with integrated agency partners
Sales and marketing experience with emphasis in strategic planning and implementation
Extensive network and relationships with brands, agencies and distribution channels
Proven track record of delivering revenue growth by securing new clients for the business and driving new branded content programs
Strategic and creative thinker capable of crafting emotional and powerful stories
Ability to solve strategic business challenges with creative solutions, in collaboration with our clients
Experience in campaign development and working with brands and agencies
Proactive thinker/self-starter and entrepreneurial spirit who is organized, energetic, detail-oriented and eager to work on a small team with strong people skills
Professionalism, sound judgment and well-developed interpersonal skills
Discretion and attention to detail is of utmost importance
Ability to troubleshoot and switch gears in real time
Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and successfully manage multiple assignments concurrently for long and short term projects
Ability to accept feedback with professionalism and make proper adjustments to work accordingly
COMPENSATION/BENEFITS
Competitive compensation package including base salary and company bonus plan
Medical and dental benefits
401K + company match
Flex vacation policy
WHAT'S OUR STORY

Engine Shop is a global sports and entertainment marketing agency built for the modern era of engagement. We specialize in connecting our clients with their audiences through the passion points of sports, music, film, television, gaming and arts and culture. Through live experiences, content and branded entertainment, we create meaningful engagements that drive our clients' business objectives.

But that's not our only focus. Our culture is a consideration in everything we do; from our casual work environments to our creative benefits and our acclaimed annual retreat. It's a part of how we treat one another, how we have each other's backs and how we welcome people who are different.

Engine Shop knows work must fit in to life and life into work.

Job Title: Work for Best & Brightest Company - Brand Ambassador

Job Description
Full Time or Part Time / Vacation and Sick Time Off / Competitive Hourly Pay / Company Paid Travel Opportunities / Career Advancement

WORK FOR A NATIONAL 101 BEST AND BRIGHTEST COMPANY TO WORK FOR WINNER!!!!!

JW's team is made upon confident, exciting, and motivated individuals. As a growing company, we offer a great range of individual benefits for our Brand Ambassadors. Job Title: Presale Brand Ambassador in Boulder, CO
Job Description:
Job Summary:

As a brand ambassador, a Personal Trainer represents Crunch Franchise to members and clients by delivering a positive fitness experience and quality personal training sessions leading to member retention and client acquisition and retention.

Responsible for:

Upholding the Crunch Franchise core values of T.R.A.I.N.: Timely, Ready, Attentive, Inspiring, Noble.

Make reaching fitness goals achievable by assisting members and clients with education and guidance on comprehensive fitness programs including resistance and cardio-respiratory training, general nutritional guidelines, and nutritional product recommendations.

Meeting/exceeding minimum monthly company expectations including session service targets resulting in Personal Training revenue, supplement/nutritional product sales, and contributing to club success.

Training exclusively for Crunch Franchise. As a Crunch Franchise team member, it is a violation of our conflict of interest policy to conduct personal training sessions or perform any person training-related duties independently or at any company outside of Crunch Franchise. This includes working as an employee or independent contractor for another health club, personal training studio or private residence, or engaging in any other activities that represent a conflict of interest for Crunch Franchise.

Organizational Relationship:

Reports to the Personal Training Manager, Assistant Personal Trainer if applicable, Franchise partner or General Manager depending on club and market. This position does not have any direct reports.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

The Personal Trainer is responsible for performing the following activities for the club:

Service and Train Clients [70% of time]

Create an outstanding initial personal training experience for introductory package clients

Prepare and deliver comprehensive fitness programs based on clients' goals that include appropriate exercise selection, nutritional programming and teaching a fitness lifestyle

Inform clients of the fitness tools available to assist them in achieving their goals

Set expectations and hold clients accountable to their comprehensive fitness programs through goal setting, follow up discussions, and tracking progress

Demonstrate safe and proper exercise technique to clients

Service Members [20% of time]

Instruct members on proper use of club equipment and exercise techniques

Assist, at the club management's request, in any member service activities (e.g., fitness seminars, boot camps, body fat tables, supplement/nutritional product demos etc.)

Understand all aspects and benefits of the CAMP CRUNCH Orientation and deliver a positive fitness experience to members and guests

Help with racking weights and assisting in maintaining a neat, organized and clean club

Additional/Misc. [10% of time]

Design comprehensive fitness programs using company-provided tools (dotFIT)

Schedule all personal training sessions, other appointments, and administration time using company systems (ABC/Datatrak)

Trainer Business Plan execution

Execute other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:

Education Level:

High School Diploma or GED required

Bachelor's Degree preferred

Current Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR)

Certifications: (One or more of the following certifications)

American College of Sports Medicine (ACSM)

Certified Personal Trainer

Health Fitness Specialist

American Council on Exercise (ACE)

Personal Trainer Certification

The Cooper Institute

Personal Trainer Certification

International Fitness Professionals Association (IFPA)

Personal Trainer Certification

National Academy of Sports Medicine (NASM)

Certified Personal Trainer

Corrective Exercise Specialist (CES)

Performance Enhancement Specialist (PES)

National Exercise and Sports Trainers Association (NESTA)

Personal Fitness Trainer Certification

National Federation of Professional Trainers (NFPT)

Personal Trainer Certification

National Strength and Conditioning Association (NSCA)

Certified Personal Trainer

Certified Strength and Conditional Specialist (CSCS)

Experience:

Personal Training experience preferred but not required.

Physical Requirements:

Must be able to lift 50 lbs.

Physical effort required for daily duties include lifting weights, squatting, bending, reaching, spotting, and prolonged standing and walking.

Work Environment:

While performing the duties of this job the team member is regularly exposed to moving mechanical parts.

Extended workdays are a frequent occurrence, as are weekends & holidays as needed to support the business.

As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.Our Mission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!Who you are:* Outgoing and excited to meet new people* Positive, charismatic and engaging* Obsessed with fashion and trends* Fantastic sense of style* Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual styleWhat you'll do:* Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience* Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy* Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice* Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits* Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store* Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed* Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other* Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountabilityWhat you'll need:* Outgoing personality* Love of fashion* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task* Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)* Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance* Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)Where you come from:* You are at least 16 years of age* Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store ManagerSPARC Group LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We value a culture of inclusion and diversity within our workforce, and are committed to maintaining a workplace free from prohibited employment conduct, including discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, religion, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, domestic partner status, civil partnership, status as a covered veteran, status in the Uniformed Services of the United States, citizenship and any other characteristic protected by law ("Protected Characteristics").

Marketing Associate & Brand Ambassador :

=============================

Drive Outside Catering Sales and Promote Local Restaurant Marketing, Coordinate the implementation of all Catering Procedures and Bookings. Must have excellent communication skills/public relations, Must have excellent organizational and service skills, Basic computer knowledge required,
Catering and/or restaurant operations experience is a plus but not required.

Its an entry level position. Must have a vehicle and drivers license. Typical working Hours will be from 8am to 6pm (Mon thru Sun)
Pie Five-Fuzzy's-Dickey's is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of that franchise. All inquiries about employment at this franchise should be made directly to the franchisee, and not to Pie Five Corporate.

Pie Five-Fuzzy's-Dickey's

Pie Five Pizza is a trend-setting, fast-casual concept offering individual handcrafted pizzas with fresh ingredients made-to-order and prepared in less than five minutes.

Since opening our first location in Fort Worth, TX in 2011, Pie Five has grown to 85 locations in 22 states and the District of Columbia and has more than 400 announced franchised and company units under contract.

People in the know keep telling us how cool we are. For example, Pie Five has been named a 2013 Top 50 Restaurant Brand of the Year, a 2012 Hot Concepts winner by Nation’s Restaurant News and was one of the top 100 Movers & Shakers for 3 straight years by Fast Casual. If that’s not enough, Pie Five was also one of “10 Hot New Restaurant Chains from Established Brands” by Forbes.com. Wow!

What’s even cooler is that everywhere we go, pizza lovers gravitate to us. And once they try us, they become instant fans. Then they tell their friends, and the next thing you know, everything you ever thought about the pizza dining experience has changed. For the better.

PIE FIVE IS ALWAYS ON THE LOOKOUT FOR HARD WORKERS WITH A GOOD ATTITUDE AND LOTS OF ENERGY. CURRENTLY, APPLICATIONS ARE BEING ACCEPTED FOR ALL LOCATIONS. FILL ONE OUT AND YOU MAY BE ON YOUR WAY TO A FULFILLING CAREER WITH PIE FIVE.

Businesses are experiencing a tremendous shift in the expectations and complexities when it comes to brand purpose and overall reputation management. While much of it is driven by the current social and political environment, it is equally driven by the ever expanding and powerful voice of the employee.
Couple that with a customer population that is more socially conscious than ever, and you have an ever-evolving landscape to manage. It is no longer acceptable for Brands to simply sell their goods and services. They are required to take a stand on issues that are important to their business/people, advocate for policy change at the local, federal and global level and roll up their sleeves to drive real change through impactful programs and funding.
And if you are not, as a Brand, communicating out about your company’s position, then you are considered to be doing nothing. There is an expectation that you will not only participate, but you will be transparent, active and engage in a public dialog. This presents both challenges for brands AND opportunities. We see the opportunity in helping companies successfully navigate both. We believe companies need to both ADVANCE and DEFEND their brands through Brand Purpose and Reputation programs and campaigns that articulate not only their mission- but their Purpose.
We see the critical components that sit at the center of Brand Purpose & Reputation as Executive Communications, Employee Engagement, Financial Communications, Crisis Communications, Public Affairs and Purpose.
Our goal is to create a compelling offering around Brand Purpose and Reputation for our current and prospective clients. To do this, we need to build out our go forward approach and a team that can scale the needs brands have today in the current climate. The work we do today in the disciplines that make this up (CEO Comms, Crisis, Employee Engagement, PA, Finance, Purpose) is strong. That said, we are limited geographically and we have the opportunity to expand our bench of experts.
We are looking for a leader to:
Be a client counselor on navigating the complex dynamics facing brands today (how to put purpose at the center of a brand story; how to activate your approach in substantive ways, etc.)
Devise a Brand Purpose and Reputation go to market approach (positioning, up level awareness of our capabilities, reach new client prospects, etc.)
Experience and understanding of digital and social strategies, in particular in areas of issues and crisis management
Expand our footprint through smart partner strategies and strengthening our offering in key markets in the US (SF & NY) and Globally
Grow our team of experts

Agency and Team Leadership
Envision and build WE's Brand Purpose and Reputation business – from the development of a 3-year strategy plan, to the build-out of the collective services, team/skillsets and growth paths (partnerships, acquisitions, etc.).
Collaborate and partner with global WE business leads to expand offerings globally.
Act as an ambassador for the agency in public forums and networking opportunities to increase awareness of our capabilities and raise our profile in the brand purpose and reputation space.
Maintain an active industry presence and stay current on market position, competitive set and future of communications.
Develop a differentiated and relevant point-of-view – about communications and technology trends – that aligns to our brand and resonates globally. Effectively communicate our perspective with our global teams, clients and the industry through owned and earned channels.
Cultivate relationships with range of influencers, from media, developers and analysts to enthusiasts, in order to develop a strong understanding of the landscape and a unique point-of-view regarding how clients can best engage these audiences.
Client and Business Management
Act as a key advisor to senior clients on key issues impacting their company, their employees, customers and shareholders.
Foster on-going, valuable relationships with influencers, serving as a critical connection between thought leaders, advocacy groups and client stakeholders.
Demonstrate deep understanding of a range of societal and public policy issues effecting Fortune 500 brands, particularly in WE’s chosen sectors of Technology, Consumer and Healthcare.
Infuse a data-driven approach to strategic communications planning and messaging to enable clients to act swiftly in dynamic environments.
Advise on strategic communications proposals to advance and defend a client’s brand identity, improve corporate reputation, broaden awareness of its programs and commitments, and tell a cohesive global story across multiple audiences.
Business acumen – capable of growing and managing a well-run client portfolio.
Provide highest level strategic counsel/input. Architect the communications vision in partnership with clients; drive strategy and oversee business plan execution and delivery of measurable results. Ideate, develop, drive and create communications plans that achieve client and agency goals.
Ensure high quality work is being delivered across all client business. Deliver great work for clients that exceeds their business goals, is creative and makes positive business impacts for the clients and agency.
Actively involved in all aspects of P&L ownership including account profitability, account health, client service and billing, and team success.
Other duties as assigned.

Bachelor’s degree in Communications, Public Relations, Public Policy or similar applicable field is preferred
At least 15 to 20 years of experience in Public Relations/Public Affairs – in an agency and/or corporate environment.
Deep understanding of wide range of communications channels, tools and vehicles spanning paid, owned and earned platforms, including social platforms.
A sense of urgency, the ability to deal with ambiguous situations, a strategic view but also willing to roll up your sleeves and dig in to the work to drive impact.
Highly collaborative, diplomatic, ability to influence others, persuasive approach.
Experience working globally or with colleagues in multiple locations.
Ability to travel frequently; around 40%.
Significant success in leading and inspiring other senior leaders and cultivating and retaining large, cross-functional teams.

Equal Opportunity: WE provides equal employment opportunity and does not discriminate against an employee or applicant because of age, race, color, religion, gender, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, or other legally protected class status.
Diversity and Inclusion: WE values a diverse and inclusive workforce and is committed to creating a workplace where everyone thrives. We promote an atmosphere in which diversity of people and ideas are welcomed and valued. Diversity includes differences in race, religion, gender, age, lifestyle, ethnic background and sexual orientation as well as differences in experiences and ideas.

WOULD YOU LIKE TO HELP TURN ONE OF THE FASTEST GROWING AND MOST DISRUPTIVE WINE BRANDS INTO A TRUE ICON OF THE BEVERAGE BUSINESS?

DEUTSCH FAMILY WINE& SPIRITS IN STAMFORD, CT IS CURRENTLY SEEKING AN ASSOCIATE BRAND MANAGER TO WORK ON ITS INDUSTRY LEADING JOSH CELLARS WINE BRAND.

A BRAND DISRUPTING AN INDUSTRY

The 2015 Wine Brand of the Year per Market watch magazine, Josh Cellars has seen tremendous growth and has become the largest wine brand over $10 a bottle in the world.

Josh was the single largest contributor to total wine sales from 2016-2019, and the brand’s growth trajectory isn’t slowing. Josh is achieving industry leading gains in household penetration and consumer meaning and uniqueness each year. The brand is unique as it is one of the few premium brands that holds leadership positions both in volume share and volume growth across all major wine varietals, from its #1 selling 1.5 million case premium Cabernet Sauvignon to its #1 domestic Rosé over $10.

A BRAND WITH ICONIC POTENTIAL

In a category where packaging is the key consumer touch point, Josh Cellars’ scripted text logo and its antique parchment label design is simple and elegant, making the brand look much more premium than its shelf price of $10-$15.

The liquid also consistently overdelivers in terms of quality. Josh Cellars wines deliver rich and expressive flavors but remain accessible to more novice wine drinkers. Not only does the brand look like a more premium wine, it tastes like one as well. In 2019 alone, the brand’s base wines have received three 90-point scores from leading Wine publications.

The brand also features an authentic and inspiring founder’s story, rooted in gratitude, community and classic American values, and leverages an engaging and authentic brand founder to connect in deeper, more personal ways with consumers.

A BRAND WITH A THOUGHT LEADING APPROACH TO MARKETING

Josh Cellars’ approach to marketing has resulted in the brand delivering the most creatively effective and intelligently deployed marketing in the wine industry. From the top-testing advertising campaign in wine to the first wine brand to ever sell and sample in a Grand Central Station pop up experience; Josh Cellars is proving itself to be a brand with a consumer-centric and innovative approach to driving brand meaning.

THE ROLE

Reporting to the Brand Manager on Josh, The Associate Brand Manager (ABM) will play a critical support role in developing strategic brand plans and executing all marketing programs in place as part of the Brand Team. The ABM will be responsible for supporting the Brand Manager in the planning and execution of the brand’s multi-million-dollar advertising spend, working collaboratively with the media buying/planning agency and the marketing mix modeling agency to ensure brand dollars are deployed in the most efficient and effective way possible.

This role will also support the Brand Manager in the development of new comms for the brand, including short and long-form advertising deployed across digital paid media platforms, monthly business reporting, and development of a strategic innovation pipeline for growth.

Qualifications:

·BS/BA degree, preferably in Marketing or Communications; MBA preferred

·Minimum 2+ years marketing /industry experience

·Strong analytical skills are a must

·Strong ability to hold themselves and others to the highest standards of quality in creation and execution of marketing activity

·Able to operate with significant autonomy and influence with functions and entities that work closely with the all levels of the organization and the distributor network

·Excellent command presence as well as polished active listening skills

·Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including strong presentation skills

·Ability to function effectively in a fast-paced, multi-faceted business environment

·Strong strategic and decision-making skills

·Ability to take initiative, develop and seek out creative and innovative ideas

·Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively interface at all levels within the organization and outside the company

·Understanding of financial P&L and budget management

·Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including strong presentation skills

·High level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint

Responsibilities:

·Contribute to development and execution of the Josh Cellars strategic and annual marketing plans which address all aspects of the marketing mix including forecasting, budget setting and management, development of pricing strategy, packaging changes, advertising and media promotion and new product development

·Help manage media buying/planning, creative and innovation agency and internal creative/marketing services department through plan development and respective activity execution in the marketplace

·Analyze Josh Cellars sales data, activity evaluations and brand research sources to derive key actionable business insights in support of annual brand planning and monthly performance reporting

·Handle consumer inquiries, requests and complaints received on-line including management of social agency in answering queries from social media fans

·Support the Brand Manager on data collection for the annual marketing mix analysis

·Help manage Josh brand budget, including coding and entering invoices

Job Title: Brand Manager, NA - KVD Vegan Beauty
Job Description:
ABOUT KENDO

Kendo Holdings, Inc. is a San Francisco-based beauty brand developer and wholesaler owned by LVMH Moët Hennessy - Louis Vuitton, the world's largest luxury group. A play on the words can do, Kendo has become the hub of creativity and next generation beauty product development for global Sephora channels and selective retailers outside of Sephora.

Through original development, collaborations and acquisitions the Kendo stable of brands will always be creative, inspiring and innovative. A dynamic engine of speed, expertise and market-savvy, the Kendo team continues to redefine the beauty industry through great product, great storytelling, great retail and direct-to-consumer partnerships. This shows up in everything we do and in what we stand for:
ENTREPRENEURIAL SPIRIT: We seek creative ways to get things done
PERSEVERANCE: We are moved by Winston Churchill's words, never, never, never give up'
GENEROSITY: The power of giving
STORYTELLING: Creating authentic stories to inspire
QUALITY OBSESSION: Our product quality is a reflection of ourselves
FUN: Work, life, and fun are woven of a single fabric
The Kendo house of brands currently includes: Bite, KVD Vegan Beauty, Marc Jacobs Beauty, Ole Henriksen and Fenty Beauty.

POSITION SUMMARY

The Brand Manager will be responsible in further establishing the North America business for Kendo. This role requires strong channel management, leadership, and communication skills to bring to life KVD Vegan Beauty in the market. The Brand Manager will oversee NA channel strategy, including sales and assortment analyses, and will make recommendations to drive the business further. This role will report to the Senior Brand Manager of North America.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Brand Strategy & Channel Management
Identify short and long-term NA brand strategies to deliver growth in both core products and innovation, while working with a multitude of cross-functional partners to successfully execute
Establish and maintain effective cross-functional relationships with both internal (global brand, inventory planning, marketing, education, creative, and operations) and external partners
Maintain updates and share out of key business documents including product newness, discontinued items, promotional calendars, etc.
Partner with Planning and Global brand teams in the development of product launch forecasts
Assist in presentation preparation and on-going support for management meetings
Prepare, support and lead meetings with effective agendas and clear outcomes
Merchandising & Assortment Planning
Manage channel assortments to optimize sales and minimize inventory liability
Monitor and improve channel and owned product inventory
Lead visual merchandising to execute brand vision for the North America market. Ensure merchandising is optimized for sales performance and is on-budget
Asset Management
Manage channel sampling programs and ensure budget is on-track
Brief creative asset requirements for all product/channel needs, including in-store animation, dotcom assets, etc.
Reporting & Research
Provide monthly executive sales recaps, key initiatives and ad-hoc reporting and analysis, as needed
Research and be in-tuned with the beauty landscape to identify innovations and opportunities to drive the NA business
REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's degree required
5+ years of related business experience, color cosmetics experience preferred but not required
Previous exposure to the North America market and/or Merchandising, Buying, or Account Management experience a strong plus
Must demonstrate strong strategic, creative, interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills
Thrives in an environment that is fast-paced, rapidly changing, and customer service-oriented
Detailed-oriented with strong time management skills; able to handle multiple priorities and work within a matrixed organization
Highest levels of professionalism at all times; calm under pressure
Team player
Strong PowerPoint and Excel skills

Role of the Brand AmbassadorWe call our Aeropostale team members Brand Ambassadors because they promote the culture, values and mission of Aeropostale. If you are outgoing, friendly and have a passion for fashion, this is a perfect role for you. As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.Our Mission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!Who you are:* Outgoing and excited to meet new people* Positive, charismatic and engaging* Obsessed with fashion and trends* Fantastic sense of style* Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual styleWhat you'll do:* Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience* Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy* Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice* Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits* Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store* Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed* Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other* Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountabilityWhat you'll need:* Outgoing personality* Love of fashion* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task* Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)* Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance* Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)Where you come from:* You are at least 16 years of age* Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store ManagerSPARC Group LLC is an equal opportunity employer. As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.Our Mission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!Who you are:* Outgoing and excited to meet new people* Positive, charismatic and engaging* Obsessed with fashion and trends* Fantastic sense of style* Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual styleWhat you'll do:* Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience* Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy* Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice* Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits* Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store* Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed* Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other* Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountabilityWhat you'll need:* Outgoing personality* Love of fashion* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task* Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)* Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance* Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)Where you come from:* You are at least 16 years of age* Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store ManagerSPARC Group LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We value a culture of inclusion and diversity within our workforce, and are committed to maintaining a workplace free from prohibited employment conduct, including discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, religion, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, domestic partner status, civil partnership, status as a covered veteran, status in the Uniformed Services of the United States, citizenship and any other characteristic protected by law ("Protected Characteristics").

As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.Our Mission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!Who you are:* Outgoing and excited to meet new people* Positive, charismatic and engaging* Obsessed with fashion and trends* Fantastic sense of style* Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual styleWhat you'll do:* Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience* Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy* Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice* Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits* Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store* Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed* Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other* Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountabilityWhat you'll need:* Outgoing personality* Love of fashion* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task* Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)* Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance* Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)Where you come from:* You are at least 16 years of age* Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store ManagerAero OpCo LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We value a culture a culture of inclusion and diversity within our workforce, and are committed to maintaining a workplace free from prohibited employment conduct, including discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, religion, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, domestic partner status, civil partnership, status as a covered veteran, status in the Uniformed Services of the United States, citizenship and any other characteristic protected by law ("Protected Characteristics").

If you are outgoing, friendly and have a passion for fashion, this is a perfect role for you. As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.Our Mission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!Who you are:* Outgoing and excited to meet new people* Positive, charismatic and engaging* Obsessed with fashion and trends* Fantastic sense of style* Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual styleWhat you'll do:* Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience* Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy* Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice* Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits* Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store* Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed* Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other* Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountabilityWhat you'll need:* Outgoing personality* Love of fashion* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task* Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)* Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance* Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)Where you come from:* You are at least 16 years of age* Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store ManagerAero OpCo LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We value a culture a culture of inclusion and diversity within our workforce, and are committed to maintaining a workplace free from prohibited employment conduct, including discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, religion, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, domestic partner status, civil partnership, status as a covered veteran, status in the Uniformed Services of the United States, citizenship and any other characteristic protected by law ("Protected Characteristics").

Job Title: FT Brand Ambassador and Sales Representative- Weekly Pay
Job Description:
Job Description
Are you looking for more than just a job? Are you serious about starting a fantastic career path and work with a team that’s dedicated to helping you reach your goals?

Here at Pulse, we work together as a unit to help everyone achieve their personal and professional goals. We believe that when people enjoy what they do, they naturally perform at higher levels. We are here to train and develop the future leaders of tomorrow. We offer a top-notch training program in sales, marketing, management, and leadership development. We are not your standard 9 – 5ers. You will not find any cubicles in our office.

Why work with Pulse?
We are committed to our people – when you succeed, we succeed.
We deliver results and exceed expectations for our clients, unlike any other vendor.
Our company culture is one of a kind – fun, energetic and family-oriented
Our proven systems and new partnerships enable us to make strides to stay ahead of the competition.
We only promote from within - we offer rapid promotions for top performers.
Job Responsibilities for Brand Ambassador and Sales Representative:
Be the face of our clients by creating a long-lasting first impression
Meet and exceed sales goals and standards of performance
Provide a fun, full-service buying experience to customers
Stay up to date on the latest technology trends
Maintain store appearance and compliance
Walk customers through sales presentations
Address customer questions and maintain high customer retention quality
Requirements:

We believe the amount of success that someone achieves is directly proportional to the effort they put into it.
Prior sales, marketing, customer service, retail or experience working with the general public is preferred but not mandatory
Excellent interpersonal skills and customer service skills
Ability to follow our hands-on, in-house, and classroom training model to be successful
Apply today for immediate consideration.
Company Description
With aggressive growth, expansion plans, and ambitious goals, Pulse Marketing Group leads the south in strategic thinking and execution. We're looking for dedicated talent to join our motivated team. Comprised of problem solvers and strategic thinkers; we work united in the direction of common goals. At Pulse Marketing Group commitment to teamwork helps us to accomplish every goal set. If you're interested in joining an all-star team, please submit your resume. We are conducting interviews this week, so you will be contacted soon if you qualify. Local candidates only as we are looking to fill this position as quickly as possible. We require in-person Interviews.

Job Title: Brand Ambassador - Aeropostale Moreno Valley Mall

CUSTOMER SERVICE OR SALES EXPERIENCE WANTED!

ENTRY LEVEL Brand Ambassador

Please submit your resume by clicking the APPLY NOW button.

Kelly Global Consultants is currently hiring entry level individuals with a customer service & sales background for the Brand Ambassador position. We have found that candidates working in a retail, restaurant, hospitality, sales or customer service positions are very easy to train for our Brand Ambassador position. We specialize in areas of customer renewal, customer, and retention, and customer acquisition. This position involves one on one sales based interaction with customers.

Our sales and marketing firm is the leader in the industry and in tailoring customer service & sales to their needs. Our client wants us to deliver a face to face customer service experience. We do this by taking care of the existing customer base and providing personal care with new customers.

Representing the third largest telecommunication company in the world, it is a priority for our team to provide the best customer service, professionalism, and to build land and maintain quality customer relationship.

Due to expansion, we are willing to train highly motivated people for management and customer service & sales opportunities but you must be willing to work hard in an entry level customer service, sales, and marketing position. All openings are ideal for recent graduates, or professionals with customer service & sales experience looking for a career change because this is an entry-level position in a brand new industry.

Advancement and compensation are based on individual performance.

Company Description
Kelly Global Consultants is creating dynamic and innovative ways to market and promote our clients brand. By having exclusive contracts with our clients, we are able to find the solutions that they need to achieve success. We are redefining how companies market products and services to the corporate customer base, all while building a great company and cultivating superb talent.

Overview


Since 1848, Morton Salt has been improving lives and enhancing every day moments. We not only offer your favorite salts for the kitchen but have also created water-softening salts for your home, ice melt salts for your walkways, and chemical-free salts for your pool. Morton Salt also produces quality salts for a vast array of industries, from food manufacturing to pharmaceuticals.

We are widely recognized for our famous Morton Salt Girl, one of America’s most beloved icons. She has been the face of our brand for over a century and remains a symbol of trust for consumers and customers.

The Culinary portfolio includes Morton Salt’s iconic “Blue Round Can” in the US, Windsor Salt’s iconic “Rectangle” in Canada, and a full range of fast growing salts including Kosher and Sea Salt. Our Seasonings, featuring Season-All and Nature’s Seasons, are also a part of this segment. Given its broad household penetration, the Culinary portfolio also plays a lead role in the overall branding efforts for Morton and Windsor as a whole.

Position Purpose

The Senior Assistant Brand Manager is a general management role with P&L responsibility. This person has shared accountability for managing the short-term and long-term profitability of the Culinary business in the US and direct accountability in Canada.

Activities will include the following:

Leads the strategic marketing planning processes for the Canadian Culinary business and supports the process for the US, identifying and driving key initiatives to advance the businessLeads the research, development, positioning and commercialization of new products, line extensions, visual graphics, and enhanced product offerings across all channels for innovation projects close to the base businessIn collaboration with the communications team, the Senior Assistant Brand Manager will develop, execute, and measure the advertising and promotion strategy to drive sales and brand equity for the portfolio. Establish and report against key performance metrics, addressing any gaps to budget and future commitments.

Responsibilities


1. P&L Ownership

Directly accountable for the Canadian Culinary P&L and supports the management of the US P&LResponsible for managing against a business scorecard and reporting to the Executive Team issues and opportunities to improve performanceLeads a cross functional P&L Team to track, forecast, analyze and identify sources to improve P&L and business performance

2. Business Strategy & Execution

Responsible for establishing and gaining alignment from the Executive Team on strategies and plans to improve profitability and achieve desired business and market objectives in CanadaLeads key initiatives in the US to strengthen competitive position and drive category growth Aligns resources and leads the cross-functional team to execute against strategies and tacticsManages performance and works closely with cross-functional partners to overcome barriers in order to achieve desired business goalsUtilizes syndicated data, and competitive intelligence to assess market opportunities. Uses quantitative and qualitative research to vet new product ideas, packaging, pricing, and positioning strategies

3. Business Development

Closely monitors and identifies changes in market, customer and competitor trends with the potential for impacting current and future business performanceIdentifies market opportunities and risks, quantifies/estimates P&L impact, and justifies investments required to support future business growthImplements all assigned commercialization efforts to ensure the organization delivers against its growth commitments and portfolio expansion initiativesEstablishes and reports against key performance metrics, addressing any gaps to budget and future commitmentsProvides input with Supply Chain & Operations to incorporate market requirements into short and long-term capacity planning

4. Build and Protect Long-Term Brand Equity

Uses customer and consumer/end-user insights to drive business and brand activity, new products, strategies, and thought leadershipContributes to the development of clear brand vision, positioning, promise, goals and strategy Works with Communications and Sales Strategy & Planning teams to create communication vehicles and sales tools that convey brand value and justify selling price premium Measures performance and implements improvement measures to achieve desired customer and consumer experience

5. Innovation and Product Portfolio Management

Provides input to the Innovation team for the development and execution of product and packaging innovation plans to support portfolio growth. Responsible for go-to-market planning and execution for all types of innovation projects from “sustaining” to “transformational” innovationOversees all stages of sustaining innovation projects – from idea generation through commercializationManages the Canadian Culinary product portfolio, investment levels and associated consumer communications (in partnership with the Communication Team) in accordance with the portfolio strategy, stage in the product life cycle, and segment objectives

6. Pricing Strategy Development, Planning & Performance

Provides strategic direction and collaborates with the pricing team to develop and optimize pricing architectures, strategies and plans by product lines in the Canada Culinary category Integrates pricing strategies and plans into product strategies and plansPartners with Brand Finance and the Sales Strategy & Planning teams to forecast and track the impact of pricing actions with regards to overall business and financial performanceCollaborates with Sales Strategy & Planning and Sales teams to identify optimal trade promotions to delivery business results.

7. Budgeting & Forecasting

Participant in monthly integrated business planning meetings, providing key market drivers that will impact the forecast and ensuring new business opportunities and risks are incorporated into the demand planReviews baseline budget and financial forecast development and recommends adjustments to estimated sales volume and revenue attainment based on key growth initiatives, market growth rates, trends, opportunities and risks

Qualifications


Minimum Position Qualifications

Education: Bachelor’s degree required

Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience, with 2+ years in consumer marketing preferably in CPG

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Well-rounded business acumen with proven skills in marketing, business strategy, and general managementPassion for inspiring customers as well as external and internal partnersExperience successfully launching new products and managing the product life cycle a plusProven track record of success and demonstrated ability in leading cross functional teamsMust be enthusiastic, self-motivated and demonstrate excellent problem solving and decision-making skills.Proven ability to think and move between strategic and analytical thinking as well as actual executionExperience with Nielsen and/or IRI strongly preferredMust be well organized, able to work under time constraints and multi-task in a fast-paced environment, meeting deadlines as set by managerSAP experience a plus

Travel

Pilgrim’s is the second largest chicken producer in the world, with operations in the U.S., Puerto Rico, Mexico and the U.K. Pilgrim’s processes, prepares, packages and delivers fresh, further-processed and value-added poultry products for sale to customers in more than 100 countries, employs more than 50,000 people and contracts with more than 5,200 family farmers. Pilgrim’s is headquartered in beautiful Greeley, Colorado, at the JBS USA corporate office where our 1,200 employees enjoy more than 300 days of sunshine a year.

The Pilgrim’s Retail team is seeking an experienced Marketing Brand Manager for a role at our headquarters in Greeley, CO. The Brand Manager is responsible for managing and executing brand plans on products sold in Retail and Club Channels. Candidate must have brand/product management experience. Reporting to the Director of Brand Marketing, with a focus on a designated retail brands and categories, you will be our Marketing expert. Responsible for growing meaningful consumer brands through planning and executing consumer and customer promotions to drive brand awareness and generate demand.

Creating demand for our retail brands & products to drive profitable top-line sales
Identifying white-space growth opportunities
Developing sell-in decks for the Sales team to attain new distribution of our retail brands

Recommend annual retail brand marketing plans & calendar
Recommended budget, budget allocation, align BU’s and gain approval
Recommend and gain approval of marketing mix, tactics
Execute retail brand marketing tactics to deliver objectives, goals, strategies & plan
Invest & manage retail brand marketing budget - media, promotions, events
Manage agencies and suppliers to create business building advertising
Measure and report effectiveness of our retail brand marketing investment & impact of the “marketing levers” via monthly and annual business reviews
Measure Marketing ROI
Monitor in-market results ($, Volume, shipments)
Responsible for assessing the business environment, competitors, customers, market trends, and implications to the business and making recommendations.
Understand how key drivers are impacting business results
Report results, recommend actions and gain approval of actions, based on in-market results and key drivers to grow business / close gaps
Gather and analyze data to identify insights and translate into business initiatives and actionable tasks to improve business results.
Adjust marketing tactics to capture the opportunities and close gaps
Continuous improvement of day to day retail brand marketing and category activities.
Help junior team members develop in these areas.

Identify white space growth opportunities and develop plans to attain new distribution
Build retail brand success stories and sales presentations to facilitate distribution in new retail customers
Supports Sales on key meetings & presentations for customer sell-in process by creating critical sales sell-in presentations.
Build a strong contact network across Business Units, Innovation, Sales, and cross functional category teams

Bachelor's Degree required
7-9 years relevant CPG experience in Brand and/or Product Management and Innovation, including P&L management
Microsoft Office applications with advanced skills in PowerPoint, Excel and Word
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proven cross-functional leading and strategic influencing

Enthusiasm about the product
An outgoing personality

Punctuality
Strong project management, customer service and relationship building skills

Exceptionally detail-oriented and organized, ensuring quality and consistent output, ensuring accurate information for internal and external stakeholders
Ability to effectively solve problems, think creatively, make decisions and take action, exercising independent judgment
Ability to maintain a professional and positive attitude and work independently with little guidance
If you have these qualities, we want to meet you NOW!

Brand Ambassador (Event & Show Demonstrator)

With more than 25 years in business, Bath Planet is one of the fastest growing brands in the acrylic bath remodeling industry. We offer custom bath remodeling that enriches the lives of those we touch with bathrooms that are attractive, durable and maintenance-free.

We are seeking Brand Ambassadors/Event Demonstrators for our Marietta, Georgia markets and surrounding areas to join our winning team. Customer service experience is a plus, as you will be interacting with event attendees, discussing our product and securing sales leads for our team. Hourly pay + bonus based on quality appointments.

Essential Duties
Attract visitors and staff booth at shows and events
Promote product and provide basic product overviews to attendees
Book appointments
Specific Responsibilities of the Job
Maintain a professional appearance throughout event
Ensure cleanliness and organization of booth
Engage with passers-by to draw them into the booth
Explain basic product features and benefits
Secure entry forms or book in home sales appointments
Collect daily leads and provide to Event Coordinator
Knowledge & Skill
Strong communications skills
Positive, outgoing personality
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Physical Demands
Travel to booked shows/events (must have reliable transportation)
Ability to stand for long periods of time
Ability to lift 30 pounds
Available to work weekends

Job Title: Brand Ambassador - Aeropostale Green Acres Mall
Job Description: Role of the Brand AmbassadorWe call our Aeropostale team members Brand Ambassadors because they promote the culture, values and mission of Aeropostale. If you are outgoing, friendly and have a passion for fashion, this is a perfect role for you. As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.Our Mission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!Who you are:* Outgoing and excited to meet new people* Positive, charismatic and engaging* Obsessed with fashion and trends* Fantastic sense of style* Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual styleWhat you'll do:* Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience* Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy* Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice* Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits* Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store* Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed* Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other* Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountabilityWhat you'll need:* Outgoing personality* Love of fashion* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task* Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)* Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance* Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)Where you come from:* You are at least 16 years of age* Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store ManagerAero OpCo LLC is an equal opportunity employer.
