As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.Our Mission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!Who you are:* Outgoing and excited to meet new people* Positive, charismatic and engaging* Obsessed with fashion and trends* Fantastic sense of style* Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual styleWhat you'll do:* Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience* Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy* Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice* Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits* Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store* Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed* Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other* Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountabilityWhat you'll need:* Outgoing personality* Love of fashion* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task* Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)* Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance* Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)Where you come from:* You are at least 16 years of age* Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store ManagerSPARC Group LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We value a culture of inclusion and diversity within our workforce, and are committed to maintaining a workplace free from prohibited employment conduct, including discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, religion, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, domestic partner status, civil partnership, status as a covered veteran, status in the Uniformed Services of the United States, citizenship and any other characteristic protected by law ("Protected Characteristics").

As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.Our Mission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!Who you are:* Outgoing and excited to meet new people* Positive, charismatic and engaging* Obsessed with fashion and trends* Fantastic sense of style* Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual styleWhat you'll do:* Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience* Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy* Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice* Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits* Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store* Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed* Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other* Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountabilityWhat you'll need:* Outgoing personality* Love of fashion* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task* Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)* Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance* Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)Where you come from:* You are at least 16 years of age* Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store ManagerAero OpCo LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We value a culture a culture of inclusion and diversity within our workforce, and are committed to maintaining a workplace free from prohibited employment conduct, including discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, religion, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, domestic partner status, civil partnership, status as a covered veteran, status in the Uniformed Services of the United States, citizenship and any other characteristic protected by law ("Protected Characteristics").

As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.Our Mission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!Who you are:* Outgoing and excited to meet new people* Positive, charismatic and engaging* Obsessed with fashion and trends* Fantastic sense of style* Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual styleWhat you'll do:* Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience* Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy* Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice* Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits* Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store* Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed* Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other* Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountabilityWhat you'll need:* Outgoing personality* Love of fashion* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task* Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)* Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance* Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)Where you come from:* You are at least 16 years of age* Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store ManagerAero OpCo LLC is an equal opportunity employer. Role of the Brand Ambassador

We call our Aeropostale team members Brand Ambassadors because they promote the culture, values and mission of Aeropostale. If you are outgoing, friendly and have a passion for fashion, this is a perfect role for you. As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.

OurMission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!

Who you are:
Outgoing and excited to meet new people
Positive, charismatic and engaging
Obsessed with fashion and trends
Fantastic sense of style
Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual style
What you'll do:
Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience
Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy
Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice
Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits
Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store
Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed
Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other
Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountability
What you'll need:
Outgoing personality
Love of fashion
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task
Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)
Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance
Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)
Where you come from:
You are at least 16 years of age
Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store Manager
Aero OpCo LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We value a culture a culture of inclusion and diversity within our workforce, and are committed to maintaining a workplace free from prohibited employment conduct, including discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, religion, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, domestic partner status, civil partnership, status as a covered veteran, status in the Uniformed Services of the United States, citizenship and any other characteristic protected by law (“Protected Characteristics”).

Job Description
Momentum Solar is a company built on the idea of community, innovation, and exceeding our customer’s expectations. We have garnered an A+ Rating with the Better Business Bureau and have been named one of the "Best Workplaces" in The United States by Inc. Magazine. Momentum promotes green energy and environmental advocacy alongside a familial atmosphere.

Job Overview:

As a Momentum Solar Brand Ambassador Manager, you will play a critical role in hiring new brand ambassadors, training and coaching your team, and guiding and prioritize efforts to optimize results. We need an experienced leader that will motivate, train, enable, and guide a team to consistent achievement of team lead generation goals.

Momentum Solar is a firm believer that our biggest asset is people. Therefore, we always invest first in you and our compensation structure reflects it. Our Brand Ambassador Managers receive a competitive salary and the most lucrative commission structure in the industry.

Requirements:
1+ years' prior experience with a strong performance record
Prior managerial background and ability to coach a team
Flexible schedule - ability to work nights & weekends
Must have a clean driving record and a valid driver's license
Intrinsic and uncompromising drive to excel
Unrivaled interpersonal skill - you're an expert a determining what makes people tick and aligning that to the needs of an organization to optimize the impact
Exceptional communicator and relationship builder
Organized, detail-oriented, and deadline-driven
Skilled in adapting to requirements of numerous, constantly changing demands
Qualifications:
Strong verbal communication skills and professional demeanor
Confident, creative, and goal-oriented
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic team environment
Schedule flexibility - available to work nights and weekends
Goal-oriented and self-motivated
Physical ability to stand and walk for long periods at a time
Willingness to be mentored, and eager to learn
Momentum Solar is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age.

Job Type: Full-time

Powered by JazzHR

Job Description
Introduce our awesome services to those with lots of vans and trucks, even ride sharing peeps! You get an hourly pay PLUS spifs and BONUSES!

JOB: Call potential customers on your own schedule from the comfort of home, get paid for submitting company Name, Phone, Person you spoke to.

SPIFS: Each time a company signs up with you a $50 SPIF is set into your bonus money (paid weekly)!

BONUSES: For every 10 Vehicles you sign up, you get ANOTHER $100, and on and on!!
Company Description
We offer fleet maintenance and repairs to company's who have several vehicles, saving them THOUSANDS.

Brand Ambassador (Automotive)

Castle Automotive Groups is seeking Brand Ambassadors to earn extra income remotely from work/home. Everyone knows someone that is looking to buy or sell their car so why not earn extra money for referring them to a Auto Group you can trust!

If you are motivated, enthusiastic and looking for additional streams of income then this is the perfect opportunity for you. No experience is necessary! We have a simple app to download and log your potential prospects, we handle the rest and you get PAID! It's that simple.

Job Description:

The primary function, after downloading the app, is to do outreach and find potential opportunities from those looking to buy or sell their car. As a Castle Automotive Group Ambassador, you will promote ALL the Brands we carry and refer anyone in their family, work, school, social life and GET PAID!
The ability to communicate this information effectively to customers and potential customers.
Matching a customer's desires, needs and budget to a specific vehicle for purchase.
Maintaining a customer database and communications.
Encourage a smooth sales process.
Qualifications and Requirements:

To be successful you should possess:
Social media skills and a proficiency towards marketing yourself and the product.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong customer service skills with a passion for sales and customer satisfaction.
Pay Type: $200 per vehicle sold or purchased.

We have a great history of providing excellent career opportunities for sharp, energetic people. To learn more, visit us at https://jointeamcastle.com

Brand Manager
Job Title: Brand Manager
Based In: Jersey City, NJ, US
Qualifications: Spirits Industry, Nielsen, Marketing
Benefits: Full Benefits, PTO, etc.

Based in Jersey City, we are a leading producer and distributor of premium spirits. Our client list includes Jose Cuervo, 1800 Tequila, Three Olives Vodka, and many more. As Brand Manager, you would be developing consumer and commercial strategies, developing creative platforms and programming, executing plans and evaluating performance.
What You Will Be Doing
- Managing annual brand planning cycle.
- Building marketing programs that win the hearts and minds of target consumers.
- Manage marketing agencies and inspire them to deliver their most creative, efficient and on-strategy work.
- Building the brand in the on premise (bars, restaurants, etc.) and off-premise (liquor, club store, grocery, etc.).
- Track and manage brand performance across the marketing mix.
- Manage multimillion dollar A
P budget.
- Work closely with the distillery and production team
- Work with our sales team and distributor partners.
- Develop marketing tools for the National sales-team.
What You Need for this Position
4+ years' experience as:

- Brand Management (Ideally with ultra-premium spirits ($50+ per bottle)

Experience with:

- Nielsen
- Developing New Packaging
- Managing Budgets
- New Media Platforms
- Data Analysis
What's In It for You
- Vacation/PTO
- Medical
- Dental
- Vision
- 401k
If interested please email Evan.Flanagan@CyberCoders.com with your updated resume, as interviews are on-going now!
-
Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.


CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Your Right to Work In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

Auctane is a leading provider of e-commerce and warehouse shipping software. E-commerce merchants, warehouse operations, third-party logistics companies and other high-volume shippers across the country trust our products as their provider of shipping solutions.

The brand manager will be responsible for planning, executing, and measuring all marketing activities for the ShipWorks product. The right candidate will be a well-rounded marketing professional who is comfortable with both creating and managing the work of others.

ShipWorks is part of a family of e-commerce brands owned by Stamps.com. This position, based in Austin, TX, will coordinate closely with a centralized marketing team in Austin as well as the larger ShipWorks team located in St. Louis, MO. Some travel to St. Louis and other locations may be required as needed.

Responsibilities:
Represent marketing on a cross-department leadership team alongside sales, product, and engineering.
Develop a deep understanding of the ShipWorks product and the customers it serves.
Create quarterly marketing plans, own the progress and execution of those plans, and track performance.
Translate business needs into a new customer acquisition forecast, including channel mix to hit goals.
Prepare an annual budget and make quarterly adjustments based on new insights and initiatives.
In tandem with the larger marketing team, develop content, coordinate events, establish partnerships, assist with new feature launches, and manage other channels as needed.
Develop strong relationships with the ShipWorks team, marketing peers, partners, users, and third parties.
Use multiple technologies in planning and executing marketing activities, including WordPress, Hubspot, etc.
Meet regularly with executive, marketing, and ShipWorks leadership teams to share updates on performance and marketing strategy.
Qualifications:

7+ years of marketing experience
E-commerce, shipping/logistics and/or SaaS experience preferred
4-year degree
Strong writing/editing abilities
Proven track record of taking end-to-end ownership of marketing activities for a brand and growing performance
Proven ability to form deep relationships with a remote team
People management experience preferred
Ability to travel to St. Louis from Austin for 1 week per quarter
ShipStation is an Austin-based software company that has experienced tremendous growth in the past year. We help thousands of customers who sell online using Amazon, eBay, Magento, Volusion, BigCommerce, Shopify, Etsy, and over 45 other online marketplaces. Our web-based shipping applications streamlines the order fulfillment process for anyone selling on the Internet.

If you are passionate about using technology to solve business problems, enjoy helping customers, and have excellent communication skills, then we want you to join us.

Job Title: (Waterford Business District, Miami FL) - Driver / Brand Ambassador
Job Description:
We're looking for great people to join our team! If asked to describe yourself and “fun,” "outgoing," and "self-dependent" come to mind, chances are you'll be a great fit for our team. Interested? APPLY NOW!!

FREEBEE COMPANY OVERVIEW:

Freebee is changing the way people move around, by providing FREE, electric, on-demand, door-to-door transportation in several high-density areas of South Florida. That's right! FREE RIDES in 100% battery-powered vehicles, made possible through customized mobile advertising campaigns and municipal transportation contacts... and we are pollinating the masses with our many services in a progressive and sustainable way!

At Freebee, we know how to live it up! Our drivers are fun, energetic, and knowledgeable about the cities we call home, and can't wait to spread the word about what's going on around town, and all the great products and businesses we are currently promoting. Join one of South Florida's fastest growing companies and sign up to become part of our team of creative, driven, and passionate professionals who live and breathe the FREE LIFE!

JOB TITLE:

DRIVER / BRAND AMBASSADOR in the Waterford Business District /Blue Lagoon area of Miami (Corporate offices located across from the Miami International Airport). 801 Waterford Way

POSITION OVERVIEW:

The Freebee Driver / Brand Ambassador position is one of the most important positions in our company. You are the face of the organization, and the one interacting most with the general public, educating them on our services and everything we have to offer. Shaking hands, kissing babies, and spreading goodwill to all.

We are seeking sharp, personable, highly-organized brand ambassadors to provide safe, reliable transportation to the general public, as well as provide them with valuable information about the latest and greatest happenings around town. The experience you provide for your guests will generate future opportunities for yourself, for our clients, and for the Freebee brand.

As part of the South Florida team, your role will be instrumental in spreading the word about our innovative free, on-demand transportation service, which will allow us to grow our fleet and take on new opportunities throughout South Florida and beyond. This is an opportunity to be a key player on an awesome team, as we continue to expand and enhance the reputation of the Freebee service as a whole.

WHAT YOU'LL DO:

- Provide safe, professional, and efficient transportation via open-air, electric marketing vehicles

- Interact with and provide great customer service to all passengers

- Create a fun environment and represent the company in a positive way

- Promote brands, distribute marketing material / branded collateral / product samples

- Document marketing experiences by taking photos

WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW/HAVE:

- CLEAN DRIVING RECORD (will be reviewed prior to hire)

- Valid Florida drivers license

- Energetic, outgoing personality

- Well-groomed appearance

- Effective time management / punctuality

- Communication skills (verbal & written)

- Must own a smart phone

- Knowledge of how to get around one or more of our service areas (see below for specific service areas)

- Bilingual is a PLUS! +

EXAMPLE BACKGROUNDS:

- Hospitality

- Customer Service

- Communications

- Brand Activation / Events

- Marketing

PERKS:

- Health insurance Benefits Provided!

- Have Fun & Work Outside!

- Meet New People!

- Career Advancement Opportunities Available!

- The rare opportunity to change the world such that everyone around you is using the product that you promote. We’re not just another service; we’re moving real people, reinventing marketing, and providing a reliable, eco-friendly alternative to transportation!

AVAILABILITY:

- Flexible Hours!

- Waterford Business District operating hours:

[Monday - Friday; 10am - 3pm]

- Now hiring full-time & part-time employees in over thirteen (14) different service areas

SERVICE AREAS:

- Waterford Business District / Blue Lagoon area, Miami FL

- Delray Beach, FL

- Fort Lauderdale, FL

- Miami Lakes, FL

- Hallandale Beach, FL

- Doral, FL

- Key Biscayne, FL

- Miami, FL: [Wynwood, Downtown, Design District, Midtown, Edgewater, Brickell]

- Miami Beach, FL

- Coral Gables, FL

- Coconut Grove, FL

- Pinecrest, FL

- Palmetto Bay, FL

- Islamorada, FL

RENEWAL BY ANDERSEN OF GREATER PHILLY “2019 TOP WORKPLACES AWARD”!
We are the largest window manufacturer in North America and still growing rapidly. We are looking for well-spoken, energetic and eager individuals who want to learn new skills or start a career with unlimited opportunities on a part-time basis.

This challenging and fun job takes place at different retail locations throughout the Greater Philly area. You will communicate with people at onsite retail store locations and farmers markets to generate leads.
Watch this one-minute video to learn more about being a Brand Ambassador: CLICK HERE

About the role
- High performing teammates have the drive and desire to make $$$
- You will work for a team that values honesty, transparency and FUN!!
- Part-time hours will include daytime and evening hours mainly on Saturday and Sunday (weekday hours a plus)!!
- Average Brand Ambassadors are making $25-$30 per hour (hourly plus commission)

As a lead generation position, this position requires the ability to have conversations with ease, overcome objections and keep a positive attitude. A very independent position, Marketing Representatives travel to and from events with setup items, so reliable transportation is required. Mileage reimbursement is provided!
THE RENEWAL BY ANDERSEN | ESLER COMPANIES STORY
Renewal by Andersen is the full-service window-replacement division of 115-year-old Andersen Corporation, the owner of the most trusted family of window brands in America. RbA was founded with a mission to redefine the industry and to offer a different—and better—window-replacement experience. Renewal by Andersen has seven company-owned locations, and over 100 independently owned “affiliates” across the United States.
The Esler Companies is the holding company for a fleet of the top Renewal by Andersen (RbA) “affiliates” in Greater Philadelphia, Colorado, Greater Phoenix, and Southern New England, and a sales and marketing ‘engine’ in Northborough, Massachusetts. Independent affiliates operate with a business model which grants owners exclusive marketing and sales territories, and nearly complete autonomy in running their businesses.
Esler Companies | Renewal by Andersen is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members.
Take a look at life at Esler Companies | Renewal by Andersen at www.esler.com

Let's start with the 'why'. J.W. Business Acquisitions believes that every person has the right to be as successful as they want to be as long as they are willing to put in the work. Job Description
Brand Ambassador (Event & Show Demonstrator)

With more than 25 years in business, Bay State Luxury Kitchen and Bath is one of the fastest growing brands in the acrylic bath remodeling industry. We offer custom bath remodeling that enriches the lives of those we touch with bathrooms that are attractive, durable and maintenance-free.

We are seeking Brand Ambassadors/Event Demonstrators for our Hanover, Massachusetts markets and surrounding areas to join our winning team. Customer service experience is a plus, as you will be interacting with event attendees, discussing our product and securing sales leads for our team. Hourly pay + bonus based on quality appointments.

Essential Duties
Attract visitors and staff booth at shows and events
Promote product and provide basic product overviews to attendees
Book appointments
Specific Responsibilities of the Job
Maintain a professional appearance throughout event
Ensure cleanliness and organization of booth
Engage with passers-by to draw them into the booth
Explain basic product features and benefits
Secure entry forms or book in home sales appointments
Collect daily leads and provide to Event Coordinator
Knowledge & Skill
Strong communications skills
Positive, outgoing personality
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Physical Demands
Travel to booked shows/events (must have reliable transportation)
Ability to stand for long periods of time
Ability to lift 30 pounds
Available to work weekends

Our Human Resource staff is responsible for recruiting, screening, interviewing and placing potential candidates. They may also handle employee relations, payroll and training. The Human Resource department plans, directs and coordinates the administrative functions of our organization.

– Have a strong work ethic.

– Have a positive, professional, and energetic attitude.

Outgoing personality
Love of fashion
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task
Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)
Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance

Job Description
THE PROFILE

Abercrombie & Fitch Co. is a leading global specialty retailer of high-quality, casual apparel for men, women and kids with an active, youthful lifestyle under its Abercrombie & Fitch, abercrombie kids, and Hollister Co. brands. A&F was founded in 1892 and is based in New Albany, Ohio. A&F sells merchandise through retail stores in the United States, Canada, Europe, Asia, Mexico, and the Middle East. The Company also operates e-commerce websites at www. abercrombie.com, www. abercrombiekids.com, www.hollisterco.com

THE JOB

The Hollister associate is truly engaged. They provide great customer service by anticipating and responding to customer needs. An individual who is outgoing, stylish, and helpful. They demonstrate a keen awareness of the store environment by ensuring they always remain approachable and warm. They are able to initiate conversations and connect with the customer by communicating in a genuine and articulate way; that ensures the customer is always the first priority. Demon- strates relatable, confident and highly social behaviors on the sales floor that translate into closing the sale.

WHAT IT TAKES
Adaptability / Flexibility
Stress Tolerance
Applied Learning
Attention to Detail
Multi-Tasking
Work Ethic
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Customer Experience
Store Presentation and Sales Floor
Communication
Asset Protection and Shrink
Policies and Procedures
Training and Development

Job Title: Cheerwine Soft Drink Brand Ambassador - On Campus 2020_2021 UNC
Job Description:
Independent Contractor Job Title: Cheerwine Soft Drink - Brand Ambassador
Department: Sales & Marketing

Summary: The Cheerwine Soft Drink Brand Ambassador - On-Campus (also known as Cheerwine Czar) is responsible for increasing the awareness of Cheerwine through brand education and sampling throughout campus. This person will attend key events on or around campus from August 2020- May 2021 such as concerts, festivals, and other fun activities happening in the area.

Compensation: This position pays $100 per event. Attend a maximum of 20 events during the academic school year plus bonus opportunities.

Requirements:
Full-time undergraduate student at designated university and in good academic standing.
Must be available to attend select events for BOTH semesters from August 2020 through May 2021.
Must have car/reliable transportation that can transport necessary supplies for events (coolers, boxes, drinks). Must be able to lift drinks.
Must be outgoing, enjoy socializing with people, and have good communication and organization skills.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Maintain brand communication standards of Cheerwine's centennial heritage.
Distribute Cheerwine samples and swag at key events. Some events will be predetermined by Cheerwine; most will be determined by the Brand Ambassador, approved in advance by Cheerwine.
Identify and secure right-fit sampling events on campus. Completely communicate event details and rationale for Cheerwine to attend to sample with student peers and faculty.
Maintain inventory of Cheerwine samples, transport samples and supplies to and from all events.
Required to lead sampling at 5-10 events each academic semester.
Take photos at the events and gather consumer feedback at events.
Submit detailed event recaps after each event to Cheerwine staff members.
Wear Cheerwine uniform and use supplies provided and follow all training instructions.
Answer consumer questions about Cheerwine.
Encourage peers to join Cheerwine's Fan Club.
Visit designated retailers to build relationships and observe Cheerwine's presentation on-shelf and in the market.
Communicate with Cheerwine staff members on a regular basis regarding all Brand Ambassador responsibilities.
Organization Overview:

Founded in 1917, Carolina Beverage Corporation in Salisbury, North Carolina remains a family-owned independent enterprise still operated by descendants of L.D. Peeler, the company founder. The company is highly respected for maintaining it's family values despite significant growth and change in the beverage industry over the last century. Our company owns 101-year-old Cheerwine: Born in the South, Raised in a Glass. Cheerwine is a unique, bubbly cherry soft drink that brings out the 18-year-old in all of us. We still produce Cheerwine concentrate in small batches using the founder's secret formula. Cheerwine is sold in grocery stores, convenience stores, mass merchandisers, restaurants, and specialty retail stores. A state-of-the-art manufacturing facility in Charlotte, NC produces Cheerwine, along with many other leading brands from the Dr. Pepper Snapple Group. At the core of the company's success is the community of Salisbury, NC, located between Greensboro to the north and Charlotte to the south. What makes us truly different is the integrity of our people and their passion for sharing Cheerwine that has been loved by generations.

Role of the Brand Ambassador

We call our Aeropostale team members Brand Ambassadors because they promote the culture, values and mission of Aeropostale. If you are outgoing, friendly and have a passion for fashion, this is a perfect role for you. As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.

OurMission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!

Who you are:
Outgoing and excited to meet new people
Positive, charismatic and engaging
Obsessed with fashion and trends
Fantastic sense of style
Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual style
What you'll do:
Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience
Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy
Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice
Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits
Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store
Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed
Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other
Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountability
What you'll need:
Outgoing personality
Love of fashion
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task
Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)
Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance
Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)
Where you come from:

CHEERS!Are you ready to join the world of Fine Wine as anAssistant Brand Managerfor a growing portfolio of Italian Wines?

Working collaboratively with our US-based Brand Ambassadors, you will be the point-person for our Italian wine portfolio, interacting with key audiences, including internal cross-functional teams, agency partners, trade and consumers.You will be responsible for tracking brand performance using internal (COGNOS) and syndicated data sources (IRI/Nielsen), and deriving key business insights that translate into actionable recommendations.You will support the development of annual strategic brand plans, and will own the successful and timely execution of key deliverables, including all elements of the marketing mix, e.g. Advertising, Social/Digital Media, In-Store Programming and Point-of-Sale materials, Educational tools, and Events/Tastings.You will interact frequently with our national Sales Team to understand brand performance and challenges in key channels and markets, and develop programs and tools to help them unlock brand growth at both the local and national levels.You will prepare and present Annual Brand Reviews to company leaders and brand partners.

Who Are You?

·College graduate

·1-2 years of marketing experience, or internship experience

·Have a passion for wine

·Strong project management skills, including the ability to collaborate with, and motivate, cross-functional teams

·Strong analytical skills

·Able to function effectively in a fast-paced, multi-faceted business environment

·Strong strategic and decision-making skills

·Able to take initiative, develop and seek out creative and innovative ideas

·Strong interpersonal and presentation skills with the ability to effectively interface at all levels within the organization and outside the company

·Experience with budget management

·Excellent written and verbal communication skills

·High level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook

What Will You Do?

·Contribute to development and execution of strategic and annual marketing plans which address all aspects of the marketing mix including pricing, packaging, advertising, promotion, public relations, events/tastings

·Interface with our internal Creative Services team as well as manage outside agencies, including advertising, promotions, packaging, and digital/social media

·Analyze Sales data using databases& spreadsheet software and derive key actionable business insights

·Interface on a consistent basis with cross-functional groups (Sales, Finance, and Operations) to rapidly identify problems/opportunities and take appropriate action as warranted

Arteriors is a team of smart, imaginative (and sometimes quirky) people who embody loyalty to our customers, our brand and each other. We’ve stripped away the red tape and provide an environment which thrives on new ideas brought into fruition.
As a Service Ambassador, you’ll act as a liaison between our clients and Arteriors by supporting client inquiries. You’ll be the first point of contact for the client and will assist with and resolve any issues that arise. To land this gig, you’ll need a High School Diploma or equivalent. You’ll also need to have experience in a customer support role that required both phone and email support.

You enjoy helping people. You get a thrill out of leading people in the right direction.
You are calm and collected under pressure. You think on your feet while ensuring the best possible level of service.
You are motivated and driven. You appreciate a challenge and thrive in environments that allow you to make decisions that impact the bottom line.
You communicate clearly. You write well and can explain just about anything to anyone. You have no problem with communicating in writing and on the phone.
You think, ‘glass half full’. You maintain a positive outlook, even in the most difficult situations, and encourage others to do the same.
You believe in personal accountability. You see the value in both, giving and receiving, constructive feedback and you often seek new opportunities to improve and develop your skills.

Medical, dental and vision insurance available the first day of the month after hire date
Open paid time off
9 paid holidays
Early release before holidays
Annual bonus potential
Annual performance review
Paid parental leave
401k with partial matching

Job Description
Brand Ambassador (Event & Show Demonstrator)

With more than 25 years in business, Bath Planet is one of the fastest growing brands in the acrylic bath remodeling industry. We offer custom bath remodeling that enriches the lives of those we touch with bathrooms that are attractive, durable and maintenance-free.

We are seeking Brand Ambassadors/Event Demonstrators for our Aiken, Augusta, Columbia, South Carolina markets and surrounding areas to join our winning team. Customer service experience is a plus, as you will be interacting with event attendees, discussing our product and securing sales leads for our team. Hourly pay + bonus based on quality appointments.

Essential Duties
Attract visitors and staff booth at shows and events
Promote product and provide basic product overviews to attendees
Book appointments
Specific Responsibilities of the Job
Maintain a professional appearance throughout event
Ensure cleanliness and organization of booth
Engage with passers-by to draw them into the booth
Explain basic product features and benefits
Secure entry forms or book in home sales appointments
Collect daily leads and provide to Event Coordinator
Knowledge & Skill
Strong communications skills
Positive, outgoing personality
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Physical Demands
Travel to booked shows/events (must have reliable transportation)
Ability to stand for long periods of time
Ability to lift 30 pounds
Available to work weekends
Call us at 803-508-6868 to set up an interview time.

Job Title: Retail Sales & Event Marketing Brand Ambassador ($10-$14/hr)
Job Description:
Bath Fitter, a local industry leader, is seeking part-time, out-going individuals to add to our already amazing staff. We have several positions available for both entry-level and seasoned customer service & sales oriented representatives.

We at Bath Fitter make up the Nations #1 Bathroom Remodeling Company; we pride ourselves on the highest level of top-quality products and reliable customer service. Bath Fitter is dedicated to serving our customers and the local community. We bring a unique and innovative bath remodeling process to the market, providing the most thorough and gratifying experience possible for our customers.

Responsibilities:

Represent the company at local community events, trade shows and business expos
Represent the company at our local retail locations
Actively engage with the public to identify home improvement needs
Answer general questions and stimulate interest in our products
Gather contact information for appointment setting purposes
Qualifications:

Self-motivated and outgoing personality
Polite demeanor with the ability to drive the conversation
Strong organizational skills
Reliable transportation is required
Sales and Marketing experience is beneficial, but not required
Benefits:

$10-$14/hr or more (Hourly + Commission paid bi-weekly)
Top Reps Make $15+
Mileage Reimbursement
Flexible PT scheduling (up to 30 hours a week)
90 day advancement reviews
Potential for growth within company
Prioritized, paid training
Year-round work
EOE

As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.Our Mission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!Who you are:* Outgoing and excited to meet new people* Positive, charismatic and engaging* Obsessed with fashion and trends* Fantastic sense of style* Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual styleWhat you'll do:* Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience* Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy* Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice* Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits* Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store* Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed* Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other* Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountabilityWhat you'll need:* Outgoing personality* Love of fashion* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task* Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)* Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance* Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)Where you come from:* You are at least 16 years of age* Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store ManagerAero OpCo LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We value a culture a culture of inclusion and diversity within our workforce, and are committed to maintaining a workplace free from prohibited employment conduct, including discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, religion, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, domestic partner status, civil partnership, status as a covered veteran, status in the Uniformed Services of the United States, citizenship and any other characteristic protected by law ("Protected Characteristics").

As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.Our Mission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!Who you are:* Outgoing and excited to meet new people* Positive, charismatic and engaging* Obsessed with fashion and trends* Fantastic sense of style* Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual styleWhat you'll do:* Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience* Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy* Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice* Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits* Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store* Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed* Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other* Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountabilityWhat you'll need:* Outgoing personality* Love of fashion* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task* Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)* Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance* Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)Where you come from:* You are at least 16 years of age* Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store ManagerAero OpCo LLC is an equal opportunity employer. Role of the Brand Ambassador

We call our Aeropostale team members Brand Ambassadors because they promote the culture, values and mission of Aeropostale. If you are outgoing, friendly and have a passion for fashion, this is a perfect role for you. As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.

OurMission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!

Who you are:
Outgoing and excited to meet new people
Positive, charismatic and engaging
Obsessed with fashion and trends
Fantastic sense of style
Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual style
What you'll do:
Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience
Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy
Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice
Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits
Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store
Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed
Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other
Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountability
What you'll need:
Outgoing personality
Love of fashion
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task
Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)
Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance
Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)
Where you come from:
You are at least 16 years of age
Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store Manager

Job Description
We are looking for social, outgoing and enthusiastic Brand Ambassadors inside local Costco warehouses to promote brand awareness and drive sales through live featured product demonstrations. This is a great opportunity for anyone looking to make extra money and/or a flexible schedule!

Things to consider:
Shifts are from 10:00am – 3:00pm, 3:00pm – 8:00pm and 10pm to 6pm.
Average hours range from 8 to 30 hours weekly.
Base pay rates are competitive starting at $15/hr
Monthly bonuses provide hourly earnings in the $18-$20/hr rate.
What You’ll Do:
Generate sales and brand awareness through product demonstrations and customer engagement
Maximize brand awareness by moving around the event area to actively engage with shoppers
Excellent presentation skills and the ability to expertly articulate product features and benefits
Timely and accurate event reporting, submission of paperwork and online training
Qualifications:
High School Diploma, G.E.D. or 1- 2 years equivalent work experience
Energetic self-starter, able to work independently with little or no supervision.
Experience in event marketing, demonstrations, sales, brand promotion, or retail/grocery (Preferred)
Availability to work part-time retail schedule Thursday – Sunday
Daily access to a PC computer or smartphone with internet/email access
Commute to a regular rotation of event sites.
Advance your career by joining, where you will work with amazing people and earn competitive pay rates! APPLY TODAY!

Job Description
Put your people skills to work earning you full time income with part time hours!!

As a Brand Ambassador for WCW& Air you will be conducting short survey's with Home Depot Customers in multiple Home Depot Locations. We are an authorized Home Depot Home Service Provider for dozens of the Atlanta Area Stores and conduct on-site surveying as well as appointment scheduling for those interested in learning more about our environmental solutions.

We are seeking candidates that can represent our Kennesaw and surrounding area Home Depot Locations.

If you love people and are the "never met a stranger" type of personality this opportunity will be a perfect fit! The flexibility of the schedule can make this a perfect fit for those seeking a part time opportunity yet needing full time income! Our aggressive pay plan combines a solid hourly income with an aggressive bonus structure allowing you to truly earn what you deserve!

The requirements for the position are as follows:
Valid drivers license and reliable transportation
Professional appearance - meeting Home Depot guidelines
Ability to use an iPad or Tablet (provided)
Reliability and the ability to work under minimum supervision
Must be able to pass a criminal background check
We are looking to fill this role ASAP so don't delay! Respond today so we can make arrangements for a face to face meeting.
Company Description
We are the exclusive distributor of Rainsoft Home Environmental Solutions as well as a proud Home Depot Home Service Provider for dozens of Home Depot locations throughout the Greater Atlanta Area. Rainsoft has been Changing Water & Changing Lives for homeowners since 1953! Our full suite of products includes whole home water treatment, food and drinking water purification systems, whole home air purification, and a cutting edge laundry system revolutionizing the way families do laundry!

We are an A+ BBB rated company focused on doing what is best for our customer as that will always be what creates the greatest success for our organization. Become a part of our growing family here at WCW & Air, Inc. and help us change lives - including your own!

Job Description
Introduce our awesome services to those with lots of vans and trucks, even ride sharing peeps! You get an hourly pay PLUS spifs and BONUSES!

JOB: Call potential customers on your own schedule from the comfort of home, get paid for submitting company Name, Phone, Person you spoke to.

SPIFS: Each time a company signs up with you a $50 SPIF is set into your bonus money (paid weekly)!

BONUSES: For every 10 Vehicles you sign up, you get ANOTHER $100, and on and on!!
Company Description
We offer fleet maintenance and repairs to company's who have several vehicles, saving them THOUSANDS.

Job Title: San Antonio, TX - Online Retail Brand Ambassador
Job Description:
Job Description
Online Retail
Brand Ambassador

Social Media and Sales Experience Preferred
Job ID# 1011

Brand Ambassador
(Independent Contractor - 1099)
Social Media Experience Suggested

JOB ID# 1011

The Brand Ambassador will market to and contact prospective customers by phone, email, text, instant message and social media to encourage purchases from the Liz Long Store.

You may contact customers with promotions and other marketing information to increase sales and increase customer retention.

Social media experience preferred.

What?

Online/Social media marketing.

Time?

Flexible at your own determination as an Independent Contractor (US-1099).

Compensation?

We compensate 15-20% of NET profit with RAPID increase based on sales volume. Offer your Customers 10% DISCOUNT on Purchases.

We offer Direct Deposit on a bi-weekly basis.

Earn more (30-50%) and get paid building your own team as a Marketing Affiliate!

Requirements?

Active Social Media accounts such as:
Facebook
Instagram
SnapChat
WhatsApp
Computer skills and resources:
Ability to use a variety of websites and social media platforms (posting and sharing)
Intermediate to Advanced computer skills and proficiency with Microsoft Word, Outlook, and Excel, excellent keyboard and web navigation skills
Access to a secure computer in order to accommodate data entry within required timelines
High speed internet connectivity (DSL or cable modem; recommended speed is 10Mx1M for optimal performance)
Additional requirements:
Mobile phone
Job Description?

Online Retail Sales Associates will:
Dependability — Opportunity requires being reliable, responsible, and dependable, and fulfilling obligations.

Integrity — Opportunity requires being honest and ethical.

Cooperation — Opportunity requires being pleasant with others in the organization and displaying a good-natured, cooperative attitude.

Adaptability/Flexibility — Opportunity requires being open to change (positive or negative) and considerable to a variety of work locations.

Independence — Opportunity requires developing one's own ways of doing things, guiding oneself with little or no supervision, and depending on oneself to get things done.
Responsibilities?
Provide customers with information needed to complete their online purchases
Direct potential customers to products and services offered through the Liz Long Store websites, social media and other sales platforms
Helpful Attributes?

Confident, autonomous, self-starter, problem solver, solution-driven, prepared,

organized, detail oriented, high standards of excellence, educated, compassionate, objective, non-judgmental, resourceful, kind, caring, team player, team builder, open minded, sense of humor, intuitive, dedicated, creative, responsive, proactive, good business savvy, strong communicator, understands family dynamics, professional.

Requirements
Computer Needed

Smart Mobile Phone Preferred

Internet Needed

Benefits
10% Discount on Purchases from The Liz Long Store

Job Description
Seeking positive, energetic and sales-focused professional salespeople who can be passionate brand ambassadors!

Are you highly motivated by goals, love interacting with people and known to be a self-starter?

If the answer is yes, then this is the job for you!

Brand Ambassador Job Details:
Energetically engage customers to promote and increase in home design consultations.
Part-time employment opportunities for advancement.
Full-time position is available for top performers!
Flexible shifts: Thursday through Sunday - 10 am to 6:00 & 8:00 pm
Brand Ambassador Compensation:
Start at $15 an hour
Earn $18 per hour or higher within 60 days with our MONTHLY BONUS!
Brand Ambassador Requirements:
Outgoing, charismatic and fun!
Professional outward appearance.
Consistently creates a welcoming environment.
Confident and Charismatic, EXPERIENCED, salesperson. This is not an entry-level position!
Positive energy, well organized, high level of focus and a strong sense of commitment.
Must have a passion for helping people.
Ability to communicate clearly and succinctly.
Meet or exceed weekly sales goals.
Complies with all company standards and requirements.
Ability to work independently and professionally with minimal supervision.
Weekend schedule availability.
Must be able to stand for extended periods of time with breaks.
Must have a cell phone with texting and MMS capabilities - must be able to text photos.
Brand Ambassador Job Description:

We promote a full line of window covering products. We need energetic, courteous and driven Salespeople to represent and sell our home improvement products. It's our mission to build a highly-motivated sales team.

Adelante Live Inc. Brand Ambassadors execute on-premise sampling events for wine, spirit and beer brands at various bars and restaurants throughout the state of Florida. We're seeking energetic Brand Ambassadors in the Naples, FL metro area to provide brand education to consumers, sample well-known adult beverage brands and promote sale of product at area venues. This is a great part-time opportunity with flexible hours. Apply today!

Will you be a good fit for Adelante Live?
Do you enjoy or have confidence with starting face to face conversations with diverse people you don’t know?
Do you have the ability to communicate with a variety of people about various topics?
Do you take pride in projecting a professional appearance and attitude?
Are you able to follow detailed directions easily?
Do you own a smart phone linked to an active email account and have access to a desktop/laptop computer?
Do you have the ability to travel to various job sites within a 30 mile radius of where you live, and work at least five (5) hours at a time?
Do you have a flexible schedule with the ability to work on nights and/or weekends?
IF YOU ANSWERED “YES” TO ALL OF THESE QUESTIONS, THEN YOU MIGHT BE A GOOD FIT FOR ADELANTE, AND WE WOULD GLADLY ACCEPT YOUR APPLICATION!
Job Details
Rate: $22.50/ Hr

Date/Time: Ongoing, varies weekly

Location: Bars, Resturants, Golf Outings and Special events (On Premise)
Current Openings: Saturday 03/14/20 2pm-4pm & 4:30pm-6:30pm (Promoting Bushmills)
Primary Job Duties
a. Engage with members of the public through face to face interactions at various public and private events and via retail stores or on site demonstration

b. Engage, educate, promote, and sell assigned brand and/or product(s) to consumers through natural conversation

c. Promote assigned brand and/or products by following directions provided

d. Learn talking points and product information prior to event, and effectively communicate those talking points and/or product information to the public

e. Ensure event materials are presented and/or distributed according to directions

f. Set up and break down of event materials

g. Attend online training sessions from time to time

h. Provide feedback on event success and complete an event recap

i. Punctual, professional, and highly organized with respect to event schedule and reporting deadlines

j. Timely completion of all assigned reports, paperwork, and training by deadlines provided

k. Ability to procure and provide required off premise materials: Sampling table, sample cups, wine/bottle opener, wine bucket.

3. Essential Job Requirements

a. High school diploma required or equivalent job-related experience

b. Experience in event marketing, demonstrations, sales, service industry or retail is highly desirable

c. Access to a reliable source of transportation

d. Access to a computer (laptop or desktop) with internet access

e. Own a smart phone with an active email account and internet access on phone as well as ability to take recap photos

f. Good interpersonal and communication skills and ability to attract and engage customers

g. Ability to work independently and prioritize duties with minimal supervision and work as a team when event requires

h. Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing

i. Background check required

j. Professional appearance free of visible body piercings and visible tattoos

k. Must be legally authorized to work in the U.S.

4. Necessary Working Conditions

a. Candidates must be able to stand for duration of event and lift up to 20 pounds at a time

5. Additional Information
All talent hired and booked for Adelante Live Inc. events will be considered W2 employees of Adelante Live Event Services and will be subject to all federal, state, and local withholding taxes and applicable laws.
It is Adelante’s policy and commitment not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability, military service, or any other category protected by law. As part of this commitment, Adelante shall provide reasonable accommodations of known disabilities to enable an applicant or employee to apply for employment, perform the essential functions of the job, or enjoy the benefits and privileges of employment as required by law.
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each Essential Job Requirement satisfactorily, and must have the ability to work within the Necessary Working Conditions. The Primary Job Duties, the Essential Job Requirements, and the Necessary Working Conditions are intended to describe the general nature of the job, and describe some of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required for the Brand Ambassador position. However, this list is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities or qualifications associated with this job.
All selected candidates are subject to a background check prior to employment. Please be aware that acknowledging or having criminal convictions does not constitute an automatic bar to employment with Adelante. We will consider and take into account factors including, but not limited to age and time of the offense, seriousness and nature of the violation, and any rehabilitation.

Job Description
Momentum Solar is a company built on the idea of community, innovation, and exceeding our customer’s expectations. We have garnered an A+ Rating with the Better Business Bureau and have been named one of the "Best Workplaces" in The United States by Inc. Magazine. Momentum promotes green energy and environmental advocacy alongside a familial atmosphere.

Job Overview:

As a Momentum Solar Brand Ambassador Manager, you will play a critical role in hiring new brand ambassadors, training and coaching your team, and guiding and prioritize efforts to optimize results. We need an experienced leader that will motivate, train, enable, and guide a team to consistent achievement of team lead generation goals.

Momentum Solar is a firm believer that our biggest asset is people. Therefore, we always invest first in you and our compensation structure reflects it. Our Brand Ambassador Managers receive a competitive salary and the most lucrative commission structure in the industry.

Requirements:
1+ years' prior experience with a strong performance record
Prior managerial background and ability to coach a team
Flexible schedule - ability to work nights & weekends
Must have a clean driving record and a valid driver's license
Intrinsic and uncompromising drive to excel
Unrivaled interpersonal skill - you're an expert a determining what makes people tick and aligning that to the needs of an organization to optimize the impact
Exceptional communicator and relationship builder
Organized, detail-oriented, and deadline-driven
Skilled in adapting to requirements of numerous, constantly changing demands
Qualifications:
Strong verbal communication skills and professional demeanor
Confident, creative, and goal-oriented
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic team environment
Schedule flexibility - available to work nights and weekends
Goal-oriented and self-motivated
Physical ability to stand and walk for long periods at a time

Auctane is a leading provider of e-commerce and warehouse shipping software. E-commerce merchants, warehouse operations, third-party logistics companies and other high-volume shippers across the country trust our products as their provider of shipping solutions.

The brand manager will be responsible for planning, executing, and measuring all marketing activities for the ShipWorks product. The right candidate will be a well-rounded marketing professional who is comfortable with both creating and managing the work of others.

ShipWorks is part of a family of e-commerce brands owned by Stamps.com. This position, based in Austin, TX, will coordinate closely with a centralized marketing team in Austin as well as the larger ShipWorks team located in St. Louis, MO. Some travel to St. Louis and other locations may be required as needed.

Responsibilities:
Represent marketing on a cross-department leadership team alongside sales, product, and engineering.
Develop a deep understanding of the ShipWorks product and the customers it serves.
Create quarterly marketing plans, own the progress and execution of those plans, and track performance.
Translate business needs into a new customer acquisition forecast, including channel mix to hit goals.
Prepare an annual budget and make quarterly adjustments based on new insights and initiatives.
In tandem with the larger marketing team, develop content, coordinate events, establish partnerships, assist with new feature launches, and manage other channels as needed.
Develop strong relationships with the ShipWorks team, marketing peers, partners, users, and third parties.
Use multiple technologies in planning and executing marketing activities, including WordPress, Hubspot, etc.
Meet regularly with executive, marketing, and ShipWorks leadership teams to share updates on performance and marketing strategy.
Qualifications:

7+ years of marketing experience
E-commerce, shipping/logistics and/or SaaS experience preferred
4-year degree
Strong writing/editing abilities
Proven track record of taking end-to-end ownership of marketing activities for a brand and growing performance
Proven ability to form deep relationships with a remote team
People management experience preferred
Ability to travel to St. Louis from Austin for 1 week per quarter

Our web-based shipping applications streamlines the order fulfillment process for anyone selling on the Internet.

If you are passionate about using technology to solve business problems, enjoy helping customers, and have excellent communication skills, then we want you to join us.

We are the largest window manufacturer in North America and still growing rapidly. We are looking for well-spoken, energetic and eager individuals who want to learn new skills or start a career with unlimited opportunities on a part-time basis.

THE RENEWAL BY ANDERSEN | ESLER COMPANIES STORY
Renewal by Andersen is the full-service window-replacement division of 115-year-old Andersen Corporation, the owner of the most trusted family of window brands in America. RbA was founded with a mission to redefine the industry and to offer a different—and better—window-replacement experience. Renewal by Andersen has seven company-owned locations, and over 100 independently owned “affiliates” across the United States.
The Esler Companies is the holding company for a fleet of the top Renewal by Andersen (RbA) “affiliates” in Greater Philadelphia, Colorado, Greater Phoenix, and Southern New England, and a sales and marketing ‘engine’ in Northborough, Massachusetts. Independent affiliates operate with a business model which grants owners exclusive marketing and sales territories, and nearly complete autonomy in running their businesses.

Job Title: (Waterford Business District, Miami FL) - Driver / Brand Ambassador
Job Description:
We're looking for great people to join our team! If asked to describe yourself and “fun,” "outgoing," and "self-dependent" come to mind, chances are you'll be a great fit for our team. Interested? APPLY NOW!!

FREEBEE COMPANY OVERVIEW:

Freebee is changing the way people move around, by providing FREE, electric, on-demand, door-to-door transportation in several high-density areas of South Florida. That's right! FREE RIDES in 100% battery-powered vehicles, made possible through customized mobile advertising campaigns and municipal transportation contacts... and we are pollinating the masses with our many services in a progressive and sustainable way!

At Freebee, we know how to live it up! Our drivers are fun, energetic, and knowledgeable about the cities we call home, and can't wait to spread the word about what's going on around town, and all the great products and businesses we are currently promoting. Join one of South Florida's fastest growing companies and sign up to become part of our team of creative, driven, and passionate professionals who live and breathe the FREE LIFE!

JOB TITLE:

DRIVER / BRAND AMBASSADOR in the Waterford Business District /Blue Lagoon area of Miami (Corporate offices located across from the Miami International Airport). 801 Waterford Way

POSITION OVERVIEW:

The Freebee Driver / Brand Ambassador position is one of the most important positions in our company. You are the face of the organization, and the one interacting most with the general public, educating them on our services and everything we have to offer. Shaking hands, kissing babies, and spreading goodwill to all.

We are seeking sharp, personable, highly-organized brand ambassadors to provide safe, reliable transportation to the general public, as well as provide them with valuable information about the latest and greatest happenings around town. The experience you provide for your guests will generate future opportunities for yourself, for our clients, and for the Freebee brand.

As part of the South Florida team, your role will be instrumental in spreading the word about our innovative free, on-demand transportation service, which will allow us to grow our fleet and take on new opportunities throughout South Florida and beyond. This is an opportunity to be a key player on an awesome team, as we continue to expand and enhance the reputation of the Freebee service as a whole.

WHAT YOU'LL DO:

- Provide safe, professional, and efficient transportation via open-air, electric marketing vehicles

- Interact with and provide great customer service to all passengers

- Create a fun environment and represent the company in a positive way

- Promote brands, distribute marketing material / branded collateral / product samples

- Document marketing experiences by taking photos

WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW/HAVE:

- CLEAN DRIVING RECORD (will be reviewed prior to hire)

- Valid Florida drivers license

- Energetic, outgoing personality

- Well-groomed appearance

- Effective time management / punctuality

- Communication skills (verbal & written)

- Must own a smart phone

- Knowledge of how to get around one or more of our service areas (see below for specific service areas)

- Bilingual is a PLUS! +

EXAMPLE BACKGROUNDS:

- Hospitality

- Customer Service

- Communications

- Brand Activation / Events

- Marketing

PERKS:

- Health insurance Benefits Provided!

- Have Fun & Work Outside!

- Meet New People!

- Career Advancement Opportunities Available!

- The rare opportunity to change the world such that everyone around you is using the product that you promote. We’re not just another service; we’re moving real people, reinventing marketing, and providing a reliable, eco-friendly alternative to transportation!

AVAILABILITY:

- Flexible Hours!

- Waterford Business District operating hours:

[Monday - Friday; 10am - 3pm]

- Now hiring full-time & part-time employees in over thirteen (14) different service areas

SERVICE AREAS:

- Waterford Business District / Blue Lagoon area, Miami FL

- Delray Beach, FL

- Fort Lauderdale, FL

- Miami Lakes, FL

- Hallandale Beach, FL

- Doral, FL

- Key Biscayne, FL

- Miami, FL: [Wynwood, Downtown, Design District, Midtown, Edgewater, Brickell]

- Miami Beach, FL

- Coral Gables, FL

- Coconut Grove, FL

- Pinecrest, FL

- Palmetto Bay, FL

- Islamorada, FL

Job Description
THE PROFILE

Abercrombie & Fitch Co. is a leading global specialty retailer of high-quality, casual apparel for men, women and kids with an active, youthful lifestyle under its Abercrombie & Fitch, abercrombie kids, and Hollister Co. brands. A&F was founded in 1892 and is based in New Albany, Ohio. A&F sells merchandise through retail stores in the United States, Canada, Europe, Asia, Mexico, and the Middle East. The Company also operates e-commerce websites at www. abercrombie.com, www. abercrombiekids.com, www.hollisterco.com

THE JOB

The Abercrombie & Fitch associate is truly aspirational. They provide great customer service by anticipating and responding to customer needs. An individual who is outgoing, stylish, and helpful. They demonstrate a keen awareness of the store environment by ensuring they always remain approachable and warm. They are able to initiate conversations and connect with the customer by communicating in a genuine and articulate way; that ensures the customer is always the first priority. Demonstrates relatable, confident and highly social behaviors on the sales floor that translate into closing the sale.

Adaptability / Flexibility
Stress Tolerance
Applied Learning
Attention to Detail
Multi-Tasking
Work Ethic

Customer Experience
Store Presentation and Sales Floor
Communication
Asset Protection and Shrink
Policies and Procedures
Training and Development
