Business development manager, customer relationship manager, restaurant, retail, full time, part time, entry level accounting, full time administrative assistant, receptionist, warehouse manager, retail associate, retail cashier, management, office assistant, office, clerical, office manager, insurance, customer service representative, leadership, operations manager, store manager, supervisor, director, teacher, project manager, communications, retail salesperson, customer service, marketing manager, marketing, territory manager, sales administrator, full time marketing executive, e-business, distribution manager, customer service clerk, call center agent, customer service director, customer service sales, field sales representative, account manager, advertising director, area sales manager, communications manager, full time communications director, media relations, public relations, e-commerce, sales, inside sales, outside sales, direct sales, insurance sales, executive administrative assistant, sports director, sports league official, business systems analyst, assistant manager, office support worker, admin support worker, human resources, full time recruiter, entry level recruiter, real estate, real estate agent, property management, training, develop, development, host, hostess, waitress, waiter, full time prep cook, restaurant manager
Company Description
Starting with a 12-person team in Atlanta, J.W. Business Acquisitions has already expanded nationally to Southeast, Northeast and Midwest markets, with the plan to expand to 50 locations in 5 years. We believe in the greatness of people. We believe that every person has the right to be as successful as they want to be as long as they are willing to put in the work and make the necessary changes. That's why we understand that developing our team personally and professionally is a must. Our leadership program is designed to do just that. We provide the tools and development necessary to help our team members reach their goals, which in turn brings success to our client partnerships. WIN-WIN!

It's simple, as a private consulting company We specialize in RETAIL BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT and new customer acquisitions for large companies in the communications and energy industries. Founded in 2011, J.W. is one of the fastest-growing companies in the outsourced retail sales and marketing industry, and our consistent growth continues to provide an opportunity to hundreds of individuals looking for an ambitious career path in business management.

Job Title: Brand Ambassador - Aeropostale Opry Mills Mall
Job Description: Role of the Brand AmbassadorWe call our Aeropostale team members Brand Ambassadors because they promote the culture, values and mission of Aeropostale. If you are outgoing, friendly and have a passion for fashion, this is a perfect role for you. As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.Our Mission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!Who you are:* Outgoing and excited to meet new people* Positive, charismatic and engaging* Obsessed with fashion and trends* Fantastic sense of style* Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual styleWhat you'll do:* Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience* Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy* Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice* Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits* Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store* Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed* Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other* Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountabilityWhat you'll need:* Outgoing personality* Love of fashion* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task* Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)* Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance* Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)Where you come from:* You are at least 16 years of age* Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store ManagerAero OpCo LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We value a culture a culture of inclusion and diversity within our workforce, and are committed to maintaining a workplace free from prohibited employment conduct, including discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, religion, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, domestic partner status, civil partnership, status as a covered veteran, status in the Uniformed Services of the United States, citizenship and any other characteristic protected by law ("Protected Characteristics").

As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.Our Mission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!Who you are:* Outgoing and excited to meet new people* Positive, charismatic and engaging* Obsessed with fashion and trends* Fantastic sense of style* Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual styleWhat you'll do:* Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience* Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy* Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice* Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits* Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store* Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed* Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other* Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountabilityWhat you'll need:* Outgoing personality* Love of fashion* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task* Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)* Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance* Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)Where you come from:* You are at least 16 years of age* Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store ManagerAero OpCo LLC is an equal opportunity employer. Job Title: Marketing Representatives / Brand Ambassadors / Lead Generators
Job Description:
Our Human Resource staff is responsible for recruiting, screening, interviewing and placing potential candidates. They may also handle employee relations, payroll and training. The Human Resource department plans, directs and coordinates the administrative functions of our organization.

The ideal candidate will:
– Be self-motivated, punctual, and well organized
– Have a strong work ethic.
– Be able to work in a fast-paced environment.
– Have excellent oral and written communication skills.
– Be customer service and detail oriented.
– Have a positive, professional, and energetic attitude.
– Have good working knowledge of computer systems.

Job Description
Brand Ambassador (Event & Show Demonstrator)

With more than 25 years in business, Bay State Luxury Kitchen and Bath is one of the fastest growing brands in the acrylic bath remodeling industry. We offer custom bath remodeling that enriches the lives of those we touch with bathrooms that are attractive, durable and maintenance-free.

We are seeking Brand Ambassadors/Event Demonstrators for our Hanover, Massachusetts markets and surrounding areas to join our winning team. Customer service experience is a plus, as you will be interacting with event attendees, discussing our product and securing sales leads for our team. Hourly pay + bonus based on quality appointments.

Essential Duties
Attract visitors and staff booth at shows and events
Promote product and provide basic product overviews to attendees
Book appointments
Specific Responsibilities of the Job
Maintain a professional appearance throughout event
Ensure cleanliness and organization of booth
Engage with passers-by to draw them into the booth
Explain basic product features and benefits
Secure entry forms or book in home sales appointments
Collect daily leads and provide to Event Coordinator
Knowledge & Skill
Strong communications skills
Positive, outgoing personality
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Physical Demands
Travel to booked shows/events (must have reliable transportation)
Ability to stand for long periods of time
Ability to lift 30 pounds
Available to work weekends

Role of the Brand Ambassador

We call our Aeropostale team members Brand Ambassadors because they promote the culture, values and mission of Aeropostale. If you are outgoing, friendly and have a passion for fashion, this is a perfect role for you. As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.

OurMission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!

Who you are:
Outgoing and excited to meet new people
Positive, charismatic and engaging
Obsessed with fashion and trends
Fantastic sense of style
Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual style
What you'll do:
Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience
Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy
Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice
Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits
Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store
Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed
Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other
Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountability
What you'll need:
Outgoing personality
Love of fashion
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task
Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)
Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance
Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)
Where you come from:
You are at least 16 years of age
Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store Manager

We're looking for great people to join our team! If asked to describe yourself and “fun,” "outgoing," and "self-dependent" come to mind, chances are you'll be a great fit for our team. Interested? APPLY NOW!!

FREEBEE COMPANY OVERVIEW:

Freebee is changing the way people move around, by providing FREE, electric, on-demand, door-to-door transportation in several high-density areas of South Florida. That's right! FREE RIDES in 100% battery-powered vehicles, made possible through customized mobile advertising campaigns and municipal transportation contacts... and we are pollinating the masses with our many services in a progressive and sustainable way!

At Freebee, we know how to live it up! Our drivers are fun, energetic, and knowledgeable about the cities we call home, and can't wait to spread the word about what's going on around town, and all the great products and businesses we are currently promoting. Join one of South Florida's fastest growing companies and sign up to become part of our team of creative, driven, and passionate professionals who live and breathe the FREE LIFE!

JOB TITLE:

DRIVER / BRAND AMBASSADOR (DELRAY BEACH, FL)

POSITION OVERVIEW:

The Freebee Driver / Brand Ambassador position is one of the most important positions in our company. You are the face of the organization, and the one interacting most with the general public, educating them on our services and everything we have to offer. Shaking hands, kissing babies, and spreading goodwill to all.

We are seeking sharp, personable, highly-organized brand ambassadors to provide safe, reliable transportation to the general public, as well as provide them with valuable information about the latest and greatest happenings around town. The experience you provide for your guests will generate future opportunities for yourself, for our clients, and for the Freebee brand.

As part of the South Florida team, your role will be instrumental in spreading the word about our innovative free, on-demand transportation service, which will allow us to grow our fleet and take on new opportunities throughout South Florida and beyond. This is an opportunity to be a key player on an awesome team, as we continue to expand and enhance the reputation of the Freebee service as a whole.

WHAT YOU'LL DO:

- Provide safe, professional, and efficient transportation via open-air, electric marketing vehicles

- Interact with and provide great customer service to all passengers

- Create a fun environment and represent the company in a positive way

- Promote brands, distribute marketing material / branded collateral / product samples

- Document marketing experiences by taking photos

WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW/HAVE:

- CLEAN DRIVING RECORD (will be reviewed prior to hire)

- Valid Florida drivers license

- Energetic, outgoing personality

- Well-groomed appearance

- Effective time management / punctuality

- Communication skills (verbal & written)

- Must own a smart phone

- Knowledge of how to get around one or more of our service areas (see below for specific service areas)

- Bilingual is a PLUS! +

EXAMPLE BACKGROUNDS:

- Hospitality

- Customer Service

- Communications

- Brand Activation / Events

- Marketing

PERKS:

- Health insurance Benefits Provided!

- Have Fun & Work Outside!

- Meet New People!

- Career Advancement Opportunities Available!

- The rare opportunity to change the world such that everyone around you is using the product that you promote. We’re not just another service; we’re moving real people, reinventing marketing, and providing a reliable, eco-friendly alternative to transportation!

AVAILABILITY:

- Flexible Hours!

- Delray Beach, FL operating hours:

[Sunday-Wednesday: 11am-9pm; Thursday-Saturday: 11am-11pm]

- Freebee operates seven (7) days a week, operating between the hours of 6:00am - 2:00am

- Now hiring full-time & part-time employees in over thirteen (13) different service areas

SERVICE AREAS:

- Delray Beach, FL

- Fort Lauderdale, FL

- Miami Lakes, FL

- Hallandale Beach, FL

- Doral, FL

- Key Biscayne, FL

- Miami, FL: [Wynwood, Downtown, Design District, Midtown, Edgewater, Brickell]

- Miami Beach, FL

- Coral Gables, FL

- Coconut Grove, FL

- Pinecrest, FL

- Palmetto Bay, FL

- Islamorada, FL

The Role

The Observatory Ambassador will be a dynamic, interactive role within the Observatory with a specific focus on the guest experience and how the guest relates to the Observatory experience. This position will play an integral role in providing local area, United States and International guests with a unique, memorable experience.

Company Overview:

Legends is a holistic agency that specializes in delivering solutions for legendary brands. We approach each project with our 360-degree service solution. Our Global Planning, Global Sales, and Hospitality service solutions collaborate on every project to ensure success across each of our six verticals including professional sports, collegiate, attractions, entertainment, international, and conventions.

Our intellectual property is our people. It's our expertise that makes up Legends. We know what it's like to be on the team, business, or athletic department side, which drives our passion in creating solutions for our partners. Collectively, our leadership has over 300 years of experience in sales and sponsorship, analytics and valuation, hospitality and operations.

Responsibilities:

The Observatory Ambassador will be a dynamic, interactive role within the Observatory with a specific focus on the guest experience and how the guest relates to the Observatory experience. This position will play an integral role in providing local area, United States and International guests with a unique, memorable experience.
Greeting guests as they enter assigned areas.
Ensuring safety of our guests while on tour or in your assigned areas.
Provide a high level of customer service by engaging guests, answering questions, resolving issues and providing service to ensure a great experience.
Ability to retain learned knowledge and offer assistance to our guests by providing operational (Observatory lay-out, experience locations) answers to all inquiries.
Ability to follow direction and to be a "team" player.
Highly motivated, enthusiastic and willing to engage guests and work in a highly busy, interactive environment.
Ability to perform and present information in a concise, legible manner to our guests - must be able to speak loudly and clearly and have a commanding presence.
Performs other duties as necessary or required by management.
Non-traditional hours (Nights, Weekends & Holidays as necessary)
Qualifications:
Minimum 2-4 years' host, operations or related experience, preferably in an attraction, entertainment or hospitality environment preferred
HIGH level of demonstrated professionalism and customer service.
Ability to memorize historical and technical information.
Multi-lingual or sign language capabilities a plus.
Entrepreneurial spirit, energetic and outgoing personality with a creative, and a proactive approach to work.
Practice safe work habits, follow all safety policies and procedures and regulations, complete company-wide safety training and any additional job specific safety training.

Legends is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, or genetic information.

Job Title: Cheerwine Soft Drink Brand Ambassador - On Campus 2020_2021 UNC
Job Description:
Independent Contractor Job Title: Cheerwine Soft Drink - Brand Ambassador
Department: Sales & Marketing

Summary: The Cheerwine Soft Drink Brand Ambassador - On-Campus (also known as Cheerwine Czar) is responsible for increasing the awareness of Cheerwine through brand education and sampling throughout campus. This person will attend key events on or around campus from August 2020- May 2021 such as concerts, festivals, and other fun activities happening in the area.

Compensation: This position pays $100 per event. Attend a maximum of 20 events during the academic school year plus bonus opportunities.

Requirements:
Full-time undergraduate student at designated university and in good academic standing.
Must be available to attend select events for BOTH semesters from August 2020 through May 2021.
Must have car/reliable transportation that can transport necessary supplies for events (coolers, boxes, drinks). Must be able to lift drinks.
Must be outgoing, enjoy socializing with people, and have good communication and organization skills.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Maintain brand communication standards of Cheerwine's centennial heritage.
Distribute Cheerwine samples and swag at key events. Some events will be predetermined by Cheerwine; most will be determined by the Brand Ambassador, approved in advance by Cheerwine.
Identify and secure right-fit sampling events on campus. Completely communicate event details and rationale for Cheerwine to attend to sample with student peers and faculty.
Maintain inventory of Cheerwine samples, transport samples and supplies to and from all events.
Required to lead sampling at 5-10 events each academic semester.
Take photos at the events and gather consumer feedback at events.
Submit detailed event recaps after each event to Cheerwine staff members.
Wear Cheerwine uniform and use supplies provided and follow all training instructions.
Answer consumer questions about Cheerwine.
Encourage peers to join Cheerwine's Fan Club.
Visit designated retailers to build relationships and observe Cheerwine's presentation on-shelf and in the market.
Communicate with Cheerwine staff members on a regular basis regarding all Brand Ambassador responsibilities.
Organization Overview:

Founded in 1917, Carolina Beverage Corporation in Salisbury, North Carolina remains a family-owned independent enterprise still operated by descendants of L.D. Peeler, the company founder. The company is highly respected for maintaining it's family values despite significant growth and change in the beverage industry over the last century. Our company owns 101-year-old Cheerwine: Born in the South, Raised in a Glass. Cheerwine is a unique, bubbly cherry soft drink that brings out the 18-year-old in all of us. We still produce Cheerwine concentrate in small batches using the founder's secret formula. Cheerwine is sold in grocery stores, convenience stores, mass merchandisers, restaurants, and specialty retail stores. A state-of-the-art manufacturing facility in Charlotte, NC produces Cheerwine, along with many other leading brands from the Dr. Pepper Snapple Group. At the core of the company's success is the community of Salisbury, NC, located between Greensboro to the north and Charlotte to the south. What makes us truly different is the integrity of our people and their passion for sharing Cheerwine that has been loved by generations.

Job Description
THE PROFILE

Abercrombie & Fitch Co. is a leading global specialty retailer of high-quality, casual apparel for men, women and kids with an active, youthful lifestyle under its Abercrombie & Fitch, abercrombie kids, and Hollister Co. brands. A&F was founded in 1892 and is based in New Albany, Ohio. A&F sells merchandise through retail stores in the United States, Canada, Europe, Asia, Mexico, and the Middle East. The Company also operates e-commerce websites at www. abercrombie.com, www. abercrombiekids.com, www.hollisterco.com

THE JOB

The Hollister associate is truly engaged. They provide great customer service by anticipating and responding to customer needs. An individual who is outgoing, stylish, and helpful. They demonstrate a keen awareness of the store environment by ensuring they always remain approachable and warm. They are able to initiate conversations and connect with the customer by communicating in a genuine and articulate way; that ensures the customer is always the first priority. Demon- strates relatable, confident and highly social behaviors on the sales floor that translate into closing the sale.

Stress Tolerance
Applied Learning
Attention to Detail
Multi-Tasking
Work Ethic

Customer Experience

Communication

Policies and Procedures

Role of the Brand Ambassador

We call our Aeropostale team members Brand Ambassadors because they promote the culture, values and mission of Aeropostale. If you are outgoing, friendly and have a passion for fashion, this is a perfect role for you. As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.

OurMission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!

Who you are:
Outgoing and excited to meet new people
Positive, charismatic and engaging
Obsessed with fashion and trends
Fantastic sense of style
Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual style
What you'll do:
Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience
Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy
Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice
Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits
Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store
Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed
Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other
Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountability
What you'll need:
Outgoing personality
Love of fashion
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task
Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)
Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance
Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)
Where you come from:
You are at least 16 years of age
Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store Manager

CHEERS!Are you ready to join the world of Fine Wine as anAssistant Brand Managerfor a growing portfolio of Italian Wines?

Working collaboratively with our US-based Brand Ambassadors, you will be the point-person for our Italian wine portfolio, interacting with key audiences, including internal cross-functional teams, agency partners, trade and consumers.You will be responsible for tracking brand performance using internal (COGNOS) and syndicated data sources (IRI/Nielsen), and deriving key business insights that translate into actionable recommendations.You will support the development of annual strategic brand plans, and will own the successful and timely execution of key deliverables, including all elements of the marketing mix, e.g. Advertising, Social/Digital Media, In-Store Programming and Point-of-Sale materials, Educational tools, and Events/Tastings.You will interact frequently with our national Sales Team to understand brand performance and challenges in key channels and markets, and develop programs and tools to help them unlock brand growth at both the local and national levels.You will prepare and present Annual Brand Reviews to company leaders and brand partners.

Who Are You?

·College graduate

·1-2 years of marketing experience, or internship experience

·Have a passion for wine

·Strong project management skills, including the ability to collaborate with, and motivate, cross-functional teams

·Strong analytical skills

·Able to function effectively in a fast-paced, multi-faceted business environment

·Strong strategic and decision-making skills

·Able to take initiative, develop and seek out creative and innovative ideas

·Strong interpersonal and presentation skills with the ability to effectively interface at all levels within the organization and outside the company

·Experience with budget management

·Excellent written and verbal communication skills

·High level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook

What Will You Do?

·Contribute to development and execution of strategic and annual marketing plans which address all aspects of the marketing mix including pricing, packaging, advertising, promotion, public relations, events/tastings

·Interface with our internal Creative Services team as well as manage outside agencies, including advertising, promotions, packaging, and digital/social media

·Analyze Sales data using databases& spreadsheet software and derive key actionable business insights

·Interface on a consistent basis with cross-functional groups (Sales, Finance, and Operations) to rapidly identify problems/opportunities and take appropriate action as warranted

Job Description
Brand Ambassador (Event & Show Demonstrator)

With more than 25 years in business, Bath Planet is one of the fastest growing brands in the acrylic bath remodeling industry. We offer custom bath remodeling that enriches the lives of those we touch with bathrooms that are attractive, durable and maintenance-free.

We are seeking Brand Ambassadors/Event Demonstrators for our Aiken, Augusta, Columbia, South Carolina markets and surrounding areas to join our winning team. Customer service experience is a plus, as you will be interacting with event attendees, discussing our product and securing sales leads for our team. Hourly pay + bonus based on quality appointments.

Essential Duties
Attract visitors and staff booth at shows and events
Promote product and provide basic product overviews to attendees
Book appointments
Specific Responsibilities of the Job
Maintain a professional appearance throughout event
Ensure cleanliness and organization of booth
Engage with passers-by to draw them into the booth
Explain basic product features and benefits
Secure entry forms or book in home sales appointments
Collect daily leads and provide to Event Coordinator
Knowledge & Skill
Strong communications skills
Positive, outgoing personality
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Physical Demands
Travel to booked shows/events (must have reliable transportation)
Ability to stand for long periods of time
Ability to lift 30 pounds
Available to work weekends
Call us at 803-508-6868 to set up an interview time.

Arteriors is a team of smart, imaginative (and sometimes quirky) people who embody loyalty to our customers, our brand and each other. We’ve stripped away the red tape and provide an environment which thrives on new ideas brought into fruition.
As a Service Ambassador, you’ll act as a liaison between our clients and Arteriors by supporting client inquiries. You’ll be the first point of contact for the client and will assist with and resolve any issues that arise. To land this gig, you’ll need a High School Diploma or equivalent. You’ll also need to have experience in a customer support role that required both phone and email support.

You enjoy helping people. You get a thrill out of leading people in the right direction.
You are calm and collected under pressure. You think on your feet while ensuring the best possible level of service.
You are motivated and driven. You appreciate a challenge and thrive in environments that allow you to make decisions that impact the bottom line.
You communicate clearly. You write well and can explain just about anything to anyone. You have no problem with communicating in writing and on the phone.
You think, ‘glass half full’. You maintain a positive outlook, even in the most difficult situations, and encourage others to do the same.
You believe in personal accountability. You see the value in both, giving and receiving, constructive feedback and you often seek new opportunities to improve and develop your skills.

Medical, dental and vision insurance available the first day of the month after hire date
Open paid time off
9 paid holidays
Early release before holidays
Annual bonus potential
Annual performance review
Paid parental leave
401k with partial matching

Bath Fitter, a local industry leader, is seeking part-time, out-going individuals to add to our already amazing staff. We have several positions available for both entry-level and seasoned customer service & sales oriented representatives.

We at Bath Fitter make up the Nations #1 Bathroom Remodeling Company; we pride ourselves on the highest level of top-quality products and reliable customer service. Outgoing and excited to meet new people
Positive, charismatic and engaging
Obsessed with fashion and trends
Fantastic sense of style
Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual style
What you'll do:
Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience
Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy
Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice
Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits
Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store
Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed
Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other
Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountability
What you'll need:
Outgoing personality
Love of fashion
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task
Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)
Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance
Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)
Where you come from:
You are at least 16 years of age
Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store Manager

Job Description
Brand Ambassador (Event & Show Demonstrator)

With more than 25 years in business, Bath Planet is one of the fastest growing brands in the acrylic bath remodeling industry. We offer custom bath remodeling that enriches the lives of those we touch with bathrooms that are attractive, durable and maintenance-free.

We are seeking Brand Ambassadors/Event Demonstrators for our Aiken, Augusta, Columbia, South Carolina markets and surrounding areas to join our winning team. Customer service experience is a plus, as you will be interacting with event attendees, discussing our product and securing sales leads for our team. Hourly pay + bonus based on quality appointments.

Essential Duties
Attract visitors and staff booth at shows and events
Promote product and provide basic product overviews to attendees
Book appointments
Specific Responsibilities of the Job
Maintain a professional appearance throughout event
Ensure cleanliness and organization of booth
Engage with passers-by to draw them into the booth
Explain basic product features and benefits
Secure entry forms or book in home sales appointments
Collect daily leads and provide to Event Coordinator
Knowledge & Skill
Strong communications skills
Positive, outgoing personality
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Physical Demands
Travel to booked shows/events (must have reliable transportation)
Ability to stand for long periods of time
Ability to lift 30 pounds
Available to work weekends
Call us at 803-508-6868 to set up an interview time.

Powered by JazzHR

Arteriors is a team of smart, imaginative (and sometimes quirky) people who embody loyalty to our customers, our brand and each other. We’ve stripped away the red tape and provide an environment which thrives on new ideas brought into fruition.
As a Service Ambassador, you’ll act as a liaison between our clients and Arteriors by supporting client inquiries. You’ll be the first point of contact for the client and will assist with and resolve any issues that arise. To land this gig, you’ll need a High School Diploma or equivalent. You’ll also need to have experience in a customer support role that required both phone and email support.

You enjoy helping people. You get a thrill out of leading people in the right direction.
You are calm and collected under pressure. You think on your feet while ensuring the best possible level of service.
You are motivated and driven. You appreciate a challenge and thrive in environments that allow you to make decisions that impact the bottom line.
You communicate clearly. You write well and can explain just about anything to anyone. You have no problem with communicating in writing and on the phone.
You think, ‘glass half full’. You maintain a positive outlook, even in the most difficult situations, and encourage others to do the same.
You believe in personal accountability. You see the value in both, giving and receiving, constructive feedback and you often seek new opportunities to improve and develop your skills.

Medical, dental and vision insurance available the first day of the month after hire date
Open paid time off
9 paid holidays
Early release before holidays
Annual bonus potential
Annual performance review
Paid parental leave
401k with partial matching

Job Title: Retail Sales & Event Marketing Brand Ambassador ($10-$14/hr)
Job Description:
Bath Fitter, a local industry leader, is seeking part-time, out-going individuals to add to our already amazing staff. We have several positions available for both entry-level and seasoned customer service & sales oriented representatives.

We at Bath Fitter make up the Nations #1 Bathroom Remodeling Company; we pride ourselves on the highest level of top-quality products and reliable customer service. Bath Fitter is dedicated to serving our customers and the local community. We bring a unique and innovative bath remodeling process to the market, providing the most thorough and gratifying experience possible for our customers.

Responsibilities:

Represent the company at local community events, trade shows and business expos
Represent the company at our local retail locations
Actively engage with the public to identify home improvement needs
Answer general questions and stimulate interest in our products
Gather contact information for appointment setting purposes
Qualifications:

Self-motivated and outgoing personality
Polite demeanor with the ability to drive the conversation
Strong organizational skills
Reliable transportation is required
Sales and Marketing experience is beneficial, but not required
Benefits:

$10-$14/hr or more (Hourly + Commission paid bi-weekly)
Top Reps Make $15+
Mileage Reimbursement
Flexible PT scheduling (up to 30 hours a week)
90 day advancement reviews
Potential for growth within company
Prioritized, paid training
Year-round work
EOE
Company Name:
Bath Saver, Inc. dba Bath Fitter
4.2

Job Description:
Brand Ambassador (Event & Show Promoter)

With more than 25 years in business, Bath Planet is one of the fastest growing brands in the acrylic bath remodeling industry. We offer custom bath remodeling that enriches the lives of those we touch with bathrooms that are attractive, durable and maintenance-free.

We are seeking Brand Ambassadors/Event Demonstrators for our Eastern Pennsylvania markets and surrounding areas to join our winning team. Customer service experience is a plus, as you will be interacting with event attendees, discussing our product and securing sales leads for our team. Hourly pay + bonus based on quality appointments.

Essential Duties
• Attract visitors and staff booth at shows and events
• Promote product and provide basic product overviews to attendees
• Book appointments
Specific Responsibilities of the Job
• Maintain a professional appearance throughout event
• Ensure cleanliness and organization of booth
• Engage with passers-by to draw them into the booth
• Explain basic product features and benefits
• Secure entry forms or book in home sales appointments
• Collect daily leads and provide to Event Coordinator
Knowledge & Skill
• Strong communications skills
• Positive, outgoing personality
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Physical Demands
• Travel to booked shows/events (must have reliable transportation)
• Ability to stand for long periods of time
• Ability to lift 30 pounds
• Available to work weekends

Powered by JazzHR

The Brand Ambassador VP will have a number of responsibilities including:
Set strategy for your team to source potential brand ambassadors through DM, email,
in-person events and at the pop-up, as well as find new ways to efficiently outreach to
new candidates.
Create templates for your team to refresh and update welcome materials based on
seasonality and collection changes.
Build-out onboarding practices
Monitor and interact daily with BAs through DM and Social Ladder.
Set weekly challenges and incentives.
Ideate and oversee the execution of IRL brand ambassador events.
Design BA brand feedback forums and fit tests.
Maintain weekly reporting on BA acquisition, customer acquisition, and sales to be
presented in all team weekly sales meetings.
Audit each Ambassador at the end of their term and decide if an extended term should
be offered.

As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.

OurMission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!

Who you are:
Outgoing and excited to meet new people
Positive, charismatic and engaging
Obsessed with fashion and trends
Fantastic sense of style
Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual style
What you'll do:
Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience
Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy
Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice
Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits
Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store
Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed
Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other
Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountability
What you'll need:
Outgoing personality
Love of fashion
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task
Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)
Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance
Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)
Where you come from:
You are at least 16 years of age
Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store Manager
SPARC Group LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We value a culture of inclusion and diversity within our workforce, and are committed to maintaining a workplace free from prohibited employment conduct, including discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, religion, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, domestic partner status, civil partnership, status as a covered veteran, status in the Uniformed Services of the United States, citizenship and any other characteristic protected by law (“Protected Characteristics”).

Job Description
Brand Ambassador (Event & Show Demonstrator)

With more than 25 years in business, Bath Planet is one of the fastest growing brands in the acrylic bath remodeling industry. We offer custom bath remodeling that enriches the lives of those we touch with bathrooms that are attractive, durable and maintenance-free.

We are seeking Brand Ambassadors/Event Demonstrators for our Aiken, Augusta, Columbia, South Carolina markets and surrounding areas to join our winning team. Customer service experience is a plus, as you will be interacting with event attendees, discussing our product and securing sales leads for our team. Hourly pay + bonus based on quality appointments.

Essential Duties
Attract visitors and staff booth at shows and events
Promote product and provide basic product overviews to attendees
Book appointments
Specific Responsibilities of the Job
Maintain a professional appearance throughout event
Ensure cleanliness and organization of booth
Engage with passers-by to draw them into the booth
Explain basic product features and benefits
Secure entry forms or book in home sales appointments
Collect daily leads and provide to Event Coordinator
Knowledge & Skill
Strong communications skills
Positive, outgoing personality
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Physical Demands
Travel to booked shows/events (must have reliable transportation)
Ability to stand for long periods of time
Ability to lift 30 pounds
Available to work weekends
Call us at 803-508-6868 to set up an interview time.

Powered by JazzHR

Arteriors is a team of smart, imaginative (and sometimes quirky) people who embody loyalty to our customers, our brand and each other. We’ve stripped away the red tape and provide an environment which thrives on new ideas brought into fruition.
As a Service Ambassador, you’ll act as a liaison between our clients and Arteriors by supporting client inquiries. You’ll be the first point of contact for the client and will assist with and resolve any issues that arise. To land this gig, you’ll need a High School Diploma or equivalent. You’ll also need to have experience in a customer support role that required both phone and email support.

You enjoy helping people. You get a thrill out of leading people in the right direction.
You are calm and collected under pressure. You think on your feet while ensuring the best possible level of service.
You are motivated and driven. You appreciate a challenge and thrive in environments that allow you to make decisions that impact the bottom line.
You communicate clearly. You write well and can explain just about anything to anyone. You have no problem with communicating in writing and on the phone.
You think, ‘glass half full’. You maintain a positive outlook, even in the most difficult situations, and encourage others to do the same.
You believe in personal accountability. You see the value in both, giving and receiving, constructive feedback and you often seek new opportunities to improve and develop your skills.

Medical, dental and vision insurance available the first day of the month after hire date
Open paid time off
9 paid holidays
Early release before holidays
Annual bonus potential
Annual performance review
Paid parental leave
401k with partial matching

Job Title: Retail Sales & Event Marketing Brand Ambassador ($10-$14/hr)
Job Description:
Bath Fitter, a local industry leader, is seeking part-time, out-going individuals to add to our already amazing staff. We have several positions available for both entry-level and seasoned customer service & sales oriented representatives.

We at Bath Fitter make up the Nations #1 Bathroom Remodeling Company; we pride ourselves on the highest level of top-quality products and reliable customer service. Bath Fitter is dedicated to serving our customers and the local community. We bring a unique and innovative bath remodeling process to the market, providing the most thorough and gratifying experience possible for our customers.

Responsibilities:

Represent the company at local community events, trade shows and business expos
Represent the company at our local retail locations
Actively engage with the public to identify home improvement needs
Answer general questions and stimulate interest in our products
Gather contact information for appointment setting purposes
Qualifications:

Self-motivated and outgoing personality
Polite demeanor with the ability to drive the conversation
Strong organizational skills
Reliable transportation is required
Sales and Marketing experience is beneficial, but not required
Benefits:

$10-$14/hr or more (Hourly + Commission paid bi-weekly)
Top Reps Make $15+
Mileage Reimbursement
Flexible PT scheduling (up to 30 hours a week)
90 day advancement reviews
Potential for growth within company
Prioritized, paid training
Year-round work
EOE
Company Name:
Bath Saver, Inc. dba Bath Fitter

Brand Ambassador (Event & Show Promoter)

With more than 25 years in business, Bath Planet is one of the fastest growing brands in the acrylic bath remodeling industry. We offer custom bath remodeling that enriches the lives of those we touch with bathrooms that are attractive, durable and maintenance-free.

We are seeking Brand Ambassadors/Event Demonstrators for our Eastern Pennsylvania markets and surrounding areas to join our winning team. The Brand Ambassador VP will have a number of responsibilities including:
Set strategy for your team to source potential brand ambassadors through DM, email,
in-person events and at the pop-up, as well as find new ways to efficiently outreach to
new candidates.
Create templates for your team to refresh and update welcome materials based on
seasonality and collection changes.
Build-out onboarding practices
Monitor and interact daily with BAs through DM and Social Ladder.
Set weekly challenges and incentives.
Ideate and oversee the execution of IRL brand ambassador events.
Design BA brand feedback forums and fit tests.
Maintain weekly reporting on BA acquisition, customer acquisition, and sales to be
presented in all team weekly sales meetings.
Audit each Ambassador at the end of their term and decide if an extended term should
be offered.

OurMission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!

Who you are:
Outgoing and excited to meet new people
Positive, charismatic and engaging
Obsessed with fashion and trends
Fantastic sense of style
Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual style
What you'll do:
Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience
Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy
Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice
Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits
Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store
Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed
Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other
Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountability
What you'll need:
Outgoing personality
Love of fashion
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task
Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)
Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance
Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)
Where you come from:
You are at least 16 years of age
Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store Manager

Job Description
Brand Ambassador (Event & Show Demonstrator)

With more than 25 years in business, Bath Planet is one of the fastest growing brands in the acrylic bath remodeling industry. We offer custom bath remodeling that enriches the lives of those we touch with bathrooms that are attractive, durable and maintenance-free.

We are seeking Brand Ambassadors/Event Demonstrators for our Aiken, Augusta, Columbia, South Carolina markets and surrounding areas to join our winning team. Customer service experience is a plus, as you will be interacting with event attendees, discussing our product and securing sales leads for our team. Hourly pay + bonus based on quality appointments.

Essential Duties
Attract visitors and staff booth at shows and events
Promote product and provide basic product overviews to attendees
Book appointments
Specific Responsibilities of the Job
Maintain a professional appearance throughout event
Ensure cleanliness and organization of booth
Engage with passers-by to draw them into the booth
Explain basic product features and benefits
Secure entry forms or book in home sales appointments
Collect daily leads and provide to Event Coordinator
Knowledge & Skill
Strong communications skills
Positive, outgoing personality
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Physical Demands
Travel to booked shows/events (must have reliable transportation)
Ability to stand for long periods of time
Ability to lift 30 pounds
Available to work weekends
Call us at 803-508-6868 to set up an interview time.

Powered by JazzHR

Arteriors is a team of smart, imaginative (and sometimes quirky) people who embody loyalty to our customers, our brand and each other. We’ve stripped away the red tape and provide an environment which thrives on new ideas brought into fruition.
As a Service Ambassador, you’ll act as a liaison between our clients and Arteriors by supporting client inquiries. You’ll be the first point of contact for the client and will assist with and resolve any issues that arise. To land this gig, you’ll need a High School Diploma or equivalent. You’ll also need to have experience in a customer support role that required both phone and email support.

You enjoy helping people. You get a thrill out of leading people in the right direction.
You are calm and collected under pressure. You think on your feet while ensuring the best possible level of service.
You are motivated and driven. You appreciate a challenge and thrive in environments that allow you to make decisions that impact the bottom line.
You communicate clearly. You write well and can explain just about anything to anyone. You have no problem with communicating in writing and on the phone.
You think, ‘glass half full’. You maintain a positive outlook, even in the most difficult situations, and encourage others to do the same.
You believe in personal accountability. You see the value in both, giving and receiving, constructive feedback and you often seek new opportunities to improve and develop your skills.

Medical, dental and vision insurance available the first day of the month after hire date
Open paid time off
9 paid holidays
Early release before holidays
Annual bonus potential
Annual performance review
Paid parental leave
401k with partial matching

Job Title: Retail Sales & Event Marketing Brand Ambassador ($10-$14/hr)
Job Description:
Bath Fitter, a local industry leader, is seeking part-time, out-going individuals to add to our already amazing staff. We have several positions available for both entry-level and seasoned customer service & sales oriented representatives.

We at Bath Fitter make up the Nations #1 Bathroom Remodeling Company; we pride ourselves on the highest level of top-quality products and reliable customer service. Bath Fitter is dedicated to serving our customers and the local community. We bring a unique and innovative bath remodeling process to the market, providing the most thorough and gratifying experience possible for our customers.

Responsibilities:

Represent the company at local community events, trade shows and business expos
Represent the company at our local retail locations
Actively engage with the public to identify home improvement needs
Answer general questions and stimulate interest in our products
Gather contact information for appointment setting purposes
Qualifications:

Self-motivated and outgoing personality
Polite demeanor with the ability to drive the conversation
Strong organizational skills
Reliable transportation is required
Sales and Marketing experience is beneficial, but not required
Benefits:

$10-$14/hr or more (Hourly + Commission paid bi-weekly)
Top Reps Make $15+
Mileage Reimbursement
Flexible PT scheduling (up to 30 hours a week)
90 day advancement reviews
Potential for growth within company
Prioritized, paid training
Year-round work
EOE
Company Name:
Bath Saver, Inc. dba Bath Fitter

Job Description:
Brand Ambassador (Event & Show Promoter)

With more than 25 years in business, Bath Planet is one of the fastest growing brands in the acrylic bath remodeling industry. We offer custom bath remodeling that enriches the lives of those we touch with bathrooms that are attractive, durable and maintenance-free.

We are seeking Brand Ambassadors/Event Demonstrators for our Eastern Pennsylvania markets and surrounding areas to join our winning team. Customer service experience is a plus, as you will be interacting with event attendees, discussing our product and securing sales leads for our team. Hourly pay + bonus based on quality appointments.

Essential Duties
• Attract visitors and staff booth at shows and events
• Promote product and provide basic product overviews to attendees
• Book appointments
Specific Responsibilities of the Job
• Maintain a professional appearance throughout event
• Ensure cleanliness and organization of booth
• Engage with passers-by to draw them into the booth
• Explain basic product features and benefits
• Secure entry forms or book in home sales appointments
• Collect daily leads and provide to Event Coordinator
Knowledge & Skill
• Strong communications skills
• Positive, outgoing personality
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Physical Demands
• Travel to booked shows/events (must have reliable transportation)
• Ability to stand for long periods of time
• Ability to lift 30 pounds
• Available to work weekends

The Brand Ambassador VP will have a number of responsibilities including:
Set strategy for your team to source potential brand ambassadors through DM, email,
in-person events and at the pop-up, as well as find new ways to efficiently outreach to
new candidates.
Create templates for your team to refresh and update welcome materials based on
seasonality and collection changes.
Build-out onboarding practices
Monitor and interact daily with BAs through DM and Social Ladder.
Set weekly challenges and incentives.
Ideate and oversee the execution of IRL brand ambassador events.
Design BA brand feedback forums and fit tests.
Maintain weekly reporting on BA acquisition, customer acquisition, and sales to be
presented in all team weekly sales meetings.
Audit each Ambassador at the end of their term and decide if an extended term should
be offered.

Role of the Brand Ambassador

We call our Aeropostale team members Brand Ambassadors because they promote the culture, values and mission of Aeropostale. If you are outgoing, friendly and have a passion for fashion, this is a perfect role for you. As a Brand Ambassador, your number one job is to share your love of fashion and do whatever it takes to create an amazing shopping experience for our customers.

OurMission: A store where customers love to shop and employees want to work!

Who you are:
Outgoing and excited to meet new people
Positive, charismatic and engaging
Obsessed with fashion and trends
Fantastic sense of style
Thoughtful with a desire to make others feel good about themselves and their individual style
What you'll do:
Engage, educate and befriend customers to make an amazing shopping experience
Achieve and exceed sales goals by utilizing our selling strategy
Show understanding of customer's personal style when offering fashion advice
Inspire customers with your knowledge of fashion and trends and help them build perfect outfits
Assist with daily opening and closing tasks to maintain a clean, neat and today store
Complete all job responsibilities such as floorsets, filling the floor, ringing customers, etc. as directed
Remain positive and professional and work together with the team to make a great environment for our customers and each other
Be a role model for our values of respect, integrity, teamwork, compassion and accountability
What you'll need:
Outgoing personality
Love of fashion
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task
Flexible availability to meet the needs of the business (including evenings and weekends)
Commitment to arrive for scheduled shifts on time and maintain consistent attendance
Able to meet the physical requirements of the job (standing/walking up to 95% of the time, lifting or moving up to 25 pounds, bend, twist and kneel to complete tasks)
Where you come from:
You are at least 16 years of age
Interview Requirement: One group interview (preferred) OR a one-on-one interview with Store Manager
SPARC Group LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We value a culture of inclusion and diversity within our workforce, and are committed to maintaining a workplace free from prohibited employment conduct, including discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, religion, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, domestic partner status, civil partnership, status as a covered veteran, status in the Uniformed Services of the United States, citizenship and any other characteristic protected by law (“Protected Characteristics”).

Job Description
Brand Ambassador (Event & Show Demonstrator)

With more than 25 years in business, Bath Planet is one of the fastest growing brands in the acrylic bath remodeling industry. We offer custom bath remodeling that enriches the lives of those we touch with bathrooms that are attractive, durable and maintenance-free.

We are seeking Brand Ambassadors/Event Demonstrators for our Aiken, Augusta, Columbia, South Carolina markets and surrounding areas to join our winning team. Customer service experience is a plus, as you will be interacting with event attendees, discussing our product and securing sales leads for our team. Hourly pay + bonus based on quality appointments.

Essential Duties
Attract visitors and staff booth at shows and events
Promote product and provide basic product overviews to attendees
Book appointments
Specific Responsibilities of the Job
Maintain a professional appearance throughout event
Ensure cleanliness and organization of booth
Engage with passers-by to draw them into the booth
Explain basic product features and benefits
Secure entry forms or book in home sales appointments
Collect daily leads and provide to Event Coordinator
Knowledge & Skill
Strong communications skills
Positive, outgoing personality
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Physical Demands
Travel to booked shows/events (must have reliable transportation)
Ability to stand for long periods of time
Ability to lift 30 pounds
Available to work weekends
Call us at 803-508-6868 to set up an interview time.

Powered by JazzHR

Arteriors is a team of smart, imaginative (and sometimes quirky) people who embody loyalty to our customers, our brand and each other. We’ve stripped away the red tape and provide an environment which thrives on new ideas brought into fruition.
As a Service Ambassador, you’ll act as a liaison between our clients and Arteriors by supporting client inquiries. You’ll be the first point of contact for the client and will assist with and resolve any issues that arise. To land this gig, you’ll need a High School Diploma or equivalent. You’ll also need to have experience in a customer support role that required both phone and email support.

You enjoy helping people. You get a thrill out of leading people in the right direction.
You are calm and collected under pressure. You think on your feet while ensuring the best possible level of service.
You are motivated and driven. You appreciate a challenge and thrive in environments that allow you to make decisions that impact the bottom line.
You communicate clearly. You write well and can explain just about anything to anyone. You have no problem with communicating in writing and on the phone.
You think, ‘glass half full’. You maintain a positive outlook, even in the most difficult situations, and encourage others to do the same.
You believe in personal accountability. You see the value in both, giving and receiving, constructive feedback and you often seek new opportunities to improve and develop your skills.

Medical, dental and vision insurance available the first day of the month after hire date
Open paid time off
9 paid holidays
Early release before holidays
Annual bonus potential
Annual performance review
Paid parental leave
401k with partial matching

Job Title: Retail Sales & Event Marketing Brand Ambassador ($10-$14/hr)
Job Description:
Bath Fitter, a local industry leader, is seeking part-time, out-going individuals to add to our already amazing staff. We have several positions available for both entry-level and seasoned customer service & sales oriented representatives.

We at Bath Fitter make up the Nations #1 Bathroom Remodeling Company; we pride ourselves on the highest level of top-quality products and reliable customer service. Bath Fitter is dedicated to serving our customers and the local community. We bring a unique and innovative bath remodeling process to the market, providing the most thorough and gratifying experience possible for our customers.

Responsibilities:

Represent the company at local community events, trade shows and business expos
Represent the company at our local retail locations
Actively engage with the public to identify home improvement needs
Answer general questions and stimulate interest in our products
Gather contact information for appointment setting purposes
Qualifications:

Self-motivated and outgoing personality
Polite demeanor with the ability to drive the conversation
Strong organizational skills
Reliable transportation is required
Sales and Marketing experience is beneficial, but not required
Benefits:

$10-$14/hr or more (Hourly + Commission paid bi-weekly)
Top Reps Make $15+
Mileage Reimbursement
Flexible PT scheduling (up to 30 hours a week)
90 day advancement reviews
Potential for growth within company
Prioritized, paid training
Year-round work
EOE

Bath Saver, Inc. dba Bath Fitter

The Brand Ambassador VP will have a number of responsibilities including:
Set strategy for your team to source potential brand ambassadors through DM, email,
in-person events and at the pop-up, as well as find new ways to efficiently outreach to
new candidates.
Create templates for your team to refresh and update welcome materials based on
seasonality and collection changes.
Build-out onboarding practices
Monitor and interact daily with BAs through DM and Social Ladder.
Set weekly challenges and incentives.
Ideate and oversee the execution of IRL brand ambassador events.
Design BA brand feedback forums and fit tests.
Maintain weekly reporting on BA acquisition, customer acquisition, and sales to be
presented in all team weekly sales meetings.
Audit each Ambassador at the end of their term and decide if an extended term should
be offered.
